Every 5 min complaining to the server that he is over this day, can't wait for his break, and "it's too early for this, I need to get smashed just to get through my day."  I think he forgot that he's in a sushi bar and that everyone can hear him.  My first two rolls were just kind of thrown together.  I get having a shitty day and not wanting to be at work, but I seriously felt like I was an inconvenience being here, and I probably won't come back, even though I was becoming a regular.

The girl and I went here for a date night and it was great! Friendly staff, clean restaurant and great food! We didn't wait very long for our orders to come out either. 

$25 for AYCE and another $5 for all you can drink!Will definitely tell friends and be back!
Their sushi was okay. kinda small. it's okay for close by nothing too special about the place. interior is clean. good service. not the best sushi i had but it's alright.

Decent sushi, good prices, in exciting experience. I'll probably be back if I'm in the area because I love sushi and I'm cheap, but I don't think I would ever make this a destination in of itself. Got the sasa sushi combo. It was average, but the price was pretty good, which satisfies my sense of frugality.

Excellent!!!
Just had AYCE and because it was our first time and we didn't know what to order, Erin offered to choose for us. 
He was the best! We are definitely coming back!
Thanks again Erin :)
Awful sushi. Wouldn't wish my worst enemy to go here. Was slimey and old. Yuck yuck yuck

This place is unbelievable! We had just gotten off of work and we live on the northwest side of town so pretty much any good sushi place is quite a drive. So I logged onto yelp and found some places. I started reading some of the reviews of Sasa Sushi and figured why not give it a try. They have good reviews and by the looks of the pictures, the food looked good too. Oh My Goodness! It was delicious! The Mark Roll, The Mango Crunch, The Sasa Roll........... The best sushi that I have had in Las Vegas. I am obsessed with it. Fresh fish and a clean, fun, nice environment. So bomb and close to home.

My girlfriend and I have been coming here twice a month for 2 years now and this is by far my favorite sushi place. Ive eaten enough sushi in my life to feed a small country and Sasa Sushi never dissapoints. So lets begin.

-Food-: The sushi is top notch, fresh and there are plenty of rolls amongst other assortments on the menu to choose from. (Reccomended rolls- Tracy 2, Paradise, Alex's Munchie, Mikes Mardi Gras)

-Service-: This is THE fastest most efficient sushi joint in town. I dont believe Ive had to wait more than 8 minutes (at the max) for a roll. I would highly reccomend sitting at the bar as the chefs (Manny, Kevin, and NIck) are nice, friendly, fun and energetic. The most important aspect in a restaraunt to me is engaging your client and this is exactly what they do.

-Environment-: The restaraunt is a smaller yet efficient setting. As soon as you walk in, the bar will be right in front with booths to the left of it and normal seating tables to the right. The inside is clean with white and bright green tones along with other fixtures.

-Prices-: The prices are comparable to other locations in town. I believe about $26 for AYCE dinner and $21 for AYCE lunch and add $10 for all you can drink. Individual rolls can run between $8-$12.

Overall if youre not looking for a fancy sushi bar on the strip but want something more conveniant, while still getting great quality sushi, this is the place to be.

my group of 7 and i really enjoyed our lunch here at sasa sushi. from the moment we walked in, we felt very welcomed by the entire staff. there was no wait and the service was awesome. the server was attentive and constantly made sure we got what we ordered. they even sent out some awesome "chef's specials" that were so bomb. the fish tasted fresh and the rice to fish portion was perfect...like 2 fish:1 rice!!! so nothing wasted. chef's were great. don't really leave reviews but they were too good. :)

This is my 3rd visit to SaSa Sushi place. We went there last night for all you can eat dinner and I would give a 3 Star for the food the extra 1 star for the service. The food taste is just average especially and nothing stands out, all their salads seem to have the Same seasoning. Still an ok place if you want to try out everything for a reasonable price.

OUTSTANDING!!!!!! Service was prompt and very friendly . The rolls are amazing in flavor and quality of fish. This place is definitely a hidden gem. I can't wait to come back. YUM- pick this place you won't be disappointed

Decent place.  We got all you can eat sushi and all you can drink sake total of 66$ for two people with tax. Sushi and the rolls came out fairly fast for how many people were there and we ended up having mostly their various rolls.  

I am no sushi expert but it was pretty good food.  

Decor was alright and staff was nice enough.

I use to go to this other sushi bar but i will never go again! sasa is the best sushi i ever had in my life...  So good.... The place is clean.  People have great service. Great prices.  Oh so so good. My heart fell out of my body is so good. I high suggest this place. Manny is so awesome. Great personality, quick service, and a great man.

We definitely have our favorite sushi spots around town but we were on a side of town where we don't normally eat sushi at however we were craving it. Couldn't go to our normal spots so had to find something close by. Yelped sushi places and this one came up. Reviews and pictures looked good so we tried it. Restaurant is at the corner backend of a shopping plaza so curb appeal is not the best but we still proceeded inside. No one was in the restaurant so they said pick anywhere to sit. Sat down and we were immediately asked for what we wanted. No customer service whatsoever. We decided to just do a few rolls since we didn't know the place well and didn't want to do "all you can eat". Ordered and food came out very quick. I would recommend the Mexican roll, so good. I took a picture of it and the Cali Royale. Other then that nothing was great. The edamame was soggy and seemed like it was steamed a few too many times over and over again. The tiger roll, not on their menu but they can make it was so gross. The spicy tuna was mushy paste like, definitely did not have a good taste to it. 

I would come back only if we were stuck on this side of town like we were when we came here and only do those 2 rolls that I mentioned.

This place is extremely delicious, I am very picky with sushi spots and usually stick to only a couple but decided to go outside of my comfort zone today. Let me tell you I'm glad I did! It's already a feat when the food is absolutely delicious but when the people working are amazing and friendly as well you couldn't ask for better. David, Manny and Lynn are phenomenal and I wanted to take pictures of the food but I kept getting distracted and taking bites instead haha. CHECK IT OUT!

This is just another average sushi place. They have all you can eat sushi for $26.99 or al la cart. We ordered some salmon, tuna and albacore sashimi and the pieces were smaller than average. The tuna and albacore were average. The salmon was much better. We ordered the sweet shrimp but it was too soft and lacked flavor. Most of their sushi rolls were very average. The service was very slow and mediocre. It took about 10 minutes to get our first order. Overall the food and the service were not very good. I would most likely not return.

Clearly our favorite local sushi place. We used to be fans at another place here in town but that one has become dirty and grimy. Some friends of ours turned us on to this place and it is absolutely AWESOME!  The fish is always fresh and the all you can eat is incredible. We have eaten at other all you can eat places and they all limit what you can have.

For example, I have to limit my starch intake because of health issues. We asked for sashimi. No problem. They didn't force the nigiri as other places do. The yellowtail jalapeño is one of our favs. The cucumber salad is to die for. The oysters can be done as shooters or on the half shell. 

Other pluses are all you can drink saki or beer for $5, or both for $8. The tuna or yellowtail collar is really good if they have it. 

We eat out all over town and this place is in our top 5 list for Las Vegas. Highly recommend.

My boyfriend and I found this place by accident and it has become our absolute favorite spot for date night. The salmon is the freshest and tastiest I have ever had in Vegas. The staff are very friendly and knowledgable. One of their newest servers is a total riot and I wish I had gotten his name the last time I was there. 

Overall, they have a great atmosphere, great service, and delicious sushi. I highly recommend sasa :)
Great food and awesome environment! Food is fantastic and the environment is casual! Highly recommend sasa to all my friends and family.
Best AYCE sushi I've been to in Las Vegas...sushi chef Donald awesome! It was all one point! You must try!
I love this place, the service is always excellent and the food even better. I love that this place lets the chefs get creative with rolls so they surprise you.

Yummy pork belly, Bank, Tracy2, and tuna carpaccio. Bus boy is clueless, but nice. Waiters are very nice. Place is clean and air conditioner works good. We've been here twice because it's close to our house. First time we had some things we liked and some not. This time we repeated what we liked and tried other stuff and found more yummy things. The ayce is a little pricey but the entire menu is open to it.
The sushi here is like every other sushi place, it's okay and service is okay as well.

I've tried to give this place a chance. The food is good. I will say that first cuz it is true. The flavored are well developed and go great together. But it seems like I always get poor service. Our server last time didn't act like we were there. People on either side were getting their food, and they got there after us. One table even got our order, and they took it!  It's ayce why would they turn it down?... maybe cuz they didn't order it. They almost got our second order. But the sushi chef corrected the server. We had to order calamari twice cuz they kept forgetting. Then they brought us 2 orders. The time before this, the sushi chef took my order, started to make it, then while playing around with other coworkers, Forgot to finish my roll. 10 minutes later I heard him ask what this was for and then realized he forgot and finished making it. The food maybe good... If you ever get it. Hire a new staff. THE CUSTOMER SERVICE SUCKS!

Hands down my best sushi experience since moving to vegas. 

I relied on my fellow Yelpers to direct me to a great, local AYCE sushi spot and SASA is what I found. 

My sushi chef was Nick. He gave me such an incredible experience tonight ! Every dish was amazingly delicious. I had a dish infront of me at all times. He asked me what my favorite fish was and made me a few dishes based on them. 

He handed me a few dishes "something with fried onions" and "something different". Refer to my pictures!

Service was great, extremely friendly hostess who I enjoyed talking with. The entire staff was enjoyable. All goofing with each other and making the atmosphere uplifting. 

I cannot wait to be back to SASA. A delicious, unique, and enjoyable AYCE sushi place! Thank you nick for a great dinner!

Every time I go I love this place more and more. We just have our server order for us and everything is excellent. The sashimi is fresh. The rolls are great. The sauces are divine. The atmosphere is great. Service is top notch. I love this place a ton.

I love this place. Best AYCE sushi deal. It's small, but they are very attentive. The worst thing about this place is that it's behind Capriotti's , making it hard to find or have people meet you at. My favorite rolls are the Double D and Mike's Mardi Gras. Enjoy!!

I found this place back in 2003 when it had different owners i never stoped going there and for 12 years i was a  faithfull customer to this place even though they changed owners  on me! I went with my family 4 adults a 3 year old and a 1 year old a couple of weeks ago. We always go there for the all you can eat which we love because we can eat all the raw fish we want and love.
 
Well the waiter decided it was a good idea to question us about the ammount of fish we were ordering and charged us for the soup we ordered for the little one which they never had in the past they would just include it with one of the all you can eat because let's  face it the kids don't  really eat that much , then when we got the bill to my surprise they had stick me with the 18% gratuity because it was 6 people..... I had no idea kids counted as adults when they hardly eat!!! 

They just lost one of their most faithfull customers i never went anywhere else for sushi for 12 years even when they raised their prices i kept going back because of the service and the fresh food but as of my last visit i am looking for a new sushi bar where i will be treated better and with a bit more respect!!!

They advertise all u can drink for a certain price but did they forget to mention that it takes them about 20 min to get your drink. Also they kept bringing  rolls to our table that we didn't order. My husband and i prefer nigiri. Over all the food was good but the service is under par.

I love that they have a veggie sushi section on their menu. I had the asparagus and avocado roll and the tempura okra. Both were great. Perfect options if you're vegan or vegetarian. Their all you can eat sushi is a pretty good deal - literally anything on their menu for $24. But I couldn't eat that much sushi so I just ordered a la carte. Staff was very friendly.
The Japanese nachos are on fire! This place is awesome ! Donald and Manny is amazing!!!

If you read the reviews you will see a lot of
Complaints about the host/wait staff. This is absolutely true. I eat out a lot and I have never seen such a rude, disinterested host/waiter. He forgot stuff. When We ordered he wouldn't really acknowledge you. It was unbelievable. I would give his aspect 1 star. 

The food quality was good for AYCE. I've been to some bad ones and although this wasn't the best, it was acceptable. Problem was it was hard to get he food because you had to deal with the d-bag waiter. 

If you enjoy feeling ignored or a bother to other people, check this place out.
Great sushi, fresh and flavorful. The best part was when the chefs just kept making us random plates and telling us to try them and they were delicious.
Best sushi restaurant in town, and they have AYCE! The chefs are fun and inventive, and if you're lucky they'll make you something "special." I highly recommend this restaurant.

Not sure if I want to relive a nightmare but for the sake of other yelpers I will... Walked in and greeted (or lack of) by this hostess who seemed to be rather peachy. Told us to seat wherever we pleased (in her very unwelcoming tone - someone must have pissed her off), brother gave me a sign to leave, I said we'll stay (well it was late and I had my kids and hungry all at once) and give it a chance so then comes the server, who was okay, he was a tad better than the hostess but still had an attitude (owners please treat y'all's employees better!!!). 

Now to sushi - it was subpar, (worst eel), don't remember anything above 3 out of 10 on any sushi and sides we had and we tried quite a bit.. Nothing stood out...

Service: (what service?) employees are just plain unhappy which makes customer unhappy (did I mention server came to bring food and still had food in his mouth? Hmmm guess we weren't the only hungry ones - keep it professional people, chew/swallow it before coming out that curtain... It's not that hard... 

So another one bites the dust and off my list...

This AYCE sushi place is conveniently located near my house and I found it searching on the nearby list. I went in by myself exhausted after a long day of working a trade show. I initially just wanted to have one roll, edamame and miso soup but as I started to look at the rolls it made more sense price wise to do AYCE.

I sat at the bar and I'm glad I did. Nick, the sushi chef was amazingly pleasant! I told him I was a fan of ponzu sauce and I loved rolls with the jalapeño. He made a 2K roll, a tuna carpaccio, an amazing mint leaf dish and other things that he said were not on the menu that would he thought I would enjoy. The presentation of the dishes were also suprisingly nice. Nick even made things off soup spoons like they do at higher end restaurants! Nick truly made this experience a pleasant one!

For you die hard sushi eaters, this place is AYCE is all you can eat so do not expect the finest quality of fish but I can say that Nick made all the rolls and dishes superbly! 

Parking was easy, service was great and it is well worth the money! I will definitely be back and will bring my friends next time.

Came here for my 30th birthday with my boyfriend & it wasn't all its' Yelp reviews make it out to be. The service was just okay. Not too attentive & didn't seem very interested in giving great customer service. At the door the 2 girls were talking & on their phones. 

The food was sub par. Some rolls were good & some were mediocre. We didn't get anything that was bad but it also was far from amazing. I've been too far better sushi joints with better prices, better food & definitely better service. I won't be going back.

Delicious and fresh sushi with even better service! My boyfriend and I went here for the first time today and definitely plan on coming back. We had the ayce dinner (I think it was $25.95) and for an additional $5, we also had the all you can drink Sapporo! We sat at the bar so we had a chance to interact with the sushi chefs. They were very friendly and gave us amazing sashimi and rolls to sample! Overall, cute and yummy sushi place!

Went for lunch on Saturday and had a very nice experience overall.  We all got the AYCE and began pigging out.  Their poke salad is excellent, as were their rolls.  The only detriment I could find was that their nigiri  were quite small, but it's AYCE, just order more.  Also, they didn't limit the number of poke salads or desserts like most AYCE places.  The chefs and servers were very professional and prompt.  Great place for AYCE.

I love a good sushi spot near me. This is not one of them. The waitress didn't greet us. The chefs at the bar acknowledged us more than she ever did. She didn't introduce herself she barely came by our table to take our orders and I had to consistently ask for a refill on my drink. The sushi tasted like not sushi and dry like biscotti... it wasn't fresh and had a fishy taste to it that I had to drown it with water because I didn't want to pay for leaving extra for ayce. The best part was washing out the taste of the "sushi" with vanilla ice cream. Never again will I come back, I'd rather get oyshi.

I love coming here with the family and ordering all you can eat. My favorite roll is the Japanese Lasagna. The service is excellent always nice and helpful with ordering new rolls. My kids are young and they constantly ask to eat sushi.

Most amazing sushi place I been to in Las Vegas!  Ate at the sushi bar and was asked what types of fish do I like and was so surprised .... the chief just kept giving me all these awesome plates filled with fish,oyster shooters, tuna and salm
on seaweed poke. Don't miss this place!! Your welcome :) ** Add on 6/20/16**  I'm disappointed on the work ethic!! I went Friday night 6/17/16 @ 11 mind you the close at 12,midnight.  Arrived by lyft, as I was going in they were closing and walking out!! They said I should have called! Really omg so rude! 2 other people came right after me. They probably lost over 300.00 by closing early. Wtf. I won't be back even though it was really good. I went back to try it again,this time sat at a table. It was the worst sushi and experience I've ever had. Never going back. Not sure how it was really good my 1 st two visits and terrible my next 2 visits  all with in 3 months???  So disappointed :(

This place was simply amazing! The all you can eat price is only $25.95 and includes the ENTIRE menu. My table ordered lots of high quality sashimi and I also ordered multiple specialty rolls, including the delicious paradise role that was topped with crab! I finished off the meal with green tea tempura ice cream making it one to remember!
I love this place! The sushi is good, but EVERYONE who works here is so nice! Love the chefs and servers!
Nick is now my new favorite sushi chef.  If it wasn't for him my experience wouldn't have been as enjoyable.  Give him a raise!  From Justin,  the guy with the crazy random questions
Always great food and great service when sit at sushi bar! I wish we there instead of the Belagio buffet on labor day. It was horrible there.

Bf and his brother like this place. It's not horrible. Really small portions, some was really tasty, others weren't. I ate so much salmon sushi. The eel wasn't very good and yet it took so long to come out. Avocado roll was also lacking. We are here on a slow night and the waitress is doing ok. I'll probably come back  to see if the quality is any better on a different night.

I'm confused on the high ratings here. Maybe I went on a bad night? Ordered the wrong things? I've had plenty of sushi and this place was not great. The salmon (saki nigiri style) was cut wrong so it was chewy and the pieces were not even close to being same size. The paradise roll was beyond terrible and the spicy scallop handroll was passable. I'm torn as to if I will ever return. It's close so I feel like I need to go again but sometimes it's better to bite the bullet and go further for better quality.

We were in Vegas for the Memorial Day weekend and wanted all you can eat sushi.  This place did not disappoint. Our chef,  Chef Manny was awesome and funny.  At some point during our meal he started making sushi that wasn't even on the menu and they were amazing!  From now on whenever we're in Vegas we'll be stopping by here without a doubt.

My Girlfriends took me here for my Birthday dinner . Upon arrival we requested and booth and were seated. It's a small little place but the server was very friendly. We had a hard time deciding if we wanted to do AYCE or just go with regular rolls. In the end all three of us got AYCE it was decent Sushi but nothing EPIC which is why I gave a 4 star rating. We received really good service and my favorite roll of the night was the BIG CAJUN ROLL. The other thing I really loved was the Tempura Fried Icecream. I got green tea and since it was my birthday they brought it out with a candle and even sang to me. It was a Awesome experience. Just so you know too they are happy to make custom rolls.  The Sushi Chefs are really nice and did a bunch of custom things for my picky friends! It isn't the BEST Sushi in town but it was really friendly and attentive. I can't wait to go back again.

We have lived near here for more than a year and I am SO bummed we just got around to trying it. 

We loved Sasa Sushi - free sake with Yelp check-in (or if you're a first time customer, so make sure to tell them!), phenomenal rolls that were just the right size (not too big, so you can try more), you can order half rolls right from the beginning, and the chefs will bring out special treats if you tell your server what you like. While waiting for a roll they brought us a tempura fried asian mint leaf(?) with a piece of tuna on top - it was delicious!

The servers were really attentive and we never had to flag anyone down to put in another order or ask for more water. 

This is definitely our new favorite sushi place within a few miles of our house. We will be back...weekly...
Sasa sushi is the place to get sushi. Christian my waiter did an extremely good job, I look forward to coming back next time.

Ordered take out the other night, I know stupid idea I should have had ayce, but I wasn't in the mood to call up some friends and have sushi with me. Ended up ordering salmon avocado rolls, 1 salmon  hand roll and a Japanese lasagna. Picking up my order I noticed that there was a regular salmon rolls but not the salmon hand roll. I told the guy ringing up my order and they saw on the order it didn't say hand roll and that both salmon roll and salmon hand roll were the same price but the "hand roll" wasn't specified. They went ahead and gave me the rolls and made a hand roll in a few minutes with no charge so that was pretty awesome. Everything was pretty good expect the Japanese lasagna it was okayish and that is my usual favorite. One of these days I'll have to stay in and order ayce and binge on some amazing sushi.

I was definitely in the mood for sushi and I just had to stop by this place . I came here for lunch and it was only $21.95 it was pretty cheap compared to any sushi places in vegas. They also have a happy hour everyday only for the sushi rolls and it's 20% off. Our sever today was Erin. He was an excellent sever he refilled our drinks and didn't ignore us like most servers do. There nigiri was absolutely fresh . The special sushi rolls were amazing ! Honestly every time I go to neighborhood sushi places they don't have the best sushi it's usually too dry but this place was delicious !

Some things good, some not so much.  Hamachi Kama, delicious, although it took more than 30 mins to be served even tho it was the first thing ordered.  Hamachi sushi, good.  Spider roll, not good, precooked and cold and hard and very small potion of crab in Roll.  Salmon skin handroll, just okay but not great.  Saba Shiso temaki, very good.  Free small sake with yelp check in, good!  Friendly and accommodating chefs.  I might go back to try again, but there are too many sushi restaurants to spend time and money at one somewhat below par.

My first time at this place and was such an amazing experience! Nick was such an amazing chef!!.. I think his purpose in life is to have everyone taste his mouth watering, delightful, pleasurable fOod!! I will definitely come back just to taste his lovely creations!! Just like his fOod his personality is just the same..! 2 thuMbs uP!!
My favorite sushi place so far!! GREAT EXCELLENT SERVICE with FRIENDLY staff!! My coworkers always order from there to and we pick it up !! :) I love the hand rolls and udon noodles!!

I've been to this sushi place a few times and still cannot put it on the best of all you can eat sushi in Vegas. The last time I visited with a friend, the service was horribly slow. Tables that came in after we did, received their food before we did. The staff may have seemed flustered since their credit card machine was down and they were only taking cash, though the restaurant was still crowded. Portions are decent, and I do like that their nigiri have small portions of rice as opposed to some with too much. There are several places in the area that are competitive with fresher sushi.

Ok. I came here just for lunch and I was enjoying myself so much interacting with the staff and eating the delicious sushi that I stayed for hours. If you go ask for the sushi chef Yoshi. He took care of us so well and he's truly talented at what he does. Kanpai!

Maybe the sushi is really amazing, we will never know. Came here after reading good reviews from yelp. It was a Friday night, just after 7pm, and the place was busy already. Stood by the door and waited to be seated--no one greeted us or even acknowledged us like a typical sushi joint with the "irrashaimase---!" Okay, fine. 

Another 5 minutes went by, still nothing. Eventually a sushi chef finally acknowledged us and asked if we were still waiting and how many in our party. The sole server (that we could see anyway) finally appeared, and asked if we wanted to sit at the bar or table. We said bar. Then he told us to each sit at the corner of each other by the end of the bar, and just pulled the chairs closer. All the whole a couple sitting at a booth complained because it had been 10 minutes after he had taken their card. 

I don't know if they were just short staffed or unorganized, but it left such as sour taste in our mouths that we just left and went to another sushi place nearly. And too bad! They are supposed to have amazing sushi!

Meh. This place is close to my house I've had a lot better sushi. I would definitely go to sushi bomb, sushi fever and sushi loca over this place. Needs a bit of a remodel and updating but service is fast. It's ok not great.

Went because of the 4 star review and it is not the best in town.  I think they have a good review because of the people there (nice and personable) however the sushi was terrible.  Salmon-  mushy and doesn't even feel like real fish-  def farm raised.   Sushi rolls-  tons of rice and on the bigger side (which will fill you up!) everything was too "fishy" and really gross.  Def won't be going again :-(

For one of my last weekends in Vegas I came to Sasa on a lazy sunday and had my typical sasa 99 while my friends got the AYCE. 

3.5 stars, but I'll  round up to 4.  

Supposedly the fresh fish at sushi joints on certain days of the week is just a myth, but I will say the fish was NOT FRESH this sunday.  Not sure if it was because it was slow, or leftover, but my tuna was not fresh, and my salmon was slightly slimy and falling apart. 

Also, I was extremely disappointed because the Sasa was served on a plate instead of the bed of ice...it's a lot of fish to simply have sitting out at once, it's as if they just had given up on the presentation of fresh fish. 

The only thing good about my Sasa 99 was the yellowtail.  worse, the service was pretty slow even though we were the only people in the restaurant. 

I love Sasa and I've brought coworkers and so many friends from out of town, but the inconsistent quality of fish and spotty service is what stands between it's ranks of an average sushi joint and an outstanding one. 

Overall: I'd recommend going on the weekends or lunch hour, it might be busy but you'll know the quality of fish shld be up to par.  Also be prepared for extremely spotty service if/when things get crazy.  Sasa has the best intentions and i truly hope it can grow and further develop its business.

the sushi is okay here! it's not the best, but the people who work here aren't Japanese so..makes sense! Try the salmon belly nigiri, if you love salmon! it's bomb! one of my favorite nigiri is Cajun albacore. 

I am so happy that there's this great new sushi place that's actually closer to where I live! I wouldn't miss this place :)

it's 21.95 for lunch time, and their menu is pretty diverse

They have slow service now. I used to come all the time but not anymore !! They are very forgetful now and it's just not worth the wait!!!

Skip the appetizers!!!

So,

We went sushi hunting again. This time closer to home so we can hopefully reel in a location where we do not have to travel so far to. Sasa came up. 

Hm.

OK so we couldn't find parking. Although located inside a big plaza, Sasa is hidden in a small corner where parking was limited to about 4 maybe 5 vehicles, and 2 of them theirs. 

Ok.

Walked in and we were greeted, seated, and given our menus. If you follow me, you KNOW I KNOW, what I want. So we ordered right away.

What ordered:

Appetizers - 
Shrimp tempura
Baked green mussels 2 orders
Tofu agedashi 
Calimari
Poke salad 2 orders
Cucumber salad
Salmon kama
Miso soup

Sushi -
Sweet shrimp with head
Bank
Birthday
Uni
Masago
Ikura
Tobiko

Chef special - 
5 piece salmon sashimi
Oyster shooters 2 orders

Soooo,

Let's start with the appetizers. Calimari had good flavor but had the texture of paper. Sorry Amanda G. In fact I felt that everything that was supposed to be served hot, calimari, agedashi, and mussels,  came out warm or nuked. 
The poke. Oh the poke. They used a vinigerett sauce that made the fish not seem so fresh. I mean it was an OK mix, but poke is not suppose to be sour meh. The cucumber was not traditionally made. I mean maybe they were going for something different, but a mayo like sauce, nah, divorce the two, marry the mayo witthe poke, and the vinigerett on the cucumber salad and that may just be the match.
Salmon kama came out great. In fact everything post appetizer came out fresh. Traumatized by the way the poke came out, we were pretty concerned about the well being of the rest of their food. I mean, uni is fresh sea urchin, so it has to taste right. To our surprise, their sushi was up there with some of the places we've been to. In fact the 5 slices of salmon sashimi that came out were 1/4 to 1/2 inch thick displayed on a banana leaf atop ice in a bowl.  Only 2 orders allowed btw for special dishes. The roes were not only attractive in color, but tasty as well. In fact, Sharo left surprisingly full by the end of the meal. 

So why 3 stars Mikey?

We came in at the end of one servers shift, and the beginning of the other. And we all know how I rate. Customer service + food + overall experience = rating. Well, we did not get the best of service. Despite there being only 4 tables in total and 2 at the bar, we did not get the same overall treatment that we get in a restaurant that has 1 server to about 7 or 8 tables. I do not want to go in depth, but customer service can use some sprucing up.

Will not be our first place to go if other sushi spots are open, but may be worth a second chance if we just need to pick up. 

Don't take my word for it, different strokes for different folks.

Well, about a year ago, I was going to my favorite and closest sushi place, Sushi of Summerlin, and to my chagrin, they were shut down. The sign said "Closed for Renovation - Will Re-open in June."
Of course, in this economy, I thought they were over and done with, and I was upset, to say the least.
Then about 6 weeks ago, I decided to see if another sushi place had replaced them and I saw that the sign said SaSa Sushi. I was happy, but who knew if the food was any good.
So I went in and the inside was spruced-up. It was more up-scale looking than the old place, but I really only cared about the food.
The banner that showed the prices (in the old place) was gone, so I asked them how much the "all you can eat was". It was about $5 less than the old place.
This was about 3PM, and I saw a chef from the old place walk in to start work. Then I knew things would be okay with the food. 
The ownership, host, waiters/waitresses, and a few of the chefs had changed, but the waiter that was there that day was excellent and one of the new chefs was amazingly fast. He was the first chef that could make sushi rolls faster than I could eat them, which is good when you're doing "all you can eat".
So, better atmosphere, better host, better waiting staff, the same good chefs and food, and slightly cheaper prices. 
I would've have given it 5 stars before the switch, so definitely 5 stars now.
Oh year, I almost forgot...At 3PM a small saki is included in the price. I don't drink alcohol, so they gave me unlimited Iced-tea instead. So it's actually $7 or $8 dollars cheaper than it used to be when it was Sushi of Summerlin.
Now, I just have to find a good Mexican restaurant, and I can die a happy man.

Oh my god, this place is so terrible!! The health department needs to crack down here. I got AYCE and the first thing that arrived was the amaebi nigiri... I took one bite and was absolutely certain the shrimp was spoiled. I eat authentic Japanese food all the time, I grew up on it, so I know what amaebi is supposed to taste and look like. This was the worst shrimp I've ever had in my life; it was slimy, overwhelmingly fishy-tasting, and the outside was starting to disintegrate. What really concerned me is that when I told the waitress, she just wordlessly took it and tossed it out... No apology, no reaction, no concern... Which makes me suspicious that spoiled fish is a regular problem at Sasa Sushi. I ordered sushi rice for my daughter when she first took our order but all my food came out and 20-25 mins later I was still waiting on her food. The waitress also had a scowl on the whole time she served us. At first I was sympathetic because she and the only other server seemed overwhelmed but after a point it just became ridiculous, especially after I pointed out that their shrimp was rotting. Everything else was mediocre at best. I actually ordered so little that paying for AYCE was more expensive that if I'd done a la carte. I have no idea how this restaurant is still open... The service is horrible and the food ought to be illegal. I keep worrying whether I'll get food poisoning. I will never be back.

Called ahead before 10pm. Closes at 11. They said no problem, get here by 10. We arrived 9:59, and we were turned away!  We were a party of Four. Don't want my business? Not ever getting it now! Not very nice. Forever off my list.

Been here many many times. Love this place. So many great choices for sushi and all have been delicious so far. Never disappointed. Ordered takeout and it was fast and again amazing. Definitely give this place a try. The mango crunch roll taste like dessert sushi!

Gotta be tough for Sushi restaurants in Vegas...

Not only is there so much competition, but there is GOOD competition out there...and of course we all compare one to another.

So let me start off saying that Sasa is GOOD.  It's far from bad, but it's not great in my book either.  Some notes :

Nigiri was hit and miss.  Some (like the sake) tasted fresh.  The Unagi was not cooked very much, so it was missing the slightly crispy edges I love.  The Ahi was SAD.  It was probably the pinkest colored ahi I've ever had, and the fish was FALLING APART.  They probably gave us the worst cut of the fish, one that most others would have THROWN out.

The Calamari was great though!  Light breading with salt/pepper seasoning.  I think this was the highlight of the meal...we ordered a second round! 

Hamachi Kama. Very good, flavorful collar! It's a very SMALL one though, but at least it's done well!  Yum :)

Soft Shell Crab Hand Roll. Very good, and I love the presentation on their hand rolls!  Tasty :)

"Pain in the Ass" was probably my favorite roll : Deep Fried Salmon, Tuna, Avocado and Cream Cheese. Heavy, but good overall, with a nice kick from the wasabi mayo.

And to finish, I ordered the Tempura Green Tea Ice Cream. I didn't think it was bad, but Cathy really disliked it. Hit or miss? 

So if you are in the area, give it a try!  But I'm not sure when I will be back...

Not sure why the pics aren't linked below :
Nick,Kevin and Donald are the best! Erin is awesome and Tyler is great! Love the food,atmosphere and always have fun when we come here!

A very pleasant surprise!  My wife and I were looking for a Japanese restaurant in our area and decided to give Sasa a try, as seen on Yelp.

Employees and the owner were friendly and patient with our questions about the business and the menu.

We had the Chirashi Bowl and the Bento Box with beef teriyaki.  Both were really good!  The sashimi was chilled for freshness, and the sushi rice was flavored just right.  The beef teriyaki had the taste of back home in Hawaii, not just soy sauce and sugar.  We later learned that the chef is from Hawaii, so no wonder!

Overall, a very satisfying experience.  We're definitely going back!

I've been coming to Vegas for years and this place rocks. This is one of the better sushi restaurants I've ever been to, not just in Vegas but anywhere. Not only is the sushi fresh and fantastic, but the cooked dishes are also amazing. I also give the bonus points is that they have a great Japanese curry. most sushi places don't even serve curry. The interior is well designed and clean. Service is very friendly and fast . This place also has a very well curated sake menu. I tried several different kinds of sake and they were all wonderful. 

I'm from Los Angeles and grew up not far from sush row, and worked in 2 Japanese restaurants....  this place definitely Holds up to any of them. 

I would highly recommend this place,  It's a great way to end a long day of of hiking and rock climbing in Red Rocks

Great quality sushi and damn good sake. If it's your first time here, check in to get a free bottle or house sake!

Also here's a great tip - ask the sushi chef or servers for any of their chef specials. Chef specials aren't necessarily listed on the menu but you won't be disappointed. Especially ask for Chef Kevin if you have the chance.
The fish is fresh. The appetizer's light which  make it taste fantastic. Good customer service. The place is small but cozy. This place is a gem. Thumbs up for the sushi chef.

I have not been here in a while since the food and service quality dropped. Me and my family decided that since we were out and about and in the area we would go and give it a try. 

Definite mistake!!

First of all the service was crap. I have never had someone stick there arm and shoulder in my face so many times. I actually had to scoot back and move or they would have rubbed their arm across my face. 

Secondly I got salmon that was so tuff that I was able to bite down and rub my teeth together and it wouldn't bite through. 

And lastly my sister ordered squid that she gagged upon eating. She actually had to spit it out in a napkin. I checked it and the smell alone almost made me gag. It smelled rotten. While moving the plate the squid actually stuck to my finger a bit. 


The only good part of my meal was the dessert. Which only tasted good because it came pre-made and pre-packed. 

I will definitely not be coming back. And for the price so not worth it!

Nick is the best sushi chef! Always keeps his dishes original and delicious! Sophie the server is observant and keeps us hydrated..! Every dish is unique and amazing.. After trying all the sushi restaurants around I've come to the conclusion this is the best in Vegas.. Come here you will have a great time and leave satisfied..

Really disappointed in this place. Had heard good things from friends and liked that it was in the northwest area. The waitresses were confused. Place was barren. Didn't think anyone could mess up Tempura Vegetables but I guess I was wrong. Waitress comes up with a few rolls and I ask her which was which..blank stare..she's confused.. I finally tell her I'll just figure it out myself, no big deal. The fish tasted like it came from a can. Nothing fresh about it. Had to take a sick day from work the next day because I felt so ill. Maybe this was just an off night for them but I will not be returning.

Came here for lunch AYCE and it was really good. The nigiri has huge cuts of fish and the perfect amount of rice. The also have popcorn scallops as an app and it was yummy! The specialty rolls were a  good size and also large fish portions and fresh rice. They also let you do half rolls which is nice for AYCE. Will definitely be back!

Free Sake with yelp check in Yay! Food was great but, I dont think its up to par with the other AYCE competition. I wish they would've done something special since I went on my birthday.. but atleast they greeted me?

This is my favorite place to go for AYCE sushi. There are a ton of rolls to choose from. The nigiri and sashimi are so delicious. The quality of the ingredients is great. The staff is super friendly and quick with your orders. I've never been disappointed coming here, It's always fantastic. The prices are great too!

Food was yummy. Loved the orange tiger roll. They have a happy hour but the all you can eat was still a bit cheaper for two specialty rolls. They have a good selection of sake. Staff and service was excellent and friendly.
I love coming here the chefs are funny and they remember what we like WOW everything they make is awesome

This was our first sushi restaurant we tried when we moved to Las Vegas a year ago. It's a very cute little spot hidden in a corner but since we saw really good reviews, we thought we'd give this place a shot. We sat at the bar the first time we went in. We went in on a Sunday afternoon and the place only had a few customers. The sushi chefs were very friendly and asked if the rolls were made to the way we liked them. They even suggested a few new ones to try, which made our experience even more fun! Great prices for All You Can Eat and will stay a favorite for our family for sure!
This sushi restaurant has excellent sushi and they have the option of brown rice which makes it a really great restaurant!

Kind of ricey even though we didn't order AYCE but they tasted good and fresh. The toastedness of the sasa wasnt my favorite but tge playboy was good. 

Aaron was great, I think he's the manager.  Good, fast service.

One word...GROSS! The sashimi tasted spoiled. The first tempura shrimp was OK, the second tasted old. We went at 1:00pm and was only given the roll menu. I asked if they had bento boxes and the waiter dully responded they were only on the lunch menu. HELLO! It IS lunch, why do I have to ask for a lunch menu?? Go to Yummy Sushi instead, trust me.

So, this place was highly-rated so we went here after realizing that about 5 of the 5-star reviews were from what seem to be fake accounts (1-3 reviews, no profile pic). Although the service was pretty good (it better be since there was hardly anybody there), the food wasn't 4 or 5-star quality. Filipinos run this place (not that that really matters). $22/person for AYCE.

We ordered edamame, calamari, a bunch of rolls and nigiri, and dessert.

Tracy II:
Salmon, avocado, jalapeño topped with salmon, lemon and sriracha. 3/5

Mountain: 
Shrimp tempura and crab salad topped with  salmon, tuna, yellowtail and snapper with eel sauce. 2/5

Sasa:
Shrimp tempura, spicy shrimp, cream cheese topped with salmon, toasted mayo eel sauce and sriracha. 4/5

Pain in the Ass:
Salmon, tuna, avocado and cream cheese...deep-fried and drizzled with wasabi mayo. For some reason, it tasted like banana. 3/5

Nigiri:
We had salmon (the cuts were good but slightly thin), tuna (we were given the worst cuts - end pieces that looked like several slices put together on top of rice), hamachi 2/5

Handrolls:
Soft shell crab was good. Salmon skin was too meaty and was not crispy at all, the juices from it were dripping. Presentation was great. 3/5

Calamari:
Lightly breaded and seasoned. Peppery has a light sauce at the bottom. Tasty...we ordered 2. 4/5

Strawberry Mochi and Green Tea Tempura Ice Cream:
Mochi and ice cream are pre-made and store-bought items but the green tea ice cream they used tasted like medicine. 2/5

The server told me they have sashimi, uni and amaebi for dinner AYCE. Good to know but I'll probably go somewhere else.

This is based on the phone call. They DO NOT have AYCE. Ignore their website, the moderately rude phone person was short and seemed inattentive. I would have gone ala carte, but the surprisingly cold phone reception drove me away. Back to Yelp search I go.
We love this place, the sushi chefs are always super cool and really nice. The rolls are always fresh & it's close to home. Can't go wrong.

The first day I was there the server was really mean I believe it was night when I came in. However, days after that I came back ONLY because the food was good and this time the staffs are nice. Ofcourse it no longer her serving us.

Tried Sasa after reading a good review somewhere, though I can't remember where. From the moment we walked
in we were treated exceptionally. Service was extremely attentive and the sushi chefs even created rolls for us that weren't on the menu as a surprise. (Which we loved).  Portions were on the small size, but since it is all you can eat it's not really an issue and the rice is proportionate. Restaurant is extremely clean.  Fantastic experience, I think we've found our new sushi place!

My family goes here bi-weekly, and the chefs start our rolls when they see our orange FJ in the parking lot.  The mango crunch and SC7 are the best food on the planet.  Fast service and personality of the staff make the experience wonderful.  The sushi is very tasty, clean establishment, and wide selection- chefs will make you something special too!

The atmosphere and sushi chefs are all excellent.  The staff is super welcoming and eager to please customers.  They informed us that they had recently undergone a renovation, which is obvious as it looks really nice.  The selection is ok.  No sashimi with AYCE.  The rice was a bit off, dense and couldn't taste any rice vinegar seasoning.  It tasted like Uncle Ben's rice in my rolls.  Pricing is on par with average AYCE prices around town @ $26/pp.  There was no wait and light traffic at dinner time.

Came in today to try the place out. I expect trained Japanese guys to be working behind the counter, but an overweight white guy? I walk in and was not acknowledged so I just sat down at the counter. Placed my order and the sushi was just so-so. Not bad but certainly not good. Crap meat in cali roll tasted kinda funky. Had to listen to the sushi chef complain loudly about other employees and then starts using vulgar language to describe female private parts with one of his regular customers sitting at the counter next to me.

None of the sushi in the counter fridge was plastic wrapped either.

Waiter was nice.

They charge $25 for AYCE which is the going rate here in vegas. Much better sushi counters at the same price around town.

It's been years since I ate at this place, when it was called Sushi in Summerlin. I'm happy to say the sushi is back to being amazingly fresh again. I was amazed by how fresh their uni was. The first time I visited was a Friday night. We arrived at 7:30 and seated right away. The sushi chefs are very friendly and laid-back. Our server was attentive and even took back the Cajun albacore that didn't taste so great. The volcano roll was yummy. The salmon, super white, and scallop nigiri were all fresh and plentiful on the fish to rice ratio. I used my Yelp checkin for a free sake! I went back again less than a week later and the service was horrible. It was a Wednesday night about 9pm and there was only one server handling the 3 tables there. We had to wait 20 minutes before he'd even take our first order, but we watched as he was boxing up food for another table and taking the check from another. I'd definitely recommend going on a weekend rather than week night. If this review was solely based on my 2nd visit there would be 2 less stars.

Sometimes you run into a hidden Gem. This is an Unpretentious small, neighborhood sushi bar. We ended up here after a frustrating day dealing with my car battery on a hot day in Las Vegas. We were looking to make it an early low key night and ended up at this restaurant. Service was good and staff friendly, people seems to be having great time. The Sushi Chefs Donald and Manny are cool. They made some great Sashimi, Sushi rolls. The Salmon was so fresh, and creamy and melts on your mouth. I highly recommend this little gem go and try it and become a fan.

Kevin and Nick are the consummate Sushi Chefs with absolutely fantastic recommendations for any palate. Staff helped with local knowledge and recommendations since I let them prepare for me as they thought I would like. I will return for dinner and also again everytime I am in Vegas. I truly cannot say enough about this establishment.......

Solid AYCE sushi. I met my brother here for lunch at 2 PM on a Saturday afternoon. We sat at the sushi bar with only two other people at the bar at the time. We got a continuous sushi feed and decent bicep workout of repetitions of chopstick to mouth. Free house Sake with Yelp check in. AYCE price includes soft drink.

42 pieces total of nigiri, 8 rolls, and ice cream. Nigiri: salmon, garlic tuna, albacore, yellowtail, red snapper, halibut, and cajun albacore. Rolls: spider, mountain, signature, Tracy II, Alex's munchie, big cajun, SSS, and volcano.

Everything delicious and no real complaints. Service was excellent from the sushi chefs and server. The fish slices on the nigiri were on the small side, but that's ok, just order more. The menu was dirty and sticky. Overall, nothing that happened during the experience was enough to keep me from coming back when I'm on this side of town.

Good food and good prices love there salads ....
I love there orange sushi very tasty
Excellent sushi, excellent service. Will return. Don't forget to check in on yelp for saki!

$25.95 AYCE and $5 AYCD is a phenomenal deal for the excellent food and service I received this evening!

The sushi melted in your mouth like butter. The special rolls tasted like a party in your mouth! The sides, like veggie tempura, pork belly and teri beef, were a nice compliment to the sushi and rolls. End the meal with a mango mochi ice cream - YUMM!

The service: everyone seemed to be our server. With that said, I never felt like I was waiting for my order or a drink. As soon as a dish was done, your empty plate was removed in less than a minute...WOW! This type of service should be adopted at other locations, as I'm sure many bad yelp reviews are caused by poor service. 

SASA is located in an assuming place, so it's even more of a reason to check out this diamond in the ruff!
I got food poisoning from the salmon and hugged a toilet all night. The service was terrible. The selection wasn't that big. Deserves one star, no doubt about it.

So the food is good and fresh but service is awful!  Three times the check was wrong then the waitress fought with sushi chef standing next to us about not clarifying our bill from the couple next to us.  I only came here cause the guy I was dining with wanted to eat in this area.... I'll never go again!  Why do I cheat on SUSHI FEVER and always get disappointed....

Mediocre sushi at best.  I was feeling lazy so we went to an AYCE dinner in the northwest instead of driving further.  The sushi pieces were small given the amount of rice.  The nigiri/sushi selection isn't as varied as places like Sushi Mon and Goyemon.  The sushi roll selection is similar to most places and my husband liked the rolls he ordered.  I was a little upset that they brought over a plate of tuna carpaccio and asked if we would like it.  I mean it's AYCE, if we wanted it, we would have ordered it!  Apparently the chef made it by mistake and was trying to offer it to different tables.  I saw them eventually take it to the back....since no one wanted it.  I also ordered yellowtail collar, although the outer cooked parts were good, most of the inside was raw and unedible...  They did have a sashimi option (1 order of one type of sashimi - about 5 pieces per person), which was a bonus that some other places do not offer.  Overall, I'd rather drive a little further down to Naka Sushi and pay a little less too!
Sasa Rocks. We always have a good time sitting at the Sushi Bar. I order AYCE and AYCD.  I've never had a bad experience here. Thanks Manny!

Was looking for a new place for sushi.. Didn't realize this place was right around the corner from where I live!! Sushi chefs were very nice and service was great. 
Can't forget how bomb the sushi was though! Definitely coming back ;)

This is just your Normal neighborhood sushi place. The best part about this place is the staff. They are super attentive, funny and make your time here enjoyable. 

They do have an all you can eat and drink option for about $32 bucks which I thought was a bit steep until I saw their specialty roll prices. For 10-13 bucks per specialty roll if you can eat at least three it's a bargin. 

I had the shrimp tempura roll and the California roll. Both were okay but the shrimp tempura was better for sure. I was not super impressed by the quality or the crazy amount of rice though. Give me more I the insides please!!!!

Overall I probably would come back only because this place is close to my house and my friends like it, but personally there are much better sushi places in Vegas for the same or similar price and better quality rolls. Dont cheat yourself- go here for the experience not just for the sushi.

This place is good. Fairly priced. Servers tend to forget parts of orders and need to constantly be reminded that youre waiting for something. 5 people at a table and one person receives food in 5 minutes another person doesnt get their first dish for 20 minutes. The first time i noticed a gratuity charge. I assumed they had mistaken us for  a large party because our friends ended up dining there the same evening and sat at the table next to us. No big deal. But the second visit there were 4 adults and 2 children.  I thought gratuity was only for large parties? Apparently they automatically charge gratuity on all checks. Wont be back here again. Felt like i was tricked into double tipping.
This is my favorite sushi place in town. Their food is to die for and the prices are great too

I would give it 10 stars if I could..The service is excellent! ..We came here with the family had an awesome experience. The food is amazing any time of the day...The staff here is very friendly and welcoming,..do the AYCE or Ala Carte, which is reasonably priced for great & fresh sushi,..Recommend to everyone!!

Great place and close to my house!

About the same deal for AYCE sushi you'll find anywhere, but their prep is superb. The guys behind the counter are from Hawai'i so right when you walk in you are greeted warmly, even more so if you're a regular. 

Excellent food, even better service and all around good vibe. 

I recommend the hamachi and escolar bc those are my ultimate favorites. But you can never go wrong with nigiri!!! For appetizers you gotta try the popcorn scallops with yum yum sauce. And get the tempura ice cream for dessert!! :)
This is a great place to eat. I come here once a while, once every two months. The service was always good, food are great. All you can eat, 20 some dollars . Well worth it. Will always come back.

Great sushi by the chef and great service by a friendly staff! Went there for lunch AYCE. Happy to discover a place close by my work. I consider myself a sushi-fanatic and I tried many of our fine sushi joints in town. For AYCE place, this is one of the best. What really stood out was the portion of the rice to the fish on the nigiris. The rice portion is tiny, compare to many other places. The nigiris were fresh and quite tasty. Tako was one of the best I've ever had. Superwhite and cajun albacore were probably my least favorite here. The chef prepared some off-the-menu, specials for us and they were DELICIOUS! He even made an Uni special, which was totally surprising. We were just doing the lunch AYCE, so uni isn't included usually but he pleasantly served us a yummy special! He also prepared a Tuna belly special, which was exceptional, as well as another one w sashimi wrapped in a leafy cone. Thx again Chef! Will return for sure! Any our Miss Waitress was really friendly and efficient w the service! (Sorry, forgot ur name ;P)

My wife and I stopped in for a "sushi snack" and bumped into some friends of ours who frequent Sasa Sushi. We chatted a bit with our friends and then sat at the bar becuase we were only going to have a roll or two. Our friends, who were on a first name basis with the chef at that point, told the chef to take good care of us. The chef was very friendly and took our orders quickly and produced plate after plate of tasty nigiri selections with nice sized portions of fish and easy on the rice (I'm sure this was due to the influence of my friend). Either way, the sushi was good for a neighborhood sushi restaurant and we ate our fill. The only hiccup was when we went to pay, nobody was keeping track of what we ordered, they just "assumed" we were on the AYCE. So we ended up paying the AYCE price for 2 people for dinner when we were being careful not to over order so it wouldn't be too expensive. Not the biggest issue since we were close to that price anyway. I would recommend Sasa Sushi if you're in that neck of the woods, and just get the AYCE...it's easier in the long run.

Best lunch time spot for sushi, cheap ($2 beer/sake) as well as great service. Very attentive. Knowledgable of all rolls. Friendly. And the freshest fish. They even combined salmon in their poke roll for me. Great place. Highly recommend.

I was here last night and a week or so ago, and I'm still happy to say that this place is still one of my go-to sushi places! I have to say that the other time I was here, I was really disappointed with the service. The salmon belly that I had was really warm and it smelled really fishy.. And then the server that we had took forever just give us chopsticks and our water. 

BUT I wanted to give this place another chance last night because of how really amazing they've treated me in the past. I'm glad I did! Delia was there last night as well as Laci and Nick! And it felt like home all over again. It felt like at that very moment it's where I belong, and I fell in love with it all over again. 

I got my usual salmon belly nigiri (still delicious), white tuna nigiri (so good!), calamari, poke salad, baked green mussels, shrimp tempura, & a delicious special roll that they've made with my favorite salmon belly! Everything was delicious and so fulfilling as usual! You can ALWAYS customize your order to the way you want it here. So if you want more or less cream cheese on your baked green mussel, then they'll add it in. Don't be afraid to ask because they love to make their customers happy here, plus they're really nice! 

Definitely going back here soon! :) Maybe even in the next few weeks! 

P.S. Children 5 and under are free for AYCE!
Service was garbage and the sushi was ok. I would NOT suggest this spot to my friends or family. A million and one rules!!!

Stuff sooooo friendly and the sushi was so good. I would love to come back to this place all the time!!!! My boyfriend and me had 2 chief specials and they were great!!! I came in this place not knowing what to expect and they really left an impression that I will not forget and so glad that I came here. 5 stars for everything and I recommend this place to everyone!!!!!!

Our family friend that lives in Summerlin recommend Sasa Sushi to us. We already had Mother's Day brunch reservation but when he brought it up to us few days before Mother's Day we changed our plans to try Sasa. We were so happy with the service, food and price! All you can eat for only $24.99, from sashimi, baked sushi, hand rolls, rolls, appetizer, salad. Grilled stuff and even dessert. We were glad we went and tried it. We will definitely going back.
Fresh fish and Chef Manny prepares sushi to your tastes~ make sure to sit @ bar!! AYCD - sake & beer available....what could be better?!?

Very expensive unless you do all you can eat.

I don't understand how a roll is 10-12 $ and Ayce is 24$ and they use same quality of fish.

Not worth it unless you get ayce

Really like the ambience of this place. I didn't have much, because I had to leave early, but the sushi I did have as amazing and took the craving right out of me. So satisfied. Staff was easy going, very California laid back and easy to strike a conversation with. Servers were speedy and chefs creative with the sushi plates, and very knowledgeable. You have questions they have answers. I went for the all-you-can-eat sushi, pretty average priced at $24.95 for dinner. Definitely coming back.

I was very impressed with the food at this nondescript restaurant located in a strip mall behind a Terrible Herbst.  The sushi was outstanding, the appetizers creative and the cooked food delicious.  Service was friendly and quick but unobtrusive.  I liked the tofu, cooked pork belly, tempura, baked mussels, shashimi, hand rolls, cucumber raps, special rolls and desserts.  The all you can eat and drink deal is great because you don't have to binge on rice and go right to the nigori and down all you can drink saki for $5.  The young sushi chef does nice specials too.
Agaim at my spot cant stay away from the fresh fish or the good staff who is coming today

We just moved to LV and are on the search for a regular sushi spot. This was our first time dining at here. 

We received excellent service today. Server & sushi chef were super accommodating! Sushi was delicious & selection was good. We'll be back!

An ok spot for ayce sushi .. I'm very picky when it comes to sushi places.. This was a cute spot close by the house so we checked it out... It was ok.. Compared to other ayce places it kinda fell short to me.. Not a lot of different options of sushi and appetizers compared to other places but it wasn't horrible .. Will I return? Probably not:(

Food was good 
Timing was good 
My favorite one the chefs special 
My roommate basically wants to take a nap after eating so much 
I'm coming back soon as soon as I get a few more workouts in and justify eating a lot again lol

I came in for the lunch buffet as soon as they opened (11am). I brought my appetite with me and had some time to kill so decided to write a detailed review. This is a LONG post, don't say I didn't warn you, lol. 

First of all, the people complaining about the staff/service must have come in at peak hours (when it can apparently get real crazy). For lunch on a weekday though, no one else was there but me. So of course, I got great service. Just putting that out there so other diners know what to expect. Also, for those doing AYCE, order HALF ROLLS so you don't fill up too quickly as most of their rolls are 8 pieces. 

Now for the food. Their (Ahi and Salmon) Poke Salad was one of the best I've had. Nice and fresh INCLUDING the seaweed. Many times I've ordered this at other (more expensive) places and the quality was sub par. So I've been kinda wary ever since. But Sasa Sushi's Poke Salad has restored the faith. 

The Miso Soup was just ok. There wasn't that much flavor but it wasn't too bland either. Safe to say I've had better. Next I had some Baked Green Mussel. This dish is a MUST TRY. I savored every bite! Their Shrimp Tempura was not that big but their Tempura Sauce is to die for! It's probably the best Tempura sauce I've ever tasted. Definitely recommend their Tempura selection if not for the sauce alone. 

Now for the rolls. I had two specialty rolls and one regular roll. First, the Spider Roll -- I've never seen it presented like this. They had it wrapped in yellow soy paper (as per the chef), and it was sweeter than most of the Spider Rolls I've had. Their soft shell crab didn't taste as natural (I guess) as what I've had before. Not to say that it wasn't fresh or tasty, it just didn't have that soft shell crab taste that I'm familiar with. 

Then I had the Volcano Roll -- which is baked, with scallops and sauce on top. Another must try! Their baked selection kind of has a distinct aftertaste that comes off as burnt foil I guess, but I only noticed that after I scarfed it down because it was just THAT good. 

At this point I was getting filled up so for my last order, I got the classic -- Rainbow Roll. This was much bigger than I expected and tasted as awesome as I thought it would. I gotta say, their raw fish selection is nice and fresh. For dessert I had the Red Bean Ice Cream only because I'm starting to get tired of the Green Tea it's like everywhere I go there's green tea flavored something but I digress. I also had the Mango Mochi which aside from it not being firmly frozen, was amazing. I recommend it!

That's about it. Parking is available right out front and they have a TV at the bar. The bathrooms are nice and clean and the chefs are awesome and attentive. This place is definitely worth a try. Overall, I give them a 4/5 star rating.

Been here before ownership or name changed and wasn't really a fan. Now back again after seeing pretty decent reviews, but still wasn't 100% up to my expectations.  

Service: PHENOMENAL. I'd probably go back JUST for the service. 

Food: the sushi was really bland. Didnt have enough flavor and rolls were not rolled tight so it fell apart. The pork belly appetizer was delicious, but it comes in many pieces so make sure not to over order because it does get heavy in your stomach. **They also offer one order of sashimi when you do the AYCE, but unfortunately we did not know about that until we were too full to eat any more.

That's really all I have to say about this place.

I honestly haven't been to a sushi spot this impressive in a long time! All you can eat with smaller rolls and less rice so you can enjoy more variety..... The chefs invent on the spot and when they're not busy will whip you up a creation based on your likes. The staff was friendly and funny! They have garnish and sauces I've never seen before and best of all the prices are reasonable! A must go!!!!

Sasa Sushi was just what we needed for lunch today. $21.95 for AYCE sushi. I highly recommend the Bank Roll. We ordered two. Checked In with Yelp! and received a FREE sake. The staff was helpful and friendly. My children were welcomed. The environment was cozy and inviting. 

Wish:
I hope Sasa Sushi extends to patio seating. (Hint: I let the itamae, sushi chef, know outdoor seating would be great with heaters and cool misters).

We chose the ayce portion off the menu.   My boyfriend really likes this place for the popcorn scallops.  We ordered 2 orders and I liked the second better as it was crisper. 

The rolls didn't impress me too much as they tasted a bit bland.  I think the rice was overcooked and under seasoned. 

I did like the nigiri as the size was great. 

I wouldn't make a special trip to come back but I certainly wouldn't not not come again.
This was my first time at this place and it was VERY pleasing, we had AYCE with Sapporo about 27$ per person... great food and atmosphere.

Second time coming to this spot and will never come again. Service was horrible. We ordered our rolls and waited patiently. During this time my boyfriend decides to order a Sapporo. Their new Waiter Josh asked for his ID, no problem, and then takes 15 min with it up and down that small restaurant. Only to come back and tell us they're fake IDs. What? We clearly had no problem ordering one before and our IDs are clearly no fake. Listed every possible thing wrong with his ID. We decided to walk out and not even bother waiting for the sushi any longer. We never experienced any problem like this and it was really an embarrassing experience.

Best price for good all you can eat sushi.  The ala carte menu is good also.  Get the sweet shrimp and uni.  The kamikaze roll with the crispy grill unagi was onolicious.  Service was friendly and quick.  Will definetly be back.

Terrible service. Rice too warm and rolls falling apart. They served our roll to another table and tried to bring it over to us so we asked them to remake it and they brought out the same serving 2 seconds later...please avoid

I used to love Sasa. But since the addition of (what seems to be) their only server we will never return. We've even come back several times in hopes that his attitude has changed or they have hired his replacement. 
My family and I just walked in to eat. No greeting,  no host, no server. So the sushi Chef points us in the direction of a table and let's us sit. Then the server walked out, asked how many in our party, then walks away shaking his head at us.
In walks a single patron after us who sits at the bar and he immediately gets her a drink....still we have yet to be greeted. Then he decides to take a phone order and help another guest all before greeting us.
I'd like to say that this is the first bad experience we've had at Sasa but since his arrival to the team it's been consistently terrible. I really wish I knew his name but he's 30ish, tall, dark hair, and the worst attitude in the industry.
We will never return. So disappointed because the sushi chefs and good are always wonderful.

Great Food & Service. Love coming to this place, but really wish they had ESPN so I can order more food & beer and watch the games. 

Please show the games so we come back more often.  

Thank you!!!

My experience was "Meh" at best. Upon reading the reviews with overwhelming positive reactions, I decided to eat here. The place wasn't busy at all and the servers were quick in response. Quality of fish was very poor. I always lower my expectations since I've tried sushi in Japan but this was considerably lower than that expectation. Nigiri was all I ate and the fish was definitely sub par. There were a few pieces that definitely had a sliver of fishiness to it. (Fish aren't supposed to taste "fishy" when fresh or handled correctly.) Although, the ratio between fish and rice was fine. I can't complain about price as it is average.

I've had better in the Valley at the same price. This was close and convenient though so I'd thought I'd give this place a try. I'll definitely be going somewhere else next time.
Always great coming here cuz we are never disappointed.  Ron serves up some great sushi and all the staff make it a place you want to come back to.

My girlfriend and I were visiting some friends in Vegas last week and were told we had to check out this brand new AYCE sushi restaurant called Sasa (pronounced saw-saw). 

I liked this place from the moment we walked in. The interior was beautifully decorated, everything was clean and modern from the tables and chairs to the light fixtures. We were seated promptly and our server could not have been nicer.

Since we opted for the all you can eat option, we went to town and probably tried half the menu. We ordered all kinds of nigiri and sashimi including yellowtail, salmon, salmon belly, super white, and several types of tuna. We also got the fried tofu, a few orders of gyoza, yellowtail shoulder, and some miso of course. I rarely say this but I can honestly tell you that every single item we ordered was delicious! The fish was definitely fresh and of high quality, also the presentation was excellent. You can tell the chefs really love what they do because everything looked picture perfect. All the dishes appeared to be carefully pieced together and there were plenty of cool Japanese style garnishes that made for a nice presentation. My favorite items were the yellowtail sashimi and the "Tracy II" roll (if you like citrus and jalapeno flavors then it's an absolute must). Also the yellowtail shoulder was so delicious, it came out fully cooked but was remarkably flavorful and tender. We also ordered a bottle of cold sake which went unbelievably well with the food. I normally don't drink sake but the beverage menu was huge so we had to try something.

As for the service, everything came out fast and our server was really good about keeping our drinks topped off. The whole experience was just perfect, my girlfriend and I want to go back to this place as soon as possible. It's so rare to find food this good, especially for the price.

So, one of my Meetup groups had an outing planned here that I wasn't able to make but the name intrigued me.  Automatically I started thinking that I don't know if I would want to eat at a place that eludes to anything that is gastrointestinal related.  However, my curiosity continued to get the best of me despite the name, so I checked out the website.  I was impressed with what I saw.  I'm a crazy picky eater so there are some dishes on the menu that you couldn't pay me to try, but there were also several that excited my stomach.  I'm a music junkie so I became even more excited when I read that different local DJs hit the ones and twos every night!  I said to myself, "Self, we are so going to Soul Gastrolounge!"  

One of my friends and I met up there on a Friday night around 9:00 and the place was packed!  There's a really cool outdoor patio that overlooks the street and inside is dimly lit and full of a laid-back, eccentric vide.  I thought to myself, "I've found where I belong (tear, sniffle, sniffle)."  My friend and I were told that we would have an hour and 15 minute wait, which normally would've sent us packing but we were fully committed.  So, we chose to wait at Twenty-Two (check out my review) which is right below S.G.

When it was time for us to be seated we were lead to a bar right by the DJ booth (who was awesome btw).  Our server came by in a matter of seconds to take our drink orders and then we perused the menu.  Since I had already looked at it online I decided to order the Soul Wings (I wasn't feeling as adventurous that night but trust me I'll going back to try oh so much more.) and the french fries with garlic-herb salt, pecorino & truffle oil.  The wings were okay but I loved the fries.  Our server came back to check on us several times throughout our stay and was pretty darn amazing.  

I'll definitely be back here.  The food options are just about limitless, reasonably priced and the service was awesome.  I say "YES" to Soul Gastrolounge and you should too!

Went for the first time this week...fantastic. Sat at the bar/DJ booth, we're sat right away by the friendly hostesses. Very hip place, reminded me of Carrboro. For all of its hipness, no one we spoke to was rude or condescending. Our server Drew was friendly, helpful and the perfect amount of attentive. Food was great: two sushi rolls, the Korean wings and the pork belly tacos was a good amount for two. Can't wait to go back.
Truffle Fries!! Definitely a must when you visit Soul! Great atmosphere and friendly down to earth staff!

Went on a Sat night with another couple and will return! The restaurant sits on the corner of Central & Pecan and is upstairs with a really nice view of the city. The atmosphere is casual sophistication with a nice relaxed feeling inside. The service was lacking but the food more than made up for it. The service was not bad it was just slow and not because she was waiting on the kitchen but because she did not seem to know what she was doing. Maybe she was new.....I asked what was good and she proceeded to tell me what the most expensive items were, not a good idea. The Bruscetta, Ahi Tuna Skewer, Southern Fried Oysters and Dip Trio were wonderful as well as the sushi (surprisingly), the meatballs was the only thing that I did not care for. The wine selection was quite good as well.
Great food. Great patio. So much on the menu, you'll want to go a few times to try everything!

Absolutely my favorite restaurant in Charlotte. They have creative and unique menu items, tapas (small plates for you Anglophones), interesting cocktails and the best bartenders in town. Getting up to the bar is like a game for me and I love it. How many people can I squeeze by to get into the prime seating?

The vibe at Soul is upscale, most nights there is a DJ, it's dark and a little loud, but somehow still pulls itself off as a speakeasy-like atmosphere. Definitely come here with a small group. Big groups will never get seated -- just not enough space. Sharing tapas is the best way to go here. I have never eaten a meal here without sharing their fries, a generous portion of garlicky, perfectly delicious fries. Shoe string style if you were wondering. I, also, highly recommend their sushi. The Soul roll is one of my faves, not overly spicy, so don't let those jalapeños scare you off. 

If you want interesting cocktails you have come to the right place. Check out their menu with tons of house favorites (Basil Smash) or tell Adam or one of the other awesome bartenders what you like and they will mix up something special just for you.
