On most nights and ALL weekends you will wait at Soul, for sometimes up to an hour, but it is totally worth it. Elbow in at the bar and order some cocktails and hummus to keep you happy while you wait. If you can snag a place on the patio on a night with good weather, you have definitely hit the jackpot. Perfect view of the Charlotte skyline. Soul is a great date spot -- nothing like getting to know someone by sharing food. 

Soul has always been an ultra hip spot in the sea of a semi-hip place, but now that Plaza Midwood is growing up, I think Soul compliments its neighbors well (ie: Peculiar Rabbit and Twenty Two). If you have someone you want to impress in Charlotte, go ahead and head over to Soul Gastrolounge.

Adam by far is the most talented bartender in CLT. I gave him a liquor selection and he masterfully created a cocktail that not only satisfied but took my senses to the next level. I am inspires by the menu and humbled by the bartenders talent. Do not miss this under shadowed hotspot!

We had a great time. We went after reading the review, and we did not regret it.. It is a small place with a laid back atmosphere. I would recommend going as a party two. We choose four dishes including a desert and split the food. Everything we tried was awesome. We also saw  many other dishes that looked delicious. We will have to go back another time to try them all!

In Charlotte for the night, and stopped by based on the previous reviews. Excellent  food and drinks. It's tapas and a little pricey, so it's probably not the place to go if you're starving. But I'd certainly recommend it for a nice, relaxing, upscale happy hour.

Don't be fooled by the hype, this restaurant lacks in good tasting food (which is my most important factor). Getting tasty food is like hitting the lottery here, there might be one or two items on the menu worth stomaching. Service and atmosphere are ok, but the marathon wait times and bland dishes are a detractor for the average patron. You've been warned!

The food is great and priced well considering. Great staff and laid back environment. This is a perfect date night or small group venue. If you need to compensate more than 6  MAKE A RESERVATION AND CHECK IT TWICE!!!  I made a reservation for my birthday a while back, called a few times to confirm and had less than stellar replies to comfort me that all was taken care of with the exception of the first conversation saying I was all set. That wasn't the case and on the event night, no reservation existed. We waited for hours for a table that never became available. We had cocktails there, but dinner elsewhere, which had to be decided last minute.

The food was very fun and imaginative while the ambiance was funky and relaxed.

My dinner date and I arrived on a Saturday night at 5:00pm, when they first opened, and we were seated immediately.  I love the ambiance of the restaurant.  It has a trendy, young vibe.  Good music, alternative looking waitstaff, clean, yet interesting decor with the exposed ceiling beams and red brick walls.

We started with an x-rated martini and the drink special of the night, the cucumber-mint mojito.  While the martini was a bit over-priced ($11) and not that tasty in my opinion, I really enjoyed the mojito.  Typically mojitos are quantity over quality (aka low liquor content), but not this one.  There was a good balance of all of the flavors.

We picked from a wide array of items from the menu, from dips to small plates.  My favorite item was the asia pork-belly tacos with watermelon salsa.  Though this sounds like a strange combination of ingredients, it worked perfectly!  I love when dishes have contrasting tastes and textures that work together in harmony, and this hit the mark on both counts.  The garlic and truffle oil fries were really good as well, though I always love me a little extra truffle oil, which this lacked.

Our waiter, Justin, was awesome, he managed to always be there when we needed him for ordering another drink to bringing extra condiments, but he was not obnoxiously ever-present.

I will definitely go here again!  It is clear that this restaurant is run with an emphasis on giving each patron a quality, unique dining experience.
Noisy spot, good nightlife and great grub! One suggestion, the foie gras....not what it should be. But try it yourself and call me a liar if you must!

So the hostess was perhaps top three least friendly people I have ever met, once I sat down, however, I was very glad I had come. The shrimp ceviche was fantastic, the sushi very good, and the caramel chocolate bread pudding sublime. I'll be coming back for sure, but probably seating myself.
Food is excellent. We come here very often. Not so uptight. It's casual dressy, a very relaxed environment. Love it.

Walked in and the music was by Zero 7 which is just a great album to chill to, so I was sold right away.  We went with tapas instead of sushi and it was very good.  The braised ribs were great, the fried oysters were great, the pita chips with a goat cheese and white bean dip was great.  Decent alcohol selection and the mix of people was awesome - suits, tattoos/piercings, young, old, hip, not hip (that would be me).  Duy Huynh paintings on the wall - i loved it and will be back soon if someone will babysit my kids for me.  Thanks a bunch.

All in all one of my favorite places. Hits all points for creativity, taste, service, ambiance. I kind of wishes they took reservations cause if it is past about 7:30 on a weekend the place is packed and there's a wait, and sometimes The bathrooms could use some help sometimes but I think that has to do with fact that at night there are a lot of people using just two bathrooms. Still, it is an area that could be improved upon I think. I love some Soul!

Absolutely love Soul! The atmosphere is what makes the place my favorite- the cozy, funky, warm environment of sharing small plates throughout the night encourages conversation and sparks smiles!! :) This is always my #1 go to spot!
long... But worth the wait, defiantly one of my favorite places to eat in Charlotte. This is the best eclectic hot spot in Charlotte.

Amazing dining experience.  Tried several tapas and several sushi along w few different cocktails.  Everything was excellent.   Great new place.   Like all new places it is always jammed and they don't take reservations  but alas the wait is well worth it!!

Hands down my favorite restaurant in town. Great vibes. Fantastic food and cocktails. Pork belly tacos are vital, but you truly cannot go wrong with anything on the menu. Be there between 5:00-6:00PM on a weekday if you do not want to wait quite a while for a table.

Given the high ratings this restaurant has, I was extremely disappointed with my dinner at Soul Gastrolounge. We ordered the baba ghanoush dip, Korean wings, sticky veal shortrib, and the southern fried oysters. I was underwhelmed by the flavor of all four. The crispy pita chips that were paired with the eggplant dip were very hard and tasteless. The Korean wings had a kick but little taste. The sticky veal shortribs were not cooked correctly. The only reason I would come back here would be to try more of their cocktails. I had the Wounded Margaret, which tasted similar to a Bloody Mary mixed with balsamic. The cocktail was the best part of the meal.

Very unhappy with this place, booked it for a friends birthday received a text at 8.11 got to the restaurant at 8.14 and they gave our table away because we were considered late! WTF!!!! I have never seen such bad service, rude staff and the management is even worse. Never will you see any of my money.
Food is over priced but delicious, atmosphere and decor is so unique but the people are a tad booshy and uppity.

Great service and yummy food. I  decided to venture to Soul for the first time thinking the rainy day would reduce the wait time.  It didn't for most of the guests, but I used the spp, and came solo,  so I was drafted upon arrival. Tiana was a superbly friendly Anna knowledgeable server. I tried everything she recommended and she was spot on.  The sushi was great and the Korean wings were superb. The bartender didn't skimp on the liquor and the cocktails were delicious.  The atmosphere was the best part.  The dj wasn't there yet, but the background music had me dancing in my seats.  The vibe alive was worth the trip and the food was a bonus.

The Bottom Line: a wide range of unusual tapas that will have you eating your face off.

Pros:
- The service was excellent.
- The food was delicious.
- If you're a carnivore, omnivore or herbivore... you are in for a treat.

Cons:
- This is really minor. More could be done with the outside area given the excellent views of the city.

Charlotte's hottest spot for the semi-well to do but not really, is a place called Soul Gastrolounge which is inspired by the gastropubs of European origin that serve small plates and libations all throughout the wee hours of the night.  

You'll find everything here, darkness, trendsters, hipsters, scenesters, nerd alerts, creepos, weeaboos, ceos cheating on their wives, questionably bent dudes in pink shirts, cuckqueens and mystic trannies along with a life sized stuff peacoack on the wall that makes for an excellent segue from awkward and potentially friendship ruining topics about butthole worship.  

The drinks were excellent, with everything being cucumber infused which refreshes the palate for the next small dish.  Dubs had the hummus which sadly, tasted more bland than a glass luke warm camel's milk but her 2nd choice of meatballs with cream sauce was an excellent dish, except the waitress took away the dip far too early and left me with dry meatballs that was a bit difficult to swallow.  

Our baritone voiced waiter who had a voice for radio and a face for the sequel of Arnold's all time smash hit "Jingle All the Way", recommended the watermelon & pork soft tacos which was exquisite.  I would recommend eating with a fork and knife because the tortilla, which was about the size of Dub's baby hands, was purely there for "deckorayshun".  

Last of all, the friend chicken skin pimento cheese nachos was also a winner.  Overall, this is a good place to kick it where service is fast and tables so close together so that the woman sitting next to you can correct you about actually being able to see the July 4th fireworks, when in fact I was right, and you can't see the fireworks.
had a great time with my husband and his old friends from his childhood.my now brother in law jon is da bomb in the kitchen!!and over all these guys know how to run a restaurant.

Perhaps my favorite restaurant in Charlotte despite a few negatives. The food is phenomenal. Great variety, well worth the money. The downside is that you have to be strategic about when to go because it is always busy, especially during the weekends. Not a place to go with a large group of people for the same reason. My first attempt to go there, I went with a group of  8 on a Friday night and waited 2 hours, and ended up leaving. The hostess was rude and the impression that we got from their service was that they can afford to be rude because their food is so GREAT and customers are willing to overlook that.  My next time around, it was better... but then again I went on a Wednesday night  with one friend at 9pm (still crowded but wait was 5min). 

In sum, my 5 star rating is for the food quality and the ambiance once you are seated.
Food amazing! The wait was more than I would have liked. They told us a 30 minute wait and then  we waited an hr.

Went here with a group of friends for the first time. We arrived around 6pm and there were still tables available outside. It was a chilly day, but they had it enclosed with heaters on. Order the pork belly, Korean bbq wings. Sunflower hummus, and blue cheese burger sliders. The pork belly was crisp with just enough sweet sauce. My friend said the Korean winds were spicy and the portion was 6 wings and they looked nice and crisp. The sliders needed a bit more mayo, but the crispy onion was very tasty. The hummus was good and came with plenty is pita chips. Dishes took a bit long to come out but it seemed rather busy.

Visiting from DC and Rome, nice place but major attitude by the 18 year old hostess who barked at us the minute we walked in. The place smells like food, kitchen needs major work. The manager saved the day.

Yes, this is my second review. I liked it more the second time. We got two orders of the mini burgers and the tuna tacos. My fav is still the cuban sandwich. the only cuban sandwich I like. It's not the most kid-friendly place but we were eating early so we took them. My 5 year old actually ate a southern fried oyster. He loved it! Can't wait to go back!

I came here for brunch and ordered the southern heritage. The gravy was meh, the biscuits were dry and my bacon was over cooked. I know it is a small plate place, but I would have liked a larger portion for brunch. Other than that the service was okay and the atmosphere was pretty cool. They had a DJ for brunch. What.

I mean, this is probably my fave place to chug and grub! The sushi is phenomenal. I always, ALWAYS get the Napolean roll. It never disappoints. The service is pretty great. The place is pretty small and can get packed and busy fairly quick. I love that there is always a feature menu - the chef creates something new to taste nightly. They have a twitter account and tweet their new items which make me get off the phone (while i'm driving) and drive right there. 

I'm no longer in Charlotte but love to see their menu items scroll down my TL. Great to go solo or with a group. P.S. The DJ's are greaaaatttttt!!!
One of my all time favorite places in Charlotte.  The drinks and food are amazing, creative and worth the wait and cramped quarters!!!
Food was delicious!! Service was great! Only reason I didn't give five stars was because the lighting is so dark!

Nice atmosphere and everything we had was awesome! I recommend the fried meatballs, flat bread and their sushi.  The mountain oysters are worth a try if you haven't had them before, very unique texture :-). You won't be disappointed.

This place is high on the list to take friends when they come into town.  Good food, good atmosphere, good wine/drinks.  As some have mentioned, no reservations so it is often crowded with a wait.  But still worth it.  I could list all the good things but it would be easier to just say that I've yet to have anything I did not thoroughly enjoy.  Parking can also require some creativity on crowded nights.  But I love a challenge.  Fun fact:  I have been coming to this location since it was "The Perch" comedy club back in the day.

4.5 soul's out of 5

I don't even want to give this place 1 star. Whenever my wife and I go out , ever, we dress up a little. We just like too, no reason. The hostess at this place looked at us like we had 8 heads because we didn't have the typical slummin it  for the night look, that apparently is the in thing there. I asked for a table for 2, and mind you there are NO reservations there, and there were many tables open at the time. It seemed painful for her to talk to me but she was able to belch out it would be a 30-40 minute wait. We sat at the bar waiting for the 30 minutes at least ( all along by the way, they were seating other groups immediately that were walking in, with no reservations either ) and were finally texted to say our table was ready. I walked over , right after they had just seated another walk in immediately, and she proceeded to tell me that the "2" seater tables ARE the bar and she moved us down about 5 seats .... huh???? LOL!!! We left. Very judgmental about class there and if you aren't the "soul bar" type and are a party of 2 only.... this is NOT your fit! DO NOT go there.

Interesting place, it's on the second floor of an art gallery that you enter from outside. There's no sign on the door, no advertising. It's a very trendy concept decor wise with some large couch like chairs around small tables. Much of the staff there are very earthy and easygoing, a very young hipster crowd with unique individuals. The best dish was definitely the pork belly tacos with watermelon salsa which were melt in your mouth, super tender and fatty.

Great vibe but you guys already know that. Loved the drinks or at least the husband did. He food was a little bit of hit or miss for us. Here's the things we got. 
1. Pork tacos - good but personally I'd like a little more sauce
2. Arugula flat bread - very well done!
3. Chicken skin nachos -  nope didn't work for me. The lady warned us but we decided to give it a try. Not very wise unless chicken skin is your thing
4. Bread pudding - oh my! It's tasted like a brownie but I'm not going to complain. 

Here's some additional details from a very vocal pair of neighbors - wings were to die for and the spinach pastry / spanakopita was the best they'd eaten. They couldn't stop oohing and aaing. Haha.

My first time here was not a disappointment. Great atmosphere, awesome food...only thing I didn't really like was the sushi (but I'm a sushi snob). We ordered about 5 different tapas/small plates and all were excellent. I think the blue crab fritters were my favorite...it was a special they had. Would definitely  recommend the Dirty South Nachos. The only other thing I didn't really like was the wine, the Malbec wasn't good, and the Shiraz was so-so. 

This is definitely a place I'll go back to try different things in the menu, will probably stay away from the sushi and wine, and stick with tapas and beer. Also will be nice to sit in patio once it gets warmer....great view of the skyline.

I visited Soul Gastrounge twice in the last two weeks and I've gotta say I'm underwhelmed.  The first time I went I was stuffed but friends ordered the veal shortribs, Korean BBQ wings and pork buns.  

Short ribs- Not as tender as I would have liked.  The whole point of braising is to get the meat to a point where its fork tender.  This was not the case and it distracted from the overall flavor.  

Korean BBQ wings- the outside skin was nice and crunchy but the inside meat was bland and not seasoned.  So anticlimactic.

Pork buns- They were ooook.  The meat to bun ratio could have been kicked up a bit but the flavor was to be expected.

Now, the second time I visited Soul was a hot mess.  I arrived at 7:30 to find that there were no tables available.  I understand that this is commonplace most nights.  I ordered a crunch roll at the bar- I thought this was yellowtail and some tempura flakes or something.  An HOUR later my sushi was done.  Admittedly, it did get pretty crowded in there but come ON.  You dont even have to cook it!  When I asked the bartender where my sushi was his only response was, "it's coming.". Well, it came but I don't think it was a crunch roll at all, it was the tempura shrimp roll.  But I ate it anyway, I was starving by that point.   It was also very tasty-which I hate to admit.

So that said, if I go back to Soul Gastrolounge, I will be a) only ordering sushi and b) watching my waiter/waitress/sushi chefs like a hawk so they don't play games with my food.

If you have not yet visited this restaurant you must! It's a great atmosphere and always packed after 6pm because their food is really some of the best you can find when it comes to tapas in Charlotte!  Please do not leave this place without ordering for the Pork Belly Tacos! I don't want to say much about them to hype them up but I can assure you that you will be pleasantly surprised!  They have the best Lamb Lollipops and a great and tasty selection of daily specials. When we stopped in they had the real fresh wasabi which was a nice treat with their sushi. I will definitely be back  to try theri brush on Sunday!

Haven't been to Soul in a while so decided to go recently. Previously have been 4-5 times, the food is going down hill IMHO.

If you are going to call yourself a "Gastrolounge" the gastro part better be good, consistent, and well prepared. 

Was seated at the bar because there was a 30 min wait, fine.
Bartenders were good enough. Ordered pork belly tacos, and flat bread

While waiting for the order, I watch the saute guy eating and touching places he shouldn't while he's was cooking customer's food. Nice ! ... If you work in an open kitchen, you Must be more presentable and conscientious ! 

I notice the health dept. score, is a 93 ... are you kidding me?   especially in a place that serves raw product.....the report is on line.

The food comes ...

The flat bread was soggy  undercooked, too much topping, and had arugula on it that  should not have been served.
Pork belly tacos were good, but nothing spectacular.

We were seated at the table, Collette did a great job ... she gets 4 stars.

Tuna skewer , 1 skewer was well cooked on all sides, rare in the middle, 1 was barely seared on 1 side, and completely raw. The tuna was seriously not fresh.

Beef skewer, not bad, but had to ask for s&p as there was absolutely no seasoning on the meat, the chimichurri was oily and bland.

Korean chicken wings, good flavor and well cooked, but didn't strike me as even slightly "Korean"

Soul is very popular but I think but I think the kitchen needs serious help.

Meh, I have experienced better....

The food was good and surprisingly affordable -- but I'm not convinced it's worth the wait and attitude you have to deal with. Too cramped of a space with too many people that care who's checking them out from the balcony.  Overall, the atmosphere and food is great, but they could step up their game with service and pricing and/or portion sizes. I might go there on a day when I have nothing better to do or if I want to be a bit more fancy, but I don't find myself coming here often.

I went to soul for the first time and thought it was stellar! = ) 
Our service was decent and the ambiance was nice. The plate portion sizes are perfect for ordering a lot of dishes to try and share. Perfect recipe for a social relaxing meal.
Being a lacto-ovo vegitarian I chose the saganaki, wild mushroom toast, and the trio of spreads. All amazing. The mushroom toast with the egg was just... gosh darn fabulous. OHOHOHOHOH! You must try the goat cheese icecream. Big huge mouth orgasm... trust me
Very good eats and friendly staff- the hipsters holding court there definitely made me feel like I was back in SF.

I went to this place on a late Saturday for a few drinks with a friend. It was my birthday weekend and when we walked in there were two chairs available woohoo. We sat down and ordered drinks and it was served quick.The atmosphere was real chilled, definitely had a soulful cozy vibe, and the DJ play some good music. I'm originally from up north and the vibe that night mentally took me back home.. Only for a second lol. It was cool. The people were nice .. Drinks were on point .. We didn't order food but I will order next time .. This review is subject to change after eating here but honestly it can only go up from here. 

Highly recommend this spot!

This place is awesome! Fun environment, great cocktails and the food is amazing! I love how you can order so many different items off the menu and just split it with everyone! It's cool because you can try so many new things. App size servings are great!

Favorite restaurant in charlotte..great atmosphere and great mix of people. Everything that we have ordered on the menu has been amazing. The most amazing fries! Get there early otherwise it's a long wait, but well worth waiting for.
Good food, nice atmosphere, friendly staff but loud and very crowded. Count on a 30 to 60 min wait for a table.

The food is an exploration of southern cuisine without limits! Drinks are as cutting edge as any NYC lounge...with the creative vision of mixologist Andy at the helm you won't be steered wrong. Well worth the wait with a drink in hand.
I love this place!! Every time I go here, they never disappoint!!! My sister and I always order the cupcakes to go!!

I  frequently enjoyed the food and atmosphere here until I had a very bad experience with the very rude hostess and manager.  There were 10 of us celebrating a birthday and our night was ruined.  We left Soul, went to the Diamond where we had  better service. Soul, quite frankly, lacks "soul". The food is good but the unwelcoming, rude staff is a major turn off.

A few things you need to know about SOUL:

1. They do not take reservations, get there early if you can.

2.  It's quite loud in there, but it is after all, a gastro"lounge"

3.  It's one of the best culinary experiences in Charlotte.


And... that's all you need to know.  Now, go!!

Pros:  

Food = 5 Stars and is not typical
Crowd= wonderful and exciting
Noise=Bar setting but more like a unorthodox restaurant/lounge
drinks=great and decent price for size

Cons:
You have to walk up steps to get there.  That may be a inconvenience to some people.
Pork Belly Tacos are my all time favorite.  yum!  The wait can be longer but it's so worth it...  grab a drink and enjoy the view!

Ever since discovering Soul, it's always a destination when out-of-town friends are visiting. I think it represents Charlotte really well: eclectic, creative, cozy, and trendy. I don't make it here often enough, mainly because I drop a pretty penny whenever I do visit. It's too easy, because I want it all! Dress up or dress down, go grunge or glam, and you'll fit in. Perfect for an intimate date night during the week or a group of fun friends on a weekend night, if you don't mind standing room and a loud DJ. You will not be disappointed by anything on the menu!

Besides for the service, the food was pretty good. The hummus was tasty, but that's a hard thing to mess up. The lamb lollipops were delicious and the chicken skewers offered up some of the juciest and most flavorful chicken I've had in a while. The dessert menu offered up 3 flavors of cupcakes which were slightly on the dry side. We tried the red velvet and the chocolate, and they were equally as average. 
Most importantly, prepare for a lag between the time that you order and the the time you receive your food, even if it's just a little busy. In my opinion, steer clear of a server named Jackie if you want things done right!

My heart and soul belong here. This place was the reason I moved into Plaza Midwood. The food is creative with surprising combinations of flavors and styles. The drinks are well-crafted and curated for quality. Soul has a quality that can't be imitated anywhere else. The mix is always intriguing with neighborhood hipsters, uptown sophiscates, local yokels, and out-of-towners. It is great to come here with friends,yet intimate enough for a date. It is one of the few places you can come alone and blend with the scene. It gets packed on the weekends so be ready for a wait, but it is fun to people watch in the meantime. My tip is to come earlier in the week because there are great djs every night. I loved my Monday nights with my boyfriend. We enjoyed the soulful spin of the dj and savoured our conversations without the frivolity of weekender distractions. I've since moved out state and miss my Soul.

This place is so much fun to go to!!!  I am in love with the food here!  Also the drinks!  LOL  Though it can get crowded on the weekends and you may have to wait it's worth it.  There is always a great group of poeple that hang out here.  Plus there is live music!  You can't beat that!  Groovin' to some tunes while enjoying awesome food!  I recommend Soul as a definite go to!
Fantastic spot!  Definitely busy on the weekends, but the atmosphere and staff make every dinner a memorable experience.

The chicken and lamb skewers were really really succulent and tasty. The other things i had were good too. The ambience was pretty lively ( read: noisy ) but it was Friday night so sort of expected it.

The only cons are the long waits and no parking . Paid $5 for a spot a block away :(

Good food but small portions and expensive.  My waiter was really nice.  This is another one of those places that tries really hard and ends up coming off as snooty and mediocre.  It would be a good date place I suppose.
Fabulous interesting food! Service was extremely good and the menu was creative. We had some of everything - appetizer, sushi, soup, skewers and dessert. We are foodies - highly recommend!

Atmosphere is trendy, but an overall great concept that stands out in Charlotte. All that needs to be said is that the FOOD is Outstanding! Oh..and the bartender concocted amazingly well mixed martinis.

Make sure you get there as soon as they open. There is always a wait, but oh, it is so worth it!! Highly recommend the ahi tuna tacos, pork belly tacos, pan con tomate, and everything else on their menu!!

This is my favorite place to get a slightly dirty dry martini - the bartenders know how to make them! This place becomes crowded on the weekends, but Sunday night is the best time to go! It is intimate and cozy, or if you want the bartenders will chat you up like an old friend. The atmosphere is like you are going to your gorgeous friend's house, you know, the one who has better taste than everyone. 

You must try the truffle french fries!
Very good food!  Great food and a fun place to eat.  Sometimes they have a band or Dj playing.  Great drink specials.

Randomly stopped by with a friend late on a Sunday night. Pleasantly surprised.  DJ was spinning some great tunes & the place was croweded. My friend knew the chef, who sent over a sampling of some Tapas. Very very nice. Staff was friendly & the environment was alot of fun. I've been to Good Food on Montford Dr. & this place is definitely up there with food quality. Look forward to going back again. Definitely worth checking out!

Went with my food-loving husband and finicky father... I wouldn't recommend bringing somebody of the simple meat-and-potatoes persuasion, but that's not a slam on Soul by any stretch. 

That said, the hubs and I Adore food and I made our way through a good bit of the  menu.  Quick notes:

- The pork belly and watermelon tacos. Are. BALLER.  Seriously, I could eat about a dozen of 'em.  
- Ramen - oddly creamy, bland, largely unmemorable but the cheeks were cooked well.  Wouldn't get again.
- Marrow - bones were good, parsley salad was Awesome; definitely replicating the latter at home.
- Meatballs - kind of dry, but good flavor. 
- Flatbread - arugula, truffle-whipped goat cheese, pesto, garlic.  Greasy but very flavorful. 
- Crunch Roll  - didn't realize the whole roll was fried, accordingly the fish was cooked through.  Sad face, don't recommend. 
- Wings.  Both Korean BBQ and Southern - nothing fancy, but good.
- Fries - garlic-herb salt, truffle oil, pecorino, yes!  Giant portion, too.

Service was excellent - Jamie rocked - and though the majority of the food was maybe three-star caliber, the atmosphere, tacos, and friendliness bumped it up to a solid four.

We went here on a Thursday night around 7:15 and did not wait at all to be seated. The crowd was a mix of after workers and locals mostly enjoying cocktails. We decided to eat outside on their heated patio. We started with the cheese plate, and white bean and goat cheese dip, both were very good. We were then bombarded with everything else we ordered, this always irritates me at tapas restaurants because the whole point is to eat slowly, trying and enjoying each new plate. IF your gonna bring it out all at once don't put tapas as your main menu, put app and entree. It was so bad we literally had no room for the last plate on our table. Other than that the tapas was very good. Here are our highlights: the mushroom and egg toast was amazing, curried lamb skewer was also very good, it came with a mango chutney, the fried oysters were also very fresh. I wouldn't recommend the braised veal shank as it was very fatty, the dolmades were just OK, but the hummus that was served as a side was out of this world. I would also avoid the the cupcake, it was very dry. The pistachio ice cream was extremely creamy and had nice pieces of crushed pistachios in it. We will definitely be back to try this place again.

The blonde hostess apparently thought we weren't hip enough and it was clear she didn't like the idea of us "older folks" sitting outside just to have a beer while watching the sun set. "Tables are for people who are having meals."  We walked out, and I will never set foot in there again.

Soul is a wonderfully intimate restaurant. Go with the time to enjoy a drink while you wait for a table (super popular place with a bit of a wait) and the ability to enjoy the food without rushing. Soul's menu items compliment each other perfectly.

My wife and I went to Soul for the first time last week and I must say, it was the best dining experience we have had in the city, since moving here from California in January. Amazing food, great atmosphere and reasonably priced. I would highly going!!

This place stays busy and I now know why.  Make sure your entire party is present to be seated.  The food is yummy!

The fried Brussel sprouts, lamb lollipops and goat cheese flatbread were delicious.  The chocolate salted caramel banana filled filo with banana ice cream was amazing!!! I will definitely be back.

I don't really see what all of the hype is about? We waited two hours to be seated.  I tried several dishes. There was a white dip that came with pita bread - the pita almost broke off a tooth. I ate some of the truffle fries that my friend raved about, and those lacked in flavor as well. I tried three of the sushi rolls. They didn't have a standout flavor. I expected something special based on word of mouth. There was a bone in my roll, so they did not charge me for it. The chocolate bread pudding was delicious and  was the best part of my meal. I would return for the bread pudding and maybe to try some drinks when the place is less busy.

SOOOOOOO Basically I love this place and enjoy coming for not only the fantastic drinks and eats, but the atmosphere, art/soul & general vibe of the joint... not to mention they serve some of the best eats late night in this entire CITAYYYY! Okay enough about how much I actually love this place bc this is ::dun dun dunnnnnhhhh...:: is a negative post bc i had an absolutely terrible **** of a server. I made him wait (my relatively blind date) and we made our server follow us as we moved down 3 whole tables to the corner table to have a little privacy earlier this evening... we must have asked far too much of her. I KNOOOOOOOOW that everyone has a bad day every once in a while and I say this with the deepest concern bc I too have been a server for many years... almost a decade to be exact (although I don't look it) NONE THEE LESS... I don't know her name... this relatively wretched looking, worn down, mousey brunette server with her muffin-top and complete disregard for her looks in general, not matching, no makeup, hair w obviously no effort and potentially unkempt for quite sometime with the rest of her looks... had less then charm, patience, concern or general care of us (i was on a FIRST date  mind you) as patrons. I am being potentially bias and a touch harsh do to upset but honestly she was quite the sight for sore eyes in the joint and I wouldn't give her a gold star for server of the month, I expected more bc everything is normally perfection. The general purpose of the story IS that she was a mediocre and not so visually or otherwise satisfying server...NOT saying she deserved or should have gotten a 10% tip... but she did. In my defense I was on a FIRST DATE!!! We left not keeping her tooo late, I mean the dance music was still bumping and we went to Thomas Street to have a night cap (we did see her there after her shift I'm presuming) then on the walk back to my car as we cross-walked in front of our server in whatever POS she is still struggling to pay off  and she yells from her window "THANKS FOR THE 10% TIP"  then peals off and hauls ass. Before her rude display of disdain from an unsavory tip (honey it happens to the best of us) I hadn't a clue... my date was embarrassed (which he should have been, 10% is never acceptable but NOT that she deserved much more...she wasn't an impeccable server by ANY means) I was without words and it was just a sh!t end to an otherwise decent evening. All I'm saying is loud mouth b!tches that don't know when it is appropriate to say something and when it isn't is the ONLY problem if any bc SOUL is an amazing place and the completely uncouth lady (i say that lightly) that served my table didn't deserve the tip she got. I understand a bad night but we weren't even a rude table and sometimes instead of acting like an a-hole you just gotta chock it up to the game, I say it only from experience... cut the fat from the sassy server staff and I would have NO complaint. BASICALLY I wanted to say B!TCH bc I didn't get to before she sped off. Get a filter... Serving is an acting job and you diffidently didn't look or act the part... step it up or find a new profession bc you suck.

Some places just feel comfortably right. Soul Gastrolounge in Charlotte's Plaza Midwood is one of those places. In the funky second floor rectangle that once hosted potty-mouthed comedy shows at The Perch, exposed brick and beams invite diners to settle in for cozy consumption.

Shouldn't all meals be small plates of surprising complementary textures and flavors? A little taste of babaganoush, blue cheese stuffed mini burgers, a wee bite of manchego, some sushi, and skewer of curried lamb with mango chutney is tapas as it is meant to be: plates large enough for sharing or not, and portions that are satisfying and delicious. Daily cupcake specials and house made goat cheese ice cream for dessert round out the menu. 

Service is impressive and personal from employees who exude pierced urban cool. When one diner in our party was unsure of which red wine she'd like, the bartender offered tastes of his top three favorites and let her choose the best for her palate from those while our table was readied. Dishes are delivered to tables as their kitchen preparation is completed, and sampling each dish as they arrive is encouraged.

Close quarters are remedied with booths for larger groups, two and four top tables, bar service and couches and chairs at just the right height for coffee table sharing. Outdoor dining is also available on the balcony overlooking the intersection of Central and Pecan Avenues and the Queen City's skyline at this laidback gastronomic retreat.

Very surprised brother took me here, haven't been to this part of town in a long while. 
Atmosphere very laid back nice vibe 
Food excellent! 
Tuna Tacos it works what more can I say 
Soul roll not very spicy but very good! 
Grilled Caesar very nice 
Sushi Fondue also excellent 
I will go back and go back soon!

I've eaten here numerous times before- My husband and I came for our anniversary... As he had never been.  the food has always been good... And because they don't take reservations, we waited to put our name in... While waiting, We overheard the hostess tell the party of 3 in front of us, that it would be about a 5 minute wait.  She went to prepare their table, and came back- we put our name in, and we were told it would be a 45 minute wait... As we watched the party of 3, who came in minutes before us, get sat... We watched 3 other tables, all of which, who arrived at least 30 minutes after us, get sat immediately, at tables that had been empty, the entire time we were waiting. I simply went inside and asked the hostess, why those people were sat immediately/before us, as we saw all of them arrive from the down the street, and she came up with some rude lie... I then explained that I overheard her tell the party of 3 before us, that it would be a 5 minute wait.. And she rudely told me that she never said that... And that we would wait our turn to sit... "Like everyone else" needless to say, we didn't make it that far- we left, and had a wonderful dinner elsewhere, at a restaurant with polite staff- that was 10 times more enjoyable. My advice to Soul? Get some employees who are pleasant who greet and take care of your customers correctly, especially ones who know how to articulate themselves to customers politely. Not sure I will be back.

There is definitely a lot of soul in this food!  I had rocky mountain oysters for the first time and they were awesome!  The ambience is unique, the menu is hard to beat and the drinks - YUM!  I forget the name - but I had a drink that was served in a copper mug....WOW!

Pros: Fantastic food, nice little patio, excellent cocktails, Good service.
Charlotte needs more of this vibe.

Cons: if you go on a weekend night, it's CROWDED. Either get there early, or choose another spot to imbibe. Bar seating is first-come first serve and the tables are for diners only.

My suggestion? Go early on a weeknight to avoid the crowds. You won't be disappointed.
Pork belly tacos are to die for! Wait took forever and host staff was a little rude, but I'll be back for the food and atmosphere.

Everything was closed when we arrived at Charlotte so we gave up on the hopes of having a great meal on our first night at Charlotte. But to our surprise, this "Tapas" bar/lounge was an absolute surprise. The food here was deliciously a breath of fresh taste buds. Everything on the menu was amazing. I truly recommend the pork belly taco because it was out this world. The vibe of this joint was extremely chill/hip, and the service was exceptional. I can't wait to check this joint out in the near future.
The worst wait ever. Got there at 7. Didn't get seated til 10:30. We were told it  was a 2hr wait. Really?  So beyond disappointed!

Tapas is not created equal. If you want a trendy ambiance, excellent flavor combinations in small plates, and a bit pricey menu, please try this place. My husband enjoyed the pork belly tacos with watermelon salsa (he does not even like fruit) but was in heaven over the flavor. Also tried the bacon shells and cheese and it was so creamy and delicious. Pita chips with dip trio is very good, and will help you save a little $$ while trying other plates.
Delicious! Must try. We will definitely be returning on our next visit to Charlotte.

I've been to Soul at least 4 times in the last year and every time I have gone it's been a bad experience.  It's a cute spot in Plaza so I always try to give it a chance, but the management and staff are terrible.  Management is young with no training and no experience.  Hostesses are so relaxed and do not care about customers.  The bartenders openly make fun of people in the restaurant.  As for the wait, there is always one! I've been twice when the booths have been available but because my group wasn't at least 4 people, they've asked us to wait.  One time we literally waited 45 minutes with no one sitting at two of the booths.   I've been at different times and days and it's always the same.  My last visit we were there at 6:00 pm on a Wednesday with several open tables but none available for two people so they lost our business. 

I gave Soul two stars because their food is unique.
By far my favorite place in Charlotte!! I could eat here every day! :) Great atmosphere and food. The lamb lollipops and bone marrow are amazing!!

We're passing through Charlotte on our honeymoon in July and stopped here. Loved the vibe of this place! It was a Saturday night and the wait was over an hour but they take your number and text you when your table is ready. Super cool so you are t stuck waiting. We explored the area and grabbed a beer while we waited. 
We sat outside which was quite cramped. 
We ordered a TON of food! Trio of dips, sushi, pork tacos, flatbreads....there was more. Everything was good, nothing I haven't had though. Fun place. Cool location. Great for a fun date night.

So so delicious. Does not open until 5, but people are lined up out the door to eat there. There is a nice bar area, a nice booth seating area, and true couches/lounge area. Amazing service, amazing food. Also - don't be afraid to try their sushi. So good! Their pork belly tacos are also unexpectedly delicious. All over great restaurant - but not very big. Plan on a long wait or making reservations, and it may not be the best choice for a big party.
Great restaurant. Goat cheese is off the hook. We don't get here often enough but when we do it is worth it. Brussels and pork belly tacos are not to be missed.

After a number of friends recommended Soul, I decided to give it a try. Atmosphere is good, especially if you're lucky enough to sit inside at one of the "living room"-like areas. We sat outside, but no problems there -- the weather was great and the view of the city was nice. 

Service was below average. Sure, it was busy, but that's not my problem, is it? Our waitress seemed exasperated when we asked questions about the menu -- to the point that on her first engagement with us she simply walked away when it was apparent we didn't know what we wanted yet. I would have left at that moment, but I didn't want to ruin the evening for everyone else. 

On to the food: 

They should either remove the sushi from the menu or hire someone that knows how to make it. We had yellowtail with scallions and hamachi with jalepenos. Both were unremarkable, bland and the plating was just wrong. 

The white bean and goat cheese dip was mainly white beans (did they even put any goat cheese in it?). Bland, boring and criminal given that it was unseasoned and lacking goat cheese. I can open a can of white beans at home and won't forget to doctor it up so at least it tastes somewhat interesting. 

Anchovy fries were OK. Saganaki -- same. Mediterranean wings were nicely done. The lone excellent dish was the fried oysters -- lightly battered, delicately fried and juicy inside. 

My main advice to the operators of Soul would be to hire waiters that can handle stress and that at least try to pretend they like their customers. Good, personable service can cure a lot of ills.

The hype is real... the food is amazing. You have to get the pork belly tacos and after that it's your call but you won't be disappointed. I would suggest going before 7pm and trying to sit at the bar. I was able to get a seat right away. I didn't have any cocktails but they looked awesome as well.

I've been to soul for dinner and enjoyed it, even after the hour + wait to get in the door, but after having brunch there today, I will never venture anywhere else (except Zada Jane's) for Sunday brunch! Wow! Awesome flavors! Awesome service! Less of a wait than other popular brunch places! The spinach feta pita=amazing! Truffle fries=f*#k McDonald's fries forever-slap your mama-holy lawd-delicious! The potato hash (sans sausage of course)=rich and tasty! Great mint Julip with fresh muddled mint, and good bloody Mary. Only gripe= they need MORE VEGETARIAN options (some TOFU and "SOY"SAGE would be lovely; they have both across the street at Zada Jane's...another great brunch place) and they need to offer a VEGAN BLOODY MARY (with vegan or no Worcestershire).

Star knocked off for wait times. Unfortunately can't reserve ahead of time so ah well.

Regardless,  the food is pretty good. Ordered the tzatziki dip, fries, and Korean BBQ wings. All food was delicious! They came out as they were ready, so nothing was too cold when it got here. One complaint some may make is the pita bread/chips are a little harder than they should be. Ask for extra napkins when you eat the wings!

Tapas were good, not amazing but worth the money. The pork belly nachos were the best part of the meal. The beer selection is lacking, especially since they are a mile away from a brewery that has 10+ beers. I'll come back again. Service was great!

Good food-great sushi-amazing drinks. Why not five stars??? The staff is rude---and not very attentive. We had to ask 3 times for water, and unless you have extreme tattoos and gauges in your ears, don't expect to see a smile come your way. Bartenders are the best chance of a pleasant employee interaction.

Literally my favorite restaurant I've ever been to. Phenomenal food, excellent service, great bar. I've had probably 12 different things off the menu and all but 1 have been stellar. Even the 1 that wasn't stellar was pretty good. The servers are all wonderful. Very accommodating, happy to chit chat if you like, or be all business. I will say, if you don't like tattoos and piercings on your waitstaff, probably not the place for you. Me? I don't care. The house mixologist is excellent. His take on a moscow mule is the best I've ever had. Its so good that they keep it on draft! Its one of three restaurants in Charlotte to which I consistently return. 

Side note: the sushi is amazing.

Finally, be forewarned: If you go on the weekend you WILL wait two hours to be seated. Its worth it.

So my friend and I checked out Soul Gastrolounge for the first time last night. As the other Yelp reviewers confirmed, there was at least an hour and a half wait - but they take your phone number and text you when your table is ready, which is super convenient if you want to bar hop in the area while you wait. 

 We only ended up waiting an hour and were seated. We ended up ordering the pork belly tacos, truffle fries, Korean BBQ wings, avocado stack salad, and a sushi roll. Each portion is small and comes out when it is ready. 

The pork belly tacos were everything that the previous reviews said they were gonna be - AMAZING. The watermelon added a nice tang to the saltiness of the pork. 

The truffle fries were amazing as well. Hot and crispy and seasoned to perfection as any good fry should be. 

The avocado stack salad was literally amazing and life changing and everything a avocado loving person like myself would dream of. 

The Korean BBQ wings were ok. I'm a fan of spicy food, but this seemed like someone just poured a whole bottle of hot sauce into a bowl, added a dash of Korean seasonings and tossed the wings in there. Wouldn't order again. 

The sushi roll was good. I believe it was called the Geisha roll. Could be wrong. 

Definitely would come back here, but probably during a weekday when it might not be so busy, in comparison to a Friday or Saturday.

First off let me say that the atmosphere is what we went for. I love the exposed brick, low lighting and relaxed seating. It does get a bit noisy around the bar, so if you are looking for something more private get a booth. We were able to grab one of the couches and people watch while enjoying the food. One down side is they do not take reservations so get there early. Luckily, I knew this and we showed up around 6:30 and were one of the last to be seated right away and ended up staying until around 9. This is a tapas bar so you never really know how long people will stay.

Now...onto the food... Which was amazing! The tuna tacos were great, I would have liked them in a soft taco instead of a hard shell, but that is just personal preference. I found myself with sauce all over my fingers after one bite. The white bean and goat cheese dip was just ok, I tasted more bean than cheese though. We had an amazing flatbread that was on special that evening which was the highlight for me. New potatoes, corn, cheese and pesto... Mmmmm! Something I have learned is ALWAYS ASK FOR THE SPECIALS! 

The drink prices were right on target and not overpriced. The service was on point before our server was sat several times with one table being a party of 12. Tatyana still checked on us often and kept our water glasses filled. 

Minus one star for not being able to make reservations or call ahead seating. We do not live close to the city, so showing up and not being able to get in when we want would be disappointing.

Overall a great experience. We will be going back!
Very good spot food was awesome drinks were good service was great the food and the presentation were excellent!!!!
Excellent service. Food was excellent! We enjoyed every bite. Definitely the place to go if you're in Charlotte!

I went here first for a girls night out. I must say, I love the hipster atmosphere with the worn but comfy couches surrounding a coffee table. That was the perfect way to wind down on a Friday evening. I didn't even realize I like cucumber infused water until I came here.
We ordered several dishes to split - lamb lollipops, sticky veal short ribs, fried brussel sprouts, spanakopita, fried meatballs, pork belly tacos and the truffle fries. There is not one item that didn't blow my taste buds out the box! The only thing I would change is the tzatziki sauce. It was not nearly "Greek" enough for me :) 
My advice is to get here early, or you'll never sit. And bring lots of people and order everything and share! One of my best girls' nights for sure.

After having reservations (which they don't take until you show up at their restaurant) and waiting for 2 hours we had to leave and go eat somewhere else because it was going to be another 45 minutes. I have no idea if this place is worth a crap but unless you have 3 hours to wait for dinner do NOT GO HERE on a weekend night!

TH said Bistro la Bon was amazing, fantastic food, spectacular service, great vibe. We will be back

First time I went to this place and loved it! I hear it is typically very busy and has a long wait but we went and were sat immediately. 
The flatbread: AMAZING! I didn't want it to end. And the atmosphere was very cool and chill. Definitely a trendy spot but very enjoyable.

We had been wanting to try Soul and finally made a visit for brunch. It was a pleasant experience all around and we're looking forward to trying the full dinner menu. The food was fresh and tasty, the drinks were mixed well, and the service was just right. Marlon was our server and he did a great job of balancing info and full glasses without overpowering. It was refreshing! We'll definitely be back.
Amazing food. LOVE the pork tacos. Wish the place was a little larger and didn't always have such a long wait.

Used to be my favorite restaurant in Charlotte, but it's more bar bites than true tapas. Don't expect to just walk in and get a seat - it's not uncommon for the wait to be hourS (yes, plural)! Pro tip though, download the NoWait app and get a place in line without having to physically walk in. Then just head up about 15 minutes before the expected seating time to get a drink. Be sure to keep your phone closeby because sometimes you're up earlier than expected and you only have 10 minutes to claim your table. Cocktails are good, but don't expect a hefty pour. I get the pork belly tacos every time! Flatbread and the duck are also delish. Skip the sushi, there are better places to get sushi in town.

3 words: Pork Belly Tacos!!!! With the watermelon? Oh. My. Gosh. A must and enough reason to go to Soul (even if it's your only). Although the fried goat cheese on bruschetta is pretty darn good, too.

My favorite spot in town for a group dinner. But you need to go right at opening time or prepare for a 1-2-hour wait (they don't take call-ahead or reservations and it's a small place). Best size group for your money/eating is 4-5 people. Get about 10-11 small plates/sides and split them all. Such a fun way to eat. Portions are small but you'll get to try a ton of things! Top three must-have's are the ASIAN GLAZED PORK BELLY TACOS (only comes with 3 though, so get 2 orders because you will want MORE), the garlic herb fries, and the curried lamb skewers with mango chutney. NOM.

The "Soul Roll" is just sums it up for this place! The sushi is amazing and the Soul Roll is the best dang roll on the planet. The atmosphere is conversational and small. The hostess's are bitches and I am not a fan of them when I enter the door, but its worth a passing to sit there and eat their amazing food! I've had just about everything on their menu and I love how they have mini plates, so you can have a variety of food at once. Great place to bring a date, have a glass wine or even a cocktail, and hang out with friends. I probably go at least once a week, but the place is very small for such a fantastic food and drinks. Not recommended for huge parties because your food will take forever! I went the other night with 5 people and it took forever to sit, the hostess was a bitch to us because we had 5 people, and our food came out in spurts so we never got to eat all at the same time. One recommendation for Soul is get better hostess's and make your place bigger for dining. Your food is way to good not too! I gave you 4 stars because of my past experience with having a bigger group and the fact that every time I go in their your hostess's are rude, bitchy, and straight up not friendly.

All I can say is wow! There aren't many places that could have made an 8 hour layover from Phoenix  to a long awaited vacation enjoyable... But this place sure nailed it. We went on a Wednesday night, waiter told us there can be a 3-4 hour wait on the weekends. Food, drinks, & service were great.

Seriously great place. Love trying new things and sharing?  Then this place is for you!  Vibe is a little hipster so I stand out like a sore thumb but who cares with such good food!  We tried about 8 different things but the chimichurri beef, dirty south nachos, and queen Charlotte roll stood out!  Great place to bring out of town guests!

Super high quality food. Went here for a birthday dinner and ordered 6-7 different tapas between a friend and I. Had chimichurri beef, Asian pork belly tacos, saganaki, bone marrow, and veal short ribs. One of the tastiest meals I have had easily. Great lightning inside, I would go here just for drinks.

Hands down, one of my favorite places in Charlotte! Their bartenders and servers are the best and the food is allllways tasty! I've loved everything I've ever tried, even things that I had no intention of loving (I'm looking at you, Pork Belly Tacos!). 

It can be a bit loud during peak dinner hours but I'm usually digging the tunes so that's never an issue for me. I take all my out of town visitors here for dinner and/or brunch.
I made my second visit to Soul and was just as pleased this time as the first. The service was great. I love the fries and sushi. Looking forward to the next visit.

Soul was literally my first stop after landing in Charlotte (thankful it's open late night,) and it was even better than I remembered. My friends and I ordered a variety of cocktails; all were creative and delicious (I liked the spicy moscow mule the best.) I ordered the truffle fries (to die for,) a california roll (good, but nothing extraordinary) and pan con tamale (new addition the menu, and absolutely delicious.) Even though it was nearly midnight, the server never rushed us and willingly separated our checks (which I know is a nuisance.) Thanks, Soul, for a lovely evening back in Charlotte! I literally would come to town just to be able to eat here.

Such a great experience and the food was delicious!

We ordered numerous dishes. The garlic fries are to die for! The garlic flavor was perfect just to my liking. The pork belly tacos were a tad too salty for me but the watermelon really toned the saltiness down and was a great compliment to the pork belly. We also enjoyed the ramen bowl, different but delicious. Another great dish was the nachos, fried chicken skin with pimento cheese. I never had anything like that before, it was definitely worth all the calories.

Washed everything down with the cucumber water that they provide which was the perfect closure to the night.

Yummy food and really cool vibe! Loved the sashimi tuna tacos, flatbread and brussel sprouts! Our server Alex was EXCELLENT! She knew the menu very well and was extremely patient while trying to accommodate our friends buttery Chardonnay request! Can't wait to go back! But it would have been nice to have more Chardonnay options by the glass

First review in Yelp gives to Soul Gastrolounge, hands down one of my favourite places in NC. I had the dinner this August and the pork belly bun still impresses me. They have a lot of specialities on the menu, just be adventurous. Nice place for a date, but the place can get quite busy for its popularity.

I have lived in Charlotte for almost 6 years now, and I have to say I sincerely love this establishment. I don't care how long we have to wait to get a table, the food is very much worth the wait every time. I understand the restaurant is relatively small, so wait times will be lengthy  on a Fri, Sat and Sunday night. My main recommendations are the Lamb Lollipops, Hummus platter, and the Truffle fries. OMFG!!! But seriously, the whole menu is quite wonderful. A must try.

This city needs some more places like this. Small, simple, good. Crazy mixed up menu that works in its own weird way. Sushi with a greek influenced menu? Two of my favorite things. WHY NOT? Came her with the lady friend on a Wednesday night. Wanted to sit on the bar and have a bottle of wine and relax. Host told us that patio was only for dining guests... odd but okay. Bellied up to the bar. Sat for about 5 minutes or more before a bartender even recognized we were there. Grabbed a bottle and the dip trio plate. PERFECT. Bartender brought us a sample of one of their specialty drinks as well as a sample of some Soju. Def made up for the small blunter. Finally after the kitchen closed we were able to grab a seat outside. Ended up being a great night. Only regret is that I did not get the Shrimp Ceviche and Spicy Feta.... next time.

I moved to Charlotte about 6 months ago and have not wasted a second to try all of the fantastic restaurants offered in this unsuspecting town.  After a few wonderful experiences and some mediocre, I finally made it to SOUL.  I had only heard great things about it other than the fact that they dont take reservations & don't seat until the entire party is there.  This was not that big of a deal, when you see how tiny the place is inside.  

My first experience was great and I could not wait to go back when my boyfriend was in town.  We didn't want to wait for a table so we sat at the bar.  We had "Bob the Bartender" and couldn't have asked for a better server.  We told him we wanted him to basically do a tasting menu but to keep it under $100.  He not only made us FANTASTIC drinks but each dish he served us paired well with each cocktail. I had the cucumber martini that he prepared old school style by pouring the liquor into the glass from above his head.  He served us wonderful tapas including the Dancing Tuna roll, Fried egg Mushroom toast, hamachi jalapeno sashimi, ahi tuna tacos, pork belly w/ watermelon, etc. For dessert he made us the most delicious Chocolate Martini; I had the goat cheese icecream and my bf had the pistachio.  Both delectable.  I cannot say enough great things about this place, the food & service are amazing and it has been a regular stomping ground for me in Charlotte.  Bravo Soul!

This was one of the worst experiences I've ever had at a restaurant.  I was sooo looking forward to my meal here, but over two hours later and a $120 bar tab, our party was never seated. When confronting the front staff they said "There's no competition, this is Charlotte" basically showed us the attitude.  I will never give this place my business, Make your money while you can, because people will only put up with this shit for so long. Learn to turn your tables.

I have relied on yelp for years, but I have never written a review. Tonight's meal is worthy of a review! The pork belly tacos and lamb lollipops are DELICIOUS. We will order 2-3 plates of tacos next time. The winter mules are also excellent...very ginger-y but it worked. The hostess and wait staff were friendly enough. :) Our water glasses were never empty and the food was served promptly. If you arrive just before they open, there is little to no wait.

This place had decent food, but overall I found it not worth the high price tag. If you're a tapas person and are looking for a cool place to hang out and try a couple different things, it's great! You can find stuff here that's not served anywhere else.

My wife decided to take me here after she went with a couple of her friends.  She thought that I would love their fries.  Which, I do.

The atmosphere is fun and lively.  I have not been when there is loud music playing so I cannot comment on that as I have heard that they do.  

My favorite is the Napoleon roll.  I am not a fan of sushi at all and I love this one.  In fact, I go to Soul just for their Napoleon roll.  

If you are looking for a casual place to hang out and have a good time I suggest trying Soul.  I feel that it is a place you will either love or hate.  I personally enjoy it.

The service that we had was great one time and then poor the second time.  Granted, this is true of most places you go to.
Love this place!!! Porkbell tacos are amazing! Only bad thing is the seating abs the wait. But it's totally worth the wait.

Great food! Great service! Great atmosphere! What more could you ask for? The menu is unique but not too eclectic. They're tapas which is nice. The fried goat cheese bruschetta is delicious. Same with the oysters. It's a popular place, so expect a wait on the weekends. However, they'll text you when your table is ready. So you can enjoy a drink at the bar or wander around the area. Overall, good spot to check out!

Got reservations an hour early.  They seated us 15 mins late.  The food was tiny and overpriced.  Quality a 3* and price a 4*.  They brought out the plates one at a time 5 minutes a part.  An hour after we ordered, after delivering everyone else's food, they finally told the last member of our crew that they were out of his order.  Everyone else was nearly finished with their meal at this point.  The foods a 3 and the experience was a 0.

We went this past Saturday for some drinks. Loved the atmosphere and the service was great. We also ordered the flatbread, tuna tacos, and fries to snack on.  LOVED the tuna tacos!  Overall, we really enjoyed the food and drinks. I didn't really like the mule (way too heavy on the cucumber flavor) but otherwise everything was great.

LOVE THIS PLACE!!! Very hip crowd, fits in perfectly with the Plaza Midwood area. Artistry and very laid back. Reminds me of a DC handout I went to. The best sushi in town. Small restaurant and bar, perfect for a outing with a small group of friends. I would not suggest bring kids, this is more of a adults only restaurant. SOUL Rolls are the best. YUM

Whenever my wife and I feel like doing something lounge-esque but don't feel like dealing with the douchebaggery (from both men and women) that passes for the norm at bars and clubs on Tryon Street, we'll venture to Soul Gastrolounge for good food, stiff cocktails, and some well-chosen chillout music. 

Soul Gastrolounge, thankfully, is devoid of the bling-ridden, obnoxious pretension that soulless dead ends like Cosmos Cafe is so guilty of. Here, you'll find a mix of urban professionals, hipsters, regular joes, all walks, so to speak. You won't be made to feel out of place here. The staff, from the hostess to the waitstaff, are very friendly; the waiter who served us the last time around offered a few suggestions that were first-rate, and he did so with cheerful aplomb. Did I just use the word "aplomb?" Of course, expect crowds on a Friday or Saturday night, but if you time it just right, you can get a table right after 9pm or so, when patrons fool enough to go hit the bars and clubs on Tryon vacate their tables. Suckas.

I love the vibe here. Dimly lit, but not dark, the music loud enough but not deafening, and, yeah, it's crowded on Friday and Saturday nights, but you never get the feel that you've got someone brushing up against you. Unless you like having someone brush up against you. Whatever works, son.

The food itself is the attraction for me. Soul Gastrolounge takes its culinary cue from the classic tapas bar set-up; you're hungry, but you don't want a big meal, you want something you and your party can pick on and share together. There's definitely much on the menu in terms of appetizers and tapas to choose from. The sushi is also quite spectacular, surprising for a non-sushi restaurant.

I particularly enjoy eating and drinking on the balcony. At night, you're blessed with an uncluttered view of uptown Charlotte. The balcony's a bit crowded, since it's quite narrow, but the view's pretty nice, plus, if you're lucky, you'll get to see the freight train come across the heart of Central Avenue.

Honestly, I'd eat at Soul Gastrolounge any time, even when we're not feeling lounge-y. This is one of my favorite places to eat in town.

Great spot. Wait for a table can be very long on weekends. The pork belly watermelon tacos, lamb pops, and meatballs were all awesome. The duck banh mi left something to be desired, but was still very edible. Generally had a cool vibe.

Very close to my house. One of my favorite spots in Charlotte. Very hip and trendy. Loud. Very helpful serves. Menu is very big and slightly complicated. Every item you order will be FABULOUS.

What to get:
Ahi Tuna Skewers
Pork Belly Tacos *****
Brussel Sprouts
Salmon
and basically everything

They don't take reservations and there is always, always a wait, so that is one drawback. But you can give them your cell number and go to Peculiar Rabbit for a drink while you wait for them to text you.

The only good things about this place are the atmosphere and the bartenders. They've got some cool, friendly bartenders. My food is always wrong, undercooked, or incredibly slow. How does that happen every time?

Soul is our absolute favorite place for dinner and/or drinks in Charlotte! We have tried so many things on the menu and have not yet been disappointed. All of their sushi rolls are delicious and I love that their cocktail menu changes seasonally.

This is my FAVORITE place in Charlotte!!! I used to live a few blocks away and went at least once a week. They have everything!!! It's a good place to take a group bc everyone can find something they like! Five stars for sure!!!!!!
A great variety of food in a chill atmosphere. The service was cool and attentive. Underneath the place now is a hipster art gallery/bar that I wish I had spent more time in. I will go again.

We checked out Soul Gastrolounge a couple years ago and for some reason... we didn't really like it. Despite our lack luster experience the place has always remained one of Charlotte's most popular restaurants. While hanging out with some friends they suggested we check out Soul again and we reluctantly agreed. Thank God we did... Soul rocks!

We must have either ordered the wrong stuff or caught them on an off night the first time because this second look at Soul Gastrolounge left us wanting more, and more, and way more. Since we were able to go as a group and split the plates we ended up ordering a lot more than if we had gone alone. We tried the:

Garlic Shrimp
Chimichurri Beef
Dirty South Nachos
Sticky Veal Shortribs
Asian Glazed Pork Belly Tacos
Pan Con Tomate
Soul Korean BBQ Wings
Wild Mushrooms on Toast
Ahi Tuna with Sesame & Soy Drizzle
Duck Bahn Fi Sandwich

All of which was delicious and worth recommending but for me the star of the show was easily the pork belly tacos :)
The pork belly tacos are my favorite plate in Charlotte!

The absolute best food in a log time- shells and cheese ranks up there with the Red Dragon Roll and then finish off with Spanakopita (perfect film dough and spinach).
The best drink with all the above was the cucumber mule!!!
Hip atmosphere, eclectic mix of food. I had the cubanini and it was satisfying.  I want to try the sushi next time.

I love this place, the food, drinks and atmosphere are all tens...my only issue is the music is too loud. Soul is such a chill place to lounge, but the music makes me want to leave because I can barely hear the people I'm spending time with
Loved this place. Great menu and really cool vibe inside. From out of town but in Charlotte often and will definitely come back here.

My husband just politely told me to update my Soul review, mainly due to 1 fact that has changed. The cocktails.

In my last review, I recommended not to get cocktails here. Since that point, my viewpoint has changed 180 degrees. Soul cocktail menu is very diverse and changes with the seasons. The bartenders use innovative techniques to create these pieces of art. Every single cocktail I have gotten has been totally delicious!!!

My opinion on the food has not changed. Everything is perfection. Pork belly tacos. Truffle fries. Ramen bowl. Pork belly stuffed shells. Some of my favs! We always end the night with a sushi roll (usually do the roll of the day) as a way to round out our fullness without spending a ton of money!!

Soul continues to be my favorite restaurant in Charlotte. We typically only go about once a year just to keep it special.
Cool happy hour atmosphere problem is it is always insanely slammed.  I probably wouldn't try to get in with out reservations (and expect service to be a little slow).

Came here on a late night date during the week, hoping their kitchen was still open, I was pleasantly surprised to see they served food until 2am! 

Small plates, BIG taste! Their fusion of Greek, Spanish, Asian and American cuisine is always a reason I keep coming back. I find myself ordering half of the menu just to try everything I possibly can! The stuffed piquillo peppers and goat cheese is one of my favorites as well as the Hummus. 

The ambiance is perfect for a late night date, or a chill gathering to enjoy smooth house music and good company. With a choice between tables, outdoor seating or couches, this place provides the setting for a very good night.

My favorite small plates restaurant in Charlotte. Service never disappoints and neither does the food. Definitely try the pork belly tacos and their ramen bowl (honestly, everything on the menu). Their sushi is also phenomenal!

I live in the area and tend to try and make it several times a year if I can. If the pricing was a little better, I might be able to attend more but can't fit it in my budget as frequently as I'd like.

I recently took my cousin and her fiancé as they were visiting from Poland and they both enjoyed their experience (probably him more than her).

We each started with a drink, my cousin and I got the Rosé, and he got a scotch on the rocks. The waiter mixed up orders and brought two scotch on the rocks but that wasn't a hard fix :). They offer cucumber water so if you want plain, be sure to let your waiter/waitress know. It's very refreshing and light, and I enjoy that little difference they offer. Who isn't bored of regular water with a lemon anyways??

It's a tapas style restaurant so we shared the stuffed piquillo peppers, garlic fries, tuna tacos, and bone marrow. I haven't had a bad experience with Soul's food and that's a reason I keep coming back. 
The last couple times I've been a bit disappointed that my bone marrow bone was very small and in turn, yielded very little bone marrow to enjoy. Luckily this time I had a nice, deep bone and all three of us were able to enjoy it. The texture is a little slimy and bulky, sometimes salty but it melts in your mouth...don't forget to add it on top the provided grilled bread, so delicious.
Tuna tacos never fail either. They're marinated, diced tuna in fried wonton tacos (thin and light), with marinated cucumbers and sriracha mayo (not spicy). 
The fries are garlic-herb salted, dusted with pecorino & truffle oil are always necessary to get. They are thin (almost McDonalds looking), and not greasy so you don't feel too bad eating them. Trust me, try them if you haven't.
The herb cheese stuffed piquillo peppers on bruschetta are sooo good. The cheese is light, not heavy feeling and compliments being stuff inside the pepper. They come out warm on the bruschetta so I'd recommend eating them when they arrive. No worries if it cools a little because they're still delicious.
My cousin and her fiancé had a lamb gyro and enjoyed it. It was a reasonable size as they were able to split it between them.

Overall this experience went well. It was later at night when we arrived so there wasn't a wait (about 10pm), but if you're looking to go closer to the weekend you could be waiting for hours. Prior to this visit I utilized the "no wait" app and I'd suggest doing the same as well because once everyone gets out of work, or its dinner time on the weekend, the place will fill up real quick. Very quickly. I mentioned living close by so the "no wait" app works perfectly. (No joke) about 1.5-2.5 hrs before I know we want to go to dinner, I put our name on he list and just wait. An hour prior to their guesstimated time I will start getting ready and once we're the next to be seated we start walking over. I once put our name on the no wait app a little late (630-7pm?) and were given such a late time that we opted to go somewhere else. We forgot to take our name off the list and we're finally messaged around 1130 that a table was ready. We've already eaten elsewhere and made it uptown by that point so no need to make it over. Needless to say, do some research and utilize the no wait app if Soul is still affiliated with it. Otherwise you may not get to eat at a reasonable hour unless you score a seat at the bar which is first come first serve. Or, you may like the Parisian eating schedule, and all I'd have to say is "enjoy" :). 

Great place, amazing and different food, great vibe with upbeat music... try to make a stop in if you're in from out of town. Your guests shouldn't be disappointed... unless they like the normal burger and fries or shrimp scampi and don't like trying new things.
Consistently good. We have eaten there a bunch and we keep finding new things we love.

I wouldn't say I'm a hipster, but I love Soul.  
Luckily we live in the 'hood and can slip into this place on early evenings or afternoons when it's not slam packed.  
I've not had anything bad here.  Sushi is wonderful and love the option of ordering several tapas plates to share.  Cupcakes for dessert - yum!  The decor is posh but the interior is small and can be very tight at times.  Always had good service here.
This place is amazing. Their pork belly tacos and lamb chop lollipops are to die for. I could get them all day! Just writing this review is making my mouth water

I have only one complaint. This place is popular - people know about their daily drink specials, their eclectic menu, and friendly service, full of suggestions and refills... and being that I wait tables myself, I am hardpressed not to leave the moment I've finished my meal and the place starts filling up. I'd LIKE to sit and stay for several more drinks but my inner-server tugs on my sleeve, telling me to get goin' and let the people make their money (not THEIR servers, though.) 

Where do I start? Went with my boyfriend and roommate one Monday, arrived fairly early, around 6pm, and the server told us about the specials and I ended up grabbing their flatbread special after I heard the words "crab" and "arugula." I LOVED THIS DISH. The crab/arugula/lemon vinaigrette/candied garlic combo is genius, I could eat it out of a tub. It would be just as good as a salad, with more arugula, of course. 

My roommate, who isn't altogether very picky or adventurous, ordered the sliders and cleaned his plate. My boyfriend and I shared the hamachi and jalapeno, which is super fresh, has a pretty presentation, and the accompanying sauce is right on point for the fish.
