Vegan breakfast have always been available to me at this friendly coffee shop upon request, but now they have incredibly tasty options on the actual menu! Their vegan cupcakes are one of my motivational tools, when I need an extra push forward I allow myself one after the goal is achieved.  It can get busy so if you are in a hurry, don't panic at the line, the friendly and efficient service staff will get everyone's order taken and made before you can absorb all the local color on display.

"This will be the longest you've ever waited for a mediocre cup of coffee."

Kind of the best way to put it.  A place with the noun "coffee" in their name is expected to serve excellent coffee, at least in the books I read.  Joe is brilliant, don't get me wrong.  I just don't understand the Mr. Espresso beans, moderate machine and undertrained baristaing that occurs from time to time.  Perhaps when he debuts his roaster and revamps the shop, things will be different.

What? They have coffee here? Really, folks, it's all about the cupcakes. BEST. CUPCAKES. EVER.

These little treats are like beautiful works of art (who ever thought you could actually eat sparkles?) and very creative with flavors - my personal favorite is the cookie dough cupcake. They like to use almond extract in their creamy frosting which adds that little extra. Also the cake itself is a bit heavier than your typical cupcake which can be too light and sometimes fall apart - these babies hold up well which seems to also contribute to their flavor.

Be prepared to shell out the dough, though (no pun intended). They won a Food Network cupcake challenge and unfortunately they now have the prices to match. Still, for a special treat these are worth it.

Oh yeah, and I hear they have coffee and sandwiches too, but why bother with those?

One tip: The selection of cupcakes are at their peak at 10-11am. Get there too early and they won't be out yet, too late and the pickings will be slim.

A nice alternative to Joe's Fresh Farm Grill.  Excellent place to visit for breakfast or lunch.  Food is delicious and prices are reasonable.

Yes, Cupcake Wars brought them some claim to fame but I think cupcakes are over-priced and unsatisfying.  Shall we have a tea party next?

This is a coffee house with a comfortable atmosphere, if somewhat crowded at times.  The patio is nice on a cool morning or evening.

Like most places in Gilbert that have staying power, your experience will be judge on time of visit.  Service suffers as each place gets busier.

Love this place. Cute as a button and the coffee and food is great. Very fresh.

 I have had casual business meetings here over coffee as well as hung out with my kids. Chill vibe:)

We absolutely love this coffee shop. We've gotten coffee numerous times and the coffee is excellent! We started coming here on Sunday's for breakfast. Love the food. The egg white sandwich yummy. It's called the Rosa which I my name Also. Friday my husband & I went in for lunch, I love the Chicken pesto sandwich so tasty. We will be back frequently, my son loves the whoppie cookies. So tasty. (Try the caramel macchiato so scrumptious . My favorite, iced) my husband likes the Spanish latte iced.

Need to study, but don't want to be in a library? This place is a good one - as long as the sun is still out. I'm not sure if they are just super energy friendly or they can't afford the electricity, but this place is always so dim once the sun goes down. If you have a laptop, then not a huge problem, but if you want to read or study a textbook, just realize it might get a little hard on the eyes. 

Oh, you want to know about the coffee? Yeah, its coffee. Nothing that blows me out of the water making we want to drive miles and miles to grab it, but its decent cup of joe that will keep you awake and go down smooth. I prefer the hot chocolate over their coffee. But honestly if it came down to having choose between starbucks coffee and the coffee from here, I would be indifferent. They are best known for their cupcakes, I am best known for not paying $3 for cupcakes, so no opinion here.

This place is spacious, tons of seating and always friendly employees. Free wifi and a really comfy patio area. A really good change up from the traditional coffee shop in terms of environment. And if you have a pimple or you rate a 4/10 on the hot or not scale, just take your date into the back couch room for a nice relaxing chill area.

There is something about his place that I find relaxing and charming. I can't quite place my finger on why, but it's a place I enjoy scheduling meetings or stopping in for a quick bite. Their pomegranate tea is unsweetened and tastes fantastic. I could easily become addicted to it. Ice also had a cooper sandwiches and they were good too. Usually it's filed with people on their computers, but I prefer to step outside and relaxing in the sun. Definitely worth trying if you haven't been.
Best cupcakes in the world. The cherry cupcake is sooooooooo good. They end up at every celebration we have

Absolutely love this cute little place! It's part of Agritopia so there's lots of plants and foliage in the surrounding area.
Lots of indoor seating, occasionally it's busy but there are tables outside as well!
The staff are always nice and both the food and drinks are great; I especially love their chai.
Try the waffles if you're there in the morning!

I love this place!! They have the best mocha monsoon I have ever had and the best coconut whoopi pie - simply amazing.  The atmostphere is just as weonderful, quaint little gem to stumble upon.  A friend of mine brought me here a few months ago for the first time and now we are hooked!  We go all the time!! Fantastic little place, you wont regret going here.

Love this place! The environment is awesome and you can't go wrong with the food here. I especially love to come here with friends and have coffee and a dessert. The salads and other items are just as awesome. They have specialty drinks that I can't find elsewhere in the valley. The perfect place to come and read, write, or just hang out with friends.

Absolutely love this place.  Love the coffee and pastries, the lemon basil scone is my favorite although they don't make them as often as they used too. My son's on a very restriced diet so the vegan cupcakes are his favorite. I never been disappointed by any of the lunch sandwiches. I usually go mid morning through the week to meet a friend or just take my Kindle and grab a table outside in the shade (during the cooler months). Nothing beats sitting on their patio with a great cup of coffee and a good read.
Best coffee...try the breakfast burrito supreme....amazing!!!  Check out the farm....so adorable!!!

Not overly impressed... have been here once and even after the girl repeated my order still got it incorrect. Because of that I probably will not go back again especially since the line was long and I had to wait 10 minutes for coffee.

Had the most charming lunch with my mom here. It is a unique setting. If I were a local it would be my go to place. The grounds are so beautiful and the food is amazing. I had the tomato basil sandwich and savored every bite. Topped that off with a luscious strawberry cupcake with decadent cream cheese frosting. Can't wait to go back and try one of the amazing breakfasts and coffee!

A neighborhood gem! Great place to bring family and friends to just relax and hangout. They have a killer chorizo breakfast burrito and their whoopie pies are to die for. This place is a regular stop for me. Must go!

Had the Papas Grande and it was delicious.  The only reason I did t give it 5 stars is that we had to sit outside and there were tons of flies.  Little surprised they didn't have fly zappers outside to try and control the flies.

How did I miss this place for so long??

It's right next to Joe's Farm Grill, perhaps I was always so stuffed after having lunch or dinner there I payed it no mind.

However, next time I'll stop here FIRST for some amazing cupcakes.  They have a lot of unique flavors (a lot of them vegan) and all I have tried so far have been very yummy and light.

The coffee is very good too, they have some unique latte flavors.

Fruit loop cupcake?  I'm still waiting to try it!

I love Joes Farm Grill so I thought this would be just as good but it was alright. 


We checked this place out for my friend's birthday. She had heard they had the best cupcakes in all of Arizona and I had to see if it was true. I ordered the berry cupcake for her and I. The cupcake itself had lots of fresh berries inside and the frosting was light and decadent. The cupcake was amazing overall.

The inside of the coffee shop has a homey, modern vibe to it. There are wood tables, fresh flowers and even the coffee bar is made of wood. The inside vibe is relaxing and your typical coffee culture you have come to expect. Plenty of patio seating outside and lots of free parking of course. 

Now for the coffee...I am a coffee snob. The coffee that my husband and I ordered was not very good. It was alright but some of the flavors just did not blend well. My husband ordered a cinnamon flavored one and it was terrible. It just tasted like strong coffee with tons of sugar and syrup. I was not impressed and would not go back to get a coffee. 

Sadly this place is called "The Coffee Shop" and the only good thing I consumed there was a cupcake. I would not recommend the coffee. I'm sure the tea is a lot better and don't forget a cupcake. You won't be disappointed with that. The scenery and the cupcake is the reason I gave this place a higher score.

The Coffee Shop has a great atmosphere in a really gorgeous location. The Indio Panini is my personal favorite breakfast item to order. It's comforting and flavorful, but balanced with the greens that come on the side. Ironically, the coffee is nothing special, particularly if you're going to drink it black. You may want to just skip it. Their dessert case is always worth perusing though. Their cupcakes come in fun flavors and they're dusted with edible glitter, which adds something extra memorable.
Initially I was hesitant on the $9 sandwiches but the sandwiches are actually quite big and definitely worth it. The breakfast burritos are definitely worth the price and wayyy good.

very nice setting, right next door to Joe's Farm Grill (previously reviewed and raved about). Friendly, cozy and crowded. Great, huge sandwiches and good coffee. I am picky about coffee though. A lot of places have coffee that tastes good but for some reason makes me very thirsty. Such was the case here, but it was ok. The absolute standout for me was the peanut butter scone. Never had one, or even heard of one before. It lived up to my hopes and I enjoyed every moment I spent eating it. 

Added bonus, the fresh dates were out at the farm stand. However, the plastic thing on the wall that was supposed to hold the cash for the honor system was empty of envelopes. I asked at the coffee shop but they didn't know. Said it was a different place. Well, ok, I went back. Stuck my money in the plastic thing. Figured even if someone else took it at least I did my part. It wouldn't be on my conscience. Had to have those dates. 

All of Joe's stuff - you're great - I hope you stay in business forever! or at least a really, really long time!

Whoa! What happened? The service at the Coffee Shop used to be so great. It used to be nothing but friendly, helpful people giving "service with a smile." But today? The exact opposite.

So, to The Coffee Shop employees, in case you don't know this already, this is how it works: when you forget to put in an order so that only one of our meals comes out to us, but the other meal does not even get started until we ask where it's at 15 minutes later...that is YOUR fault. You should apologize; and you should not look at me like I'm being a trouble maker. [I'm still waiting on an apology, by the way.]

And when a customer has a complaint, do not stand there doe-eyed and silent hoping that the problem will just go away if you stay quiet enough. That's not how it works. Instead, address the issue: admit the mistake and correct it. And when you deliver the missing food -- the mistake YOU made -- do not drop it on the table like you're doing me a favor and I'm lucky to be sitting there.

And no, it wasn't just me having a bad day or something. The table next to us overheard our complaints, and chimed in how appalled they were at the horrible service they received today too. In fact, the palpably bad attitude left such a bad taste in all of our mouths, I don't think any of us could really appreciate how good the flavor of the food was. I know I couldn't/didn't.

I hope the owner/manager checks up on their reviews. Because if the service to be expected is anything like what we received today, we will not be back.

This is where I get my gourmet cupcake fix!  Love the cupcakes, lots of unique, delicious flavors!  The edible glitter just speaks to my inner girlie-girl and makes me happy!

The coffees are great- I calorie splurged and had a Spanish Latte on my last visit.  It was the perfect sweet-bitter combination!  

I've only eaten breakfast here, but the menu looks great. 

I love the atmosphere-very industrial meets antique meets country.  It can get a little loud, but I blame that on the rude people who don't watch their children and scream into their cell phones more than the business.  

Staff has always been friendly and efficient!

UPDATE: 3/19/17

Honestly I really WANT to like this place because the cupcakes and drinks are good but every time I come here there's always something wrong. Last time I ate a chunk of dirt from my salad because it wasn't washed properly. This time, I found hair in my food. This has actually been the second time I've found hair in the food. I don't know if it's because they are always busy but come on.... tie your hair up or something in the kitchen.

YEAH!!!  AGRITOPIA!!!  In case of zombie apocalypse I will be setting up my KINGDOM here. After wandering through BARONE and Joe's and the lines being SUPER long we decided to get a sandwich at the coffee shop.  Awesome and cute little place, GREAT CUPCAKES!!  Me and my daughter split the veggie wrap and a couple of beverages from the cooler. I loved the place. They had a great pesto aioli on the wrap that we were scooping up with our chips. ONE SUGGESTION.......with such a great menu, I think they could step up the wrap selection instead of using a plain ol tortilla, I think you guys are better than that.

This is place is in the middle of Agritopia, which is a very nice place. 

FOOD - lots of choices. mostly brunch meals. They are very decent

COFFEE - one of the best here in the valley. 

SERVICE - real and genuine service. Polite and answers the needs of the customers accordingly

AMBIENCE - very trendy considering that is in GILBERT where everything is made to look feel and look like the great "AMERICAN SUBURBIA"

PRICE- same with any coffee shops here in Metro Phoenix. $7-10 for brunch and about $4-5 for a cup of coffee. Average. 

RECCOMENDATION- I highly suggest to check this place out. Nice people, awesome ambience and LEGIT food equals GREAT TIME.
The atmosphere and food are good. I had the breakfast sandwich. The coffee tasted burnt and a bit bitter. The service at the register was sub-par.
The coffee shop has the best shiiii in town. Their pastries are so soft and good IVE NEVER had a bad one. Also the cuff cake americano is soooo good. Love this place.

It's been unusually cold and it's April!!  I don't mind since I love coffees and teas.  
I'm on my way to meet up with girlfriends at Agritopia.  Glad I was unusually  early enough to pick up a cup of Cappuccino at this cool little hidden gem.  Opposite from this coffee shop is the farmstand.  On the off hours they usually have an honor system, depending on what is grown each season.  This time there were bags of oranges sitting on the table outside.  
I go inside the coffee shop to find a  couple of friendly young girls tend the register while a couple of guys are busy cooking and prepping in the kitchen.  I really want to try their breakfast one of these days, but Joe's Farm Grill keeps me from it.  
I got the last of the coconut cupcakes.  They have about 15 different cupcakes such as horchata, red velvet, boston creme, etc.  Surprisingly, there were not much choices left considering it was only 6:30pm.  The buttercream with coconut frosting was delicious.  The cake itself was supermoist. The cappuccino was a little weak for my taste, but still enjoyable.  Cartel's is hard to beat when it comes to cappuccinos.  The extra star rating would be for the cupcakes and ambiance.
I was taking my sweet time when I looked at my watch!  Crikey, I'm gonna be late and holding the sleeved paper coffee cup, my friends would know why.
This place is great.  Vegan Cupcakes = Dee-Lish!

If only it were closer. Or if only I was. I would marry this wonderful gem of a business and call it a day. 

The cupcakes are delish.
The latte is as close to on par as I suppose I can ask for.
The ambience is stellar.
And the line was in direct relation to its awesomeness.

I cannot go often, but if I could, I would.

Oh, and I asked if they could make gluten-free cupcakes. They said they could make any flavor gluten-free, though I am not confident in that, it still cracks the whip on any other cupcakery out there.

Now if only I were rich and well, had a car, I would move there in a hot second. Too bad for me. Good for them.
I love this place for the food and environment. It's also a great place to meet people in the community. Gorgeous outside and friendly staff! Good place to work on my laptop during the week as well!

Great coffee (latte for me), yummy scrambles and breakfast burritos, and tons of indoor and outdoor seating. So far, this is my favorite coffee shop in the area. Also the prices are reasonable and the staff is really friendly. It gets pretty busy on the weekends, but it's a quiet and cool place to relax during the week.

This is honestly one of my favorite coffee shops in town. I love the vibe of this place and it's a great place to study or do work. It can get pretty busy at times but for the most part it's not too packed. They have seating outside but it's usually too hot because you know, Arizona. However during the cooler parts of the year, it's a great place to chill outside.

Good food great atmosphere. Home made salsa goes great with Papas Burrito.  Relaxing back patio under the trees in the midst of a huge farm. Community garden across the streets 

Pastries are made fresh daily and their cupcakes are award winning .
Had the California club and it was amazing. Also enjoyed the home fries! Love the quaintness of this little shop! Highly recommend it. It has ample parking, outdoor patio, small kids menu.

The Coffee Shop has become a Sunday tradition to the ladies in my family. It reminds us of all the things we love; the beautiful weather of Arizona, the hip indoor rustic décor that reminds us of San Diego or Santa Monica, and the beautiful farm outside. We love sitting out on the beautiful patio surrounded by lush greens and flowers, at times it feels like I'm sitting back at my family's home in Michigan. 

I typically order the quiche which is fantastic and comes with either fresh cut fruit or a spring salad which is a perfect combination to the fluffy quiche. The coffee is good; I have yet to try a fancy coffee drinks since I typically prefer iced black coffee.   

If you are ever in the area or want to try something different, I would highly recommend a stop to The Coffee Shop. If you are ever there on a Sunday and see a group of ladies (we all look alike) laughing, chances are that's us...stop by and say hi!

This place has so much charm and is delicious. I can only speak for the coffee and pastries because I haven't bought food here yet. I make an effort to try coffee where ever I visit and this place is the best place I've tried. It was their monsoons that won me over (the mocha coconut monsoon). Also, their drinks are priced a lot more reasonably than other coffee shops. I highly recommend giving this place a try.

Oh I wish that this place was closer into town ...and even dare I dream in North Phoenix...Joe has a fun style that I really relate too. His coffee shop has many elements that I can't resist ..coffee drinks, great baked goodies , fun vintage feeling decor and a " farm stand" out front. 

Unfortunately the only time I get to stop by here is on my ventures to The Pork Shop ..

Great place to hang out and converse over coffee, breakfast, or lunch. It's a local favorite so be prepared to wait - to order and to sit, especially on Saturdays. But it's worth it! Healthy options, Midwest/retro feel and outdoor seating. Rose garden, farmers market and room for kids to run outside. The only con is that I don't think the baked goods live up to the hype. Overall one of my favorite places & the San Diegan is as good as the reviews say!!

I love this coffee shop! I love the concept behind it, I love the coffee, food, service, atmosphere, you name it- I love it. They have wonderful seating outside, beautiful gardens, and a 24 hour farm stand outside! That's right! A 24 hour serve yourself farm stand. I work from home and often take my laptop and head over to get some work done. I have always had great service, and it's my go to spot when I have family in town. Everyone that has visited has loved the area and it has a feel that says "come on in and stay awhile" Joes Farm and Grill is next door- which is good as well!

One of my favorite places in Gilbert for a delicious meal, pastry and drink. Yesterday I ordered a turkey and Havarti and added avocado, it was so delicious. I also ordered an iced green tea and it was very refreshing. I was greeted and served by friendly staff and that alone makes experience that much better.

5 stars easy... A friend of mine turned me on to this caffeine heaven. I'm from Chicago but visit AZ often. Every time we visit we make it a point to stop at The Coffee Shop. 
The Joe is out of this world and the Bakery items look like they came of the pages of a magazine. The atmospheres is pleasant and the staff is friendly. 
We ate there for breakfast was wonderful as we sat outside enjoying the flowers and weather.
You cant go wrong going here.
Favorites: vegan taco salad wrap (even if you love meat), bacon breakfast burrito, the breakfast sandwich with avocado and onion, butterscotch and Spanish lattes! There's so much good stuff here :)

Sorry to say to all the lovers here, this place is not that great! I have been to plenty of other places that were better. Especially in San Francisco!! But the girls wanted to try it out. Now my wife went home and made some that were a lot better! And we didn't have to deal with the flies!! Jen! please the Best cup cakes ever????? You need to get out more?
Another hipster coffee shop - cute atmosphere right next to Joe's Farmgrill.  Decent regular coffee.

This is actually my favorite coffee shop to go to! There is always a very nice environment there and the decor is truly unique! The food and coffee are both great! I especially love their cupcakes! It does get a little noisy at times which makes it hard to stud, so I use it more of as a hangout spot than a study spot.
Surrrounding areas are beautiful...Flies inside the bake goods display...tasteless food...overpriced...never again.

Yuuuuup!

So good, we did it again (literally, twice).

Amazing home cooked food with an amazing menu and amazing coffee and amazing experience.

How can I explain this for some of you who don't know me....I love breakfast and I gave The Coffee Shop 5 stars (which I don't do often).

With such a wonderful and helpful staff, the food to energize you for the day and coffee that will make you melt, you cannot pass the opportunity by to visit The Coffee Shop (they have way more than just coffee).

I love love love this place. Their food is great. San Diegan is a must. The chai tea here is fantastic. All their food is great. 

One downside is their seating absolutely sucks. If you go when it's busy you are probably better off going somewhere else. People are pretty cut throat there about stealing tables. It really sucks standing in line to order and have all the seats taken from people behind you. There are no heaters or misters for the patio. 

Overall I love this place and think it's one of the best places in Arizona to eat

Studied here for a couple hours in the back on one of their couches. Their green tea is one of the best I've had at any local cafe's; it was a tropical mix, but I think they need to go to the loose leaf teas and incorporate that art. Outdoor and indoor was great. They had plenty to choose from with drinks, breakfast/lunch items, and pastry like items. The only down fall was that their WiFi was only half reliable while there... But hey at least it was free. I would definitely recommend.

I just moved to Arizona last year. I am a mile or so away from this place I love the ambiance, the streamed music (though sometimes loud for the acoustics), the wiFi, and the food. Oh, wait. I love the Cafe Mochas too. The people who work here are the greatest, and the whole experience is of a nice little coffee cafe where you can get breakfast, coffee, lunch, and dessert, all in one place. My favorite coffee spot since I moved here due to the overall experience and convenience of being so close. Now all I need is a Scooter so I can hook up on weekends for rides. 

The food is pretty good. I like the variety, and thankfully they have added to their menu recently. I would still like to see more options though, and if they offered more specials it would be a breath of fresh air. I would also like to see a few salad options. I know I would love to forgo the bread many times and just have a large salad with fresh organic ingredients. Maybe one day they will add salads to the menu. The fact that they add almost vegetarian options is wonderful. With all of the fast food and chain restaurants around, I'm happy to frequent a place that tries to serve healthier, fresher, options. 

One thing they can improve upon is the fly situation. The flies do make contact with the cupcakes. If they were to keep the cupcakes in the display sealed, this would resolve that issue. But realize the fly situation is just as  bad at Joe's Farm Grill. It's due to the openness of the buildings, so there's no getting rid of them. But, you can cut down on them making contact with the food by keeping the desserts in a closed display. That little investment alone will put people at ease. Again, I've been to Joe's Farm Grill next door where I had to leave due to the flies. It's those open buildings. The best they can do is cut down by being extremely clean in picking up debris and adding a sealed upper display case so the flies don't have the opportunity to land on the desserts.

As for the complaints about the kids from someone above, there are days that the kids are all over the place, which is what kids do. I don't have kids, so that can be unnerving. Depends on the time of day. It's not like that all the time. Also, this is a neighborhood of families, so what did you expect? Although it's wonderful for you to have this daydream of studying here or doing your business, it's a restaurant/coffee shop. It's going to have noise and activity. Frankly, I hate it when I see the place crowded and find that the students or business people with their laptops have monopolized the whole area though they are no longer eating or drinking. That table you're hogging could be used for someone else who will actually be eating their meal there. So, do your studying at home if it bothers you, or better yet, the library. 

All this being said, I still love going here as the people who work there are very nice and always greeting you with a positive vibe.

Great Vegan Cupcakes and Rich Delicious Coffee

What makes this  place great? the ambiance 
The coffee shop provides customers with a peaceful, easy going vibe. It is the perfect place to study or meet with a friend. Outside their is a community garden, which is a great place for a stroll 

Highly recommend this place for a Lunch/Breakfast or just a quick coffee fix.
Love this place! Try their red velvet cupcakes to die for! As for mom and pop and not every Starbucks on every corner this is truly a hidden gem!

The cupcakes!  Oh, the cupcakes.

I frequent Joe's but always passed over this place.  I work at a coffee shop so I just wasn't interested.  I'm so glad I stopped in...

the red velvet cupcake was to die for.  Seriously.  When I think cupcakes, I think airy and light... super sweet.  This one was dense.  Every bite made me so happy.  My little sister & I split one... I really didn't want to share, it was that good & rich.

I also had a Spanish Latte... which was delicious.  I'm sort of an annoying coffee snob so I was surprised that I liked it so much.

Yum.

Had breakfast with a friend here today. Cupcake game is on Point!! (And Yes cupcakes are an acceptable breakfast food). After seeing this place featured on cupcake wars and being a die hard sugar feen, I knew I had to try this place. Beautiful landscape, friendly service and breakfast ( had to get some eggs to balance out that sugar) was yummy. There was a long line, not surprising for a Sunday morning, but it moved pretty quickly. It's a bit far of a drive for me so probably won't be here on a regular basis but will definitely be back!

I love coffee. I love coffee shops. My secret dream (not so secret now) is to one day have a coffee shop of my own. The Coffee Shop, across from the Agritopia gardens and Joe's Farm Grill, is what I aspire to. 

The coffee selection is vast and everything I've had tastes delicious. And if you, dear reader, do not like coffee and feel that one cup of coffee is indistinguishable from another then you would be very wrong.  Some establishments are very capable of making bad coffee. However, and thankfully, not The Coffee Shop. 

While I'm not the biggest fan of sweets I would still recommend partaking in one of the beautiful cupcakes offered here. Did I mention they are award-winning? Cupcake creators, Jessica Cuff and Jenna Flowers (sisters), won Cupcake Wars. 

I'm a creature of habit and so you'll find me sitting in one of the retro couches with my laptop, sipping a Spanish Latte and noshing down on a Tomato Basil sandwich (Mozzarella, mayo, tomato, basil, onion, avocado, feta, and Italian dressing on 9 grain bread).

Last minute decision to stop here because of the few vegan items on the menu my wife was able to eat. The ambiance was great but man the Flys all over the cookies and pastries. I saw three Flys having a picnic on one of the cupcakes in the window at the register, I watched Flys land on every single item, NO covers on the trays! Maybe the regurgitated fly saliva is the secret ingredient on the sweets, but for a group that made to to a TV show this mistake is novice. I had the chorizo omlett it was over salted and the cheese wasn't melted. My wife enjoyed her tofu scrambler. The waffle that came for our son had previous burnt waffle residue all over it. Come here to pop open your laptop and take advantage of no table service which equates to no one bothering you while you sip coffee and hide from the sun.

I've been here dozens of times and always liked the atmosphere.  However, the coffee has really gone downhill it seems.  Not sure if the beans are over roasted or the baristas just don't know what their doing.  Incredibly bitter coffee drinks during the last month or two.  Go to Cartel is you want to see what it should taste like.  The baked goods are tasty but they always have a serious issue with flies.  Get a handle on the flies please.  It's just disgusting, especially with cupcakes sitting out in the open.

Such a cute cafe. Love the patio area. Ordered the coffee cake for my son & the bacon/cheese/spinach/mushroom omelette with a side salad. Plus a triple latte. Food was delicious and the coffee was perfection. This place is definitely worth checking out.

*note, sleepless night, just finished my first pot of coffee, so this review might suck*

Hard to find, no sign visible from the street, most people rush past ignorant of it's existence...
Even my Sons family who had lived here a year before us had never been there, and he married a coffee person.


Welcome to my "Third Place" I make a fine "cuppa" at home, but a day I don't stop by here is a day that I feel a lack in my life. 
By far, my favorite coffee house in years, and here it is in Gilbert Az? 
Really? Here? Thank you Starbucks, for convincing the Masses that paying more than a quarter for a cup of Joe was acceptable, even mainstream! 

Lovely space, well decorated, by a person with taste, flair and fun, NOT by a committee or a panel or by customer survey. , lots of wood, with a sitting room in the back for your lazy hanging out needs. 

Ratty recliners? Not here, Nice... VERY nice leather chairs and sofa with driftwood tables scattered about. Nice artwork on the walls, mixing family photo's, nature photography with understated rock and Roll pictures. (having a pic of Jim Morrisons grave is cool, having a UNPRETENTOUS picture of Jim Morrison's grave is worth a star of its own, there is a fare farmers market out front, but for myself, I like to park in the rear and walk through the garden and patio... It's a oasis amidst the sprawl, the explosion of colors and aromas are a extra treat that shouldnt be missed.

This family understands that the atmosphere, the music, the creation and integration into the lifeblood of the community is what makes a coffeehouse so effen awesome.
and effen awesome it is!
 

And probably most importantly... full of the exact friendly faces you need when getting your java on. 

Homemade sugar goodness is available. It's the sort of thing that one dreams coming from your own kitchen, but with a tad more color and odd combinations (Coffee and Cigarettes cupcakes anyone?), to intice you in. Displayed in the front case, drawing you in like a moth to a flame,  like Teri Garr in Young Frankenstein... wholesome goodness you want to introduce your Mom to, yet you know it's soooo bad for you... It's gonna kill you, but your urges make it impossible to say no.

*ahem*

Did I mention awesome cupcakes?

Oh, I guess I just did.

The "real" food is quite wonderful as well, and worth the trip on its own, you simply cant go wrong, the open face omelet is magnificent, sandwiches quiche, burrito's etc, all normal food, but with a flair and style that make every bite full of extra-awesome.


One downside... success.


Alas, they were discovered and won a much deserved "Best Of" award for Phoenix, since then they have had to hire more  people and the family has had to move into the kitchen to keep up. 
The service has not diminished, the only downturn is has been in my beloved coffee. 
they still remember my families order, but sometimes its not as good as it was, and I view that more as a sign of how much they spoiled me before than anything else. 
Business is booming, and they couldn't keep up so they had to hire. It's normal that new people need to be trained, and that any amount of training will not equal years of experience.
As other coffeehouses fight and cut corners in these tough times, it says a lot that The Coffee Shop is growing and healthy. 

Still, with that all said, this is my favorite coffeehouse in years, 

This is a perfect companion to Joes Farm Grill next door. (many reviews on Yelp and elsewhere) Together, they are reason for my Bride and I to want to move to the Agritopia subdivision they are a part of, just to be able to walk there in the morning, along the tree lined streets (rare around here in a work of cactus and ... dirt)

It is certainly no secret to anyone who knows me, reads my blog, or follows me on Facebook or Twitter, that Im a foodie at heart and will go to great lengths to try new restaurants, dishes or types of cuisine I've not previously experienced.  All of that having been said I have a HUGE food crush on a little gem hidden in Gilbert, Arizona at a place called Agritopia, I'm speaking of course of "The Coffee Shop."

With such a simple name you would be tempted to assume this was a mere coffee shop slinging run of the mill or even above average coffee drinks and you would be WRONG.  While The Coffee Shop does in fact serve up coffee drinks as expected, it is not caffeine which drew me in or keeps me going back.

Lets begin with how I found them and what has brought me to today.  A few weeks ago Joe's Farm Grill was having their 5th Annual customer appreciation day (they served in the neighborhood of 4000 free cheeseburgers but more on that later) and trusty pal Mikey and I dropped in to have a burger and fries.  As we were leaving, I decided I wanted to stop by The Coffee Shop (which is on the same parcel of land) to see what It was all about.
Upon walking inside, the salivation began.  There, arranged before me was just about the most mouthwatering display of cupcakes and whoopie pies I have ever seen.  The first thing that caught my eye were the Coconut creme whoopie pies, seemingly very plain but with the promise of greatness if done well...and they were!
 
These Coconut creme whoopies are just about the best things I have ever eaten (and Ive eaten a LOT).  Unlike many of the whoopie wannabe's I've eaten in the past, the pastry chef here achieved the perfect balance of sweetness, moisture and density with the most pleasant, light crunchy outer texture.  So flavorful was the shell that I was almost taken aback by the creme filling that was obviously made with absolute care and devotion to the craft.  Simply incredible (I feel like there should be a new Food Network show called "Whoopie Pie Wars!")

On to the next bit of tastiness in the form of a tray lined with cupcakes whose sign read "Chocolate chip cookie dough,' YES please.  They looked simple, well decorated but not overdone and I was keen to try one. No flaccid, tasteless frosting here, there's butter creme on that there cupcake.  Sprinkled with chocolate chips and what looks like chocolate Disco dust was the best tasting buttercream I can remember having eaten.  They've somehow been able to create the essence of cookie dough in cake form, a bit of gooeyness, great flavor and yes, i'd eat a whole bag of them.
The PB&J cupcake found its way into my mouth next and took me back to my Grandmothers kitchen with her homemade bread, peanut butter and preserves only BETTER (sorry Grandma), it was deliciously dense, the peanut butter buttercream (say that 5 times really fast) was sweet, creamy and perfectly accompanied but a little dab of jelly on top (along with a generous squirt in the middle of the cupcake.) I highly recommend this one.

I did grab a few other cupcakes before lapsing into a sugar induced coma including cake batter, coconut and a strawberry one I got pictures of and ate but whose clever name I cannot remember (terrible journalist...oh, wait, as a Blogger I admire recently wrote, I'm not a "professional journalist!").  Everything i've had so far has caused me to make the 40 mile trek from home to The Coffee Shop for a treat I just can't find anywhere else in the Valley.  If you desire a creative, perfectly made treat, get into your car and make the trip from wherever you might be to THe Coffee Shop at Agritopia.
 
Check out the Chefs responsible for the creations I've mentioned and more on their recent winning episode of  Cupcake Wars on the Television Food Network.

I so want to like this place, but I am continuously dissapointed.  I can not understand how a coffee shop that has a bakery can never have baked goods at breakfast.

This morning the have about a dozen cupcakes, not one was chocolate.   The only other options were their mini loaves(think muffin flavors in loaf form). 

I asked what the cookies were, the server replied those are scones.   Have never seen a flat scone.

They offer a menu item called the Yountville.   I always order it burrito style.  Side note to that, it never comes the same way twice.  Sometimes I am charged for burrito style, I'm ok with that, sometimes I am not.  Sometimes it comes with mixed greens sometimes it doesn't. My favorite..mixed greens come with dine in but not to go???

Today I was informed they can only do that when they are not busy.  

I have given them multiple opportunities,  I have called but the phone just rings, last visit I left a note asking to speak to someone, no one called.  

In fairness, it's a great environment,  good coffee and love it being neighborhood.   Maybe I just don't understand their business model but I'm on my way to the new coffee shop down the street.

Excellent breakfast! 
Great ambiance amongst nature
We had a veggie omelet & rosa breakfast-wich. Would recommend both. Comes with a nice side of fresh salad. 

OJ was delish. Not sure if it's freshly squeezed but we liked it. 

Would come back next time we are in AZ.

Have been literally coming here for years. Always loved the owner Jessica Cuff and her sis. Well i have been in about three tomes in these last months, bringing new people with me each time. Again, the staff seems like they are doing you a favor by serving you. Great food and drinks. So its sad. But i thought at least the owner was nice. But now even she seems unfriendly and sour when I have said hello. Maybe the attitude is pervasive? I don't know, but this place needs a new vibe of the warm friendlies. Customer service is everything, not hipster snob..... Too bad. Great little concept, great products. Maybe they are all just really burnt out or bored? I dunno but it definitely is sad to see the change. You'd think if you'd been going somewhere since day one they'd be excited to see you????? Adios coffee shop. There are too many other places with less attitude.

Stopped by in the morning for a coffee and a few hours later for a sandwich for lunch, all was great! I just really wish they would keep the kale and quinoa bowls as a healthy option for lunch! Great atmosphere

Have never had a bad experience here. Food is fresh and light, the artisan pastries are fantastic. Kid friendly and comfortable. Usually a big line but they are on their game and move it fast as well as get food out fast. A nice change from the usual big chain manufactured food joints all over the valley.
One of my favorite local businesses! Great coffee and food. Perfect atmosphere for reading or working. Dog friendly patio too.

Okay, it's official... I'm dropping out of Journalism school & opening a cafe! I fell head over heels in love with this little gem back in April when my mom&I stopped in for coffee on her birthday. I'm a total Starbucks junkie (Gold Card holder since 2010, baby!) and frequent it on the daily, so I really am skeptical when it comes to getting my caffeine fix anywhere else. However it is safe to say that The Coffee Shop makes the BEST dang chai that has ever graced my perfectly glossed lips, Y-U-M! But the loveliness sure didn't stop there. I couldn't believe my eyes as we walked outside to a patio enveloped in a gorgeous rose garden! 

I took my mom back for Mother's Day & one of the adorable waitresses told me it was supposed to be the busiest day of the year. There were 15+ guests in front of me in line, but of course I was willing to wait. I ordered skinny soy caramel macchiatos for the two of us, as well as a strawberry scone & blueberry white chocolate coffee cake. My mom loved her pastry (the coffee cake) but my strawberry scone was really salty :( I'm positive that it was just a recipe fluke because of the Mother's Day insanity, and a little salty scone will not stop me from a 5 star review!

Love this place. Awesome cupcakes. Great location. The food is to die for. The cupcakes are amazing. You just bit into them and it's creamy. The bread in the cupcake is just right. I got a tuna sandwich. Soo yummy. I recommend this place if you love cupcakes and mellow atmosphere. This is your place. Did I mention their cupcakes won cupcake wars on the food network. Everything is just amazing here.

"This girl's here to say.. with some luck and love life's gonna be so sweeeeeeeeeet!".. 

I was actually surprised.. based on the name you'd think some big haired red head would scream out "Kiss my grits!" at anytime. Not at all! Its actually kind of romantic in there sans the dead animal head on the wall. Its cozy and a great place to have a cup of coffee and a sweet snack.

They make desserts like your mom would have made.. cookies, brownies and fridge pies.  Ah, I forgot, they don't use those click click turbo-spresso machines here.. each pulled espresso shot is hand packed and is very potent. 

If it were closer to me in Scottsdale I think me and the Mr would hang here all the time.. but its "country, when country wasn't cool!"

My mom and I came here for coffee and sweets after enjoying a nice breakfast at Joes Farm House. As we walked in we were overcome by the delicious coffee aroma! It was my moms birthday so she picked out a beautiful looking expresso cupcake. I asked the women working the register what I should get and she picked out a coconut cookie thing, I don't really remember what it was called. But it was GREAT. Coconut is my favorite and it also had chocolate chips in it! I also order some chai tea. It was so lovely and refreshing! 
All in all, this place is a perfect for a nice, relaxing morning with a cup of coffee and tasteful pastry.

REALLY impressed with this place.  I showed up on a weekday around 10 and there wasn't a place to park and a long line.  I highly considered coming back another time but really liked the look and wanted to try it out.  The patio is awesome with tons of shade and seating.  The line moved quickly and I grabbed a great iced coffee and the basic American breakfast.  Every bit of the food tasted crazy fresh and was perfectly cooked.  I'll be back...frequently.  Shudder to think of what the place looks like on a weekend though.  Worth it.

Ok, I have tried nearly every cupcake place in the Phoenix metro area and this place takes the cake..no pun intended.  It puts Sprinkles to shame.  They are not too sweet and the frosting is perfection.  I have a hard time eating one, I always have to order more.  There are two cupcakes that are worth the trip to Gilbert, the rosewater and raspberry and the lemon lavender blueberry.  They will be the best cupcakes you will ever eat, I can assure you.  The owner doesn't make these two everyday but if you call ahead she will make them for you the next morning.  I'm not as big of a fan of the vegan cupcakes they make, as they can sometimes be inconsistent, but the traditional cupcakes are D-lish!  I always order a pomegranate iced tea to accompany my cupcakes as well.

It is such a cute place with great coffee! However I was not impressed with the food quality. Also we were not aware we could have fruit or greens as a side. We received broken Ruffles potato chips instead. The bread was also very hard and there were a lot of flies.

Ew. There's always a blonde girl working in the kitchen with her hair down and I found a piece of hair in my food. I'm sorry but that's just gross. Also there was flies everywhere. The place has potential but needs to work on a few things

A hidden gem! Tried this place for the first time and ate their vegan cupcake (I'm a vegan)-was so impressed! I'm definitely coming back to try their chai latte.. and hopefully in the near future, they will have a vegan option on their breakfast and lunch menu because it is so close to where I live!

I crave their iced soy lattes, I dream about them, I wish everywhere else made them as spectacular as The Coffee Shop, and I wish even more that there were even more of these places (for my convenience of course!).  I would go here every single day if I could.  I love everything about this place, the atmosphere, the drinks, the everything.  Ok now I probably need to get in my car and go get some coffee....

I loved The Coffee shop especially knowing everything they sold was fresh produce.  I ordered the turkey cranberry sandwich and it was phenomenal. The red onion on it gave it an unusual but wonderful kick. Atmosphere was great and would totally recommend!

Being winners of the Cupcake Wars, I had to try this place.  I had their lemon cupcake and it was very yum!  I also had their chocolate mint whoopie and that was good too!  Can't wait to go back and try more flavors!

This place is fantastic! There's a large outdoor patio  in the back and a few tables out front.

I had the Papas Burrito- delicious!! It was huge, stuffed with potatoes, bacon, cheese and eggs. The salsa it came with was spot on too. The tortilla tasted homemade 

It was busy even at 7:30 but the food came out quickly.

My husband and I went to The Coffee Shop tonight around 7:30pm and the cashier was extremely rude to us. I guess maybe we were there close to closing but we were being very nice and had easy drink orders. My husband had asked what a monsoon drink was and the cashier failed to explain it. My husband didn't really get what he ordered but he did like his drink. The cashier was in a hurry and I feel like she didn't want us in there. I don't think I've ever written a bad review on Yelp but I just felt her attitude with my husband and I was uncalled for. If you value customer service, like I do, I would maybe consider going else where.

I have been several times to The Coffee Shop and every time, it's a treat! Literally! The coffee is really great and the atmosphere is totally comfortable but to be blatantly honest, it's really all about those cupcakes. Holy amazing cakes, Batman! That's some serious greatness packed into that little bundle of dough and frosting.

I hosted an event here not too long ago and it was so fun! The service was perfect, the atmosphere was awesome. It really set the stage for a great evening. We packed the inside out and just had an evening to remember. I suggest you do the same. Come, hang out, chill and soak up all that is The Coffee Shop. You will not be dissappointed.

Love the atmosphere. My favorite place to have breakfast. Food is consistently good, but always takes a long time to receive food and coffee. Take your laptop and enjoy the free wifi in their living room after eating.

This place is great. I had breakfast here and service was quick! The food and pastries were good. Everyone was friendly. If I am ever in this side of Arizona, I'll make sure to drop by again! I would recommend it.

As far as food and coffee go, I give this place a 4.5 / 5, hands down. I got there too late for breakfast, which was a bummer. But the Club sandwich was amazing.  Thick cut bacon and plenty of avocado slices.  I'm 6'3" @235lbs. And as a full grown man this dish was just right. The sandwich was a little tall so I imagine for non-giant people it would require a fork. The guy who brought me the food even asked if I wanted a fork.  The cappucino was tasty as well.  Good balance of espresso and milk.  I'm curious who provides their beans?

Now to the three stars... I know it's a little coffee shop, but the crowd was mostly hipster college kids (ripped up, overly tight clothes talking about their Apple Watches). I got the feel that a lot of snobbish kids living on their parents money were in there. I actually moved to the patio (which is very nice) because one of the fellows I was sitting across from was having a conversation loud enough for the whole room the hear about his trip to New York? It's a small joint. I recommend the patio as it is a shaded, open space with music that isn't to loud. Comfortable seating as well. 
.

One of the many great places in the ever expanding Agritopia neighborhood. Perfect patio spot for a coffee and/or breakfast when the beautiful Arizona weather hits. A real change from all of the strip mall coffee joints and chains. I usually stick to the house coffee and it's more than decent. Only thing to watch out for is a crowd. Weekend mornings can bring quite a long line, but if you find the right spot, especially on the newly expanded patio, its worth the wait. Extend the coffee shop break into either lunch next door at Joes, or beers at 12 West!

I enjoy coming here. I use to live near by and the only thing stopping me is the distance. I like their coffee, desserts, and food! They were on Cup Cake wars a while back and their desserts is amazing!!! Try them when you want something sweet.
The line was long but it was worth it for the delicious pastries and the smiles on my grandkiddoes faces!
ive never had a bad experience. small menu but everything is amazing. the urban atmosphere is my fav. customer service is good. coffee drinks and cupcakes are perfect.

The best Breakfast chorizo/egg burrito ever. 
For lunch fresh veggie sand is amazing. Every sandwich is amazing, veggie is just my favorite.

We stopped here on a whim for some much needed coffee. We're from Chicago and were in town for a memorial service, so we needed something to perk us up. When we got there we saw a gorgeous display of cupcakes. Since we were heading over by family next, we decided to grab a dozen. Everyone loved them! I usually hate cupcakes, but even I enjoyed them. Their coffee was great too! I only had an iced coffee, which was delicious, but they had a whole wall of tasty sounding concoctions that I would've liked to try. Their breakfast and lunch menu looked awesome as well. If I had had more time, this is definitely the kind of place I would've wanted to chill at and get a few more cups of coffee. Check it out.

The service is always friendly and prompt. The drinks are def on the sweet side, but all of the cashiers and baristas are familiar w the menu and are amazing at recommending tweaks to their drinks to fit your taste. 

The food is pretty good - from the Omelets to the Friday fish taco special (which is a Must Try!), delish!

This place reminds me of LA without the LA coffee shop BS! Friendly service, amazing atmosphere. This is our go to place for breakfast or lunch. My wife and I love the vegan Benedict. One of the only places in the area that accommodates all sorts of dieters restrictions. I also love the Tuna sandwich, super fresh and always good. Sitting outside with the birds around if it's not too hot is also amazing. 
Only downside is seating, people come and sit there for hours to study and grab a cup of coffee so some days even though we would love to eat here, due to the heat outside and people just studying at the tables we pass on going. All in all one of our fav spots in gilbert.

I come here pretty often as this is a great place to get some work done and have great food and drinks. 

I stopped in here this afternoon to get some out of the four wall office time and was going to treat myself to one of those amazing whoopie pies. Coconut it was and it tasted very good until I came across the red hair that managed to bake it's way into the side of the sweetness. (I am blond, not naturally, but still blond )

I brought it out the counter and the young man was very apologetic. I sat back down and he came over shortly with a $15 coupon for next time. 

Because they are local and because they took care of their customer, I will be back.

This place is a beautiful, very quaint coffee shop that just happens to have wonderful cupcakes. The location is great. It is in a quiet neighborhood by Joe's Farm Grill and The Farm at Agritopia. The atmosphere of this place is very welcoming. It has very big windows that allow a lot of sunlight to come through. There are tables indoors and outdoors for eating and couches for lounging. There are many varieties of people who come in, from friends wanting to chat, to students meeting for study sessions. (The have free wifi.) The only downside is the lack of wall outlets needed for charging electronic equipment such as computers.

I had one of the best breakfast croissant sandwiches here. The bacon was out of this world...like from mars or something...I mean...what does "out of this world" even mean...

I digress 

I have never really had a coffee drink I enjoy here...but I also do not drink milk, and prefer coconut milk in my coffee, which they do not have. I know they will jump on the coconut train soon...I hope....please read this. Thank you.

I avoided this place for a long time because I assumed that since it had the generic name and seemed to be part of the community center that it couldn't POSSIBLY be good - and how wrong I was.  This place is awesome.  It's one of two places I've been where the toddy is ALWAYS smooth and delicious, no need for cream!  I usually grab an iced coffee and a pastry of some kind on the way to work and have never been disappointed.  I've tried a breakfast sandwich as well - very good.  You can always taste quality ingredients.  I wish I could go here one morning without having to go straight to work, because the ambience is amazing.  Lots of windows, surrounded by beautiful foliage and huge cactus flowers, cats walking around.  I love it and want to stay all day.  The only downside I have is it's definitely on the pricey side - my morning routine of iced coffee and one pastry sets me back about $7 to $8... so I have to cut back.  But long story short this is a standout cafe and definitely worth a visit.

Tried this for the first time today. The very young girl taking our order was not very friendly and seemed annoyed that I wasn't familiar with bread choices for my sandwich. I ordered an over-priced BLT with a side of chips. It was only over-priced because turns out their idea of a bacon sandwich is to take one piece of bacon and crumble it up and spread over the whole sandwich. They should really call it a tomato sandwich because they put about six slices of tomato on it. My side of chips turned out to be the crumbs at the bottom of the bag of Ruffles-type chips. Seriously-not even one whole chip, just crumbs. The only reason why I give 2 stars is because my wife's wrap was decent and they have a nice patio.

I am a fan and love the concept however the owners aren't as kind and outgoing as I thought they would be, to be fair they are usually pretty busy! I consistently go in there and never even get a smile. Love the freshness and the food. Wish they had pancakes, waffles, etc. Pricey but cute! I used to love the way they operated with post it notes, etc. keeping it simple but noticed they have iPads now :)

Went here for lunch today, not the best but not the worst. I got the turkey and havarti sandwich, wasn't very good at all. I don't know what type of lettuce they use, but it was awful. I got one of their red velvet cupcakes that several people told me are "better than sprinkles"....lies! They were ok, but no where near sprinkles status. I liked the ambiance and the outdoor seating, it's a cute little place to grab a coffee, but my husband and I won't be going out of our way to go here again.

Only reviewing the 2 cupcakes I bought here. One was the red velvet and the other was the lemon. They just didn't taste fresh at all. The lemon one seemed like it was still in the process of being thaw. 

My sister enjoys the coffee here, but I'll definitely be back for the food and give it a fair review.
My favorite place for breakfast in Gilbert.  The San Diegan is to die for.  This place is a going little shop that is always busy.
Great place to sit on a quiet patio for breakfast/brunch. It's casual and affordable, quick and yummy! Try the San Diegan omelette! I'll be back next time I'm visiting Phoenix!

Most locals know about this place. Owned by "Joe" known for Liberty Market, Joes BBQ, and Joes Farm House. This place meets the standards of the others. Great menu and great drinks. I went with the basic drip coffee tonight. It defiantly did not disappoint. I normally go with the iced green tea. You can't go wrong there either. Pastries are awesome too. Basically, go and hangout at this rare coffee shop. It will not disappoint.

Good food and a really cool atmosphere. The breakfast burritos are really good but pretty pricey. 

Local haunt always busy but worth the wait. Bring your dog to the patio as its pet friendly.

I moved to Gilbert about six years ago and was in search of a local coffee shop and much to my surprise this business popped right away.  It is tucked away in Agritopia right next to Joe's Farm Grill.  Don't let the name fool you because they have wonderful baked goods, breakfast, lunch, and of course assorted coffee drinks.

I have tried an array of items on the menu and my favorite is always the San Diegan.  It is an open faced omelet with potatoes, bacon, cheese, tomatoes, onions, sour cream and feta.  I know I know...that is a lot of food but it is darn good.  It is definitely something that you can split with someone as it is very hearty.  I go back and forth between the scones and coffee cakes.  The scone flavors vary day to day but my favorites are the butterscotch and chocolate chip peanut butter.  I've never seen a blueberry white chocolate coffee cake and they make one that is out of this world.  

They were also featured on cupcakes wars a few times and were also featured on Check Please, AZ.  I may have reviewed them on Check Please, AZ....maybe   This is one of my favorite places and I go back there on a regular basis.

Way to go, Joe!  You did it again!  We love Joe's family of restaurants, so why did we wait so long to try the Coffee Shop?  Well, we finally did, and that's what counts.  Now my quad of Eating at Joe's is complete. 
My sister and I rode our bicycles over to The Coffee Shop one morning for coffee and breakfast.  We opted for indoor seating in the a/c since it was pretty hot outside even at 8 am.  We shared the Veggie scramble with egg whites.  It was chocked full of mushrooms, spinach, tomato and topped off with just the right amount of swiss cheese.  We add a small fruit which was sweet red strawberries and tangy sweet pineapple cut up into tiny pieces.  We completed our meal with an iced black n white mocha and iced caramel macchiato.  
We then brought friends and family to eat breakfast here.  We have tried the breakfast burrito that is so huge you better share it.  It is stuffed full of potato, egg and cheese.  Dad had an omelet that came with home fried potatoes that were sooo yummy! 
This is a MUST if you like fresh made to order food and delicious coffee.  Forget Starbucks, this is way better!
The place also offers sandwiches and salads for lunch, so if you don't have time for a stop in the morning, make time for lunch!  And if you don't have time for lunch, grab a yummy cupcake, cookie, muffin, or whoopie pie to go!

So wanted to like this place. Ordered pastrami sandwiches. When asked what kind of bread, my wife and I said rye but were told they didn't have it and that everyone gets sourdough. The sand which was incredibly dry. We also ordered cupcakes that were pretty good. The worst part came when we went to order a sandwich a cupcake to go. As my wife stood in line to order, I used the restroom. While in there, I noticed something on the floor... several somethings. There were two dead cockroaches and a what I thought was a third one... until it started to move. I came out of the restroom and my wife, who was ready to leave without the food, simply pointed at the cupcake display and then I noticed the flies. Completely disgusted!  You can tell it's bad when you don't even want your money back, you just want to leave!

Love this place! Amazing staff. Great food and amazing coffee! 

I work from home and have started using this as my "get-away office" so I can be around some people and good energy. 

Great wifi service. 

It can DEFINITELY get a bit crowded but if you get a chance I'd definitely stop by!
Great food, simple menu, fast service, cheap prices. Fresh ingredients. Where do they get their avocados from?

Great breakfast spot! Good coffee, fresh food (the eggs were delicious), great selection of pastries and vegan options too. The location is a nice change from the desert scape with lots of trees and grass.

I love this little coffee shop next to Joe's Farm Grill.  They have a nice patio that is dog friendly and can accommodate a lot of people.  They have different sandwiches and breakfast items than Joe's Farm Grill and the quality is right on par with JFG.  I had a delicious breakfast burrito there once.  I love the creaminess of their lattes and they don't over sweeten them.  Take a stroll through the community garden after your meal for an all around great experience.

I have no idea why I waited so long to write this review. Maybe because the line is long enough to get 1 of my favorite breakfast meals that I don't want the line to be any longer. Unfortunately, the word is out because this place is action packed even on the weekdays.
I found this little gem while eating next door. It sits nestled in a quaint garden of flowers and greenery. Open patio seating in the front and rear. So beautiful and serene, It's easy to imagine yourself anywhere but Gilbert, AZ. Ordering takes place inside. Step up to the counter and the entire menu is chalk boarded on the wall. Delicious baked goods taunt you from the display case. Gourmet coffee harmoniously filling the air tempting your taste buds. If your not excited let me know and I'll grab the defibrillator. 
I've tried several items on the menu but the 1's that impress me the most is the San Diegan. It's an open faced omelette with mushrooms, bacon, tomatoes, feta cheese, Shredded cheese and I think a couple other things. Delish!! On the weekends, if your lucky you can catch an amazing biscuits and gravy or an eggs Benedict. Mind blown! Tempt your taste buds with a baked delicacy, my advice the faux doughnut. What does that mean exactly.... The doughnut is baked instead of fried. Now get your self into the coffee shop and see for yourself what a breakfast bliss can do for your chi

Coffee - cheaper and better than the competition.  Americano is my go-to.

Food - I've only had the club on sourdough(!) and chocolate chip cookies - both are excellent.

Atmosphere - nice.  Couches inside and a great patio overlooking the farms at Agritopia.

This is my favorite coffee shop in the east valley - hands down.

I love the coffee shop!!  A perfect place for breakfast!  The tj omelette is so delicious, a wonderful blend of chorizo, potatoes, cheese and tomatoes!  It tastes like a taco in omelette form!  The sitting area outside is so nice, I love it. The imperial is also a good option, can't go wrong with it. The bacon is so crispy!  The brownies are so moist, I couldn't get enough. I wish I could eat the whole pan!  

Bird enthusiasts also come there every weekend with exotic birds and you can even get a picture with a parrot on your shoulder!  How nice. I just feel that the sitting area inside is very limited, not too happy with that. But the food is great and the ambiance is nice!

Love this place! First time I was here was because we were looking for a place who had gluten free breakfast pastries for a friend of mine. The pasteries were amazing. They had a variety of options from coffee cakes to cupcakes, cookies to bars. Some gluten free! I loved this place so much, I returned with my hubby but this time we had a burrito. LOVED IT! I had the chorizo and recommend it to everyone! Piping hot and eggs were nice and fluffy. Mmmmmm! The atmosphere is nice and staff is very friendly. All over great experience.

Saw this place on cupcake wars and decided to make the 15 minute drive out to taste the cupcakes.... was pretty disappointed overall. Parking wasn't simple, parking lot is a bit strange.. was looking forward to  trying the cupcakes, selection was not really there but we did go a few hours before closing so maybe that was it? I did like their icing because it wasn't just pure sugar, it was a cream cheese nice and light icing.. the cupcake on the other hand I was not what I was expecting, and not in a good way. The cups and itself, as in the flavors, was good, it was just so dense and thick that my 4yr old didn't want to finish her vanilla one and I had trouble finishing the berry one. I'm not a cupcake expert but I was pretty sad with the cupcake:/

Amazing!!! Cutest farm to table lunch spot. Food is delicious, cupcakes make you dream about them! 
Food takes a while but well worth the wait!!

I love The Coffee Shop!  I stop in weekly to relax for a few hours with my service animal.  They are so kind, the coffee is fantastic, and their breakfast burritos are prime!  Great energy and I'm genuinely happy to be there.  Thank you for providing such wonderful service in Gilbert! :)

I heard about this place from the Food Network Cupcake Wars.  I promised my girls to take them for a treat so this was the place I picked. I thought for a $3.00 cupcake it would be spectacular, but it wasn't.  It was - - a cupcake.  I frankly could make 12 cupcakes at home for the same price and the same taste. One of my daughters didn't like it at all. I wouldn't go back for the cupcakes.  I haven't tried the other stuff they offer.  It seems like they specialize in vegan cupcakes.  Which I could care less about.
I had the Tj omelet. It looked and tasted so good that a lady at another table made her son come over and ask me what I was eating.

Stopped in to grab one of my favorite breakfast burritos this morning. Chorizo and egg burro at The Coffee Shop is delicious. 
Place was buzzin this morning as always. 
I passed on the blended monsoon coffee, which by the way is also spectacular! 
Recommend you try it for yourself. 
Great place to hang out with ur wife and relax.
It was ok not the best breakfast and coffee ive had but overall it was good thanks for the coffee

Excellent coffee, the baked goods are some of the best I've ever had. 

I come here for my morning coffee often and love it. 

I only wish they would open earlier... 7am is very late in my morning

Best coffee and atmosphere around! The Cuff Cake coffee is my go to, but you really can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Not to mention their sweet treats are to die for! Their breakfast and lunch options are fresh and delicious!

This is one of my go to coffee shops when I want to stay in Mesa/Gilbert area. I love studying here but for others looking for a study spot - there aren't many outlets!! And the brunch time rush on weekends can be really distracting if you're trying to get some hard core studying in, because the line will be huge! 

Aesthetics - this is why I come here. I love every bit of Agritopia, and The Coffee Shop is a perfect addition. Something about being here with natural light of Arizona sun flooding in just lifts my spirits. Exactly the mood booster I need when getting ready to *hit the grind* (heh pun intended) or just get brunch with a friend.

Caffeine - pretty wide range of options, both coffee/tea/more!

Cupcakes - I personally don't love cupcakes, but for the sake of Yelp, I took a bite of my friend's red velvet, and I have to say it was pretty good! And honestly, the display is so enticing I actually think about ordering the desserts even though I don't have a huge huge sweet tooth. Everyone I know enjoys it though, so definitely worth a try! (Especially bc they were featured in Cupcake Wars!!!)

Food - every time I come, I have a dilemma with what to order because everything looks so good and FRESH. I got the Turkey and Havarti sandwich the first time and loved it so much I sometimes have cravings for it. Next time though, I'll be sure to try more of their options - because there will certainly be many more next times to come!

So many things are done right at this great little shop. The atmosphere is inviting, the baked goods are amazing and their meals are delicious. The sad irony about The Coffee Shop is they do everything right except for the coffee. It's awful and has been consistently awful through all my visits.

There is a marked difference between a cup from Liberty Market, one of Joe's other fantastic ventures, and The Coffee Shop and I don't understand why.

Don't get me wrong though, The Coffee Shop is really more of an experience or an ideal. They've done a fantastic job creating an environment that is comfortable, relaxing and fun. The kind of place where you can hang out with a group of friends and never notice the hours slip by. It's the neighborhood coffee shop we all wish we had around the corner.

The amazing quality of the baked goods far outweighs the lack of quality coffee. The red velvet cupcake is a masterpiece and the homemade scones are outstanding.

The food and the atmosphere are the reasons I like this place. If they started serving Cartel coffee, The Coffee Shop could become nirvana.
I think we have tried almost everything at this place.  From the cupcakes to the coconut cream moon pies.  Not only is the food really good, the atmosphere is fun and relaxed.
This place. Just adorable. The atmosphere is amazing and the company is even better. Everyone is so friendly and the coffee is very good.

the four stars are strictly for the cupcakes and the service. $2.75 for a small iced tea is outrageous and while the field veggie sandwich was good- it wasn't worth the almost $8.00 i paid for it. the cupcakes, however, were amazing-the boston cream and red velvet were SO good and the fact that they held them in the freezer for me until i got there was great. i would recommend you call ahead and find out what flavors they have-they are more than willing to make suggestions and give reviews. the place is nonsmoking inside and out, which is a plus for 99% of the population.

Here's a fabulous tip: they serve breakfast ALL DAY on Sundays. Yes, you saw that right, alllll day. 

Boyfriend got the papas grandes burrito and I got the waffle with fresh cream and berries...and here we have discovered the miraculous and satisfying pleasure of getting to half both savory and sweet. Perfection. 

Also, try a monsoon. With almond milk if you dare. Seriously the creamiest, tastiest coffee confection you'll ever try. 

The atmosphere is casual and cozy and everything you could possibly order is wonderful. You can't go wrong here folks!

This cafe is really nice! There are windows everywhere and outside they have a patio and grass! Their coffee is a hit or a miss (depending on who makes it), the cupcakes are good, strawberry smoothie is great, and the sandwiches are delicious! 

Food 4/5
Atmosphere 5/5
Service 4/5

The best part of this place is the atmosphere, it's very pretty. They also have wifi, making it a nice study spot.

I love The Coffee Shop! I have only been for breakfast, but everything I have tried has been delicious.

It is a little noisy on weekend mornings, and there are a lot of people there. However, they handle the large number of people efficiently and are super friendly.

I recommend the Indio and Baby Got Jack breakfast sandwiches!
Love this place, have been coming here for over a year and coffee and staff are always great!

So I came here about a year ago for breakfast and since I don't live in the area I kind of forgot about it. One day my husband's comes home with some cupcakes and it completely changed my life!! He brought home a chocolate chip cookie dough cupcake and it really tasted like one! It wasn't dense or heavy feeling and amazing! He also got the lemon one and I was thinking ehh once you've had one lemon cupcake, you've had them all but boy was I wrong!! This was the best lemon cupcake I've ever had! I used to be crazy about Sprinkles cupcakes, but they got nothing on The Coffee Shop's cupcakes! You definitely have to try their cupcakes at least once!

A well balanced coffee shop, with good drinks, amazing pastries, local community, and hidden surprises.

It's built in an old tractor shed, located on at Agritopia, an urban farm and neighborhood. During the day, you'll find plenty of moms with their kids, a few coworkers with their laptops, and one or two of the hard-to-find Gilbert hipsters.

Oh and did I mention surprises? Keep an eye out of mahi mahi fish tacos, Coffee and Cigarettes cupcakes, and a local cigar group on Friday nights.

Other notes: Beware laptop users, limited power outlets; Vespa/scooter owners, there's a reserved parking spot for you; Produce stand (seasonal) is across the way

I like the Coffee Shop. If you are a fan if sandwiches, coffee and tea, then this is your place. They also have good cupcakes. I do think it's a little overpriced. But it's the atmosphere and the atmosphere is fabulous. I love to meet with friends and enjoy coffee together there. It's a great place.

Great breakfast and whoppie : )  It was too hot to sit outside, but I saw many local still enjoy outdoor sitting.  I have the IMPERIAL OMELETTE, and my friend have BURRITO SUPREME and a lot of whoppie. Life is good with great food.

I enjoyed the outdoor sitting, but a little too hot.  The staff was friendly and many cute girls.
Every single item I have ordered here has been delicious and consistently made well! The drinks are very flavorful and the food is fresh and filling.

We recently moved out of Gilbert and this is literally the only place I miss. We would come here weekly for their fantastic sandwiches and savory breakfasts. The California Club was always a standout. All of the ingredients taste so fresh and so well put together. And I love that they always put chips on the plate! The selection varies, so you never knew if you were gonna get Fritos or Ruffles that day. The TJ omelet with its chorizo, sour cream, and potatoes was so addicting! My other faves were any of the breakfast sandwiches, the breakfast burrito (must get!), and the turkey havarti sandwich. Really, you can't go wrong with anything you order here. 

I haven't tried many of the coffee drinks because once I had the Spanish Latte, I was hooked! It's really better warm, though, so I had to miss out on it during the summer months. But it's so sweet and delicious!

The cupcakes are phenomenal too. Order one. You won't be sorry!

This place is ALWAYS busy (and for good reason). I just wish they had more registers open and more people to help out because the line can hit the back of the restaurant. There never seems to be any urgency in the staff. It's also a little frustrating when you place a pickup order, you have to get in that line to pick up your previously ordered food. So your food could be sitting there for 10-15 minutes just waiting for you to get to the front of the line. Not really convenient when you're in a hurry and just need to grab-and-go. Sometimes the water jug is totally empty and there's no one available to refill it. Hence the need for more help. You have to keep up with the demand!

Why are you so far from my house!!!!!!!???? 
I love this place.  Great coffee, amazing pastries, and a really cute ambiance.  I can't wait to go when it's not a thousand degrees to enjoy their farmer's market area and possibly even sit outside (what a novel idea in Phoenix!).
On second thought, it's probably better that you're so far from me...my butt would be huge if your cupcakes were any more convenient.

Who doesn't like the coffee shop!

I've been going here for years, as a Gilbert resident, and this place still hasn't shaken it's aloof, hipstery barista vibes. Oh well. The drinks are fine and it's a cool little meet-up spot next to the equally cool agritopia.  

Give it a try.
