Also, their cupcakes were featured on the Cupcake Wars TV show on food network (if that means anything to you)

The coffee and the food are good here. I suggest the breakfast burritos! I agree with most other yelp-ers. The service isn't great. They are not overly friendly. There is always a long line and it's always very crowded. It can be hard to find a seat inside and it can be very noisy inside. I prefer to sit outside on the patio when it's nice out!

Also, they frequently get my coffee order wrong (wrong milk, wrong syrup, wrong size, etc) but they will fix it if i tell them. They just aren't super nice about it. 

I like coming here because it's close to my house, but it's not worth driving out of the way for.

Looking at all the other fantastic reviews for this place I was really hoping for a better product. I bought 6 cupcakes for a birthday dinner (chocolate, chocolate oreo, red velvet, lemon, mixed berry, and coconut). I have to say that I was extremely disappointed by the taste, and texture of all of the flavors. The cupcakes were dry, dense, and had very little flavor. The overall presentation of the cupcakes was very cute, and they were decorated wonderfully, however that did not make up for the taste. After paying over $3 a cupcake I was really expecting something better. I was almost embarrassed to serve these to my friends and family. I will give it two stars because it was a nice little coffee shop in a great location. I can only base this review off of the cupcakes, I haven't tried any of their other food, but I sure do hope that the rest of their menu tastes better than their cupcakes.
The food is good here. If you are waiting in line at Joe's, try this place. It is just as hip and the food is good. Why not eat in the garage.

I love this place, I eat here at least once a week. Great food, drinks, ambience, and the best cupcakes you will ever have. The only thing they need to change if their ordering system. They hand write your order on a post it note and then walk the note over to the kitchen and then ring your order on an ipad. They need to get a pos system so they can simply ring the order in on the ipad and it goes directly to the kitchen. The current process takes way too long and is seriously frustrating since there is always a long line of people waiting to order.

I love this place! They are always busy, which is ok because I think it's well worth the wait. The Coffee Shop has a good atmosphere, and the outdoor seating is nice. They are known for their cupcakes (even featured on Cupcake Wars) but I have not tried them yet. As for the breakfast, I love the San Diegan- yum! The coffee is good too!

Atmosphere - Great!

Service - Great!

Veggie Sandwich! - AMAZING....hands down the freshest sandwich I have every eaten.

Very disappointed in this place. I was excited to come here and try the party punch and a small lunch with my niece. I got there and told them it was my first time here. I tried to order a party punch but they were out of that. Then I chose another tea and they were out of that AS WELL. I got their pomegranate tea and a club sandwich. Tea was okay and the sandwich didn't have much flavor plus a slap of ruffles on the plate. MEH. I was better off going to s-bucks. Maybe I happen to go on a bad day? I'm not sure, money ain't a issue for me but it wasn't worth the 16 dollars. =(

A new place that I was recommended too! I'm glad I came. As soon as we walked in, we were greeted. They have so many menu options and dairy free options. I didn't eat here but the food menu had many options. I did get a cookie that was yummy! To drink I got a matcha tea latte and it was one of the best I've had. The price was reasonable.
Great food , great coffee and unique environment. One of my fav places for breakfast or lunch.

I stopped at the Coffee Shop this morning after reading the yelp reviews.  I was torn between The Farm next door and this place since they were right next door to each other.  For whatever reason, I chose the Coffe Shop.... I had already been to Starbucks and had just a few sips of my iced coffee left.  Rather than let it melt in the car, I decided to put the cup in my handbag.  While waiting in line to order several breakfasts to go, the owner came up to me and said I was not allowed to bring in any outside food or beverages, as she had seen my straw sticking out of my handbag!  I found that to be EXTREMELY POOR customer service!  First of all, had I planned to finish my last few sips in her restaurant, would it really have made an impact on her business?  Secondly, I wasn't planning on drinking it in there, I merely didn't want it to melt, so I stashed it in my own handbag!!! Really???  I promptly left the restaurant and went to The Farm, which was absolutely delicious!!!!  The breakfast tacos are to die for!  In addition, the staff was very friendly and welcoming.  A bit of advice, if you're ever faced with the decision of breakfast at the Coffee Shop or The Farm, don't hesitate.... GO TO THE FARM, you won't be disappointed:)

Vicky, Scottsdale AZ
Love it! Everything here is great. The coffee, the cupcakes, the food, the atmosphere. I come here as much as I'm able!

Maybe it's my red velvet southern roots, but gourmet cupcake my ass. 

Credit due for the fresh salads and garden. Cute place!

After watching her win on Cupcake Wars I was determined to find this place (It's very well hidden)and sample the cupcakes.  I have to say I was not impressed; i make better cupcakes on my own.  More creative and not so sweet you'll go into a diabetic coma.  i did have a California BLT as well and it was a good sandwich although the bread was a little too toasted for my liking.  The staff was friendly, the ambiance was very pleasant and it was clean.  But the cupcakes...really not all that.  Sorry....

Amazing, especially for the East Valley. Their coffee has always been great - and they're one of the few places I've found that has butterscotch syrup! Butterscotch iced lattes are dreamy...

The Field Veggie sandwich is equally delicious. And their cupcakes are always dependably yummy - I tried the coffee and cigarettes one when they had it...so strange, but really good!

A really good find in the sea of Starbucks stores that is Gilbert.

Awesome atmosphere, too!
Food is really good. It does get crowded on the weekends. I especially love the little farm stand outside of the coffee house on Saturday. Try the oro blanco grapefruit from said stand.
This is mine and my wife's new favorite place! Wonderful environment, amazing food and kind staff. I couldn't say enough good things about this place.

Burrito Supreme-one word. Amazing!!  The combination of potato, cheese, chorizo, an egg is just right. My first time here and definitely no my last. The employees are pleasant and good vibe. This place is more than coffee. It is an experience.

My review is limited to breakfast only. Oh, and the cupcakes of course- that's what brought us to the Coffee Shop in the first place. We heard about the owners winning Food Network's Cupcake Wars and had to try them out. The interior is minimalistic, but works. The patio is excellent but a little on the small side- grab a spot early when the weather is nice because it fills up fast.

The cupcakes are excellent- my wife loves the classic vanilla and the strawberry. I prefer the red velvet. The frosting is light and sugary, the cakes balanced just right. Don't pass these up when you're visiting!

The breakfast is great- we've tried most everything on the menu and you cannot go wrong. The classic egg breakfast is a no brainer. The burrito with chorizo is also superb. The portions are enormous so come hungry. 

The coffee is stellar- always spot on. I go for the iced caramel mochiatto. My wife likes the vanilla lattes. 

What a great way to support local business, eat a great breakfast and hang out in the Agritopia neighborhood. The Farm Grill next door is another popular spot, and it's walking distance from the Coffee Shop.

This place has the best breakfast in all the land! Go for one of the breakfast plates, like the All American, and you won't be disappointed. If you're looking for something a little lighter, try one of their coffee cakes warmed up. The coffee is great, staff is friendly, and you won't find a cooler coffee shop anywhere in Gilbert.

I really love me some cupcakes. So when I found out this joint was serving cupcakes made by winners from cupcake wars - I was like HELL YES. So were they nice looking cupcakes? Yes. But you know they were just not that tasty at all. kind of dry. I got a coconut and got the birthday cake for my daughter since we were sampling to possibly purchase for her birthday party. I really wanted to love them. But I didnt. I might go back for some coffee but for the mean time im sticking to Sprinkles for my cupcakes.

Adorable little spot, but was slightly disappointed in a few aspects.

Overall, It comes highly recommended, however I didn't notice the staff to be particularly friendly and the vegetarian options were almost non-existent. I ended up with a pretty expensive veggie sandwich that was nothing to write home about.

The atmosphere made up for it and the music was pretty decent!

Nice cafe tucked away in a housing community. A few friends & I stopped here for breakfast on a Sunday morning and it wasn't very crowded at all. The place had a home-y vibe, with couches and books lying around. I got the San Diegan omelet, which was good, but a bit pricey. I also got one of their red velvet cupcakes, as I had seen that they were featured on Cupcake Wars. The frosting of the cupcake was perfect! The cake itself was moist, but it had a weird flavor to it, that I'm not sure was accidental or on purpose. I think if I had tried a different flavor, it would have been ok.
Service has been a lot better the past year or so.
I absolutely love their blended Chai lattes! The coffee shop's is probably top three on my list. It is such a cute little shop owned by two sisters (not a chain) and has so much to offer.

07/07/10

Had coffee and some sweets here w/ a friend, and after much anticipation on trying the fare here, I was a bit disappointed w/ what I found :(  I decided I'd try a couple of scones and a berry coffee cake, and a cup o' joe.  I really enjoyed the coffee, but the pastries?  Not so much.  The coffee cake wasn't sweet enough, and I found it to be too greasy.  The scones, also a bit on the greasy side, were so flat, they looked like cookies!  Out of the two, I liked the butterscotch best.  However, I wouldn't order these again.  

A few hours later, I decided I'd go back to write some reviews and have another cup of coffee.  I went back up to see if there were new additions to the display, but was turned off when I saw a couple of flies crawling over the cupcakes.  (((shudder)))  The clerk manning the counter followed my gaze and saw the flies, but didn't shoo them away.  Tsk, tsk.  Turned me off on trying anything new.

I am a big fan of Joe's Farm Grill and The Liberty Market (a little less of Joe's Real BBQ, but I've only gone there once, so a return visit may change my mind), so I'd like to give their sister company The Coffee Shop another try.  The sandwich and salad menus look delicious, but most of the selections are off-limits to me.  But... flies in the sweets counter?  I don't know if I can stomach another visit :(

Me and my husband are visiting from San Diego and coffee shops our favorite places. Finding this place was a true reward. Everything about this place was amazing!! I loved the lay out of how it was decorated and how much space there was even the outside seating area was nice. The food is truly fantastic their breakfast/lunch even their pastries I would recommend this place to any one to have an enjoyable time with friends and family. For food options I would suggest getting the breakfast Barito's they are my favorite and for a vegetarian get the vegan bagel
Share the Indio on a croissant with your favorite person! It's the perfect portion to share and super delicious!

Nice spot for lunch!

The atmosphere is cute - a nicer coffee/sandwich stop!  Plus, they have great outdoor seating.  Very pretty outside - flowers, trees, cactus, etc.

For food, I had a breakfast burrito - it was tastey!

I would highly recommend this spot to catch up with a friend.

I absolutely love the coffee shop! I've had several different coffee beverages and they've all been fantastic....and recently I had the devils food (I think that was the name) cupcake.....absolute heaven in a cupcake. It was so moist and the frosting was delicious. Highly recommend this place. Great for meetings as well.

Love the location, staff is friendly and if you don't know what you want. Cashier would really help you out on what to choose. Outside seating is very clean along with interior.

Got the California Club sandwich and strait delicious. Can't wait to try their breakfast again.

This review is pretty much only on the cupcakes-- which are good. I have also had an iced coffee, which was really good.

So, the cupcakes are pretty good with some interesting and fresh flavors. But nothing spectacular and some are too plain. If I had the ambition and time, I could make better cupcakes myself. But they are still good. And still good enough that some of them are worth the 10 mile drive and the price. Good flavors included strawberry (with fresh strawberries), pina colada, and cinnamon bun. But the vanilla, which I expected to be awesome, was so-so and the frosting tasted mostly of food coloring. The red velvet was okay, but I won't get this flavor again. And the coconut was a bland vanilla cupcake with coconut sprinkled on top.  

We eat next door at Joe's all the time, so I plan on going back for more coffee and other treats and will revise my review after more tastings...

I love the Coffee Shop. It is atmosphere mixed with food mixed with efficiency perfection.  Yes, there will always be a line but it's a Gilbert line so you're 7 people deep and thinking, "Oh my gosh, this is insane! I'm practically out the door!" but just hold up and hang in. It is worth it. The coffee drinks are great - iced mocha is my jam. Breakfast dishes are delicious. I recommend the Veggie Scramble. If you're feeling a sweet is necessary then definitely do not skip the cupcakes. Amazing! So, so good. Also, really cool people stop in....like probably everyone you know. I can never leave there without seeing a friend or friend of a friend. It's a good place to be!

Cupcakes = amazing. This is the main reason I go there. 
Got lunch once, and it was good but a little pricey for an ordinary sandwich.

Love the atmosphere and outside seating.

I love this place! 

The Coffee Shop opened when I was still living in AZ & was going to grad school in Mesa. Even though it was about a 15 min. drive from my school (and there was at least 3 Starbucks that were closer), when I had the time in between classes I would come here. I'm happy after all these years (okay...it's been like 5ish) The Coffee Shop is still around, and has actually grown. Not that I had doubts based on quality & service, but I still consider this location to be somewhat in no-mans land. 

Even though I no longer live in AZ, when I come home to visit I have a friend who lives close by so I still try and drop-in when I go to visit them. Maybe I'm exaggerating this, but I think the place has grown over the years. There's tons of seating both indoors and outdoors, and there's even a cute little living room type area w/cozy couches. The atmosphere here is very clean & open. 

Now for as much as I love coffee/espresso, I'm not a huge connoisseur of it, but that being said whether it be Chai or a latte the drinks here are great! What really sets this place apart from other coffee shops though is the food...particularly the baked goods! The scones, muffins, & cupcakes are all FANTASTIC! There's a huge open kitchen where you can see these delicious pastries being made! As far as the sandwiches, soups, and breakfasts, I can't really say much since I've never had any of that stuff but I'm sure they're yummy if they're anything like the baked goods! 

The Coffee Shop isn't exactly located in the most central area, and I wouldn't necessarily go out of my way to come here, but when I'm relatively close by, I make it a point to come here...even if it means bypassing other coffee shops along the way.

this place is just amazing! the owners are sweet and always remember our order. as someone from seattle, i'm thankful to have found a place with character and community that i can make a part of my daily rounds. i have yet to be disappointed.  

top notch items to order: 
san diegan
california club
lemon whoopie

they have great wi-fi, cozy leather couch and oversized chairs plus a dreamland garden in the back to hang out in. to top off the experience, their playlists are always impressive set with death cab, minus the bear, and the like.

We come here almost 2 x a week and I keep forgetting to "check in".  

Fresh baked goods everyday.

The best cupcakes that won Cupcake Wars.  

This place is great for meeting your friends or clients.  

Breakfast plates are awesome here.  

Try the San Diegan omelette.

Oh, The Coffee Shop. You have officially lost a cool point. 

I usually get tea when I go here, because I am not an avid coffee drinker. My sister, on the other hand, is a coffee aficionado. She knows about different beans and flavors, and tries different cafes all the time. I've taken her here several times, and apparently The Coffee Shop does not make good coffee. Ironic. 

The food is great though! But unfortunately they've started charging for extra salsa. I always used to get it for free. 

A few suggestions: 
1) Bring back free salsa! 
2) Create a frequent cupcake card. I buy them all the time! It would be great to get a free cupcake with a purchase of 10. 
3) Have a special price for a dozen cupcakes. My husband bought 12 for my birthday at $3 each. Do the math = $36 for cupcakes. Could you do a dozen for $30? 
4) Pupcakes! Cupcakes for Dogs. I saw this at Heavenly Cupcakes in San Diego (which I also reviewed). People always bring their dogs to The Coffee Shop.

I was surprised, I thought this place would be a five-star yelp page.

We've loved every experience here. 
Awesome breakfast burritos. A must try.
Awesome cupcakes (they offer vegan and gluten free sometimes! Call ahead to see what they have that day if this interests you!)
Awesome espresso and fruity/ smoothie drinks.

I use to love to come here on my lunch breaks to relax. Great atmosphere!! And I love the outdoor seating. On days with nice weather, it makes you forget you're in Arizona for awhile! ;)

Check it out, for sure!!
The coffee is great. They won the cupcake wars.  The place is packed because the food is really good too.
Great coffee, tons of food options, indoor outdoor seating, great WiFi signal. Highly recommend as a breakfast spot for healthy (and unhealthy but yummy) options!

Cute little location. They have a small room where you can hold an event like a meeting or a baby shower.  Coffee was A+. I got a vanilla latte. Always hesitate to order espresso drinks at a new place because so many go crazy with the sweeteners.  The latte was perfect! No bitter, burnt coffee bean flavor and not overly sweetened.  Also ordered 4 cupcakes for a birthday. They were decent. Enjoyable but nothing stellar. The lemon and coconut were our favorites.
Oh my, I love the coffee shop! Best chai in gilbert and my has my favorite southwest chicken salad/sandwiche. SO good!

Love this place! Great coffee and breakfast plates. It's family friendly, but also a great place to sit down for a meeting or to get some work done. The Coffee Shop is always buzzing with customers, and has a good vibe. Plenty of outside seating. My only suggestion would be to try to create more seating inside because it can be hard to snag a table if you want to be inside with some AC. 
Overall great experience every time!

Best Chai latte with almond milk I ever had. Way better than Starbucks. Had breakfast here with my family just passing thru. My son and hubby loved the cinnamon rolls. Known for their cupcakes but I couldn't eat any being on a vegetarian paleo diet.

I would probably give this 3 and a half stars if I could. Wonderful atmosphere and I love the concept of Agritopia in general. The iced coffee was just decent. I'd like to come back and try some other drinks. The food menu looked good as well.

Wowie, is this place difficult to find!  But it's well worth the journey of getting lost on my way there!  My friend and I went for lunch and we thought we had stepped into an alternate universe or the set of Desperate Housewives.

I had the tomato-basil sandwich and my friend the veggie and they were quite tasty (although we both agreed that the 9-grain bread really made them great).  The reason we stopped by the place was cause I heard that they had won an episode of Cupcake Wars and had to try them out for myself.  I got the coconut and lemon for my brother who loved it and he's not much of a dessert kinda guy.  My friend got the double chocolate-something-or-other and said it was good but too sweet for her liking.  Their frosting to cake ratio was spot on, I thought!  Their coffee was also very good, we both had iced lattes but will want to come back and try their "monsoons".  The prices are a tiny bit higher than my liking, but worth an occasional visit.

Overall fabulous place and will return with friends!
Just had breakfast and it was great. This place is top notch in my book I will have to come back here more often. Not to busy and a very friendly staff.

happened to be scoping out some dr's offices for my job in this area and stopped by this little place. The area first off is absolutely beautiful. It's in this fantastically gorgeous spot in gilbert surrounded by lots of greenery; trees, grass, flowers, all things that arizonans are not usually accustomed to. First impressions were that this place was slammed. Inside was rocking and it was a friday morning. Wide drink selection, good (not great) food. I had a supreme breakfast burrito. It wasn't the best, lacked some flavor, but the portion was huge and kept me satisfied. I sat in some cool upholstered chairs and just took in the ambience. Lots of students, but you see a lot of young families in there also. The place looks like it is being run by teenagers and the nicki minaj with +7 bass that popped on the stereo at 9 am confirmed that fact. Real cool place to hang out and get some work done. Will be back.

This place is a weekly stop for me.  I love the California club!  Coffee is great and the dessert selections are always amazing.  If you're in Gilbert off Ray and Higley you must stop here.  Off peak hours are the best times to go to avoid the long line.  Breakfast is also a great option here.
One of our favorite places to go after the Cosmo Dog Park. Love the San Diegan.
Excellent service and a developed food menu! Everything a coffee and tea spot should have, with an elegant, windowy, and outdoorsy atmosphere

Great coffee, breakfast and lunch. We visit this cute coffee shop often and hey are always consistent with food and drinks. Just watch what time you go because they get very busy and you could wait 30+ minutes.

Burrito with chorizo had far too much chorizo. I requested light chorizo yet it was so overloaded I couldn't see or taste the egg. Wondering why they say they will make it with light chorizo and yet they never do. I'd prefer you mention up front if there is no possibility in decreasing the amount used..... This prevents setting one up for disappointment.
Clean place nice to hang out. Chicken salad wrap was short on Chicken, would go back but insist on more chicken.
Tucked away in the Agritopia neighborhood is this heavenly shop. The coffee is superb and the sweets are spectacular! It was worth the drive. Looking forward to more caffeinated visits.

Would it be to forward to say that I want to live here, on premises? I mean, is that allowed?  I love this place. How did I live before coming here?  Do you think Joe would care if I made this my new home?

Love love love this place.  I am currently sitting in the back writing my review and never want to leave.  Joe, if your out there, your awesome.  this place rocks!

I love this place so much! The atmosphere and layout is really cute, both outdoor and indoor. Their coffees, teas and food are so very delicious. Their employees are really friendly. This place is just great overall. The only single downside is the outdoor patio in the front tends to have a lot of flies and birds which can be annoying. Regardless, I've never been let down by this place and I've been coming here for the pat year. It's a must-try!

I've been known to frequent the area here to visit Barnone (also 5/5 stars, FYI) for a late night out and have wanted to stop here for coffee for awhile. Well, today was the day and I wasn't disappointed. 

There area here is beautiful. Agritopia is just north with their beautiful garden to walk through, plus the area has a Midwest farm vibe. With several places to eat and drink nearby, it's a great meet up spot too. 

There's plenty of seating here both inside and out on the back patio. Parking can be tight. Free WiFi is also available (no password). 

For this visit I ordered a triple chocolate brownie and a Cal-Cake* Americano iced. OMG - everything was great. The brownie was gooey and delicious and a good size portion. The coffee flavor was bold and not overpowered by any of the flavors. Even my girlfriend, who doesn't like coffee, tried it and thought it was bomb. Can't wait to try another drink here! 

Had I known this place was known for the cupcakes I would have went for that but I wasn't disappointed. I guess it just means I'll have to come back again ;)

(*Totally forgot the name of the drink :/ but it's similar to this - comment if you know!)
Finally, food grown on the farm and served up fresh, great coffee, free wifi, shaded outdoor areas for sitting and playing, all in one. I thought I was back in Portland for a minute. Love this place!

I first heard about The Coffee Shop on The PBS Show Check Please. I decided that I would take the trip and see if it is as good as was stated on the show. 
Of course I checked the Yelp reviews and they were very favorable, so my fiance and I decided to go for breakfast. The only downside was we didn't get there until about 12:45pm and they stop selling breakfast at noon Mon thru Sat.. Of course that was our issue. Sunday they serve breakfast all day. 
Even though we were looking to have breakfast we got sandwiches instead. I had the Southwest Chicken Sandwich on Sourdough Bread and my fiance had the Chicken Salad on croissant. Both sandwiches were excellent. Great flavor, fresh ingredients is how I would describe both of them. Now for those you folks that like loads of food when you go out to eat, these sandwiches were just enough, not too filling. Which left room for one of the incredibly lushish sweet delicacies that they serve. 

My fiance had the Boston Creme Cupcake and I had the Lemon Cupcake with sparkles on them. All I can say is "Forget About It" these cakes were Fantabulous. You must get a sweet something when you go here. Finally, it's a little hard to find but it's in Agritopia subdivision on the north side of Ray. You will see "The Farm Stand Market" sign - turn here.

My family LOVES The Coffee Shop! 

The San Diegan is sooo good for breakfast! Fabulous pastries and sandwiches, you really can't go wrong with anything they serve here. The turtle monsoon is one of my favorite things ever.

The atmosphere and service are amazing. It's a great place to just come hang out, have some good food and take in fresh air! 

Can't say enough good things about it!

This place doesn't need yet another review - it's awesome. We know. BUT I had to put a good word in for their FISH TACO FRIDAYS!!!!!!! Oh my oh my I long for Friday's 11-2pm ish.  I order Fish Taco's on many a menu and these rank in my top 3 of all time. 2 tacos, Special sweet sauce (lots), hot homemade tacos, crunch cabbage...FINGER LICKIN good.  $8.95 I think. It comes with a salad that I barely touched because it couldn't keep up with the tastebud party of the fish tacos. They should swap out the salad for something else more exciting like a summer corn veggie "salad" or something.  

Anyway, my other MUST HAVE at The Coffee Shop is the scones! I've never ordered a scone in my life - but here they are unbelievable - soft - like glorified magic muffins.  The whoopie pies are pretty spectacular too.  I always get an iced mocha - and it's always just the way I like it.  

P.S. The ambiance here rocks.  a great place to get some work done (wifi), chat with a girlfriend, baby-watch, or go on a lunch date with your 15 month old like I do (plenty of high chairs and nice people that say SHE'S SOOO CUTE!)

What we have here is a fantastic uber chic coffee shop ripped right out a SoHo corner and slapped in a contemporary farm setting. The Coffee Shop offers a rapture of stupendous desserts and a massive menu of blissful coffee/ espresso drinks. The atmosphere and decor is smart and happening yet still keeping to its roots with exposed articles of the previous structure. I love love the ultra glamorous Jessica, all of that Chanel!

My first coffee shop I visited since I moving out here and I loved it! The look was great, very diverse customers, and the food is really good. Especially the desserts! They have free wifi so I was able to get some homework done there as I drank my tea. Great vibe, great place definitely coming back!

I gave up coffee about 2 years ago.. most of the coffees I drink now a days make me jittery because its too strong.  The Coffee Shop has such good coffee, kind of like a mix between tea+coffee! I atmosphere is really nice and open.  We ordered their American Breakfast and chorizo burrito.  

American Breakfast- eggs were cooked to perfection and the wheat bread was so good, not dry like most kinds.  

Chorizo burrito- overall really good but too much potato.  Should opt for no potato next time.  

I liked it so much I told my boyfriend we have to come for brunch this weekend!

*I've written a review for this place in the past, but that was about a year and a half ago, so I feel it's a good idea to revisit and revise.*

I've been frequenting The Coffee Shop for a year and a half now, at a rate of close to three times a week (sometimes more, sometimes less). Since becoming a regular, I've gotten to know the staff and their names, and they know exactly what I want every time I come in; although, that's pretty simple, as it's just a medium black coffee. Given that their drip system is a fairly standard one, you can expect the same brew every time. While I would love it if they went a bit more high-end in their regular coffee brewing, I can't complain too much. They source their beans from Mr. Espresso, which is based out of California. Would I prefer it to be something a little more local? Yes, especially given that most of their other ingredients for food is locally sourced; but again, this is a relatively minor quibble. If you choose to go the espresso route with a latte, cappuccino, etc., then you'll more than likely be satisfied. My guess is that most of the customers who frequent here wouldn't consider themselves to be coffee snobs, so I never really overhear much complaining on their part. 

The Coffee Shop's ace in the hole, however, is their cupcakes. While I'm not a cupcake critic, I've never been anything less than pleased with what they have to offer. You'll find an assortment of unique and endearing choices, from Birthday Cake Cupcake to blueberry scones, and more. My personal favorite is the Red Velvet Cupcake, but I've also tried their signature item: Coffee & Cigarettes. While the name isn't the most appealing, it's what won them an episode of The Cupcake Wars, and I can see why. 

Aside from sweets, they offer a pretty decent menu of healthy sandwhiches and wraps. However, if you can, go in the morning and grab something from their breakfast menu, such as The San Diegan. This open faced omelette will literally open your face with delight (whatever that means). 

The only real drawback to The Coffee Shop can be summed up in the immortal words of Yogi Berra, "Nobody goes there anymore. It's too crowded." Given that it's situated on an idealic urban farm that tends to play home to the more hip and socially conscious crowd of Gilbert, you can expect to have to deal with long lines and relatively little seating due to the sheer number of humans. The inside decor and vibe is pretty open and rustic, as it's a converted tractor barn, complete with concrete walls, an open aired dining and seating area situated between two walls of near floor-to-ceiling windows, and a backroom filled with comfortable couches and chairs. The natural light poors in nicely, though it can create a bit of a glare at certain times of the day. Seating is available outside, but on hot summer days you'll probably have to fistfight someone for a spot indoors. Since it's also a coffee shop, you'll more than likely see idiots like me taking up a table for inordinate amounts of time while slowly sipping on their brew and typing away on their devices. That's just how it is, so be prepared and ready. Besides, if you're just getting a drink, you can always grab your beverage and take a nice walk through the beautiful urban farm area and enjoy nature a little. Your mom always says you need to get outside more. 

In all, The Coffee Shop is one of the best destinations for food, coffee, and hanging out in the East Valley. Does it have its areas it could improve on? Of course; nearly every establishment does. However, there's a reason I come here most days to do my writing, so they're definitely doing something right.

Went here for brunch and they have so many breakfast options and yummy looking pastries. Clean ingredients too which is very important to me. I had a breakfast burrito and my companion had a breakfast sandwich. Both were very good! It can get crowded and depending on the time of day the line can get long. Parking can be tricky too. Coffee options are great and their regular coffee tastes really good! Love the location. Will be back!

This place is great. Really homey and comfortable. Their food has always been good and same goes for the pastries. I keep trying to replicate the San Diegan but there's just something they do with it! Not much a fan of their coffee ironically, but for breakfast it's awesome!

This is my favorite coffee shop to go to in Gilbert.  It's tucked in agritopia so it gives the feeling of a Midwestern small town.  Plenty of seating outside, not so much inside, but I have always found a seat.  It is usually busy, I have never been there when there has not been a line.  Friendly staff and great coffee!
returned to The Coffee Shop at Agritopia today for the most perfect lemon cupcake I have ever seen and tasted. I will post a picture of my happy self eating it too.

Very very yummy!!! We ordered the papas grande burrito and it was absolutely delicious!!! The salsa that came with the burrito was to die for!!! We have also ordered lunch there and have been impressed with that also.  My only complaint would be the attitude of some of the girls that work behind the counter.  But other than that we have always been pleased with the food and coffee!!

I just visited The Coffee Shop which is part of Joe's Farm Grill in Gilbert and it was awful. The service was terrible (couldn't make a sandwich correctly and the restaurant was out of meats and bread) and the cupcakes are no better than store bought or box mix cupcakes. The owners lost twice on Cupcake Wars and now I know why. 

A tiny BLT and a Tuna sandwich (with maybe a tablespoon full of Tuna) with chips, two cokes and two small cupcakes were $30. I will not be going back to this place and I would recommend that you not waste your time or money.

Love the location, but their coffee just isn't good. I have ordered iced mochas from here a few times and they are drinkable like McDonald's, but not good and certainly not worth the money you pay. Food is overpriced and again it's decent, but not good. Best thing here are the cupcakes and obviously location. Wish it were a better review.
This place is absolutely delicious! Papa Grande burrito and their Waffles are to die for! Those are the only two things I've had from here but I bet you couldn't go wrong with anything on the menu.

The Coffee Shop is my favorite coffee shop in the valley, though I more often go to Coffee Rush.  There's now a plant nursery happening on the outdoor patio, which has been modestly expanded to include more seats among the plants in partial shade.  Excellent no-hassle wifi.  The Caramel Deluxe is delicious hot and iced.
The coffee was good.  The coconut cupcake my wife and I shared was great.
Best Chai Tea I've ever had. So much better than any other coffee shop I've been too, even Starbucks. The staff is so nice. I attend bible studies here and they are very respectful.
We come here every Saturday morning..favorite breakfast place in Gilbert! Scenery is beautiful, located right next to a beautiful little farm. The patio is very nice and food is amazing!!

The coffee shop is such a cute little place! They have a nice atmosphere with top to bottom windows in the main area which is prefect for chatting and catching up with friends and a separate quieter back area that's perfect for working on something. They also have an amazing outdoor area, with plenty of seats and shaded/ unshaded areas. The workers are friendly and the coffee is delicious. My favorite drink is an Iced black & white. Their food is good too! They have a healthier styled menu with mostly sandwiches/ salads and wraps but there's still plenty to choose from. The only reason I don't give 5 stars is because I've had to send back my sandwich a few times when I've asked for no onion and have gotten it anyway, and one time they didn't switch the bread so I could still taste it, but it's always been a quick fix! Love it here!

I come here because it is one of the few independent coffee shops around and the ambiance is really nice. The chairs in the back are comfy and I love the decor. The hot chocolate is great. The sweets also taste good. The only bad thing is there are ALWAYS flies on their baked goods. I have come in multiple times to get a cupcake or a whoopie saw the flies on them and turn right back around.

Rare find in the East Valley! 
Cute Cupcakes and the place definitely has character!

I ate a coconut cupcake with sprinkled coconut and glitter on top. I only bought one cupcake and took it hope to share with my 3 roommates. It made me wish I had more cupcakes to share with the rest of them! We took our forks and gulped it down. 

The pink frosting was delicious and melted right in our mouth. The cupcake itself was very rich and moist. They must have substituted milk for the water while baking it, I could tell, so moist and mouth watering. 

I will be coming back here to eat for breakfast and lunch. Its a great place to study.
Love love love coming here for breakfast and coffee just wish that had more gluten free options!!!

Wanted to checkout the cupcakes. We got the red velvet, mixed berry, vanilla and coconut. I got the red velvet for my son. I'm not a fan of red velvet but he said it was moist and the frosting was not too sweet. I had the mix berry which was also moist but tasted tangy at the end. I'm guessing from the frosting and berry which was different. 

I'm not a fan of frosting especially on cupcakes because usually their too sweet and there's too much. This one was kinda gritty, don't know if that's how they wanted to make it. I did take some of the frosting off the top, which surprisingly was not overly sweet.
The whole area over here is awesome. The Coffee Shop offers delicious Artisan sandwiches and coffee/tea drinks. It can be very busy during lunch time, so be prepared for crowds.

The place is literally next door to Joe's Farm Fresh Grill.  I didn't see a sign on the building for it.  It has a hip and trendy vibe and sometimes long lines.  The food is good.  Even though they won a round of Cup Cake Wars, I didn't think they were great.  Also wasn't a big fan of their coffee.  The food was very good though and I loved the atmosphere.

I would give the place (4) stars except for the fact that they do not have any gluten-free bread or cupcakes. If you do not eat gluten you are sorry for choices here. In this day and age there should be some choices for limited diets. Don't even get me started on the make-shift salad. The greens did not look fresh and the tomatoes were lackluster. The dressing was the best part of the salad. The tuna salad was good but it did not make up for the caloric difference of a sandwich at the same price.
Love the staff but sorry management-owners, get some GF options!

I really love this place. For the longest time it was like my second home, I could walk and be there in 20 minutes. Their food and pastries are always the same great quality, and their tea/lemonade is so refreshing. However I feel like the staff could all smile and be a little more friendly. Such an amazing place, the vintage decor and small succulent plants on each table really tie the whole thing together.

I have been going to The Coffee Shop since they opened their doors. I absolutely love the cozy atmosphere, and lively setting. I never have to give my name when ordering because they always remember who I am. The food is so delicious.,the cupcakes are unique in taste, and addicting! I love the breakfast burritos as well. My kids also love going, and have grown up enjoying all the different things they have to offer. you cant go wrong!

We love having a local coffee shop with actually delicious coffee drinks! The quality of the beans, correct preparation of the drinks, including the equipment used, and knowledgeable baristas to prepare the drinks is key. Garrett is the best- he makes them beautiful as well as delicious! The food is also incredible: homemade granola, pappas grande burrito with eggs, bacon, potatoes and cheese (and their amazing tortillas!), many sandwiches and wraps with your choice of breads.The sweets case is full of scones, cupcakes, and cookies, too. Sitting outside in cool weather is a treat, as they have a rose garden, and potted flowers, and it's quiet, as it's not right on the street like many coffee shops. The line on the weekend shows, it's worth the wait- so come early to avoid the line! Or come on a weekday!

We used to go here all the time and loved the concept and neighborly feel.  Then it felt like the owners started to not put in much effort in training the staff & caring about the customers.  Our orders were continually messed up and staff seemed clueless and sometimes rude. We felt it was too expensive to continue to be disappointed so we stopped going.
Had a double expresso was really smooth, not acidic, not pungent, and a nice well balanced expresso smooth roasted aftertaste, best expresso on the east side hence the 5 star
Best local coffee shop in Gilbert. Solid selection of specialty coffee drinks if you're into that, and the food options rock. Their iced Americano MIGHT just be my favorite. Ever.

Awesome atmosphere to grab a coffee with someone and hatch out some conversation, and digging into your homework. Amazing food always being served here that the Coffee Shop.  The award winning cupcakes are a must have in every visit. I love the homemade touch and all organic ingredients that is in every meal here. The only downside is the attentiveness of the employees and friendliness as well. Other than that, another great experience at the Coffee Shop.

The almond chai is the best chai latte I've had. Their espresso is fantastic. I don't need to talk about the pastry selection here because it's fantastic and anyone could tell you that. I definitely recommend the San Diegan for breakfast. They also have a great tofu eggs benedict. Try out their prairie bread toast! Everything is always delicious.

I had lunch here today with my mom and I was pleasantly surprised. The food is really good and reasonably priced. Of course, we had to try a cupcake, so we split a cookie dough cupcake and it was to die for! I can't wait to go back and try another flavor. The staff is really nice, but honestly, my favorite part was the music - Elliott Smith, Beck, Radiohead, Beatles...it doesn't get any better than that for me. I could have sat there all day listening to my favorite music while eating delicious cupcakes :)

When going in and seeing a fairly long line, I knew it meant that the food was going to be good. The service was quick, and they were flexible with my order to accommodate my needs. Cute area, amazing food, and great blended coffee drinks! Will definitely go back!
Awesome patio (and super cool indoor seating) for enjoying a coffee with a yummy pastry.
Busy place and wish they would open earlier on weekends, BUT they have excellent coffee and my absolute favorite breakfast item is the San Diegan open faced omelette

This place is a gem, and their pristine outside patio is perfect for morning lattes when there is a scent of chill in the air.

The wife and I popped in based on an article she had seen.  I know the following statement has no business being in a business review, but the cashier had the bluest eyes I've ever seen, and it took everything in me to refrain from asking if they were real.

The Lemon Whoopi was a great little cream-filled, sponge cake cookie.  But the real shining star was the Cinnamon Cupcake.  Amazing concentrations of cinnamon sugar were dispersed throughout the cupcake, delighting me bite after bite.  The frosting was creamy, with a little crust of sugar, adding to the consistency.  It was simply wonderful.

I simply must try to recreate this award winning pastry.  So Joe, if you're reading this, we can do it the easy way, or the hard way.  You could bestow the recipe for this little treasure, and I could sign an NDA, and it would be our little secret.  

OR... I could assemble the greatest axis of cupcake aficionados this side of... um, a place that would be notorious for cupcakes?  Then, after purchasing hundreds of these treats, and returning most of them to my team for careful analysis, could come up with the same recipe.

The ball is in your court Joe, but be forewarned: I wont wait forever before soliciting my hench-women.

PS: Applications now being accepted for cupcake hench-women.

Really yummy cupcakes. That's about all I can really say for this place. Service has always been pretty sterile and very young. It's Gilbert so the personalities of most of the people there are kinda blah. Welcome to Gilbert.

This place keeps falling off more and more each time I go.

I absolutely LOVE this place! They have a super veg friendly menu. I've been a few times and tried something different each time - always amazing. Their vegan sweet treats are delicious! Love the setting, super relaxed. Totally recommend this place. Will be back again soon!

It was a perfect day to sit outside in the patio enjoying the Bacon & BBQ sauce cupcake from the Food Network "Cupcake War" Challenge.  The thought of BBQ sauce on a cupcake doesn't sound very appealing, but surprisingly it wasn't too bad.  Joe's BBQ sauces are good by itself.  The cupcake was moist and with some unique flavors.  I just couldn't resist not trying it.   The view of the farm was gorgeous too.

I love love love this place!!! My family and I love the Cup Cakes. My favorite is the chocolate peanut butter. The topping is a peanut butter frosting adorned with chocolate sprinkles. No mistaking peanut butter in this frosting. The cake is chocolate yum and super moist! I've also had the red velvet, vanilla glam and the coconut. All are great! They also serve other sweet treats which I'm tempted to try but the cup cakes always reel me in first! The atmosphere and friendly staff is great too!
The only con is....it's super busy...hard to find parking on weekends but worth the wait!
This place is awesome! Staff is super friendly. Decor and atmosphere are incredible and definitely a nice change from the usual coffee stops. Iced latte was great and less expensive then most places.

My family and I lived in Gilbert for two years and The Coffee Shop was our favorite breakfast place (although their sandwiches are equally delicious!). Consistently yummy food and beverages, the staff is always friendly and courteous. Very dog and family friendly. You must try their peanut butter cupcakes and Spanish lattes! I have moved to San Diego and while there are great places here, nothing compares to The Coffee Shop! We miss you guys!

A+ place for a quick breakfast.  I had pappa's breakfast burrito with a whole slew of stuff in it. Eggs, potatoes, bacon, salsa, sausage maybe?  It was very very good.  Eggs were cooked well and that flavor was great.  Thick cut bacon FTW (for the win).  
Also had a small cookies and cream monsoon (frozen drink) and it was good as well.  
Service was quick and polite with the food coming out quickly.  
Atmosphere wasn't anything amazing but it was clean and not too loud.  The small is a bit small and can probably get crowded if there at peak time. 

My only complaint.. the place is clean.. however, there were flies, 3 or 4, all over us while we ate.  Just buzzing around, irritating the crap out of me.

Very disappointed here. Has the baker changed? Their cupcakes sure have. My 3 year old granddaughter wanted a birthday cupcake because of the sprinkles on top and the funfetti. That's where the magic stopped. The cupcake inside was bone dry! Do they don't make them fresh daily? This one was like day day day old.
This is HANDS DOWN my absolute favorite place for breakfast in Arizona. I was born and raised in the Valley and nothing compares to this spot!

Yum! they have the best  chai tea latte i ever tasted...my taste buds screamed for more after every sip.  chai tea in it's basic form is black tea that is brewed strong with a combination of spices and is diluted with milk and sugar. next time i will be sure to try the coffee!

as for the food we have tried the papas grande burrito (eggs,potatoes and a little bacon) and it was fresh and delish. I have yet to try their desserts.  the cupcakes and scones are a big draw at the coffee house. in fact the cupcake wars will be making a stop at the coffee shop this month and will air june 29th.

Small breakfast menu....probably a better place for lunch due to more choices. I got the San Diegan omelet (which the cashier said was their best seller). It was nothing spectacular and needed more veggies.  I also got the iced coffee and thought it didn't taste that great. However, the cupcakes I took home to eat later were pretty tasty. I might return for lunch one day for a sandwich .

I really enjoy the Coffee Shop.  Nice atmosphere, some outdoor seating, the inside is very cute. I've been here before and had coffee and it was quite good. 

I came the other day for lunch, and I had the vegetarian sandwich. It was excellent!  I believe it had pesto, avocado and other veggies, very good!  I also ordered a cherry cupcake. The cupcakes got five stars for the beautiful icing, but I was not as impressed with the taste. I have had better icing and better cupcakes. Don't get me wrong it's still good, but I'm a baker and a bit picky. 

I do think the coffee shop is a great place to go and have some coffee and a little light lunch and relax.

The food is good (a little overpriced)...the sweet treats are phenomenal (fairly priced)! There have been a few times that I've been in and the customer service hasn't been the greatest, which is always such a turn off for me. The whole setting gives off a hipster vibe and let me tell you, they are overloaded with these folk! One other thing that really grinds my gears about this establishment is the seating situation. I've gone in and first hand witnessed individuals (WITHOUT food or beverage, not even free water) just sitting at a table meant for 4 working on their computers. GO TO THE LIBRARY OR YOUR OWN HOUSE! If I were the manager I'd make it a rule that the coveted tables are reserved for people that are actually eating! This isn't Starbucks after all! It's ridiculous to expect paying customers to sit outside in 115 degree weather because some yuppie is working on editing their Instagram pictures...(end rant)
Food is amazing here. Love the omelette for breakfast, or any of the great sweets. Southwest chicken sandwich is one of the very best anywhere.
I can only attest to their iced coffee, but it was delicious.  The pastries in the case left me drooling and my eight year old begging for one.

Well now just conveniently located by joe' grill....a nice little coffee shop....the staff...well....good looking young kids serving you tasty cupcakes (one young buck had a crazy hairdo and seems like eye candy for the cougars). Anyways...gf and I got a whoopie cookie, red velvet, and a ginger cupcake......all delicious except i couldn't taste the ginger...she is saving it for work...booo. So good for family and emm...cougars and teeny boppers.
My fiancé and I come here all the time and have never had less than excellent food or service. It is our absolute favorite breakfast place and the bacon is to die for!

The food is good, the inside seating is very limited, but the patio space is pretty big.  The prices are definitely on the high side.  Now for the quality of this place and for what they charge, and being in Phoenix, I'm extremely disappointed that they don't have misters or outside fans or evap coolers to keep their clientele comfortable.  I won't be going there again any time soon.  It's no fun to be miserably hot and today is far from our hottest temperatures here.
The coffee is pretty good and the place is always busy. There are always pretty girls here, but it can have the pretentious vibe too. The food isnt bad either, but i can only speak for breakfast.

I'm torn between giving TCS 2 and 3 stars: my breakfast sandwich was good and the music and decor were really good.

The 2 stars would be for THE WASTE: so many disposable containers and no recycle bin. Additionally, they still use styrofoam!

What's more, this is a coffeehouse and my latte was burnt and bitter.

I wanted so to love this place.

The Coffee Shop has the bones to be the best coffee/breakfast spot in all of Arizona--but it has one big flaw. The coffee. 

Walking up to the counter, you'll see a mass of oily, dark black, oak-roasted beans from Mr. Espresso in the hopper, and they produce an espresso shot that can only be described as a punch in the face (there's a reason they're the only ones in America roasting "coffee beans exclusively over a fire fueled by Oak Wood"). Harsh is an understatement. 

But the food really is wonderful. Seriously, if they ditched the coffee and renamed the place The Omelette Shop or The Pastry Shop, it'd be a no-brainer 4-5 stars. But it's The Coffee Shop, and as a place that serves coffee, it's just not that good.

What an adorable little place!  I received a gift certificate to this place and decided to use it and meet up with a friend for coffee and breakfast.  We both ordered the San Diegan open omelette.  It was delicious. The only complaint was the bacon was a little bit fatty but otherwise we both enjoyed it very much.  I also enjoyed my caramel macchiato. I will definitely go back to try one of the yummy looking cupcakes.  We enjoyed our meal on the outdoor patio since we are experiencing such wonderful weather at the moment.  Great service and atmosphere!

This place is definitely not given enough credit! I can't believe it only has four stars. Every single time I come here I know my coffee will be fresh with great taste. Great coffee and great cupcakes made fresh with all organic products  So if you haven't tried this place before I strongly recommend you give it a shot

I work from here a lot and love it, especially when the weather is nice to sit outside and look at the farm. 

I'm not a coffee drinker, but often get a chai  or matcha with almond milk. The pomegranate tea is good, as well. 

I recommend eating the Field Veggie sandwich on 9-grain bread with a side of greens. 

Stay way from the desserts; they look pretty but most of them are dry and tasteless. Yes, some are gluten-free and whatnot, but still bad for that, in my opinion. 

This place has friendly staff. Often they are really busy and the line/wait could be long. 

For the love of all things beautiful, please bus your own table when you leave, as intended. Especially if you're outside, so the rest of us don't get attacked by birds. (From experience)

If you're looking for a place to kick up your feet, get some good coffee and read a book - this is it. If you're looking for a place to grab a seat, pull out your laptop and get some work done - this is it. If you're looking for a place that has some killer cupcakes - this is it (or so I've been told). 

The only reason I'm giving this place four stars is because of personal preference. I'm not a cream cheese frosting kind of a guy and their cupcakes are almost exclusively frosted with that stuff. They do have other options for something to go along with your coffee, but I've only tasted the cookies, and they're just about ok.

I've also had lunch here on occasion, and although nothing I've had stands out, nothing I've had disappoints.

All-in-all, if you're looking for a place to catch up with a friend, catch up on some emails or catch up on some reading; look no further. Great ambiance, friendly staff and cool vibe.

One of only airlines who doesn't charge for bags. It's cheapest option. They don't have tvs on the planes, but I don't mind. I rather save over $100 than to pay it for tv and fees from other airlines. They have free drinks and snacks. And the snacks are better than other airlines. Not just peanuts and pretzels. They have cookies and crackers too. Free too! The seats are okay, maybe a tad smaller than other airlines. However, for every airline. Seats have it drawbacks, either not enough leg room, seat won't go back than you like, or seat is small.

As for the stewards, sky caps, and other customer service agents. I haven't had a problem. But like other businesses, you'll get good ones and bad ones.

I'll fly from this airline until other airlines stop charging bag fees and have the flights I want. For now, SWA is the best option for me.

I checked in 24 hours prior to my flight and received an early boarding assignment. The boarding process was smooth and easy. I had plenty of room for my carry-on. I was always apprehensive about using Southwest because they did not assigned seats but it turns out you don't really need them. Flight crew were efficient, helpful, and friendly. I am certainly a southwest airlines fan now. Thank you.

I have to give a star but if I could, I would have given no star. Customer service at the check in window at the Las Vegas airport was not at its best. An older woman named Karen is one who is not very friendly and made our experience awful. She didn't greet us warmly but instead called us by saying next. No smile. Gave us a lecture about what we should have when traveling and went on rambling about it until we left her window. We were also trying to help speed up process by putting our luggages down for her but she insisted on us putting heavier luggage down first after already putting down a luggage for her (how can she tell which is heavier if the luggages are the same size?) She made us take luggage off to put the other luggage on. I've never had to do that with other airlines. Other airlines weigh the luggages in the order you take them off luggage cart. It would have been nice if she had engaged in small talk and to wish us a fun trip but instead we had to experience poor customer service and left her window dissapointed and upset.  There was a woman behind Karen, helping her carry luggage behind the counter, it would have been nice to be greeted from her instead of giving us hard looks. I hope the service gets better for that location, because they represent Southwest.

Delayed again.  Got bumped and pushed back 5 hours.  We pretty much lost a whole day spent at the airport now. This seems to happen every time I fly Southwest.  I'll probably spend more money in four hours waiting at the bar than the crummy voucher I got.

Southwest Las Vegas

While Southwest Airlines is usually our preferred flight of choice, my most recent experience was nothing but inconvenient. I was traveling in a small group that included a seven month old baby, while boarding in Las Vegas, the woman at the boarding station was the opposite of helpful and in fact very rude. (Name tag read, Fonza.) On the previous flight we were all able to board between A and B as a family with the baby, this time around we were rudely told that only 1 person could board the "family boarding." (I guess family means 1 adult and 1 baby.) We were all separated for our 5 hour flight and the baby was highly distressed. When we inquired about why only one person was allowed to board with the child, "Fonza" ignored any question we had and insisted we get back in line. Once boarding, I saw her arguing with another customer and giving
him unnecessary attitude, when he too, just asked a question. The flight itself was very long and I spent most of it worried about the rest of my family and the baby. The air staff were altogether not very friendly or observant of apparent things like garbage piled up in the walking row of the plane. I will not be traveling Southwest again, though it is cheap, I can now see why. 

Date: July 4, 2015
Time: 4:30pm

Flight today from Las Vegas to LA 12/18/2016. The SW staff reminded us several times it was going to be a packed flight so my husband spent an additional $60 on upgrading our seats to get on the plane first with tickets  A 1-15. Upon boarding the plane, we waited in line to board as A ticketed passengers....I notice a couple waiting in the front (about 6-7 people in front of us) who waived C tickets...I watched the SW crew member scan the C couple in right after pre-boarding. Right when I brushed off a brief moment of irritation, we boarded the plane and I suggested we sit in the 2nd row that was open. I noticed these two rows of "open" 6 seats were "reserved" with back packs and sweaters. 20 minutes in the C ticketed people were boarding, and I watched a family of 6 people fulfill those reserved seats with back packs and sweaters. There were 4 SW flight attendants manning the isles and front, and yet said nothing to the man that held those seats for his family members?! And we paid $60 for that and didn't get it?? Awesome job Southworst Airlines, way to "keep the line moving filling those seats as quickly as possible." Takeaway from this: have 1 member in your family pay a single upgrade fee, get on the plane before anyone else, take all your family's luggage and save all the seats.

What happened to their low-cost model? I used to always find really good deals on "Wanna Get Away" on the day before the flight in years past, but they vanished last year. They've actually priced themselves as the most expensive carrier with the least amount of daily flights from LAS-DTW, a flight I fly a handful of times each year (DTW's #3 and LAS' #11 destination for travelers).

There's no assigned seats which means it's Russian Roulette in terms of the middle seat with a B45+ or C boarding ticket. However a good portion of the flights I take aren't sold out as I usually travel on Tuesday/Wednesday and from Vegas on a Friday night.

But they do have their pros. If you really need to get to a destination at the last minute from McCarran, this airline likely has a handful of planes going to ced destination with seats available. If you need to cancel last minute, they'll give you points. If you need to swap flights, you only pay the difference in fare if there is one. If you need to bring a hockey bag + golf clubs on a flight, you can at no additional cost as they already factored it into the price. They do offer drinks + peanuts / pretzels on flights. 

Most of the complaints about the C-Gates are unjustified, as that's more the doings of McCarran than Southwest.

My flight was delayed from Las Vegas to BWI for 3 hours.  I never received an email notification either through email or text on this delay, so I arrived at the airport early and sat at the airport for 3 hours people watching, gets kinda old after 3 hours.  I have yet to receive an apology or explanation on the delay.  They clearly do not value their customers.

They're strictly business, only concerned with on-time departure and arrivals. Customer service is low on their list of priorities. All their employees just feel like robots and you can see the pressure placed on them by management. They never smile and show no sign of enjoyment.

The management at this airport could learn a lot in terms of customer service, especially from airlines like Delta in the Ft. Lauderdale airport, whose employees go out of their way to assist passengers.

Canceled my flight and then had the nerve to be rude about it.  Claimed maintenance but I suspect it just wasn't crammed enough for them. 

When you buy business select down and back in one day you atleast expect some empathy for not getting another plane.  Gate agent and the woman 'allowing' people through the line were unfriendly. Could have gotten more work done if they had notified me in a timely fashion. 

Such a hit and miss experience on SW. I don't think I week fly them anymore. My wife will hate losing the credit card!

People must HATE working on New Years Day. Dingy ass workers at Starbucks couldn't get out order right. Dude reading a magazine at Tap Out didn't give us any customer service. Guy at Lids was cool. Lazy ass lady at the oxygen bar didn't acknowledge us until 5 minutes later (there were NO customers). "Do you have any questions?" She said finally. "Not from you," I replied and walked away.Then when we went to board and the bitch at gate B14 (flight 3527) was like, "You have to line up in numerical order." And started calling our numbers out load like we were in pre-school! FUCK YOU OLD HAG!
Other airlines should take a training course from southwest on how to treat their guests! Great prices, awesome customer service, clean planes, quick to unload.....simply the best
The customer service at Southwest in Vegas is fantastic!! Lance T helped me on a recent trip and I am grateful to him and everyone at LAS!

SWA usually has great service, but the proprietary machine oriented culture of Vegas has rubbed off a bit at this airport.  And while the flights and inboard service is typically great, the airport service has some local coolness.

I am a road warrior.  I fly every week for work.  I leave on Sunday or Monday and return on Thursday or Friday.  I have been doing this for the last 10 years.

As you can imagine, I have flown on virtually every airline.  Early on, I was a regular on the big ones.  In the summer of 2006, that changed.  It was a Thursday evening and my flight out of Chicago O'Hare was cancelled due to inclement weather.  To my surprise, all flights out of nearby Midway airport were operating.    From then on, I pledged to avoid O'Hare and, in the process, discovered Southwest Airlines, which serves Midway with direct flights to many parts of the country.

To most road warriors, Southwest is a love or hate relationship.  The haters detest its single-class and open seating arrangements.  They do not care for Southwest's absence in the international market, which limits options for reward travel.

All things considered, I have become a big fan of Southwest.  Here's why:
1) It's the only airline that does not charge a fee for changing reservations.
2) The first two bags checked in are free.
3) While no longer a true discount airline, its fares are always competitive.
4) It flies into many smaller airports, which are easier to get in and out of.
5) The single-aircraft model permits fast gate turnaround and efficient maintenance.
6) The flight crews appear to enjoy their work and inject a sense of humor into most flights.
7) It has developed a vast network of U.S. destinations and recently added Mexico to its portfolio.
8) The revamped rapid rewards program eliminates blackout dates, enhances free flight redemption, and adds international travel rewards through its credit card.

Every airline wrestles with flight delays, lost luggage, and obnoxious passengers.  Southwest is no exception; but, it has consistently ranked high in all customer satisfaction surveys because it deals with the negatives better than other airlines.

Southwest has the image of a no-frills, discount airline with the cattle-call passenger loading process.  It has been the butt of late-night comedy jokes.  Some of that has changed over the years.  What has remained is its ability to deliver consistently acceptable service with a smile and tongue firmly in cheek.  In an industry where mediocrity is the norm, that is exceptional.  This year is Southwest's 40th anniversary.  I salute its management and staff.  Keep up the good work for the next 40.

DONT FLY IF PREGNANT!!!! I had a horrible experience flying with southwest at 7 months pregnant this past Thursday! When I asked the flight attendant to help me put my carry on above she told me she couldn't. I explained that I was pregnant and not able to lift it that high. Thankfully another passenger helped but she was really rude about it. Then, when I went to the restroom which I did wait til the seatbelt sign was off she was rude again! I came out and she was in front of me. I was just waiting for her to pass my seat and walking patiently behind her as we were almost there. Instead of walking forward she told me to walk between her and the seats in the small aisle! I'm pregnant and can't suck in. It was obvious I would not fit and I explained that to her. She then leaned all over the passenger in the aisle instead making me still squeeze by. I was so embarrassed and uncomfortable! I don't know why she wouldn't just walk forward. Even the other passengers were shocked and shaking their heads at her. When I sat down the lady next to me said she could t believe how rude she was being to someone and mistreating a pregnant woman like that. I fly pretty often and always choose southwest but I don't know if I will continue anymore after being treated like this!!!! There are many more airline choices!! If you're pregnant don't fly southwest!!!

Currently on flight 1809 in route to Florida. This airline is generally great. The staff on broad today is a little rude and short with the passengers. I hope (faith) your crew member starts to have a better day and starts to be friendly towards us passengers. 

Best regards
Jeff.

Never again will I fly southwest.  In the past two years my 4 flights I've taken with them from Las Vegas to SF and SF back to Las Vegas have been delayed. Not just one flight either, coming here I was delayed an hour and now we're being delayed 3.5 hours going home. Wtf!!  Flying with a child and having to deal with this is very frustrating.  I would much rather pay an extra $20-50 to fly with Virgin Airlines then get a deal on my tickets at least the times I've flown with them I've been delayed once. Never again will I fly Southwest.  You guys need to get your shi* together!!!!

If I could give negative stars with regards to Southwest's service and professional competence I would. I have suffered multiple hours of delays, been bumped off flights, and been subjected to countless hours of frustration at the hands of this company with no compassion. I have been flying with them for years because of the lack of alternatives. This lack of alternatives is something they seem to be painfully well aware of.  Expect the perfect storm of incompetence whenever you are forced to fly Southwest. If given the choice, choose ANY other airline.

Southwest Airlines could actually be THE worst airline ever. In late May, they left me stranded at three airports over the course of three days. Although the airline claimed the delay was weather-related, my friend and sister miraculously were able to fly on SW into NYC without issue. It wasn't until I purchased a business select ticket, after spending hundreds of dollars on hotels that I stayed in for 3 hours, that I managed to get to NYC. Shocking. Never mind the extremely rude counter representatives in Chicago who, at one point, just closed up shop and went home leaving everyone stranded. I vowed never to travel Southworst again. Like an idiot, I decided to forgive and try again. First time I've booked with SW since they stole 3 days from me. Ten minutes before boarding in Las Vegas and I get a text message, flight cancelled. The boards, the app, the 1-800 number all say the flight is on time. Brilliant. Turns out, not only is the flight cancelled for some unknown, undisclosed reason, the counter reps can't even rebook anyone because "headquarters has taken over and locked up the system." I called "headquarters," as directed and the recorded voice told me it's an approximately 67 minute wait. Would I like a call back? No. What I'd like is for SW to stop treating its customers like they give zero fucks. We're the airline, we have your money, what are you going to do? Nothing, except go on Yelp. I couldn't hate you anymore, SW. you're an abusive airline that should be stopped. I wish I could replace the star rating with a middle finger because that is the only way you'd get a 5 rating.

I felt like a little sardine in a can.  I don't remember being so cramped last time I was on an airplane.  That was probably 10 years ago though....I have been to way too many restaurants in the last 2 years.  Of course, it was only a 737, not a 747 so that made a difference, I am sure.  Not sure about the "no electronics" rules they have.  They guy in my row filmed the entire take-off and landing.  Not sure if it is safe or unsafe.  The attendants didn't seem to care (or notice).  Someone dropped a terribly nasty "bomb" in the restroom towards the end of the flight.  Oh well....  We made it to Vegas and back in 2 pieces.  The price is right.  I just want bigger seats.

We flew on flight 4790 from Orlando to Vegas on 6-22-14. When we boarded and were waiting for everyone to sit down, one of the female flight attendants got on the P/A and asked people to place smaller carry on bags under the seats. When some weren't listening she said "Ok, no one is listening so I guess I'm just talking to myself, Blah, Blah,Blah..." Which I found very unprofessional. Later, the same attendant was cleaning up after a child got ill and again announced on the P/A " People, please don't put your heads out in the aisle while I'm trying to clean, you're just in my way. If you're going to do that feel free to clean it up yourselves." Again, very unprofessional.

The rest of the crew was pleasant, but this attendant seemed quite callous and rude. This lessened our flying experience. A male attendant also announced "if you paid more money, you'd be on US Airlines right now" I have no idea what he meant by that but I took it as though he thought US Air was a pricier and therefore better airline. At least that's how I took it. Add the rude Mr. "William" at the Orlando check in counter with the condescending attitude about baggage weights like we were idiots, and this was not a great experience. I won't be flying SWA any more.

Southwest is a dependable and affordable airline. They have 2 bags fly free for each passenger which is awesome for vacation. My only complaint is that they are rarely on time. I'm A-List preferred and enjoy the benefits of this status and have a companion fly free with any paid ticket. Great perks and I only like boarding in the A Group since I normally travel with carry on.  Business Select tickets allow you to make changes on the fly without any additional charges which is great for business.

I have flown SW many (100+) times. Today at Mccarran was the worst check in experience. Pretty much the equivalent of a trip to the DMV.  Customer service reps with "power" issues taking their sweet time to lotion themselves, one to re-direct flyers to auto ticketing kiosks, and another to yell at guests who were out of line after the first one told them to move. Another rep who just stood around with zero information. Why is this company paying these people to do nothing or contradict each other?

Had to cancel a flight back in March for which I had used some travel funds and paid $118 anew. I was told then that all the funds, both from the old booking and for the travel I was cancelling would expire in May. I explained that I am a teacher and can't travel until the summer. I was told to go ahead and try to use the funds after they expired. So, I called today, and SWA gave me $18 for the $198. in funds that I had. I'm sure that SWA needs that $180 far more than a simple teacher, so I am happy to donate to the cause.

I have been flying with SWA for 25 years, a couple of times a year.  I can't afford to take trips very often, but when I did, I ALWAYS would fly Southwest.  They say they are a company with heart.  Apparently not.

Ray the flight attendant. Not only was he rude but learn to communicate to your staff he was late calling last board and soon as we stepped up the doors were closed. He didnt make the 10 minute call, he made it 5 minutes till. If you cant communicate and keep up find another damn job that you can. People time is important. Clearly you have no damn customer service!!!

When am I going to finally learn - to STOP flying this disaster of an airline!  Really, these guys have gone from worse, to much worse. They can't get out of their own way. Seriously, this is the last time flying Southworst.

I have been flying on Southwest Airlines for many years. I use then for business travel, personal vacations, and I even use them to bring my sister and nephew in to town from Phoenix.  I have a business southwest visa and a personal one, too.  So do my employees.  That all changes today.  For the first time ever, I tried to change from a 545 flight to a 245 flight due to a family medical emergency.  Margo Holly, the supervisor at the ticket counter wanted proof of what was happening with my special needs daughter and wanted to be able to call the doctor.  She said that was the only way she could help me other than to charge me 20000 points for each of the two tickets I would need. That is a HUGE amount of money that I don't have.  I spoke with the supervisor at 1800iflysouthwest, and she said it should be no problem.  She would do it, but she couldn't because it was within two hours of the flight. 1.5 hours to be precise.  She said the only thing I could do is to get a supervisor at the airport to change it.  She said that customer service could override the airport, but they are not open on the weekends.  She actually told me that i might try sending out a tweet, because the corporate office monitors those and might intervene. This is incredible.  The staff and supervisors had the most dispassionate manner that I have ever experienced.  This will be the end of a long relationship that I have had with them.  Southwest Airlines.....the most uncaring airline in the skies.
