After delta and united delayed my bags by several hours I have a great appreciation for southwest. I have flown with them more than any other airline since they have more options when flying to CA. They have not yet lost my luggage (knock on wood)..the seats aren't the best but i can live with that on short flights. Not having to pay the extra $25 for checking in luggage is a huge plus. The employees seem to be happier (compared to delta and jet blue) and the flight attendants are usually friendly (9 out of 10). The pilots usually get us to the destination city on time or a few min earlier.

I am an A lister on SW so I flown many legs on this airline.  In all fairness I would consider this experience to be completely isolated but I just got off flight 634 from RDU and I am totally disappointed about the experience.  The flight attendants were so rude to passengers and two of the male flight attendants were on their cell phones throughout the course of the trip.  I was so taken back by their attitudes I almost said something.  In addition I paid for the NFL red zone and it froze about an hour into the trip.  I am giving them a better rating then they deserve because my flight out was the polar opposite experience.

I have only great words to say about my experiences with Southwest Airlines! If I can fly with Southwest, I will do ( Denver, Vegas, Dallas, Chicago... You name it)  
One of my lovely experience with them was amazing!

I have no idea how I missed my plane flying from Las Vegas, NV  back to San Francisco, California, while I was sitting at the gate... I was reading a book and must have spaced it out that I haven't even heard my name when they called me or must have been still excited about my friend's wedding that I went to and me being their wedding photographer.... 
A very nice employee/ agent at the desk was so helpful and gave me a few options and sent me right away to a different terminal to catch my new flight that was flying to Oakland, California. 
I landed even before my original time that was scheduled to San Francisco Airport. 
The only thing I had to take care of, was to get my luggage from the originally scheduled airport. That was totally fine with me. The most important thing for me was that I needed to be back that day and that mission was 100 percent accomplished.

Southwest is one of my favorite airline! They have always great deal! You can bring your luggage for free on a plane. There is no change fees in case you need to cancel your flight or you keep your credit if needed.
Their boarding system is a bit different from the other airlines which I totally don't mind at all. I think unassigned seating is not bad at all. 
Southwest employee/ agents are always smiling and nice and willing to help! 

Look forward to fly with Southwest Airline again!
Best.  Really funny flight attendant guy today.  The jokes were non stop.

I have to say I have flown #Southwest Airlines many times in the past and never had an issue.  Not this trip! Not only was our first flight late and we missed the connector flight, they cancelled the 2nd connector flight. BUT, this was not the issue.  I understand things happen. There is absolutely no excuse for rudeness by counter personnel. The information board behind the counter stated the flight was on time. We had been waiting for at least 30 minutes to board not knowing that flight had been cancelled. When I went up to the counter, Jillian, the most rudest of them all, stated she had announced the flight had been cancelled.  There was 4 of us and many others waiting to board this cancelled flight and amazingly none of us heard this ghost of an announcement.  She then said to go get in line. Once we finally made it to the counter again, 1 of us got on the next flight and the other 3 had to wait till the evening flight.  I asked Jillian why the board behind her still shows the flight as being on time. She stated the City controls the board - WHAT!! Unbelievable.  She had no sympathy for all those inconvenienced and was flat out rude. Very disappointing #Southwest, very disappointing.

So far I am not impressed.  Do you people know what the definition of customer service is?.. how about a smile? Nope nothing.  And you have the audacity to raise prices. Why? Your customers do everything for you other then fly the plane. Tag you own luggage, carry it to the window, and I'll  I get is a blank look and let me see your license. Honestly  what has this world come to. High price flight for a bunch  of snot nose, you owe me attitude punks. Oh ya just what I want to pay for. Your so called customer  service in the Las Vegas  airport SUCKS...
TERRIBLE bag handling at McCarren Airport in Vegas.  We arrived Thursday nite on A flight from JAX and waited more than 1 hour for them to deliver our bags.
If I can help it, i'll never fly SW ever again. 85% of my flights with them have been delayed. Both at gate and on tarmac. Random cattle herd seating. No thanks!

Worse customer service for Vacation Package problems. Had issue in Vegas and every number I called referred me elsewhere until I ended up in a complete circle back to the beginning. Makes you wonder what idiot managers are in charge of call support. Never got problem solved and everyone at SWA could care less.

The most frustrating time waiting for flight. Delayed so far 3 hours and no information given.  First told the plane is circling the airport, then told mechanical problems and now told they are looking for a plane for us. The southwest website is updated with most recent delay and no info from gate people as to delay. I planned this trip as am meeting up with others flying in from other destinations. Now southwest has delayed them in Nashville waiting for me. And not even a sorry.

We arrived at Concourse C then our connection was in Concourse B and then after 4 cancellations we were sent back to Concourse C. I looked at my reservation update on SW app and they had not even booked me on a flight. Guess they figured I did not need to leave Las Vegas. Worst communication ever. I fly several times a year and my family does as well. We have been faithful to SW and even excited when we heard they were going to be flying to Hawaii bc we go there annually. But for now on my flights to and from Seattle to Nashville or anywhere else would be via Alaska Airlines.

I've traveled with Southwest exclusively for over 10years for business and pleasure. Last week our flight kept getting delayed and delayed which is fine,I understand things happen, but at the end of the night I found out it was canceled not through an announcement but a text message on my phone. Because of this cancelation I missed a cruise with my husband and friends. I was on hold for over an hour, two separate times while standing in line trying to get something worked out. I left to go to another Southwest counter that had a shorter line and this guy tells me there's nothing I can do because it was canceled for weather reasons. Well that's interesting, not once was weather an issue and flights before ours left. Our plane was there, ready to go but we were told we had to wait on the pilots. Pilots got there late and had met their hours and apparently NO other pilots were available. If they had told us this hours before (we sat there from 3pm-9pm assuming this flight would leave once the pilots got there bc that's what they told us!), we would have gotten there the next morning and had plenty of time to get to our cruise. Called customer service the next day bc no one answered the night before and she was just as rude. I will be finding a new airline and canceling my SW visa unless this get resolved.
Had good experience with southwest , I was having trouble with Spirit airline which I'll never go to again, went to southwest in Vegas and the employee Michael was kind and very helpful.

Platos closet had a convention in Orlando Florida, on the the way home on 5/15/15, flight number 4974 (Orlando to Albuquerque), a flight attendant named Mitch had the BEST customer service I have ever seen with an airline! Southwest, good job with Mitch! He's a keeper!!!

I used to just dislike Southwest Airlines, now I am absolutely disgusted with them. I flew  on eight Southwest flights in 2014.... Seven of those flights were either delayed by several hours or canceled completely. I also have to just say first off that giving one star to this company is way too generous. The last trip from Phoenix to Vegas was my last straw. A five minute plane maintenance delay turned into a five hour nightmare. Had the aircraft not been 100% full, the first hour would have been a little more tolerable while I sat on the overheated runway with absolutely no communication or update from the staff about the delay. I was told "only ten more minutes" on five separate occasions. I deplaned and was rerouted on standby so I lost my "A/ boarding group place in line and was the very last person on the next overcrowded aircraft. When I finally arrived in Las Vegas I had discovered that bags were misplaced and transferred to a flight that would cost me another two hour delay. My returning flight from Las Vegas to Phoenix was of course also delayed because of faulty equipment, and I could not be rerouted to the next flight out because that aircraft was also delayed because of bad equipment!!! I am writing this review right now as I am sitting at the airport in Las Vegas wondering how many more lies the Southwest staff are going to put me through before I can finally get back to Phoenix. 

I can deal with a delay every now and then but with Southwest Airlines I have dealt with a delay and or other problems over 90% of the time I fly with them. I booked this round trip flight about a month ago and southwest was maybe about twenty five dollars cheaper then US airways and United. Please, please,  please.... save yourself the time and stress and pick ANY other airline besides Southwest! My Christmas was officially ruined by this airline and I have nothing positive to say about this company or the staff. If you respect yourself in any way at all then do not fly Southwest until they start getting their S$$t together, which I'm sure won't be for a long long time.
Copilot couldn't get the seat adjusted close enough do they delayed our flight for maintenance to fix it! Once in Vegas, they didn't have a gate ready! Bad night for SW all around!

The personnel was AWFUL- they lost my liggage, which I don understand is not the personnel in the airport's fault..but they could have been a tad more understanding that arriving in LAS VEGAS with nothing at all is a scary thing.. I had to buy EVERYTHING- and a toothbrush there is over $10 so do the math... I finally got my luggage back 24 hours later but I had no idea I was going to get it. No contact at all from the personnel until about 10-11:00pm of the day I flew in...and I got there in the morning. What an AWFUL experience. I've always loved SW, too... it's a shame. They didn't even offer me a voucher for losing my luggage, either. In order to get a $50 (wow, thanks) voucher, I would have had to sit at the airport all day until it POSSIBLY came in on another plane..... WOW. Customer service? I think not. I'll be flyign elsewhere from here on out and I suggest everyone else does too, unless SW decides to remedy THEIR mistake and reimburse me for my REASONABLE costs I incurred due to their mistake....

SW found a new way to make money... A way to show on the books that the flight was full, when in fact it was not. It is now standard procedure to discriminate against the averaged sized Americans that are not a part of the "Ken and Barbie" class.

I have flown SW, among other airlines for several years, and never have been treated with such disrespect. CS agent Regan at the counter could not think for himself. He asked if I could sit in a single seat.. Of course! No problem putting the arm down?  Never in 3 years! OK.. You will have to buy another ticket... Um, how do I prove to you that I'm not going to take up my wife's space which I have also already purchased? It up to our discretion.. Or their ability to discriminate for profit. Maybe next they will start charging folks that don't wear enough deodorant...

Note: We had flown Southwest from SFO to Vegas 3 days earlier with no drama. Maybe staff training is needed in Vegas?!?

Had enough, requested for money back. Take Virgin America from Vegas to SFO everytime. They cost just a bit more, but have treated my wife and I with respect. They are awesome.

Be careful.  Coming home from Vegas Southwest Airlines lost half of our luggage on Sunday.  Four of us travelled and two large pieces were lost this week.  We learned during this process that the airline tags used to identify your luggage are not scanned into the system.  This is hard to believe in a data driven society.   They have no idea what happened: if they were stolen from the airport, if they stayed on the plane we were on to Chicago and went on to Kentucky, or if they are in an airport somewhere in the US.  The claim process seems draconian.  They want receipts for every little item, and we'll have to buy all new clothes and accessories in advance.  :(

Flights severely delayed. Computers going out! 4 hours with no end in sight. Let's have back up plan airlines!!, what decade are we in? The increased prices and we can't manage to organize people without computer??
Now after 5+ hours canceled my flight. No reason given. Noone can tell me when and/or if I will ever see my luggage.  One attendant said I"It might GO TO PORTLAND!!!" How come my luggage can go but passengers cant!!! I will never fly SWA again Ever!! Even if it were free. I wish could give negative rating. It is deserved!!!!!

This goes for all southwest, I'm just stuck at the one in Vegas. This is by far the worst airlines I've ever flown. Not only do you board a plane you already delayed, but knowing you have mantiance issue, you then make us get off and say "sorry". Absolutely unprofessional as it comes. Not even going to mention how you ruined majority of the passengers flights and connecting flights getting here and best you can do is once again "our bad". Have some pride in your airline. This is will be LAST southwest flight I pay for. I may not even take a free ticket because I'm betting it'll have problems of some sort. Thank you for nothing.

Southwest Airlines is my favorite Airlines . Every time I flown with them I always have the best experience!!! Love Love Southwest Airlines. Thank you for providing excellent services to make my traveling easy & more fun!

I've always loved Southwest Airlines since I was a little girl. From flying by myself to flying in groups, they have always made my experiences wonderful. There are so many great flight attendants, no matter what time of day it is. I definitely recommend southwest, also because if you become a frequent flyer and get a certain amount of points, you get a "companion pass" which allows you to bring someone for free!! We love it! And with our baby being under 2 years of age, we BOTH fly free. So it's 3 for the price of one! It's all around a great airline!

Haven't flown with Southwest in almost two years and I don't recall the service being so poor. Looks to have gone down hill pretty fast I wanted to upgrade our boarding for the $40/ticket fee but was pretty much ignored and made to feel that it was an inconvenience to the two employees who were having a personal conversation. Even though one ticket was free with the points I had, I would prefer to spend more on a company that is more service oriented. Decided not to spend way more money with this company. Will continue using Delta and Alaska airlines.

This review is for my recent experience in Las Vegas only (because otherwise I really like SW a lot!!)  Rude, rude rude lady at check in. It was very early, not yet busy so I am not sure what her issue was. Beside being snappy, she clearly saw I was writing out a tag for my bag yet threw it on the belt anyway and said 'too late' . Also, 4 of us were travelling together, with 5 bags total. She had us put up only one bag at a time and check ID, yet she still managed to get the wrong name on every single bag. Very poor service, very disappointed, SW. I know you can do better...this bad egg needs to go if she is so miserable.  I did also try to send an email to SW to advise of the ssituation, but was unable to do so, the website does not seem to be working properly. Or maybe they just do not want to hear the criticism.

Worst experience with an airline in 40 years! Today's flight was delayed 5 hours; fine, that happens. But they announced the new departure time of 830PM via text. When I got to the gate (at 755), it said new ETD 810! Great I thought, but what about the people who think it's still 830? Yeah, this plane won't leave b4 then. Whatever. Then I hear a guy at the counter upset that he missed his flight to Hartford. Hartford? That's where I'M going! Turns out the flight left at 757! 2 minutes after I got to the gate, 13 minutes before their sign said, and 33 minutes before their text message said! Since when does a plane leave early just because they want to? Is a 5 hour delay not enough of an imposition, but now they leave b4 the promised time?! The ONLY reason to fly SW is a direct flight. of course, I'm now rebooked on a connecting flight the next day. Also, I was an A priority boarder, now I'm a B (that's the least of my problems, but that's how they make up for their idiocy??) I don't complain about airlines, because I expect them to suck. But at SW, they try harder...to suck.

What is there to say about Southwest Airlines that hasn't already been said before? Everything about them is awesome and the savings are amazing. Customer service is amazing no matter where you go. The process of using Southwest Airlines is so easy whether you are cancelling a flight or checking in. I am always excited to fly with them.

Racking up those miles! Ya! 

I have been flying by myself since I was six years old and I wish I could count those flights on my rewards now, but I doubt my parents thought to save that info. I would have so many free flights by now if they did! 

Anyway, I love Southwest. I have never had an issue with them. I am sure things happen and people freak out, but it happens. Yelling at someone is not going to solve your issues. I love them because they are simple and one of the only airlines left that doesn't charge for luggage under two bags. I think that is a pretty sweet deal for the blood thirsty economy these days. I get my money's worth, especially if I purchase flights during the sale times! Bingo! I once paid 40 bucks each way between Oregon and California! Today I booked another flight for $68! Woot!  

I also enjoy their seating system. It is so simple and it makes people really competitive to check-in on time to avoid getting placed in the C group. I set my alarm for 5 minutes before I need to check-in the day before a flight and I am always in the A group. I would hate to be the one to choose between the last two middle seats, but hey you snooze you lose! :) 

This past weekend I had to go to a conference and all my flights were really funny in some way. The first one, the stewardess was freaking out the the Las Vegas Lingerie Football Girls were on the flight and even a Nascar driver, who sped off the plane (Pun intended) when we landed so I couldnt track him down! Bummer. Then another flight, my friend and I got be stewardesses for the flight, passing out snacks to the whole plane. It was really awesome and I love how the staff on Southwest flights are usually really fun and upbeat. I have had the occasional attitude here and there, but I do not make a big deal about it.

We pretty much know what Southwest is, how to ride a plane and so on. So I will end this review by saying they have money when it comes flying, even when it comes to the little bottles of vodka and jack when it is just that type of day.

Donni southwest flight num 3849 sac.
I don't think I've ever seen a flight attendant with such good customer service before. Haven't felt this happy and accommodated on a flight in a long time. Bravo.

Only one star so I can let you ALL know they kept my husband myself and MY 91 YEAR OLD WORLD WAR II VET waiting for HOURS! A man who fought for this country was searched and fingerprinted after they got him out of his wheel chair THEN!!!! Switched gates at the last moment and when I asked the lady at the desk she told me we were going to have to wait to find the correct gate! My uncle who NEVER cusses said this is all f@&$ed up!!!! Sad sad sad will never fly southwest again with the disrespect for me and my husband maybe BUT A 91 YEAR OLD VET??? HELL NO!

I'm not a fan of the open seating, but you know going in whats up so you are prepared. They have made it easier on families with the prefered seating option and online boarding passes. I had a great experience on my flight from Reno to Vegas and then back to Reno. Flights on time, easy boarding, helpful people at baggage check, didn't loose anything. 

Thank you SW for getting us there not only on time but early on both flights.

Very satisfying trip! Reasonable prices with lots of destinations. First time flying with this airline. The flight and cabin crew was quite amiable and so lighthearted/comical! While taking off and landing, I actually laughed out loud at their humorous announcements (while still being safe of course!) No fee for checking two bags and carry ons, peanuts/pretzels and drinks, overall  a happy flight. I'm excited to look up tickets for my next trip!

Love these guys, my husband and I missed our flight by 6 minutes, but the woman at the counter got us on the next flight out for no additional charge.  This is why I fly them, their people are great and there's no bullshit fees.

Recommended: Pay the extra $10 for the early check-in instead of waiting impatiently by your laptop to check in online 24 hours in advance. I wish the flight attendants still told jokes. I miss that. Free bags is definitely a bonus. Make sure you factor that in when pricing flights.

Southwest Airlines Flight 4546 on December 3, 2017 from Las Vegas McCarren Airport to LAX was a total disaster. 

Flight 4546 was part of a 2 leg flight originating from San Juan, Puerto Rico. The first leg went up to Orlando FL to drop off passengers. It was a bearable flight although longer than expected. Then, it turned westward to Las Vegas. Young people who got on sounding happy and healthy, ended up coughing and wheezing.  Something definitely was wrong with the cabin air to make healthy young folk very sick.  

But then it got really bad.  Once we landed, there was roughly an hour layover. We get a mumbled announcement that the flight taking us to LAX would be delayed by 10 minutes.  Then 10 minutes go by and another announcement adds an hour past 11 pm, due to wind conditions. We were quite puzzled. Wind conditions? Apparently we were unaware of the huge fires whipped up in the Southland at that time. So we asked if we can get vouchers. Instead, we were told we can stay as long as we like at the airport (and freeze).  All the amenities at this so-called international airport in Vegas closed down.  Not even hot tea or coffee was available--even for purchase.  Hours continued on with no flight in sight.  We were told another crew was coming but then they had exhausted their time and had to stop, basically telling us to buzz off. More mumbling announcements. 

Southwest did not want to say that they were now the cause of the delays, not some weather or natural phenomenon.  One family was able to get vouchers for the family and kids so they can come back the following morning.  Now it was not until way past 1:30 am that a flight finally showed up.  The crew looked at us like we better not complain like they were doing us a favor! All of a sudden the announcements were crystal clear to hear and understand. Check in and board now!  You did not have to ask us twice to do that. We were freezing cold and pissed as hell. 

How could Southwest Airlines drop the ball so badly. How could Las Vegas McCarren Airport turn out to be a two-bit hick town??? Very very pathetic and disappointing to say the least. The on-board announcement says thanks for your business and it will only be a 40 minute flight to LA. Well I checked my watch and it ended up being a 90 minute flight. Very different time sense if you ask me. And we caught a sinus infection with persistent coughing to boot.  

Thanks for nothing Southwest Airlines. We will seriously rethink this airline when we choose to fly again.

Awesome airlines! The flight attendant didn't charge $5 to anyone who ordered an alcohol beverage! Drinks were on them, which was a perfect start to our flight to Vegas. It was definitely an entertaining flight esp. since he beat boxed over the intercom and during the safety speech, spoke as if he were hosting a live auction. 

I bought my flight 3 hours before the scheduled departure and prices dropped from $161 to $116, which saved me a whole lotta moolah. Best airlines when it comes to customer satisfaction and price - oh yea! and free pretzels & peanuts!

I really don't think I'm going to continue using southwest when I'm traveling to Vegas anymore!! First, when I got here there was a endless line for people to get into the gate, yes just get into the gate. When people asked for by passing the line because their flight was very soon, they didn't let any people to go in except this women who just went in. Second, I asked if they have TSA/global entry and they said they do not have it. Yet, they had an advertisement about TSA for shorter lines, ironic. Third, I'm not sure if this is a good thing or a bad thing, but the security line went really fast and they didn't really do it throughly. Because it was fast, people could move up pretty fast but I felt like they didn't need people to line up from the beginning so that they can save time and do the security check more effectively.

Again the most terrible customer service of any airline I have ever flown.  The longest lines I have ever seen not enough help for the customers and when you do get to talk to someone they are very unfriendly. Customers are the ones inconvenience by cancelled flights and problems not be employed. They should do everything they can to give customer service. But it just isn't happening.

Our flight heading to Vegas was tolerable, but the flight home the plane was rickety, squeaking, and smelly.  Seats are tight and uncomfortable but overall we got to and from our destination in one piece. Can't complain since the plane got us to and from and served its purpose for air travel.

This airline is the worst. I used to love them because of the friendly staff and affordable fares. Now I realize why it is so cheap. My flight was delayed from Los Angeles to Las Vegas, then completely cancelled on the trip back. I called the airline to see why and they had no answers for me and made me feel as though I was inconveniencing them by calling. After being told there were no earlier flights than 4pm, I got to the airport to find there were two more early flights, and that one had 5 open seats but they could only put me on standby. Why not give me a seat if this is the fault of the airline? Also, when I got to the gate to ask about earlier flights, the woman told me she was completely unaware of my flight being cancelled. How does this happen where the customer is telling the employee about a cancellation? There is no communication between employees, and even if there was a reasonable explanation, no one seemed to care. I will not fly Southwest anytime in the future, as I am missing an important work function because of their lack of execution. Unreliable and unwilling to make it right.

Very disappointing service from Southwest today.  They were late getting to San Diego from Phoenix and therefore late leaving San Diego so I could not make my connection to Tulsa.  No apologies at all.  They rebooked me through Las Vegas and cost me 2.5 hours.  No apology, no kindness, no drink coupons.  So disappointing.  I have come to expect more from them.

Our flight from Vegas to St Louis was supposed to board art 4:50p.  Pushed to 5:45p, now they're saying it will closer to 8pm before we're out of here.
What a way to run an airline.

Great airline. Would fly again. Staff very helpful. Nice not to have to pay additional fees for bags and included in price. Flight on time, good information given and appreciated the small snack and beverage. Low cost and excellent service.

It's a big southwest hub with lots of dining options nearby. All gates are relatively close to either a Starbucks of coffee bean which is a plus. People are super nice and helpful. It's as good as you'd expect from a southwest terminal

I recently flew into Vegas and my bags were lost on another flight. I was angry at first but the two individuals in the Southwest baggage office were so amazing. They helped myself and my friend out by hunting down our bags and delivering them to us that night. Next time I'm in Vegas, I'm going to say hi to them and say thank you again. Great airline and awesome employees! Keep it up Southwest Airlines!!!

Fuck you southwestern airlines not only did you make me 4 hours late on my small trip from ontario airport to las vegas but youv also reschedule my departure today from 8:30 to 10:10pm. I make it hear by 10:07pm and you tell me that the plans already gone And next flight isn't tell 7:50 the following day.  Wtf an I supposed to fo about work in the am, room? All you give me is a new boarding pass and send mr on my way? This is ridiculous customer service, at the very least you could have put meup in a motel 6. I want looking for the Aria or anything.

My first time riding an airplane ever was when I was 19 years old. Yes, I know. I always got so many weird looks from people when I told them I had never been on an airplane before. Suffice to say, I was a little bit scared.

I am so happy that my first experience with Southwest was a good one. Everything went smoothly on my trip to Chicago, and none of my exaggerated fears were realized (i.e. sitting next to an asshole who smells bad and has no sense of personal space, losing my luggage, excessive turbulence, not having enough leg room, etc.....). It was also fast (4 hours, versus almost 12 hours to get from Vegas to San Diego on that Greyhound bus). 

They're also a great airline for your money as well, can't wait to fly with them again.

I have been flying a lot more with Southwest Airlines lately because of my newly earned companion pass (in which I am able to bring another person with me, wherever I fly to and only pay tax of $5.60 each way for my "companion") from the end of last year. But it is rather unfortunate that Southwest does not fly to a lot of airports and also does not have that many direct flights to the East Coast from the West Coast (or at least from California). 

Anyways, my husband (my companion pass user), our little girl dog (cost $95 each way for her to ride in the cabin with us) and I had a layover in Las Vegas (from Burbank). Our layover originally was supposed to be 1 hour and 50 minutes but sadly turned into 4 hours :( If we had known ahead of time, we would have most likely left the airport and dined at one of the many wonderful restaurants (I wouldn't dare try eating at a buffet and feel so full and bloated on my next flight out of here) nearby the airport. But of course things happen and we have no control over that. 

For the most part, I do like Southwest because they allow patrons up to 2 bags to be checked in for free. Generally, most of the flights that I have had with Southwest has been friendly, shown by from the flight attendants and ticket agents at the gate, etc. 

But I am not a fan of unassigned seating. I much prefer to pick my seats ahead of time and not have to worry about the 24 hour check in the day before to try to get a higher group letter and number. 

On this flight, the flight crew were kind and professional. Provided flight patrons beverages and snacks. 

Didn't have any problems with this flight (just a bummer with the longer layover than anticipated).

I'd say we are slightly above average flyers for a family with a small child, and most of the time, we fly Southwest. 

We've always had good luck with Southwest, and because we always do Early Bird check in, we never have to worry about getting seats together.  If you wait to check in until right before the flight leaves, don't complain about where you have to sit.  It's easy.  The Early Bird Check In is the way to go, if you're concerned about sitting with someone else, and it's totally worth the extra fee (something like $12-$25).

Our last trip had very friendly flight attendants and an excellent pilot.  Our flight got really hairy over the Rocky mountains that cause a lot of screaming, sick people, injured people, drinks and electronics flying everywhere... It was concerning.  However, our pilot knew what he was doing and maneuvered us into safety.  

I've flown with other airlines before and have had some concerns or complaints. While, I've not flown enough to have used all of the big name airlines, I feel good saying that I do like to fly Southwest; they always happen to be going where I need to go (without connecting), the prices are decent, and the crew are friendly.

Southwest is one of those airlines that takes an extra step to accommodate their passengers. Big thank you to Don at C2 for helping us with family boarding. This is why Southwest is our airline of choice.

Don't know why Southwest gets a bad wrap... No frills, you get what you pay for, free snacks, soft drinks, and free TV through WIFI (sponsored by Dish TV.) At times, during the Winter, it seems that they cancel/delayed more flights than usual from Vegas - however seems that there is always another flight choice to replace the canceled/delayed flight.

My husband and I flew Southwest Airlines for the second time in 3 years.  The second time was no better than the first time.

The first time we flew Southwest Airlines my husband and I was in line and the old nags behind us were speaking under their breath that they did not think we were in line according to our boarding pass numbers.  Then when the line started to move I held up my boarding pass to show the old biddies that we were in the appropriate spot in line.

The second time we flew Southwest Airlines was on August 13th 2015 going to Spokane, WA from Las Vegas, NV.  It was the 10:10 Am flight.  We had B41 and B42 passes.
Southwest Airlines does not have assigned seating, they let you board the plan by seating a number.  People with A seating assignments get to board first, then folks with B passes are next and then finally the C passes are allowed to board the plane.

Well, all the A passes boarded the plane then they called the B passes to board.  There were A pass passengers holding seats for folks with B passes and C passes in the front of the plane.  There was one man holding 4 seats and another holding three seats in the front of the plane and the stewardess let this happen.

Until Southwest Airlines gets assigned seating they just lost our business.  I will pay more money to fly any other airlines that has assigned seating.  Southwest Airlines is like the Walmart store flying in the sky.   Just pay a little more and get better service.

Can you say DISCRIMINATION? We all know that with increased airline security comes detailed proof of your identification. As a married woman, this airline cannot get my name straight in their system! I have a driver's license with my full legal name yet their system can never find me. I ask you....how far would you get in checking into your flight if your name is always a problem? I spent 2 hours on the phone with customer service a couple weeks before my flight to preemptively make sure this doesn't happen. I was promised it was fixed. I went to check in today for my flight and STILL couldn't check in. So again I get to be on the phone with customer service for another hour. Then I get a boarding pass to be practically last to board. This is gender discrimination pure and simple. This is not the only instance where this has occurred to me. I'm quite certain I am not the only woman it happens to.  Southwest, when are you going to treat women with equal service????

Southwest will be my go to when booking.
Easy to modify/cancel/book etc either online, through app. or calling for services. 2 free check in bags + 2 carry-ons beats a lot of the other airlines & the service is always great. Thanks for another great flight SW!

The people who work for SW are the best. There is no debating that. The air service is just fine too. Good flight schedules from my home airport.

But what's up with the check-in process? It's been bad from day one and only continues to get worse. This is an airline built for non-business travelers, or people who travel infrequently for that matter. The mad rush to find seats is both inefficient and annoying.

Bags free is great if you're traveling with a family. But for business travelers, who don't check bags anyway, the entire pre-flight process is a major hassle. Setting alarms for early AM, afternoon, or PM, to race and check-in is not convenient.

Yes, I'm aware there are ways to check-in early...for a fee. Fees are something I expect on luggage, but not finding an aisle economy seat. 

In addition, "WIFI" has been promised for well over a year and I've yet to be in a SW plane with "WIFI" capability.

SW has a cult-like following. I just don't see it.

Southwest as a whole is a great company. They are the only reasonable US domestic carrier left. Good legroom, good flight attendants and great overall service. We fly a lot and have flown on many other carriers (Frontier, American, United, Delta, etc) and Southwest is consistently the best. Both times that we have missed our flight we got on the next flight for free. Completely our fault, but no issues there. The first come first serve boarding is not only genius, but it has been proved to be a  more efficient loading method. If you have kids, then pay the $12.50 to pick a seat first. Don't complain on the plane and make people move. For business and single flyers it's a no brainer, they are the best. It is sad when the budget airline becomes the best out there, but great for us the flyers.

Southwest sucks... Employee out of San Diego was so rude.
Get to Las Vegas and now the plane is 2 hours late. REALLY!!!!!  Can they do anything right?

Flight delayed a bit to help incoming passengers from other delayed flights (due to weather) make their connection, but not bad.  Long flight meant the flight attendants were busy keeping folks happy and occupied with drinks/snacks/conversation.  Long flights also mean crying babies and rambunctious children.  Again, the flight attendants handled them well - sympathizing with the kids/babies and keeping them calm.

Inexpensive, and of course - bags fly free!
SWA has the friendliest employees! They are always helping their customers to ensure that you are special. Your bags fly free and they don't have change fees!!!!

This airport has always had a dreary feel. The southwest gates fit in well with this general theme. The distant drone of slot machines are obnoxious. Thankfully my noise canceling headphones block this out. Even with the drawbacks This is always my first stop for finding a flight. I like the price, even though the experience often  feels like a trip to a busy shopping. Ultimately it's worth the few oddities. No goofy up charges or fees. The cattle call boarding works reasonably well if you check in to an A or B boarding. Once you get to C it gets more dicey. For a nominal fee you can get in the high A boarding, but what fun is that? I just set an alarm on my phone and I always manage to get an A or high B boarding number. Staff is always casual and friendly. Most all flights now have a closed Wi-Fi (wireless fidelity) option that allows for watching a limited selection of television and PPV movies. It works out really well on the iPad. Drinks and snacks are free and beer, wine and cocktails run $5. I've found that about 1 out of every 3 or so flights they don't even bother having you pay for adult bevies. I've also noticed this most often also aligns to flights that have been delayed for whatever reason. The rewards program is also nice and has provided multiple free flights with very little hassle. They seem to do well at hitting the intersection of price and function. Southwest will continue to be my first call as long as the prices are decent and the continue to avoid the inclusion of silly rules and fees.

Asian lady didn't want to do her job and took a break as i was walking up to her station ... leaving me baffled ,..... good thing southwest had a good customer service specialist when they hired Adrienne Sims ... she seen what had happened and immediately caught my attention so that she could assist me... i appreciate her goin above and beyond and she deserves a big KUDOS. now if their prices were more competitive I'd use them more

The majors (UA, AA, Delta) all should go through customer service training from Southwest.  SW's customer service is a thousand times better than the major arlines combined.  These guys understand, and I believe actually care, about the customer.  That statement is simply not true at most other Domestic carriers (especially United right now).  Not only is SW focused on customer service, they are keenly focused on getting their aircraft turned around as quickly as possible - no other airline can turn around a packed 737 faster than SW can.  

The one downside for me is that they don't have first class.  I understand that isn't part of their business model and I can respect that.  As a result, I generally only fly them for short haul flights (90 min or less) - I'm 6'2" and need space to be able to work, something that first class affords me the ability to do.

For shorter haul flights, SW really can't be beat.

Horrible!!!! In my opinion I wouldnt leave a star but yelp requires you. My husband and I just recently landed and as we are getting our baggage. We found one of our luggages opened with my husbands clothes spilled on to the conveyor belt. If it weren't for some kind people we wouldn't been able to get all his clothes together. We understand they need to check the bags but for Gods sake close them after your done!!!  It's our first day here and now my husband's clothes are dirty and we are here for 4 days. Thanks Southwest, you made our vacation!!!

I had my bag stolen and the woman from southwest airlines that I spoke with was awesome....and we got to the sf airport and the las vegas airport about 25 mins before flight was leaving and not only did we make it but so did our bags...way to go southwest......

lets just say ill never fly with any other airline again! Southwest was simply amazing! they really made our vacation even more enjoyable. Our flight was on time both ways and the staff was great!! definitely tended to our needs without hesitation. keep up the good  job Southwest! you have a customer for life!

Southwest people suck they didn't let me in when I was right at the door and it was still 10 mins before boarding time. They were too rude and lazy to do their job and let the passengers make their flight. Even their lost and found crew can't even do their jobs right in finding lost items because they said they don't throughly clean their planes after each service. I can't believe how rude the crew is and I will make sure a lot of people don't either.

give me free alkie & cheaper rates and ill give u more stars, SOUTHWESSSSSSST!
bahahah


okay so
no fees for checking in ze bags = win.
who wants to pay extra for hauling your sessy little outfits to and from vegas?
i know i dont!
:D


but yea
most dates&times are blacked out. so i dunno how im gonna fly to ny or whatever for free during reasonable times.. smh.
-____________-

Southwest is rapidly becoming the Delta of the business. For years their on time performance was terrific. I've had nothing but delays every week for months. Tonight in Vegas? 2 hours delay at the very last minute. Delta here I come. This isn't worth it since their prices are exactly the same as their competition.

It takes almost everything I have to travel Southwest anymore this former discount carrier needs to rethink their boarding protocol, fortunately I almost always get the "A Zone" boarding pass and the few times I haven't I've spent the $40 to upgrade to get the A 1-15 boarding passes, however that still doesn't get you much the planes are almost always completely filled and as the seat backs get thinner the more seats they squeeze in so the leg room is ridiculous unless you score a bulk head or exit row and unless you have a blue boarding card forget about it. It's even becoming difficult for the usually cherrie flight attendants to force a smile on most flights but flying out of this terminal could depress anyone...

We have flown on Southwest many times, mostly between LA & Vegas.  This time it was SF to Vegas & Vegas to LA.

Never had any issues with them, always on time, crew is pleasant, & love it that there are no baggage fees.

I know there are other carriers out there that are competitive in price, but over the years, we've grown to love the good ole red & blue.  Keep up the good work Southwest!

You usually find the cheapest tickets here, but their baggage claim SUCKS. Just make sure you don't check in late! I made my flight, but apparently they lost my luggage. I had to drive back to the airport twice to finally get it half a day later. However, they did give me a $50 credit for my next flight, which is cool. While on the plane, you get drinks, peanuts, and pretzels :)

( Las Vegas Southwest) 
The only reason I'm giving you a star is because Yelp is making me but if I had a choice I would give the southwest workers that answer the flight questions at c19 a zero , for there horrible customer service. Please hire people that want to be there and not giving everyone attitude problems . The African American lady with the short curly hair and glasses that works terminal C19 , shame on you !! Go learn some manners and quit gossiping about paying flyers who keep your job going . With that kind of rudeness I'm surprised you haven't  been fired sooner plus with the Shity job you have maybe you can go buy yourself some manner , that's  if you can AFFORD it
Empty flight...gotta love all the room...and the peace and quiet:)

I love me some Southwest Airlines, whenever I fly I try to save money with Southwest! They have the best prices and I love the fact that you can sit anywhere on the plane! 

With there recent expansions you can pretty fly anywhere in the U.S at a fraction of the price! I especially appreciate and like the I want to get away specials, they save me so much money which allows me to travel to more places per year!!! Thanks southwest for being amazing and amazingly priced, which allows everyone to travel in comfort and on a budget!!!!

I have flown Southwest regularly for ~6 years straight now. I've never had any major issues, the staff has always been nice, there aren't really any crazy hidden fees or other microtransactions, and they have a good drink selection :)

I like the open seating approach, too. It is flexible and I think it actually speeds up boarding.

Has a flight or two been slightly late before? Sure. But things happen, I get it.

On the whole, love 'em.

I actually like southwest, but it really isn't for the SUPER traveler (or is it?).  If you don't know they don't do assigned seats, its first come first served based on the order you board (which is based on how soon you booked). 

When I fly American it's terrible. After ruby, diamond, platinum, world class, priority executive, Adamantium, and anyone that knows someone that falls under the categories above, there are like 6 people left.  Good luck getting baggage space there. 

If you fly semi frequent you'll get bumped up when boarding for free.  Frequent travelers get a companion pass, basically buy one get one free every time you fly.  Helpful when it's time to travel with someone. 

You pay less, bags are free.  Don't complain there is no TV on the headrest in front of you. Lol.

I missed my connecting flight on Delta, they were not helpful so I found a gate agent at Southwest who got me a flight and took care of the problem. She was awesome and very helpful. 
Thanks Southwest your people are great!

Paige's behavior today at the customer service counter was deplorable I checked in for the flight yesterday and today I provided her my Southwest print out and she advised my confirmation number was not valid. She continued to argue with me concerning this matter and then located our reservation and read off the same number I had given to her on my print out and she argued mine was wrong. When I showed her the boarding pass along with the original paperwork she stated well I guess I typed it in wrong but that was not good customer service as she argued with the customer from her own mistake!

I knew there was a reason I don't like this airline! I booked three tickets from Spokane to San Diego for myself, my wife and my mom who is 76 and hasn't flown much for a family reunion. Things went smooth leaving Spokane until we had to switch planes in Las Vegas. Our layover was about an hour with all of us in the same boarding group with sequential numbers for the next flight. When we were boarding and they scanned our boarding passes they let my wife and I on but told my mom she was on the wrong flight, hers wasn't leaving for two more hours. Needless to say I went to the ticket counter with her for what I thought would be an easy fix since obviously there had been a mistake. I don't know if they are used to dealing with liars but you would have thought I was the biggest liar of all the way we where treated. They would not let her on the flight unless she paid for a new ticket. My mom is on a fixed income and did not want to pay the much higher price for a ticket she already had. My wife who is on the plane is freaking out wanting to know where we were. I offered to let my mom get on the flight so she would be with my wife and I would stay and take the later flight. No, that was unacceptable! They couldn't allow that! They promised to take her to the gate for the later flight and make sure she got on. If I stayed with my mom they wanted me to buy another ticket, so as they were closing the door on the flight my wife was on I squeaked thru the door. I fly for work and have never experienced this kind in treatment. I will no longer fly Southwest and will shout it from the mountain tops that no one else should either!

Southwest ended up reaching out to me and , I assume, other passengers and apologized for the delay. They also issued flight vouchers! Everyone makes mistakes, it's how you address and correct those mistakes that matter. Good Job SWA!
I love this airline. Last Friday was the start of my wife and I's honeymoon and they treated us to a bottle of champagne. They are always so polite and they take good care of us.

It is so sad.  Southwest Airlines used to receive a 5 star rating from me.  This rating has dropped dramatically.  Reasons??
1.  They have continued to raise rates.  If you compare the rates of their competitiors, it is strikingly the same.  
2.  Their rewards system is now a joke!  In the past, you can receive a free ticket per credit.  Nowadays, they have a point system.  And, most of the point systems are on the high end.  
3.  Most dates and times are blacked out.  
4.  They have expired credits.  What?  We earned that man.  If you were to renew, you have to shell out another $50 buck for credits that you already earned.  This is stupid!

As a frequent flier, I switched this year from SW to Delta. I still have my A-list for the next few months, but the Diamond status with Delta offers me more perks... 
i.e. 
a. First class/business upgrades (thus far, 90% of my flights have been upgraded)
b. A hot meal
c. Access to the SkyClub
d. Free checked bags
e. Priority check-in, 
f.  Access to Free Movies/New releases, HBO, satellite tv (yes, I get to watch games on ESPN LIVE during those long flights between JFK and LAS and LAS to NC)
g.  Wi-Fi on all flights
.... And other better rewards.  

After experiencing all this, I sometimes wonder why I stayed with SW so long... couldn't be the peppy cheerleading flight attendants... eeck...

Bye Southwest...

This is the first time I got a b--ch of a stewardess. Being new to flying with an infant (we flew once to Hawaii where disabled and families boarded first-not Southwest) and not understanding, I went up there to hand her my boarding pass and this mean-azz woman looked at me like I was crazy and shook her head with the biggest attitude and pointed back toward the line and said something like "uh huh... You got to board with the rest of them".

I was like WTF??

Me: damn, sawwwwrrrryy! I didn't know! Giving me attitude like I did the shit intentionally!!

So I walk away talking about how rude she was and she calls after me with the same attitude and mumbles that there will be boarding for families (and some other crap I couldn't make out at that time). Instead of saying something like, "Sorry miss, we will be calling you in a few if you just want to  step aside, you won't have to get in that line because I'll be calling for families in just a minute". 

 So when she started calling seats positions we missed our boarding position all together because it was so packed and we couldn't maneuver around to our spot in line. 

I was super livid at this point so I gave the boarding passes to my son's father and told him to deal with the broad because I was done and afraid that I may say something real bad to where I'd be arrested (arrested in Vegas? Eh, just another typical day hahaha).

When we got to the stewardess again and tried to hand over our passes once again she turned us around and made us go to the other Southwest desk to check the stroller! I told her we would have done the sh-- earlier if there was someone at our check-in desk long enough to get there and do it! 

That made me even more mad!!! So we walked over to the other counter where the guy was helping people who were preparing to board for another flight! (Meanwhile the people on our flight were completely boarded) However, the man gave us his full attention, was very kind, reassuring, quick, and efficient (I'm bummed I didn't get names), which calmed me down immensely.

Finally we were able to board , but not before seeing that broad one more time. Because we were seated late our family was split up and I didn't even get to sit near my son and his father.

Thank goodness that cranky-azz lady didn't board our plane because she would have brought her bad juju on with us and I wasn't wasn't having it.

When we got in the air things turned back to normal, our flight attendants were nice, and I drenched what was left of my bad mood with a decent stout and good conversation with my neighbor about books!

Southwest is always cheap and reliable.  Today my mother in law missed her flight so I called and we were able to apply the missed flight fare to a new flight with no questions asked.  The woman on the phone was very pleasant and helpful, like the majority of SW staff I've encountered.  My only gripe is that it's a free-for-all when it comes to seating, but hey you can't have everything for the cheapest fares.

They are extremely busy but they try to make things easy for you if they can.  Asside from the two free bags and cheap flights you would get flying on any Southwest flight, Las Vegas Southwest tries to accommodate you with all the people they service.  They have a Kiosk for quick check in if you are going to carry on and only need a boarding pass.  They have skycaps to help with the wait inside to check in bags and get a boarding pass.  Security is always a slow down but not much anyone can do about that except become an A-list preferred status.  Flight attendants are super friendly and I always feel safe!  They never give me grief on the size of my carry ons.

I fly Southwest most every-time I fly. Mostly because they have the most flights to and from where I frequently visit. The flight staff is sometimes not the best. Often they seem bothered and frustrated at the process. I sure wish they would dial this part of their business in. I think it might be their only holdback with me getting 5 stars!...

This is the same review as my other Southwest check-in at BWI but it applies to every Southwest flight you will take!


Southwest Airlines knows how to do it!  It starts from their customer service agents.  They are always willing to help with a smiling face!  

On to their boarding process which I know is different from every other airline.  Un-assigned seating actually makes the process go so much quicker!  You don't have to worry about paying extra for an aisle, window or exit row.  It seems like more and more airlines are charging for this.  Very sad.  

On the flight, their flight attendants are top notch!  This is comparing to US Airlines or Delta whom I've flown many times.   SWA flight attendants are actually happy!  They keep your drink full and hand out snacks several times during a longer flight.  It's not just a bag of peanuts to tide you over for a long flight.   They offer 'Plane' cookies, 100 calorie cookie bags, wheat thins and other tasty treats!  Bonus~  you don't need to whip out cash for these!  

The pilots like to keep you updated with the weather and when we should be landing.  I know first hand, these pilots are extremely well trained and prepared for any situation.  They are the best in the world! 

Another great option for flying is buying their Wifi.  For the 5 hour flight I took, this was absolutely great!  You can only play so many games on your iPad.  Having the ability to send emails, check social websites and just chat with people at home makes the time go by so quickly!  

As far as my money goes, you can't get any better than Southwest Airlines!  You are treated with respect and always greeted with a smiling face.  Thank you again for a great flight! I know I'll be back soon!

Ding.  Yo, I wanna get away, hook me up with a flight to Vegas son.  I dig your rappin' flight attendants, Southwest A/L, dude's all up on youtube tearin' it up...and I dig your 2 carry-on items with no Benjamins or dead prez involved - mo' money mo' problems for me not chu'.  I book ma' flights online without the hustle-bustle-ma-nizzle at the airport.

Yo Southwest, them pilots are cool cats too.  One of them dudes straight up told me "keep your tush in the cush until we push."  How many pilots gots rhymes like that?  And let's not forget the safety announcers, they be phat!  I heard one say: "Should this flight turn into a cruise, your seat cushion can be used for floatation."  They gots humor for the homeys!

When I get my bidness off the plane, an attendant told me "Please be careful when retrieving your luggage and personal belongings from the overhead bins. Shift happens."  Ya'll crackin' me up, y'allz are riotz up in there, mang!

I've flown just about every national airline there is, and Southwest is by far my favorite.  Unrivaled customer service.  TWO free bags per person.  Very affordable with excellent sales/deals.  I've never had a single issue with Southwest.

One of the biggest differences is that you board based on your checkin time, rather than having assigned seats.  Make sure that you check in right away; otherwise you might end up with a less-than-ideal seat, or being seated away from your family members or friends.

My husband and I also have a Southwest credit card and love earning free miles with every purchase!  It's definitely allowed us to travel more, and much more affordably.  Would 100% recommend Southwest!

Let me start by saying I have always been a big fan of southwest but recently things started heading in the wrong direction. This is my second trip in four months that has turned into a trip from hell because of how poorly southwest is running their business. Answers, people willing to help? No where to be found. Excuses and assumptions. A lot of those. Southwest is becoming just another airline with poor service. I did find one person, Rebecca, who at least stopped to help. Thank you Rebecca.

Disorganized.

I booked an 8:40 am flight home from Vegas.  I know, what was I thinking.  It was peer pressure!

I've never flown with Southwest before.  I didn't know about the open seating.  This combined with them delaying boarding the plane until 8:30 made for a big mess.  There seemed to be no carry on bag restrictions.  I saw people with full on trunk sized suit cases trying to jam them into the overhead bins.  Meanwhile my bag is being jammed and crushed into who knows what.   

Due to a mechanical issue we had to de-board and change planes.  Don't get me wrong I am thankful they caught the issue before take off.  I don't even want to think about the alternatives.  But the way it was handled was messy and frustrating especially for a person that's been up for +24 hrs.  I heard one of the staff announce over the PA system to another waiting flight that they "didn't know when or if they would be making it to Pasadena today."  WTF!?! 

We finally get on the replacement plane and make it to our destination safe and sound.  That's all you can ask for.  But I will definitely think twice before booking with SW again.  My sanity is worth the extra 20-30 dollars.

What is the point of checking in with a check-In number if you are going to let other passengers with earlier numbers save seats for friends? That is not fair for anyone! You put us on a plane to tell us we have to sit here for 45 minutes because of a mechanical issue?   Figure it out and let us board when ready!  You allow passengers to get off the plane while  fixing the issue but then they can save seats? Even though there are no assigned seats!?
Lazy staff

As I sat in the terminal and waited for my flights, I kept trying to understand the process. Who came up with this grand idea to make people waiting line with a number,1-60, and pick any seat they want. Personally, I think it's crap. Ticket prices change all the time so for someone to potentially pay a lot less than I did for my flight. and get a front window seat?!... yeah... I have a problem with that. Then I saw what can happen when a group of friends travel together: because of the way they arrange seating a group if three friends had to separate and sit in different sections. The only way to guarantee that they could sit together is to upgrade to business select. I just don't see how that's fair. Especially since I can get better service and accommodations for the same if not better at another airline.

My biggest pet peeve was the lack of outlets. It's 2015 and I took a 4.5 hour flight with a company that offered free wi-fi but no outlets?! Really?!? Fail southwest. You get 2 stars for the pure fact that there was free wi-fi. You lost the other three for your rude flight attendants, lack of outlets, and crappy seating arrangements. I'll stick to Jet Blue.

I have no problem at southwest airlines, I appreciate the free bags, snake and drinks. I just got irritated because me n boyfriend flew together tried to find a seat together n we couldn't find any. With NO SIGN SEATS makes it hard, I feel like I was fighting for a seat together, everyone had the window seat n the aile seat. So no one sits in middle, n we needed two seats together. It's a mess if u ask me. So please work on sign seats since we paid for that seat. I don't want to fight for it. But I appreciate The flight attendant for her help. Had to bribe a person by buying him a drink to move for us to sit together. 
Thank you for that Lady.

***Southwest is a popular airline from LAX to Las Vegas so you will find lots of flights at reasonable prices, which makes Southwest both a convenient and reasonably priced airline for a Vegas trip (you can also check up to 2 bags for free); flight attendants on Southwest are friendlier than most major airlines and complimentary snacks are also provided; unfortunately, Southwest's baggage claim at McCarran International Airport was very slow***

I am not sure what the parking situation is at Las Vegas' McCarran International Airport, but I imagine parking is expensive like other airports.

Southwest is a budget travel with traveler friendly policies. The planes show their age and lack of amenities (why offer free wifi if you are not also going to offer charging ports like most other carriers now do). The boarding process is no fun- you stand in your boarding group - up to 60 people-  in a very small and tight place in you are in the 30-60 range (Gate C7) in a line that a does not move. Their mobile reader to scan boarding passes on the phone is poor quality and the staff gets mad when the machine will not work. This is not the problem of the traveler, this is the problem of SWA who owns the equipment. It is an iPhone being used- if there technology does not work they need to just say the service is not available. The price and option to cancel flights and keep flight credits though is what keeps this 3 stars.
I hit the skies on these birds quite a bit. Two free bags are more than others offer. That's a c-note in savings right there! If that doesn't tickle your ass with a feather nothing will!

I got to the airport 3 hours early as Southwest had an earlier flight that was only half full and my later flight was delayed. I asked at the Gate if I could get on the earlier flight... They wanted a $140 fee... More than the flight cost! South West has changed and is no longer the customer friendly airline... As shown by recent polls... They're all about cutting back and becoming a true low cost, low service airline....

Seems to me like Southwest Airlines is reverting back to there disastrous quality of service they had for the first several years after their inception. In the last year this airline has plummeted to each flight I'm on having a negative attribute such as but not limited to a delay, broken seat, luggage delay, broken tray table or worst of all, a cancellation. I'll allow them to have two stars, for now, because they're attempting to perfect their paperless ticketing system but they better get their act together imeadiately or I'll be asking my vendors to choose a different airline.

The best service bar none from start to finish! People are real and truly seem to love their job. Love that I get more than one snack and can ask for another drink without being frowned upon. Would be wise to all other airlines to take note as this is the only airline I would fly even if it meant taking a few more legs. I wish you were in Hawaii! Should change its name to United States Airlines (USA) as it should be the only ones in the air! Service with a smile for sure!

I usually fly with Southwest Airlines. 

I have traveled to many places, and I have used many airlines. For most airlines, you only get good service if you fly First Class.

Southwest goes to more airports including my favorite in Southern California, Burbank! 

Usually the rates are better, and they don't charge you for checking in luggage. The service is usually pretty good. They are usually on time. The seats are spacious and comfortable. I really have no complaints. 

I would definitely recommend Southwest to my friends, and family.

I used to love Southwest but the customer service seems to be lacking. It's disappointing to me because they used to be very good. I give 2 stars because they still let you take 2 bags for free but I would pay for my second bag for better customer service on and off the plane. I am also not a fan of open seating. It give me more of a headache wondering if I am going to be able to sit with my girlfriend on a long flight. Let the passengers book a seat online like everyone else and it will be less stress for us travelers.
I almost always fly Southwest. Easiest way to fly with cheap prices and free carry ons.

This was my first time flying with Southwest and hopefully it will be the last. I always wondered why SW was so popular and now I know why. I was just going to Vegas so I didn't need anything too fancy but that's where I went wrong. So yes SW is very affordable and they will get you there but I never heard of not having an assigned seat. I was in the C group which is the worst because you are the last one on the plane which means you have to fight Mike Tyson to find a seat and to find a spot to put your carry-on.

When people have a small back pack and don't put it under their seat it causes people with a bigger carry-on to have a problem. I couldn't beleive all the people who were doing this non-sense and the flight unattended didn't do nothing about it. Going to Vegas and coming back was the same story it kind of reminded me of    Walmart vs. Target and don't get me wrong Walmart is very affordable but the quality at Target is a lot better.

I wanted to fly with United or even better Virgin America but it didn't work out that way. I'm glad that I flew with SW because now I know not to fly with them again!

Love the fact that you can cancel your air travel with SWA without penalty.    You can use the credit for another travel date and destination.  The only problem is that when you don't use the credit within a year, you lose the amount but could call for a 6 month extension minus 100.00 dollars.   Love the airline for domestic travel.    
    
Buying Early Bird can be a good & bad (Early Bird allows SWA to check you in early automatically). The groups are A,B,C etc  with up to 60 people boarding in each group.  I did get B30 one time and was not happy.   Wasn't worth the purchase because that meant almost 100 people before me bought Early Bird passes.  Then, of course, they say there may be a glitch in their system and they can't do anything about it.    Thus...it might not be great to get  Early Bird at times.  

Overall.  SWA is my favorite airlines due to 'on time' consistency and rate to which their flights go out.   That's important.  

They have great customer service over the phone and in general.

I'm surprised I haven't reviewed Southwest Las Vegas yet. I like to travel to Vegas two or three times a year and always fly Southwest. I'm loyal to my airline. Let's start with their prices, which can't be beat. I have found it to be extremely rare for Virgin or JetBlue to beat Southwest's prices. Also, you can't lose with their no baggage fees. I've never paid for checking in luggage and I don't intend to. Open seating? Awesome. For just $10 extra, you can purchase priority boarding, which will get you in and off the plane before many others. Most recently, Southwest has begun adding WIFI to their fleet and is starting at $5 per flight. While many other airlines get worse and worse, Southwest seems to get better.

My fellow Yelper, Ashley S. did a good job of pointing out some of the pros and cons.

Pros:
Inexpensive flights
No baggage fees
No change fees
Friendly flight staff
Never lost a bag of mine

Cons:
None

Staff has always been nice. But lately my flights are always delayed!! It's pretty annoying, I understand delays 30 min or less but once it was delayed an hour! I could do so much with an hour! Once we got to the runway and they had to turn around and go back to the gate to fix something...ummm shouldn't you have checked the plane before we left the gate? I don't mind delays for safety but I would have felt better if they figured it out before we almost took off. 

Still, the planes are clean and never had any rude staff members. I just want it to be on time!

Well we were 30 minutes early on arrival but because they over book their flights, we had to sit on tarmac waiting for a gate to open so we could get off.  It was crazy  ! After all said and done.. we were 5 minutes late LOL
I have flown this airline quite a few times, and they have always been friendly, and the closest to being a consistent on time airline.

Leticia Caride (south west employee in Las Vegas). 
You are the worse employee ever! You should change your attitude and your customer service. You don't belong in the people's business.

First time I've flown souhwest and was impressed.   The general seating threw me off for a bit but if you register early enough and check in, you'll be fine.  

There was plenty of room on the flight as well.

Overall, it was a cheap and great way to fly on the mainland... I just wish they had flights that cheap coming/leaving hawaii.
Love this airline!!!!  2 bags per person fly free, excellent customer service and great rates!  My favorite airline!

I like the fact that you don't pay extra for bags. Hate that you have to check in online, but you don't pay extra for bags. Prices aree always reasonable and the staff is friendly and I've been to airports all over the US. Definitely better than United!

We paid 60 bucks more online to what we thought will get us a good number for southwest airline. Well, they gave us the last number or close to it in the A section. In the airport, they will charge us $30 more if we want a better number.  Crazy isn't it?? They get you coming and going!

Southwest is really a great airline.
There's a lot to review here, so I'm just going to be short and sweet.

PROS:
*iPhone app to check in early.
*No baggage fees
*No charge to change your flight (unless the prices went up, then you just have to pay the difference)
*Easy check in
*Polite workers
*Easy flights

CONS:
*3 to a row. But thats kind of standard with any airline nowadays, right?

I will definitely use Southwest for all my domestic flying needs! :)
Nice airport and the Southwest experience was great and affordable as usual,

Hey Larry, at Baggage Check-in S70 how about stopping your gossiping about your coworkers? You know the one that you said was getting beat up by her significant other, and showing up late. Why don't you reach a little higher with your customer service skills, look up, smile, acknowledge your customer and smile. Oh my gosh! What about helping them put the tag on. I think a really nice final touch would be to wish them a good flight instead of turning around to continuing your gossip session. Pathetic.

Whoever works here is just as disgusting as the airline.. I got kicked off my flight for refusing to take off my wig... you have the audacity to kick off a customer post cancer? I literally have been suffering from the hardships of chemotherapy, and your company laughed in my face about it and publicly humiliated me. After someone just got sucked off the plane because of your lack of due diligence to keep the plane up to par?! Fuck you southwest, you're an evil, disgusting parasite. I hope you go bankrupt, your corporate values do not shine... NO MORE LIVES SHOULD BE SPARED... due to such negligence and disrespect for human life. You're the bottom sucking leach of society, and you just recently KILLED someone. Enough said.
Checked in 2 hours prior to departure time and still received last boarding position.

Southwest truly boasts some of the best customer service I have ever experienced.

I recently flew round trip from LAS to MDW this past fall, and the service on the ground as well as in the air was polite, friendly, and efficient.

NOTES:

1.  No hidden fees.  No baggage fees.  

2.  Open seating.

3.  Zone boarding.  

4.  Beverages served on the flight.

more NOTES:  The check in process at both LAS and MDW was quick and efficient.  We merely presented our IDs to the attendant, he tagged our luggage, printed our boarding passes, and sent us on our way to the security check point and gate.

The boarding process, much like checking-in, was efficient and organized.  The staff provided passengers with clear instructions on how to proceed, and allowed ample time to line up for their designated zones.  On the plane, the fight attendants were attentive in directing passengers to open seats as well as assisting others with stowing their luggage in the overhead compartments,

BEST:  For me personally, the absolute best part about the entire flight (to MDW) was the humorous flight attended conducting the announcements.  As an example, he provided comical and witty explanation of the safety features and equipment, going as far as to compare the life jackets as a fashion statement and the illuminated lights on the walkway as the "runway."  In any case, my attempt at describing the comic relief does no justice to his actual speeches, but I can honestly say most passengers elicited chuckles whenever he spoke.

BOTTOM LINE:  A memorable and positive experience flying with Southwest Airlines.
I love you so much Southwest.  But please - your DING and "wanna get away" sales are not competitive.  Please review your pricing!  I miss flying your airline...  I do love you though...

I'm sorry to have to do this but I have to tell the truth. I have been flying Southwest Airlines every week for the last 2 years so I think I have a good enough sample size to give them a review. Southwest is absolutely, positively the worst airline our great aviation industry has ever created. It is the equivalent to the greyhound bus of the 1970s. To be fair--most of their employees are great. They seem to care for the most part and they have gotten me safely to my destinations but not without headache. Constant delays of an hour or more every time I fly. I live in  the Southern California. It isn't a weather issue. Their schedulers are terrible. Loading of planes is constantly late. They are plagued with mechanical problems and they NEVER apologize. I don't know what else to say. They need some one to challenge their model.  They totally suck!

Please help!!!

So far, I've always had a great experience flying into and out of Vegas with Southwest. Since this airport tends to be busy, finding seats, at your given gate, can be an issue. Other than that, I have no other complaints.
Love flying Southwest, wish they flew to every airport

Unfortunately I was at the Route 91 festival this year when the shooting happened. Our flight was booked for 6am the next day. Because the airport was closed we were unable to leave. As you can imagine, we just wanted to get home. I called Southwest and they immediately rescheduled us on the soonest flight out, no questions asked, no charge for changing and they were very friendly and helpful. I will never forget what the woman on the phone said at the end of our phone call, she told me "Don't worry sweetie, we will get you back home." It was very comforting at a time when my friend and I really needed it. Thank you Southwest.

I like Southwest Airlines! Specially when we fly to Vegas! It's the cheapest when you make your reservations in advance! It's basically a flying taxi.. 
The only thing I don't like is you can't get assigned seats and if you are running late, most likely you will end up with separate seats from your partner! We have flew on this airline over 25 years and lately all flights are full so register 24 hours before your check in! And if you are a yelper, then don't forget to check in here as well!!
