Has to be one of the worst airlines. Always late. Have cut costs so much to the bone that they fly pilots whose flight time is expiring. Just keep saying we are moving and flights just get dealyed and never move. All american airlines are pathetic and this one takea the cake on punctuality
The lackluster way they let a person to save all the front rows for here I in-laws when there were handicap people like me who needed it. And yes I payed the $5 to post this from my plain

Amazing service! It was my sons first time flying, so they let us board first! The flight was a little shaky to Denver but overall great flight attendants and the staff!! Will be flying southwest in the future for all my flights!!
Long direct flight from Orlando!! It's Super Bowl Sunday so it's all good. Stuck on the Tarmac cause we got in 20 min early.

This review is targeted at the baggage claims office. The treatment that the paying passengers of a cancelled Baltimore flight were exposed to today (6-27) was atrocious. The baggage crew is terrible. To be successful liars, everybody needs to be on the same page, from one computer terminal to the next, they could not corroborate their stories, nothing will get people steamed more than being lied to after being cancelled.

Shoutout to SOUTHWEST for making my birthday super sweet. They comped my drinks on the plane, gave me a birthday shoutout, and had all the passengers turn on their above head lights, so I could "BLOW OUT THE CANDLES" when everyone sang Happy Birthday. This was my first flight with Southwest and it won't be my last

I've always known southwest to have impeccable customer service, and I wish I could say that was the case in my most recent attempt to fly with them. I was unable to catch my flight due to personal reasons and they refused to work with me unless I were able to provide documentation that is literally impossible to get. I understand there are policies in place, but coming from the customer service industry I also know that you need to make certain exceptions to truly provide exceptional service. So very disappointed southwest!

People have so many complaints about Southwest, but I don't understand why.  They have some of the lowest rates around, they don't charge for baggage, and the staff is always friendly (most of the time).  Yes, I get it they don't preassign seats!  If you check in online exactly 24 hours prior to your flight, in most cases you will be in the "A" boarding group.  Pay more for an assigned seat, whatever.  *shrugs*

I love Southwest Airlines. I love the fact that bags fly free! Super friendly staff and sometimes they get pretty creative when they go over the flight safety rules before take off. 

The bad parts is that they don't have TV's which can get a little boring if you're traveling far, but on this particular review, I'm reviewing my flight from LAX to Las Vegas... which is about 45 minutes, if that. So no TVs is OK. The seats are a bit old... I mean it's not the Beverly Hills of aviation but it's not too bad though. 

I'm not sure if I'm saying all this because I flew Spirit right before this, I'll get to a Spirit Airline review in a bit... and I'll let you know now, it's pretty much a complete opposite of this one. 

Fly Southwest. It's one of the cheapest... though it is a bit more expensive than Spirit, but trust me... its WAY better... and remember Bags fly free!!

Gate agents are all pathetic...they had vacant seats available in an earlier flight to SFO but instead of accommodating me in that flight,they wanted me to pay $100 more if I want to go in that flight..the only reason for me to change my flight get was to save time ... I had to take a different flight the one I had booked was through sandiego which took me 6 hours instead of just direct 1 hour flight ...

Even though the board along the passage to the plane says" All airplandes have attitude, we just have good kinds". WHICH IS SO UNTRUE! I have my cup of water on the tray, but the attendant took it rudely without  either asking me or letting me finish it. I told him I wasn't done with the water yet. But he just rudely took it away. Terrible experience on Southwest 3919!

Great flights for great prices.  When I fly from Cleveland to California, I can never get a direct flight.

Also only drinks and snacks on the flight.  I do like the free bags, and have never been given an impossible transfer to make (like on US Air).

I like their sense of humor, and the service is great.  I always try to fly southwest

I have checked in exactly 24hrs prior to my flight and got B 12. It's very hard to get A. I travel with my partner all the time and he is always A1 - A15. We asked them if I can go in with him but they denied it. So he has to go in and hassle people to not sit next to him and save me a seat and space above his head for my carry on which is sometimes hard to do. 

It would have been so much easier if they would allow A-list flyers to bring their companion with them. United let's us board the plane together so we will switch airlines. 

Sorry Southwest... Get better customer service and we will gladly switch. Did I mention we fly almost every week for a business!

Well... just got kicked off of a Las Vegas flight by Lydia the supervisor. I haven't been drinking but was told I was too drunk to be on the flight. The "supervisor' had to ask me my name twice after pulling me off the plane... really. Was told my ticket would not be reimbursed. AND merry Christmas. Thank you southwest. I have ALWAYS flown you, About once a month. But because of your poor customer service and misjudgment. AND A FULL PRICE OF A TICKET. I will never fly with you again. Thank you Allegiant Airlines for getting me home to see my family!

What can you say, they try to make flying fun. And when they change flights no fee YAY, but lets be honest the new cool younger airline Virgin America. But Southwest gets my needs done and tries to entertain me along the way but is it just me or are some of the flight attendants getting meaner...
Great airline low prices best part sitting arrangements are very comfortable you pick any available seat you want bags are free
I was really impressed with the crew (to and from Vegas).  They were always upbeat and genuinely seemed like they enjoyed their job.  haha.

Smooth as usual, fly in and out of Vegas often. Only thing I thought was strange was, some guy pulled the "Armed Services thing" and it was like the last 10 people boarding the plane ? Really dude pulling the military card in boarding group C ?
Chris was rude and stubborn at the gate when I asked to consolidate bags. I was late for a wedding rehearsal because of his inability to listen and forcing me to check a bag.

I used to love Southwest Airlines but lately they aren't getting it for my travel.  While they used to tout being one of the most on time airlines now I cannot remember the last time I was not delayed.

I really like their gate attendants, flight attendants, and their whole philosophy on flying BUT if you cannot get me their on time then I can't continue to use you.  Because Southwest stacks their flights so close if one flight is delayed you are almost guaranteed to miss the next one.

Unfortunately the last 5 flights I have had with them have been either delayed or canceled.  I cannot use them for business any more because of the importance of being on time so I only use them for the short hauls and family trips.

The one good thing I can say is that when I called their customer service, they owned that they have had some issues with their on time performance and that they are making changes.  They were very friendly and said they wanted to earn our business back SO I hope that I can update this review later on and say things have improved.

In my book thi is the last remiaing real airline. They are the only ones left who do not nickel and dime you to death, to pick you seat, board luggage, print a boarding pass....etc.... they are very up front. The prices are modest and the planes are on time normally. I have never had an issue with this particular airline and in my opinion is the only way to fly!!!!!1

Love southwest! 

Why you ask?

1. Never had a problem. Their customer service representatives go above and beyond, in person and over the phone. Every time I call them with a question, they have an answer. Theres no ring around the rosies (which Ive had with other airlines). Last june our flight was delayed 3 hours with having a toddler. The southwest ladies at the desk offered snacks, drinks and entertainment for her, since the food area was closed.

2. They allow each person 2 checked bags for free! Other airlines charge $25-50 each bag. With 3 of us flying we always bring 3 bags and on our way bag we're able to buy items and bring them in an extra bag for no charge or worries. 

3. Cheap flights! With the economy now adays, everyone wants to save a buck and this is where we save the most. Southwest constantly has amazing deals throughout the year. Weve gotten tickets as cheap as 49 bucks each way! Good example is their  wanna get away deals. They normally run 72 bucks each way, which is a really great deal for last minute flights or popular cities like Miami, Los Angeles, New York, etc. No hidden fees. What you see online is the exact price. I love that!

4. Their Rapid Rewards Program. Every time you book a flight you get points. Those points add up quickly. Once you earn 25,000 you get a free flight. Use your southwest credit card to book the flight and you double your points. BOOM. Free flights easily!

5. You can check in online 24 hours before for free, and get seating first. All the seats are the same and theres no first class. Another thing I love is you get to pick your seat. Front, back or middle.. your choice?! I personally like to pick seats (when traveling with my daughter) near other kids. Hey, then they can all be loud together OR they understand as my kid acts up because they have one and understand the feeling. other times, im on a peaceful trip and want to be left alone... I'm able to pick a secluded seat all by myself. YAY! 

6. Want to make a change to your flight because you want to stay a couple extra days?! No problem! Just call and they will adjust your flight for no cost! Woohoo.

For those 6 reasons I give southwest 5 stars!

So I'm gonna go ahead and say that it felt like Steve was on some type of drug. No disrespect to him or any other employee (Dave Eaton), but his fidgety demeanor and inability to hold eye contact as well as the perspiration above his brow was concerning. His lack of courtesy was noticeable as overheard him giving a visibly single mother a hassle regarding what I believe to be a change of flight and/or a standby. I remember thinking to myself that he was being louder than necessary and was somewhat exposing too much of the woman's details during the exchange, but because it's 5:30am I was willing to stay tuned. I noticed the name tag on the manager next to Mr. "Steve" read Dave Eaton so I was intrigued to see how he would diffuse the debate. I then overheard the woman imply that she's a disabled navy veteran and needed to change flight information regarding her toddler. Contrary to my expectation, Steve showed no empathy and Mr. Eaton supported it. I didn't want to allow myself to believe it was related to the woman's race, but I can't help but believe that a male military veteran wouldn't have had such an embarrassing experience. I'm sitting next to the woman on the plane now and she's totally embarrassed and it's shameful. Shame on you Steve as well as Dave for treating people that way. I'll fly frontier to Chicago next month.

I had a family emergency and needed to get home a day early from Las Vegas I met agent Yvonne F. at LAS Southwest ticket counter. She was extremely friendly and greeted me with a smile. I explained my situation to her and she and supervisor, Sean R. got me a standby ticket on the next flight home. I was ecstatic!! Southwest, you have gained a customer for life!

Unfortunately I can't give Southwest more than one star, and that's because the customer service reps here at the Las Vegas airport are horrible. Understandably flights get delayed from time to time, but when one approaches the counter one shouldn't assume that all customers are there to complain. Some do need assistance, as hard as that is to believe. 

Note to Southwest, if flights are delayed and paying customers are notified of the delay via text or email, one should also be notified if the airplane is back on schedule. Or would that be asking too much!?

It's so disappointing, honestly I don't expect much of SW, but always hope their service will change.
Wow...not even a month from when y'all last screwed me over, you lose my mf luggage. Get ur sh*t together. THERE'S NO EXCUSE FOR THIS

I give it 4 out of 5 because I like this airline better then most (Virgin Air is my favorite). The pros are: cost (It is usually pretty fairly priced), flights to Vegas usually happen about every hour, usually a speedy check in once it gets started. Cons: customer service is not always that great, no-frills compared to virgin air, several of the A list boarding is reserved so you have to check in exactly 24 hours before your departure time or else you will be in the back of the plane and possibly no room for your carry-on.

Vegas southwest is full of slot machine.  Hey ding ding ding.  I won $3.00. lol.
I like to fly southwest because you still have the 2 free baggage check in,   They also give yiou little mini snacks such as peanuts and preztels with a beverage.  Their not to selfish with the snacks .  I heard one man ask fo 2 bags of peanuts, she was like no problem.  

Just remember it is first come first serve on seating unless you have priority boarding and they get to choose before all the other class.

I can't even stress this enough. We ride southwest a lot but never have we had the above and beyond service that we experienced today. BOTH Britney, and Victoria were what I would call top notch. So friendly, accommodating, and the number one reason why we will be flying southwest the next time! Thanks crew, YOU ROCK

I fly Southwest about 4 times a month for work. I like it a lot. It doesn't hurt that I'm A List so I always get a good seat. Also, I like that bags fly free. One benefit I was reminded of today was the fact they don't charge for changes to your flight. I tried to change a reservation on United today and was told I'd have to pay about $150 for the ticket change and another $150 or so for the new flight. WTF! That's at least as much as I paid initially for BOTH flights. None of that with Southwest. The other benefit is Southwest has a really good in-flight magazine. I always enjoy the articles. I do wish they had wi-fi on more of their flights though.

Normally I would give Southwest Air 5 stars, but not today.  I don't know if it is a new policy or if the boarding pass taker was just being a control freak. I set my alarm to wake up in time to check in exactly 24 hours before the flight. I got B25 and my girlfriend got B31.  So we are in the boarding line together. When we get to the boarding pass taker, she tells us we can't board together and that my GF has to leave me and go to her number spot in line.  I have flown SWA for decades and this never has happened before. I told the woman taking the passes, that this was messed up. She said "send in a complaint." I wanted to tell her off, but did not want to get thrown off the flight.
Here is the bottom line:
Southwest offers paperless boarding passes, but makes it impossible for a couple to get them if they are on the same reservation.  Separate reservations means separate boarding passes that are not likely consecutive numbers.

I'm rating this airline a four because they are one of the only airlines who still provide free snacks. After paying $500+ for a flight the least they can do is feed us, even if it is just peanuts and pretzels. Flights are increasing yet amenities are decreasing. 

I like their moto, "every passenger is first class." Even if it isn't true I like their attitude! 

Lastly, to Southwest, what makes you a competitor in this market is your occasional sales. Please keep that going and stop the blackout dates. Thank you.

ok i had a terrible time in sfo with the southwest guy about my stupid paper ticket that never came in the mail.  i dont understand why they mail tickets anymore anyways.

this attendant did everything for us without us asking.  we just stood there.

the con - waiting to take off.  siting on the airplane in 100 degree heat with no AC.  what the heck?!??!?  i had never experienced that before.  they had all the doors open the air running full blast and all i was getting was hot air.  i asked the attendant if something was wrong with the air and she said "welcome to vegas"  everyone sneered.  no.  how about cheapo southwest warm up the engine so we get some AC.

never flying southwest again.

I was very late leaving LV for home and was not likely to make it in time, all flights were booked through the next day, and had my 2 kids and a sick wife in tow.  The SW curbside check guy was a great help, and helped me get checked in quick and on the plane.  Couldn't have done it without him.  Hope my phat tip made your day. THANKS!

For an airline today, southwest is pretty good.
The free bags (2 per person) are a very nice bonus.
If you took 2 bags for each leg of the trip, that would be $100 per person on any other flight! 

You can tell the workers love working for southwest and are some of the funniest flight attendants around!

We had never flown southwest before but had heard good things! The bags fly free was an awesome deal and I liked the idea of choosing your own seat! We were heading to Vegas for our 2nd anniversary and couldn't wait!

My husband and I arrived about 2 hours prior to flight and found out immediately Due to weather in Atlanta that the flight was delayed! This went on for the next 3 hours as the plane wouldn't leave Atlanta to get up here to Richmond! We ended up having to get switched to a later flight leaving out if Atlanta (the last flight). We started getting concerned about missing that flight as well as it was approaching the time to leave and the plane still hasn't arrived and no one was telling us anything. I feel like we should have been kept up to date, especially because at this point we knew the storms in Atlanta had been clear for hours! 
 
To help ease everyone's frustration they did offer free snacks and $100 to each person towards a flight! That was a great thing. We finally boarded the  plane and made it to Atlanta with enough time to get off and get right back on the next plane.

So we finally arrive in Vegas, 5 hours late , letting go of the earlier frustration! Well, 20 mins later at the empty carousel with no bags, we find out our bags didn't make it, they went to Orlando!!! At this point I finally reached my breaking point. I just couldn't understand how this whole experience could be so bad. We filed a claim and had to spend the first night with nothing! Thank goodness for Mandalay Bay supplying us with lots of essentials but with only my traveling outfit, I didn't enjoy our first night walking in sneakers and having to by something to sleep in! Our first day began and still no bags or updates! I would have been ok if they would just call! Finally the end of the day we got our bag AFTER WE called.

Now onto the flight home!! Guess what, flight delayed!! I couldn't believe it! We barely made it to our connection and had nothing to eat! Just crazy! I understand things happen, things out of their control but I really feel the communication with passengers was just awful and not being able to transfer our bags after all the trouble prior was just unacceptable!

My point of this review is not to tell people don't fly southwest, but don't expect a lot of communication! You'll be spending your time back and forth with the people at the gates trying to get info! 

Good luck in your flights but we won't be flying southwest again!

What good is the free baggage policy when you have a seven hour delay at the airport in Las Vegas because of mechanical issues and not having a backup plane ready to go. Really. Seven hours??? Give me a break. Poor poor poor customer service. There is absolutely no excuse for having to sit in an airport for seven hours waiting for Southwest to come up with another airplane. Pathetic.

Flew from LAS to BUF would most likely not use them again.  Did not care for the boarding process we were in group B and got stuck at the very rear of the plane in front of toilets(gross).  Happened again on our return flight even though we checked in early.  Felt  crammed in like cattle.  Very rough flight into BUF--pilot did good job  keeping us updated on weather.  Will probably spend more next time for more comfortable flight.  FA's were friendly and generous with snacks.

I like this airline.  Airfares reasonable, decent schedule, and BAGS FLY FREE, my main reason for choosing SWA.  
I also love the queuing methodology at the gate; I despise the stress trying to board on other airlines with high checked bag fees (i ALWAYS check mine) and their greedy passengers with two huge carryons and a laptop bag or enormous purse.  
Offloading is quicker since more folks checked luggage.
I resent, somewhat, the gate agent insisting that my 1st carryon go under the seat - I have long legs, I checked my bags, my camera bag is going UP.
I like the ease with which I can use mileage points for travel.  I use the Visa card prodigiously.
Airplanes tend to be barebones w/o modern accoutrements like USB outlets.
Keep up the good work!

Tonight my experience with Southwest airlines was a much better experience then last Sunday night. Last week it took us,
 4 hours to get to Vegas which is a 45 minutes trip. Tonight at Burbank airport no lines at baggage check or TSA and we arrived in Vegas early. Perfect trip.

Without a doubt, this is my favorite airline.  Anytime I have to travel, my preference is Southwest Airlines.  I've always received excellent customer service and they always have a lot of flight options to choose from.  I also appreciate the first 2 luggage items being free - that's definitely rare in this day and age.  They still provide amazing snacks and beverages which most airlines now require you to purchase.  

Thanks Southwest - you're amazing - keep it up!!!

A less positive experience than others this time.  Basically, everyone else who has left one, two or three stars has said it all.  Las Vegas to Phoenix Flight 171 on April 17, 2014, I'm stuck here for the next nine hours, despite my early bird check in.  The reason the airline mentioned for this less positive experience is that someone forgot to process the check-ins.  I guess someone woke up one day and decided, oh, I'm not going to do my job today.  I used to always avoid this airline because of the unnecessary and tremendous stress and chaos, but since the assigned numbers in A, B or C, I recently decided to come back.  I'm not so sure after today.  Overall, the low cost and convenient locations cause me to buy from them and the service is adequate.  Fingers crossed for more positive experiences again, in the future.  As for this trip, well, you know how life is sometimes.  Things could always be worse.

How in the heck does Southwest Airline only have 3.5 stars on Yelp? Makes no sense!  Of all the airlines, they are definitely number one in my book for traveling in the U.S. The staff is so polite, they don't over-use the intercom for announcements, they are sometimes funny, sometimes talented enough to serenade you with a song, and badass enough to know how to properly LAND a plane!!! I'm not kidding when I say they are my first choice. Everything from booking my ticket to getting my seat, etc - the process is easy, smooth, stress free. Southwest Airline... Well done valuing your employees. It shows in the eye of the consumer. Your people are everything. 
#iluvswa
Sincerely, 
Britt

Good price and I appreciate the 2 Free luggage check in with 1 carry-on. However, bring rubber gloves and a degree of separation from the seats. Absolutely disgusting! Tray tables clearly don't get whipped down well. There is a build up of food and dirt around the edges, booger smears on the back fo the seat in front of me. There is face grease all over the windows.  I really am grossing out big time

Real talk: I've never been a big fan of Southwest. I used to fly a lot (like, multiple times a week) and I rarely chose them. Part of it was convenience, part was that I was much more a part of a different loyalty system, but mostly it was about the flying experience. 

You should also know that I don't particularly care for this airport. It's had some work done, so it's getting better again, but overall I'm just not hugely into it. 

So with those two strikes, I actually feel pretty good about being middle of the road about Southwest. I have this theory that Southwest has continually been average, and all the other carriers have been on a steady decline since the whole "we charge you for baggage" fees began, and with the advent of discount nickel-and-dine carriers like Allegiant, Frontier, and Spirit, Southwest starts to look good. The only improvement they've really made, however, is assigning you a number with your lettered section. Back in the days of only three boarding groups, it was a nightmare. So, kudos to them.

Unfortunately, I still often have delays coming out of Vegas on Southwest. I've had cancelled flights, delayed flights, and the occasional incident-free flight.

I'm not gonna get to riled up about it, though. It's just a bump in the road, and nothing has been too egregious. The staff here are aplenty and seem competent enough to handle those bumps.
Frequent SWA flier; it's an ok airline if you can carry on your luggage. If you have to check bags be prepared for heartache

I hate this terminal. Period. It's always packed with throngs of people. It's noisy. If you are delayed you're stuck listening to the repetitive sounds of the slots. The interior is gaudy. The food choices are less than stellar and over priced.  There is limited seating and limited charging areas. The concourses are too tight. The walking distance between terminals when switching flights is ridiculous. Need I go on?

The only reason I don't give it a one star is great location from the Strip and free wifi.

It's Southwest. They got their game on lock.  Yes we had to move a couple of terminals down, but that's okay.  We departed a little bit after the schedule, but the flight crew was nice, and i wasn't really in a rush.  The fares as always, were pretty cheap.  I'l defintiltey fly SW again.

I flew in from Phoenix I was meeting family in Las Vegas once I arrived I was lost!!! Lee a pilot was so nice to help me find my family I really appreciate your time today it was great service above and beyond....thank you Trish C.

Let me start by saying, I just love the flight attendants on Southwest. They are funny and energetic. They are the reason I gave 2 stars.

However, the 2 gate agents in Las Vegas last week were the rudest people I have ever dealt with. I did complain to Southwest and the canned response I received made it even worse. 

Susan and Nicole were their names and I really hope they find new jobs because they should not be in any type of customer service position. Not being able to admit when you are wrong is childish. Saying "thank you" in a condescending tone while wearing an ugly scowl is not believable. Major fail Southwest.

What made it even more pathetic is when I boarded the plane and picked up the Southwest magazine. There was a big article from their company's president talking about how customer service is their #1 priority. Ironic, since the 2 women working their gate were embarrassingly rude and Amanda's response to my complaint was flimsy.

I think paying a baggage fee next time I fly to Vegas might be worth it to not see those 2 sad females ever again.

Terrible package booking. Booked at the website and was charged full amount on credit card. Got to the hotel and could not find my reservation. Called Southwest twice and they did nothing. Been waiting an hour and still no resolution. Will be absolutely the last time I uses Southwest to book package vacations. They clearly only know how to operate airplanes and nothing else. Absolutely a nightmare and ruined the start of what is supposed to be a fun weekend. Not to mention we had to endure the embarassment of having no reservations when we showed up at an upscale hotel. Stay away from their vacation deals!

I love flying SW. This location is terrific because there are plenty of places to eat in this terminal and if you're bored, many slot machines to use and shops to browse through while you wait.  

The staff of Southwest all have this snarky (in a good way) attitude that adds humor to your travels. I love coming through Las Vegas and flying Southwest Airlines because overall, the customer service is great, no assigned seating and there's never any hassle.  Highly recommend! :)

I have always been a huge fan this airline.  I will be honest I have been unfaithful my last few flights but never again.  After learning a relative was terminally ill. I planned a trip in a few weeks because the outlook seemed positive at the time.  Less than a week later my relative suddenly passed in his sleep. WOW! I contacted the airline after going back to the website to see it would cost me close to $1100 to make the trip to pay last respects.  I contacted Southwest and told them the scenario. I told them my new travel plans if possible....after a brief hold they said as a one time courtesy we will change your reservation and will not have to pay ANY...ANY additional fees. WOW! Mind blown and completely exceeded my expectations.  For that Southwest I THANK YOU! I will fly you everywhere possible and tell everyone about your amazing gesture and customer experience savvy.

This was my first tome flying with Southwest and I have to say it was not as bad as some peple say. All airlines aren't perfect so it is hard to gauge how i feel about this one, but I guess it could be worst. 

I think it is kind of weird they dont assign you seats but whatever works I guess. Also, they lost my bag once and gave me a $50 voucher. I eventually got my bag later on but $50 is not enough. I should have gotten more for the time I had to spend in the aiport. I guess I will deal with them though since the air fare with them is much cheaper !
Flights delayed often and was cancelled today. I hope my southwest flights are cancelled more often. :)

The best airline in the WORLD. Superlative service by employees who smile & are pleasant. They all seem to enjoy their work.  Friendliest cancel or ticket change policy EVER, no charge, as long as it's 15 minutes prior to your flight. WHO does that ? 2 bags free, adds up if you fly often & I do.  I always fly Southwest, unless they don't service my destination. I am a customer for life. They are simply the best.

I've flown on several Southwest planes for a very long time. My next visit with them will be in April where I will be flying from Las Vegas to Baltimore, as we will be visiting Washington DC.
Most flights I've been on with them have been very full, but otherwise, it's worth taking Southwest because they do not give you assigned seats and bags can be checked in for free.

What happens in Vegas stays in Vegas...and apparently Southwest takes this to heart and is keeping us here-- whether we want to be or not...delayed flights, canceled flights, and staff who lack any sense of empathy or human emotion.  More empathetic customer service would be nicer.

I will fly these guys anytime.   We had some bad weather in Chicagoland in January 2014.  The flights were delayed due to this weather.  The people that worked the counters at Las Vegas were mostly professional and helped my wife get home safe and sound.  
The airlines DO NOT control the weather or we would have 365 days of perfect flying weather, alas we do not.  They did do a very good job in helping as many persons that they could.
Thank you again for returning my wife safe & sound.

Southwest is the BEST! They are so courteous & helpful. Even if you miss your flight, they truly do all they can to assist you in getting on another flight as easily as possible. They make it easy to get on an earlier flight, if needed.  They don't overcharge you for luggage. They're definitely my first choice! Thank you, Southwest!

I like Southwest Airlines because the pricing is reasonable and they also have a sense of humor sometimes as well. I like how they give free drink coupons too. Overall, it's a great airline and I prefer to always fly Southwest.

Customer service is good until there are issues and then the Customer service reps in the airport and on the customer service hotline say there is nothing they can do. Call back tomorrow. Are you serious?
Flown using southwest 3 times within the last 5 days and each flight was delayed for an hour or more.

Southwest is my primary choice for flying in the U.S. It's all about your bags flying free! When I fly domestic airlines in other countries, it's free for your bags up to a maximum weight. We shouldn't have to pay here either, especially in addition to our seats on the plane. I've worked in a Southwest Airline terminal in the airport for a couple years too, but for serving food to them and flying customers. As a fellow neighbor employee and customer, I've always had pleasant encounters with their friendly and smiling attitudes. I had a delay one time with them and seen many people have delays with them too. However, we can't change the weather or expect the unexpected difficulties amongst planes all the time. They handle problems professionally and well! I'll always choose their "Wanna Get Away" prices!

I've flown Delta and Jetblue before and those were 5 hour flight one way each...flew southwest one hour and I'm ready to never fly them again.. I hate the no assigned seating. Its unorganized and makes check in a million times more stressful if flying with ppl in this case I had to sit seperatly from my kids who both have NEVER flown before.. smh The attendant told me she can't ask ppl to move just for that reason and then say my son in front with s snide " young man never pass an open seat" ugh just ugh! also the planes are dirty-no tv- wifi is literally non existent. One thing that really bothered me was the lack of notification from the flight team. Like wow no warning of turbulence or an all clear? we're all just sitting there trying to breath until 45 minutes into the flight and suddenly the plane is landing. Inever experience such a bad experience on the other airlines flown. My kids refuse to fly now.

Love that Southwest has online or mobile check-in! Pretty awesome. I usually set my alarm 24 hours before the flight so that I know when to check in.  The process of booking my flight to Vegas from Sac was very easy (and moderately priced). I would NEVER drive to Vegas from Sac unlike my fiance who once did and said it was the worst 10 hours of his life.  That 1.5 hours on the plane went by so quickly.

The staff were really nice and there were no delays on both the departing and returning flights. I like that the staff leaves you alone when you're sleeping and there is moderate leg space.  Did I also mention free check-in? 

Southwest, you make me very happy!

Let's face it, domestic air travel these days has become a joke. Long gone are the days of "flying the friendly skies" and good customer service. With airlines reducing the amount of flights and routes, along with added seats to an already cramped seating area, makes for an uncomfortable ride. 

Recently I was in need of a flight to the Miami area, I was checking the flights daily into FLL or MIA, and  was baffled to find there were barely any nonstop flights. I prefer nonstops on long flights, and I have no problem paying extra. Comparing costs and luggage fees, and the fact that SWA had one nonstop leaving first thing in the morning, I grabbed it. 

Flight time, 8:50am leaving out of McCarran, as I being dropped off I receive my first text message from SWA announcing a delay to 9:30, ok no big deal. By the time I get to the gate, we are all informed that the flight is now being pushed to 2:05. Thanks to the Polar Vortex and the Snowpocalypse of 2014, most of the flights coming from the East Coast have affected the rest of the travel. It's not SWA fault, and I'm not one of those people who get crazy mad when my flight is delayed due to weather. So I spend my time at the bar, making the best of it. We are finally called to board around 2:30pm, and as I arrive to the counter, I am presented with a $200 credit for future travel with SWA. Wow, that's awesome. It was not their fault for the delays, I thought this was above and beyond.

On the way to FLL, I noticed that it was taking a lot longer to get there than usual (I'm a clock watcher), and recently I've been experiencing some motion sickness out of the blue. Well the pilot comes on and tells us that he has been circling for the last 1.5 hours due to a closure of both MIA and FLL airports due to a storm and that we are being diverted to Tampa. So we land and we sat at the gate for over 2 hours. I sprint to the lavatory, I won't give details, but I'm not feeling well. When I come out, I asked the stewardness for some water (as I can't brush my teeth with the non potable water in the lavatory) and she says she can't give anything out, I offer to buy it. She denies me. I ask to please be let off the plane so I may get some water, as I was not feeling well. She denies me. At this point I wanted to throw up on her shoes and her non-ironed, looked like it was pulled out of the dirty hamper, uniform.

I sent an email to SWA letting them know what happened. A few days later, I received a CALL, not an email, but a call from a representative expressing his concern for her lack of customer service and letting me know he had filed a complaint against the crew, AND giving me another $200 voucher for future travel. 

This is what customer service is. If something went wrong, they make it right.

I mostly fly Southwest because overall it is the best value that I have found. When I was flying to Kansas City, my pit stop was in Las Vegas. It's not a bad airport. There's decent food choices and a little shopping. If you like to play the slot machines than you are in LUCK! I am not sure if it's a big winner, but I see a lot of people playing!!

When I was here, I got settled in the right area and was eating my lunch. After eating, I went to throw away the trash and noticed the flight board. I doubled checked my ticket and realized they had changed gates. YIKES!  I picked up everything and headed to my correct gate. I wasn't worried, but I sure didn't want to miss my flight. Bottom line is you should pay attention to your flight times and gates.

I've had good luck here and bathrooms were clean. I don't mind it here.

We flew from Las Vegas to Orlando on one of the new planes and it was awesome.  The flight attendants treated us so well and the plane was awesome.  I am six foot four and it seemed like I had a lot of room.  

Southwest didnt run out of food and they were very accommodating.

Las Vegas - The home hub of my favorite domestic airlines. If I could take Southwest everywhere, I would, but alas I cannot. I must put up with all the other dinky airlines including United and US Airways. SW never loses my luggage and I know I don't have to pay for it if I decide to check it in (unless of course it ways a million pounds). I'm not really happy with the random seat assignments, but hey, it works. 

Their crew is always always cheerful and peppy. Good people to hang out with if you are on a 6+ hour flight!

First and last time ever flying with southwest!!! Giving us bullshit from the start!!! "Minor dent, just waiting on paperwork" "maintenance is checking on the dent, about 10-15 minutes"... and hour fuckin later, "maintenance had to remove the door to check on the god damn "minor dent" and reseal whatever the fuck they did with the "minor dent"" it will take another 30 god damn minutes!! None of the flight attendants offered anyone water, drinks... NOTHING!!! We are flying out from Las Vegas where it is 100+ degrees and one of the dumb ass flight attendants decides to open the back doors so she can chit chat with that maintenance people?!!!?!??!!!!!!! hot air is coming in and still no beverages served to any of the passengers!!!  FUCKIN RIDICULOUS!!! I'll make sure inlet everyone know on social media to never fly Southwest!! 


Update.... after all that nonsense that went down at Mccarren, we finally reached San Jose and what do you know... another god damn delay. Pilot said there was a weather issue in Seattle! What weather issue?!?!? Bullshit!!! It was a perfect day in Seattle!!! 1 hour passed and finally went on our way. Touchdown at Sea-Tac and what do you know, another god damn delay! For FUCKS SAKEs!!! After all the delays we had in Las Vegas and San Jose, we had no terminal for our airline to park.. we were stuck on the runway for another 45 god damn minutes... what was suppose to be a 2+ hour trip turned into a 5+hour trip... never fuckin ever am I flying with this airline!!!

What I enjoy about this airline is the free baggage. Although, they have continuously been raising their prices. It used to be one of the most affordable Airlines. I so appreciate that you're able to choose your seat there's a pro and a con to this one is you may be stuck in a middle seat and the pro is if you book your seat way you still may be able to get a window or an aisle seat. They do give some more snacks then just peanuts or pretzels. So I would definitely recommend this Airline just remember it is an economy airline that is now starting to offer some international travel which would be difficult due to the economy accommodations.

I have been flying in and out of Las Vegas since middle school. They have always had the best rates compared to other airlines. Our recent trip to Nashville cost us $200/per person. Other airlines were charging at least $300. There is no assigned seating, so make sure you check in online 24 hours prior to your flight to get the best boarding group. Otherwise, you'll be stuck in the C group and forced to sit apart from your party. All of the Southwest employees are friendly and some even have a sense of humor. I've even had a few flight attendants even sing a little song while onboard. The snacks have greatly improved throughout the years and they have plenty of options to choose from. You can even get beer and mixed drinks for $5 each. Restrooms are super tiny so make sure you go at the airport before you board. Overall, I've always had a pleasant experience with Southwest and I will for sure be flying with them in the future.

This is my favorite and by far  the best airline I have flown with overall. If you are lucky enough to fly business,  you can change or cancel your tickets with no penalties. I love that they will call you back if the wait time is too long. The only draw back of course is the unassigned seating,  but I guess you can't have it all especially when your not paying any baggage fees like with American Airlines or other similar ones. I live on Orange County,  so it is convincente that they fly to multiple destinations from there, including our favorite and direct flight to Cabo San Lucas, which is awesome!  Hopefully the other airlines will follow suit and go back to not charging baggage fees, great job Southwest!

My husband and I use Southwest Airlines as our go to airline because of the free check luggage and the variety of options for flight times and destinations.  With that said what blew me away this trip was our flight attendant Tolando.  She was on our flight 5/19/17 Flight 369 LAS to BNA.  Customer service can make or break a reputation of a company no matter the price of the service.  From the first hello stepping onto the plane she greeted me and everyone with a huge genuine smile.  And her positive energy continued throughout our 3+ hour flight.  She never wavered with her upbeat service to all passengers.  There was something special about her, which I know people may think that's weird to say but it started the tone of our trip and would make my day.  As we exited off the plane I didn't realize I soon would receive a message of a family member passing away while I was in air.  It was almost like she was meant to be there to keep my energy positive and remind me how others can really affect the mood of the day.  Instead of being depressed and sad about the passing of my grandma it was Tolando's positive energy that made me thankful of the wonderful people in my life whether they are family, friends or a complete stranger who had an amazing impact on my day.  If only everyone had a soul like Tolando.  What an amazing employee.
This flight was terrible the coffee was cold as the artic and staff was the worst. They were super mean. Plz fire the staff on my flight

I have a flight coming up next month and I bought a "surprise" ticket for my boyfriend which unfortunately didn't work out. I was super stressed because I didn't buy any type of insurance but I called and got a customer service rep almost right away. She helped me book the flight with ZERO hassle which was a huge relief. I was refunded right away no questions asked. I'm looking forward to my trip stress-free now!

Let's make this simple. Anyone who gives Southwest less than 4 stars never flies. They were delayed? It happens. You missed your flight because of a delay? Get over it. It happens. It's not the agent's job to accommodate YOU and forsake everyone else. You don't like not having an assigned seat? You knew that when you booked it, so you have no right to complain. Ditto for check-in procedure. 
I'm a Million Miler on American. Now THOSE GUYS suck. They treat customers like we owe them! I'm a fourth of the way there on United. If they could figure a way to engineer the seat any closer, they would. Year after year, I'm either A-List or A-List Preferred on Southwest. Honestly. What's not to like? The friendliest staff of any airline in the US. If you're nice to them, they treat you like a million bucks.

Southwest Airlines, i would like to thank you for many reasons. I would also like to thank a complete stranger named Jen on Flight 1146 05/29/2018 Las Vegas to Houston.
Jen, my 12 year old daughter was flying by herself. She told me how kind you were on the flight. My daughter had to change planes in Houston, Jen left the plane she needed to stay on, just to escort my daughter to her next flight. That melted my heart completely. Thank you for your kindness. I'm so grateful for you.

Southwest, your employees are amazing. They gave my daughter pre check. Constantly asked if she needed food, water, or had any questions. They were overly sweet and I'm soooo grateful! Southwest employee Kayla in Houston, thank you to you also. You made her feel safe, comfortable & confident. You left a big impression! I left my daughter in your hands and you took such good care of her. I could not be more thankful.

So filthy - the terminal and the plane. A child threw up on the floor at the terminal and the mom simply tossed a wipe on top of it and left it - it fit right in with the other messes all over the floor everywhere.

My flight from Pittsburgh to Orlando was cancelled, due to "maintenance" at 10 am for 12:15 flight. Was told we would have to take a 5:45 flight. After sitting in airport for 9 hours, I'm still delayed at 7 pm...  Like another poster said, they just suck!!! 58% on time...  horrible...  they gave me a voucher for future travel, like I'd fly them again. Kiss the bargain fares good bye, and fly a real airline!!

I fly SW more then I would like to admit. They're a solid airline, you know what to expect from them. Peanuts or pretzels and a drink mid-flight. They will greet you with a smile and try to make you feel comfortable. The only bad thing is that they book the flights to max capacity. If you get a C boarding pass you can plan of experiencing that akward feeling of sitting in the middle of 2 oversized strangers. 

They were 3 stars until I remembered that everyone else over charges for for luggage. 4 stars
Cheap flights and two free check in luggage. Pretty easy system to return your flights as well since you get credit that is good for a year.
The crew was super friendly.  They made jokes with us they were very nice. They had fun. They made the plane ride a good trip

Southwest Airlines is my main way of getting out of Dodge aka Reno NV. No frills, peanuts and maybe on a long haul cookies or pretzels or cheese crackers, Tip! Pack a lunch if you want something more. Yes you can get it through security. Just don't bring wine or beer. SWA has both and at a reasonable price. 

SWA  also has a decent rewards plan so far, plus cheep drinks, free bags, and free wifi now on all their planes with really good stations like the Food Channel. Or the Disney Channel for the children.. Love watching that as I cross the USA. The miss, I may have to go to LA before I can go to Fort Lauderdale with a stop in Atlanta. Never mind all the planes you may have to change to get where you need to go and the fear and angasity that you will go through if the weather is bad or the Harpies conspire so you will miss your connecting flight. 

If you want to serf the net you do need to pay. It's modest compared to other airlines.. but there is a charge. Since everything I have to do by email these days can wait, and I can write my Yelp recommendations off line etc. etc. and my FB people do not need to know what's happening at 35k+ feet I love the free wifi. 

SWA however is much more then just shuttling me around. It has been the airlines that has shuttled precious cargo. Ever since I was the Executive Director of the Nevada Diabetes Association way back in 1980 SWA has been flying our kids into Reno from Las Vegas and back home again for our biggest camp for kids with diabetes. Plus for the past 10 years they have flown our kids for Teen Camp too. 

It takes a lot of heart and a lot of cool to handle 40+ kids and 20+ staff who are all  singing camp songs in the back of the plane while having their blood sugars checked and who may have a major medical emergency at a moments notice. Yes we do have medical staff with them. But still there are other passengers who do not know that and SWA has never lost their heart or their cool. 

Look, in all honesty flying these days is not a joy. We get packed like sardines into a tin box and pray to the powers that be to keep us safe as we amazingly enough get off the ground. Image that?? We defy gravity!. So.. what makes a difference. The flight attendants, the check in people, the voice on the phone.. Customer services is everything. Plus.. the Pilots . They are really the coolest. If ever they say we are not leaving.. do not argue, they have made a right decision because no matter how long it might take they want you to get to your destination and then home in one piece safe and sound. I trust them with my life every time I fly. 
. 
SWA is my airlines of choice as I travel around these United States. I take them to NYC, Chicago, Cleveland, Denver, LV, New Orleans and lots of places. My only problem is if only I could get there without having to go some place else they would be perfect.

Update:  Upon reading my email, Southwest immediately compensated our family with a new set of plane tickets.  I was a little upset they didn't do more, but most of our experiences have pleasant with the company.

I am a lover of Southwest flights.  I guess because I have never had to pay for one.  Oh yes I paid $39 round trip to Vegas twice must the other longer flights I have taken I have used miles.  They are always predictable and I know the routine so I like that.  They have good coverage and I hear they will start doing Hawaii soon, that should be nice for all those people with miles. I don't check bags but they are one of the few airlines that don't charge you extra and let you check 2 bags for free! Once in a while you get a singing crew that does funny stuff but even in general their staff has a sense of humor. If you want to fly for free for awhile sign up for their credit card and do some travel, or check out those deals like my $39 vegas flights.
Great flying experience with a friendly and attentive crew. Love Southwest!

I've used Southwest Airlines for three round trips from Reno to Las Vegas this year and the only problem I've had was a flight delay by ten minutes. Southwest lets you check in TWO 50lb bags for free. I always check in my bag because I'm really short and I hate the hassle of trying to get someone to help me put my bag in the cabin, then getting someone to help me take it down with everyone exiting the plane. I've never had a problem with my checked in baggage and I know how cruel the ground crew can be (my boyfriend used to work at McCarran and he said the ground crew members would just throw people's baggage around and into the trucks without even caring). The most that was ever done to my bag so far was an inspection and they left me a note to tell me my bag was searched. 

On my first flight to Reno this year, one of the flight attendants started singing on the microphone about what a great flight we've had and how he was glad to have us all on board. It was pretty entertaining and surprising. The flight crew has always been very friendly on all my flights thus far. They give you two bags of peanuts/pretzels and even more without hesitation if you just ask. On my last flight, I was reading the menu and saw they had a cranberry vodka special for five bucks and monster energy drinks for $3, which I think is pretty decently priced for an airline. 

All in all, I'm sticking to Southwest!

Summary based on 1 to/from trip and only for the LAS location:
--on schedule
--handles standard boarding process well
--ok facilities, but could use more AC receptacles in the SW gate area
Fuck this airline unfortunately it's cheap but that's what you get is shit services and delayed flights no WiFi but now I'm getting har

Southweezy. 

This airline has earned that nickname for many reasons, like the rapper of the same ilk, they have become unpredictable; delayed flights, random boarding times (sometimes early, sometimes late), but always ready to party. Those peppy safety regulation speeches and quirky birthday announcements add a little spice to the flight, but after three or four of those it can be a little annoying... we get it, you like to party.  

Also, don't think I haven't noticed the price increases and overbooked flights in the past few years. Elbow room, what's that? I'm flying Southwest today! The Wi-Fi sort of works even you buy the premium, so you're better off just downloading whatever you can before boarding the flight. This will make your tight elbow rubbing spot next to the drunk fellow or flatulent elderly person that much better. 

Southwest. I can't quit you and I don't know why.

I absolutely hate Southwest. The flights are cheap and you get two free check ins but they're ALWAYS delayed and they always claim cancellations due to weather when other airlines are running perfectly. It's such BS and utterly inconvenient for everyone who has to either wait hours to fly into their original airport or fly into another one further away. Half of the southwest counter people are so rude too. Plan accordingly  especially if you're planning on flying out of Las Vegas. If you're from SoCal just drive it's not worth the amount of time wasted sitting at the airport.

Southwest was more than accommodating of me traveling with an infant. They were so very nice and the fact that you can check 2 free bags, car seat and stroller is amazing. Very nice Customer Service desk.

SWA check in counter in Las Vegas. Wow, rude and unprofessional
People. Never have I been treated like they are doing me a favor. I don't freaking think so! Hopefully it will be my last time using SWA! I am a Jet Blue fan and now I know why! SWA ground hired help is just that, hired help to SERVE the public. Not have some fuckin attitude to make you feellike your a studpid FUCKIN idiot. The check in dude was rude and if I owned this Co. I would fire his ass!

Flew to DC with my 90 year old father as part of Utah Honor Fight.  All of the Southwest employees were wonderful and very helpful.  They treated all of the veterans with a great deal of respect and helped to make it a wonderful experience.  One flight attendant, I wish I could remember her name, did the pre-flight info and she was hilarious and had everyone on the entire plane laughing.  Southwest is always my preferred airlines when I fly myself or when my son flies home to visit.  Never had a problem.

Review #091 - 2017

Southwest is always my airline of choice whenever I fly within the mainland.  I don't think I've every had any bad experience that would make me stop flying with them.  I mean I have experienced a few flight delays, but it's usually due to bad weather so it's forgivable.

My most recent encounter with Southwest in Las Vegas was especially worthy of a 5-star review.

I arrived in Vegas on Monday, May 1st, around 11:05 AM.  As soon as I walked up the ramp, my daughter's stroller and car seat were set up and ready to go.  I don't remember any other airport ever doing this for me.  It was definitely appreciated!

Flying with a baby is hard enough, but having to fold and connect and unfold and disconnect all of her carriers make it even more stressful on top of having to carry my own purse, her diaper bag and baby blankies & toys.

Then on our flight back home on Wednesday, May 3rd, around 9 PM, we were lucky enough to have a few empty seats so I was able to bring her car seat on the plane.  

However, deboarding the plane was a little complicated because she fell asleep in the carrying pouch, which was connected to me, so I had to carry her car seat in one hand while carrying her diaper bag and my purse on my other arm.  

Our pilot actually noticed that I was struggling so he was very kind & offered to take her car seat off of my hand & even helped me connect it back on her stroller at the ramp.

So, with all of my positive experiences with Southwest, I highly doubt I'll ever fly anyone else, especially with all these crazy news going on about all the other airlines.

By far the worst experience with southwest! They keep giving wrong information. The only reason I'm still flying southwest is because their airline tickets don't put a hole in your pocket and the bags are free. First my flight is delayed to 8:25, then they said 9pm. It then goes back to 8:30.. Giving us hope that we'll leave earlier. Then they change it again to 8;45. They finally board us and as soon as everyone is seated and suppose to take off soon, they say they got a message indicating that we will not be taking off to 9:30. What's next? Keeps going back and forth: they should seriously get their facts straight before announcing inconsistent information. Now we're stuck in the plane waiting when we could at least be walking around in the airport. Irritated!!
Good flight. A little bumpy but a good flight. The flight attendant named Jeremy from Reno to Vegas is very rude. Let's just say you better not open the storage compartment when he's around. Dick.

My best friends birthday, mine and her best flight ever! Thank you southwest for having these employees that keep me and my family, friends so loyal to you

I want to emphasize that we had to wait to take a picture because they were worth it! Thank you for them! Thank you for making our flight to Vegas the untimate best... btw they need a raise

This is not my favorite airport to transit and especially if you are flying with Southwest. I love the SW, the staff and especially the new plane but it is always full flight if you are flying from Las Vegas. They should do a better job of making sure customers does not carry oversize luggage into the over head bin. It just slow down the boarding process when everyone bring along a huge carry on luggage and try to fit into a small bin space. Please make sure you stop those big luggage. Also, SW plan is always hot and stuffy in summer when departing from LV.

Thank you Southwest for forgiving me...
Thank you for helping me save money in booking a next morning flight that would of cost me a price...
Thank you lady at the counter that helped me get a free open spot and that felt sorry for me probably!

I missed my 8am flight on a Sunday morning after an EPIC night of debauchery ( may i add my worst night ever.. and never again ).  It probably wasn't the best idea to book such an early flight.. ( but it was cheaper.. !! ) 

For everyone out there, Stand-Bys on Sundays in Las Vegas.. is the toughest thing to deal with.. since everyone wants to go home from a busy weekend in sin city!!

I can't believe my eyes - less than a 5 staff from people; how?

Never have a better experience from another airline.  My most recent travel, I had arrived 40 minutes ahead of schedule.  This is my primary airline... never another airline again (if I don't have to).

No baggage fee, free drinks, food/snacks as much as you want..... :-)

Most of the time the flight crew will make jokes or say funny things.

All good stuff.

southwest is starting to not be as good as it used to be. i seem to be delayed on 80% of the flights i take!
i probably wont stop flying them cuz they still are the cheapest (usually). so, i guess you get what you pay for!

McCarran Airport. Las Vegas.

We checked in our bags outside, guy was friendly and helpful. 

Little did I know that I was going to witness a dude (an African-American male with short curly hair) throw every single bag onto the the carousel like they were trash bags. EVERY SINGLE BAG. Giving no FU*** about other people's property. Literally throwing them like he was bowling. Someone needs to tell this dude to care a little more for people's property, the people who are purchasing tickets and basically letting him earn a paycheck.

When I told him to not throw the bags, he just laughed and looked at his other coworkers like he was making a joke out of it.

I'll still fly Southwest. But if I have to witness this again, someone is getting fired.

Only star - good deal on the flight.

My favorite airline. Never had delays. Affordable. First come first served seating. But the best thing is their flight attendants. They are funny and awesome. Sure, there's no real first class but I never fly first class anyways so don't care.
Very rude employees. Terrible service. They don't care about the customer, only themselves. A bunch of monkeys running airplanes is what Southwest is.

Gotta "LUV" Southwest Airlines.

Clean, modern planes.  Friendly, funny employees.  No baggage fees!  Reasonable points (frequent flier) system.  Comprehensive routes (especially on the West coast).

Whenever Southwest flies where I'm going, it's the only option for me.  Favorite American airline.

5 stars!

Not terrible, not great either. It's an ok place for an airport. Like most airports it's a bit crowded for my liking but I suppose it's that time of the year. One really good thing is the selection of places to grab a bite. This place is definitely better then LAX

Southwest is my default airline when I travel within the US, especially to Las Vegas. They offer great deals most of the time and haven't had an issue with delays more than 10 min.

Sure the seats aren't the most comfy but SW is pretty much for travelers who just want to get from point A to point B on a budget.

Of the 8 years I have flown SW, I had only one negative experience, which was resolved in a fair manner. Last weekend, I had to check-in my bag since there was no more room for my carry-on. I never check-in my bags since I have a fear of my bags getting lost. Anyways, so I just decided to go with the flow and of course my biggest fear comes true...my bag gets left behind during my transfer in Oakland. Southwest tried to coordinate to have my bag come in on the last flight at the night. I decided to come in to pick it up since they offered me a $50 credit if I came in. Unfortunately, my bag was not able to make the last flight. At this point I was pretty angry since I had a wedding to attend the following afternoon. However, they made sure they put the bag on priority for the first flight into Las Vegas and offered me another $50 credit. Surely enough, my bag came in early in the morning. Although this was very inconvenient for my family and I, I did appreciate their effort in getting my bag to me and compensating for it. Thanks SW!

Cheap, on-time and great customer service + lack of amenities and uncomfortable seats = 3.5 stars

Southwest is old reliable. Cheap, friendly, and easy flying. 
You can check 2 bags with no fees. Each has to be under 50 lbs. 

What is it about certain fat girls that just make them mean. They're such pack animals. I think when they don't fit in, because they think being a big girl means they're out of the club, they turn on anyone who's out of the ordinary. One such chub was friends with my seatmate. As I was nearly having a heart attack on the plane due to terror, surely my seated neighbor noticed. On the return flight, saw the duo in the airport again and Big Chub shoots me a dirty, and let's be honest, fucked up look. Mean mug may be the term to employ. On the return flight, they sat near me, and my fellow ex-seatmate pretended I didn't exist, fattie shot me another look. Why all the effort? Why all the work to let me know you don't approve... of a person you've never met. We have no connection, no relationship, no nothing, yet you feel the need to create a conflict. Who puts effort into that?  I don't get it. 

Thank you to the lovely flight attendant who sat and chatted on the plane.

Every time I fly on southwest my flight gets delayed for no reason. I absolutely hate this airline and don't understand why it's so hard for them to be on time.
I paid extra to be on an earlier flight since I was able to get to the airport early, and now I'll be arriving later than if I had just stayed on the original flight! So upsetting.
Just flew from Orlando to Las Vegas, squished in like sardines. Clean plane and a GREAT flight staff! Jennifer and Russ were both top notch and made the flight and travel experience OUTSTANDING!

Was OK, typical SW Airlines stuff.  The flight attendants on this trip were boring old ladies.  They were nice enough, just no personality.  Being married, with children, I never thought I'd say this but: Give me the perky gay dude any day over these boring old ladies.
Great service with friendly people. They give out drink tickets to their credit card holders, which is nice.

I left my driver license at my gate before flying out of Las Vegas and was very scared I wouldn't be able to get back without a hassle. Fortunately, a Southwest Airlines employee found my ID and helped me get it shipped express to my hotel before I had to fly again. They didn't even charge me for it!

Southwest really sets a standard for service. Great job!

I love flying Southwest. Unless I need to leave the country (which I never do) it's the only airline I fly.

I hadn't flown in a few years but I found Southwest still quick, still mostly punctual and still fairly friendly. My flights were delayed by about ten minutes each which considering the recent storms, I wasn't too shocked about.

The only recent negative change I've seen is that they seem to now reserve the A class boarding for frequent fliers. I've checked in within 10 minutes and still been B class. Not sure why or if paying the $12.50 for automatic check in gives you the A class, but it's definitely something to be aware of.

Both my flights to and from Vegas went off without a hitch and both were easy and simple experiences

I love Southwest and they'll continue to be the only airline I'll fly.

Ugh. I may have flown Southwest for the last time.

This last trip we had vouchers to use due to our bad experience the last time we flew them. So we used them to pay a portion of the fee for going to Vegas.

Didn't do early bird check in so I checked in 24 hours in advance, as soon as I could, and still got stuck in the very back seat. No room at all. Really uncomfortable for 5 hours. Flight got in over an hour late too.

On the way back I again checked in via my phone 24 hours in advance. Got C boarding. Awful. So I paid the $80 ransom once at the airport to get in A boarding. I really don't like this boarding process. Seems that one needs to pay some type of extra fee to not get really bad seats. 

Once again, we were delayed. Mechanical/maintenance this time. Got in over an hour late again. At baggage claim in Columbus, 3 flights of baggage were all coming at the same time to the one carousel. Vegas, Orlando, and Atlanta. Orlando got bags first, we were second. Waited about 45 minutes for bags.

Why did we have vouchers? Because we were delayed leaving Cancun last year and missed our connection in Atlanta. That was a horrible experience. Will spare the details on the that one...

So in the last year, I've been on 6 Southwest planes. 4 of these 6 have been delayed at least an hour. The prices seem good until you have to pay a fee to not get stuck in the back seat or to be able to sit with your wife. I've seen enough.

Love SOUTHWEST!!! I use to be such a fan of DELTA until I moved back from Atlanta to Las Vegas! I believe one of the main hubs for this airline is here in Las Vegas so there are constantly flights going out. I will continue to use them because of the great customer service and those two free bags checked?! What?! What other airline does that. I hear people talk a lot about why they don't like southwest because of the fact that there aren't any assigned seats? Well I always recommend the early bird check in so that they can automatically check you in 36 hours before your flight! Now you may not always get the boarding zone A but you will for sure get on the plane early enough to sit where you want. The flight attendants are usually really good too I have no complaints at all! Go Southwest!

I used to love flying Southwest, but after flying Virgin, I am now a little spoiled.  I do love the free bags and free flight changes and cancellation.  One big dislike is if you have a credit on a flight, it has to be YOU that uses it and you have to FLY out by the expiration of the credit.  Not just purchase the flight by then.  When I first found that out, I was really annoyed, but I took a last minute trip to Vegas and it ended up fine.

Their new Rapid Rewards system is another negative in my book.  Well, I guess it's not so new anymore, but I wish they had converted all my old points into the new point system instead of basically making them useless.  Oh well.  It's Southwest and it's cheap.  Good for short flights.  Anything over a couple of hours I'll fly another airline.

Great airline in terms of pricing, availability, and flexibility. Other than that just a run of the mill old airplane, stewardess' are cool and friendly though which helps you get through your travels. Got a cool app to so you don't ever have to print boarding passes again and you can get the latest fight information too. Good airline for the money.

My first time flying with southwest ever. Now I've always heard good things about this airline from friends and family that have chosen to fly with them before. I'm glad I finally get to fly with southwest. I honestly regret taking this long to experience the wonderful service they offer. For once,  my flights are not delayed. In fact,  the one time we left 30 minutes later than expected,  the pilot got us to our destination on time. The flight attendants are friendly,  I didn't have any issues with my luggage. I look forward to planning my next trip and flying with them again.

You know...it's hit or miss. There are times when the flight attendants are like "I hate my life, what do you want to drink" and there are other times when they are like "OMG, it's your bachelorette? Drinks on me!" So It's hard to say. I will say one thing. This is the first airline where I heard a female pilot speak to the passengers! #feminist! I was so excited! You go girl! And it was a great landing! We need more female pilots...

They also have great honey roasted peanuts. So delicious! MmmmMm! Except if one person on the plane is allergic to peanuts, the entire plane has to eat pretzels. Lame. Can't that person just walk around with their Epi pen? #allergyproblems But if you ask the flight attendants for extra, they will give it to you. 

I wish they flew from SFO to Ontario. Why don't they do that?! I'm stuck flying from Oakland and dealing with the AirBart! I can't even drink my drank! (Unless you have an enclosed container...and btw, I was talking about coffee...this time). 

Lastly and the best part...they totally put you on different flights in case you miss your flight. As long as there is room. They are great about that. I've never been charged extra...unless I do it by the phone. But if you do it directly at the airport, they're good, as long as you aren't checking in bags. I like that a lot! I hope they don't change it.
Have not had the best of luck in Vegas with SWA. Some agents go above and beyond and the rest are mediocore. Inconsistant.

I have to say I've been disappointed in Southwest Airlines before, but my experience this time is the absolute worst flew into Las Vegas  Sunday for work. Got a call late yesterday afternoon mother was in ICU we need to get home called the Southwest airline to get the first flight homr as they were booking our morning flight they added a hundred and seventy per person and here we sit at the airport there's hardly anybody here.  we already paid for a flight to get here and go home the customer service is deplorable!!
 
 I'll be turning this one over to the Department of Aviation they need to do something for people  when they hit emergencies and cannot plan ahead to fit into their timelines of fairs and then take advantage of people when they're at the worst times.

Will most likely be my favorite airline forever. 

We fly many times a year with southwest. The crew is always great. The service is the best. Prices are great. 

Hopefully one day they will fly every where in the world.

One of the best airlines IMHO. They do tend to suffer from consistently delayed flights but the service is great. They have frequent flights, free drinks, free peanuts. 2 free checked in bags too, which is awesome. Prices tend to be good and I'm usually able to change the same flight around after purchasing to get a better deal. I usually take my backpack and a carry-on on board for a weekend trip.

The service is great here. I fly Southwest out of Burbank to Las Vegas for work and the flight attendants are usually very pleasant. I also love how they still offer free peanuts and pretzels!  My only complaint is the open seating....I'm a nervous flyer and need to sit towards the front of the plane....which doesn't always happen on SW.

It is hard to give any airline 5 starts, if I'm being honest, but it is nice to not have to pay to check a bag and I appreciate that they usually seem as in a hurry to get to our destination as I am! Also, while the teeny bag of honey roasted peanuts is not quite sustenance, they seem to be one of the only airlines that will give food away on short flights.  And hey, this is how one goes to Vegas from LA, right? (And, of course, by LA, I mean flying out of Burbank!)
Fast ,Efficient Friendly. I Fly Southwest to Las Vegas and they are the only way to go. On line check in Rocks. No Delays .Doesn't get any Better.

Make sure and check in as early as possible to secure a great boarding group. There is no assigned seating so if your traveling with a buddy you must check in early to get early dibbs on seats that will be next to each other. Love this airline they don't seem to nickel and dime you as bad as other airlines.

Maintenance issue??? Or is it??? 3 hour delay on the airplane getting here because of a "maintenance issue" then when it does finally get here they are one pilot short. Now that we're all boarded the pilot finds a "maintenance issue" on his walk around. This is ridiculous. Oh by the way it's freaking hot and people are smelling bad.
Flight took off 1.5 hours late. And it's southwest, so no food, just light snacks. Waiting 1.5 hours then taking a 5 hour flight without a meal does not render a positive Yelp review.
Everyone was very very helpful. Im glad I chose SW.

South West is the most disgusting poor excuse of an airliner I have ever met in my life. Last night was the top of everything and I will no longer be flying with them. Not only have I had high dollar items stolen from me a time before,but yesterday was probably the worst experience, they had their computer systems go down and a bunch of flights were canceled and nobody was told that their flight was canceled. So then when I try to drop my mom off and she should a left at 10:50 PM instead her flight got canceled and pushed back to Friday on top of that they didn't let anybody know that there systems went down and it caused a huge back up at the airport. Then when I went online to check the flight status it said it left at 10:50, so then I try calling South West and I'm on hold for 20 minutes I hang up and then I finally call the Las Vegas airport and the human being that I finally got to talk to you is confused as well because she tells me the flight took off at 10:50 which was not the case because my mom was clearly sitting there until 2 o'clock in the morning because they couldn't figure out that there was no crew to run the flight please do not ever fly Southwest they need to throw in the towel and call it quits while they are ahead they've needed to do that for a long time they are horrible piece of crap company and Need to go out of business so the world can be a better place without them!
I love Southwest. I love Vegas. But, when you add the two together..... It's a bloody late mess. Please stop over selling your seat!
Fast and easy checking and out. For a budget airline southwest is great. 45 min from LA to Burbank and fast boarding why fly anyone else for a short flight.

Really stuck it to us on this package deal to vegas.  You suck.  If anyone ever considers a southwest airline vacation package be warned... The package they sold us wasn't half what we thought it was.  They screwed us royally...and I think treasure island should share in the blame too

We board the plane 30 minutes before the actual flight, to make sure that we leave on time! The flight from Las Vegas to Sacramento took 1 hour and 15 minutes! Not bad at all! During our 1 hour and 15 minute flight, the servers were very kind and polite. They serve soda, oranges, water, roasted peanuts, and pretzels while you are in there. The flight is a breeze and I wasn't afraid at all! It was a nice experience and I hope to be able to go on another trip with Southwest Airlines again.
Normal flight out of Las Vegas, do have to say this Airport is well organized!! Good job! Keep up the flights!!
