I've always loved Southwest (free drinks, free peanuts and each person gets to bring one luggage for free).  Unfortunately, I've been using another airline due to the prices.

Are you skinny? Good, then you have nothing to worry about. Are you overweight? Yes. Then you should be fucking terrified. Southwest Airlines is notorious for kicking out the "heftier" people from their flights. It's like shopping at abercrombie & fitch, we just don't fit in.

Don't get me wrong, I'm not talking shit to the overweight people. I'm on the same boat and tall to boot, that's why my latest trip to Vegas via Southwest was a little scary.

The flight to Vegas was cool, luckily no one sat next to me so I had extra room to move around and be comfy. Thank God no one sat next to me though because then we'd have serious issues.

On the way back it was a packed flight and it was time to suck it in. Shit got uncomfortable quick. One thing I noticed though was that on the flight to Vegas the tray didn't hit my knees and things just seemed more comfortable. This time around I felt like I was sitting on a kids seat. I tried my best to get comfortable and not complain because I knew if I did I would get the Kevin Smith treatment.

Overall the flight(s) from L.A. to Vegas and vice versa were only an hour long so I didn't have to endure too much uncomfort. Fuck flying anywhere beyond that though. I just had a flight in April through American and that was way better.

Now I'll go ahead and do the responsible thing and go on a diet, these type of problems are not cool.

The flight from Las Vegas to Orange County sucked on St. Patty's Day! This company is shady and wanted to keep on the down low that alcoholic beverages are free on New Years Day, Valentines Day and St. Patrick's Day. They were still announcing beverages cost $5 even though it says it on the brochure on the seat in front of you. When we showed it to the flight attendant she agreed to it but still wanted to keep it quiet. Same thing on our Reno to Vegas flight. We didn't order anything on that one but they were announcing $5 and taking people's money. If you don't want to give out free drinks ever then don't have it in writing! So then on the Vegas flight we didn't end up getting anything anyway because they said it was too turbulent for service after they took everyone's orders. There was hardly any turbulence after they announced it though so that was really lame! They also had no wifi available. They apologized but did not offer anything to make it up to anyone. Such a shady cheap company and this was an expensive little flight!

Thankful I used them 2 weeks ago and not this past weekend.  Here is my synopsis of my most recent usage of SFO to SD and SD to LAS.

The not so good:

1) Check in with bags is a bit painful.  The lines were relatively slow and they do check baggage weights and will make you take things out of your luggage even if you are over 1-2 pounds.

2) The number assignments to board are random.  I checked in with my wife online and at the gate at the same time yet were given completely different numbers / letters.

The good:

1) Flights were on-time
2) Baggage arrived promptly
3) Free entertainment using ipad

'So, if you want to get on the earlier flight to San Jose, you are going to have to forfeit your discount,' says the cheerful SWA rep.

'Uh, haven't I seen about a million commercials for Southwest making fun of other airlines for not having change fees?', I ask.

'Oh, sir, this is not a change fee!'  she says cheerfully.  'But if you want to change flights you are going to have to pay $72!'

I feel like I am watching Romney and Obama argue about the healthcare thing.  You raised taxes!  It's not a tax, it's a penalty!  I don't care whether what you call it...it's costing me money!

This is the irritating thing about Southwest (and Romney).  They make everything sound great...but when the reality is not what any rational person would think it means (no change fees should mean no cost to change a flight, right?), they just cheerfully say it's your fault for not understanding.

'It is a little misleading, isn't it, sir?' she says with a smile as she swipes my credit card.

'
This airline is always delayed, but I can't beat the price and the two free luggage deal.

Oh southwest.... How I use to hate you! I'm not sure why but I have done a 180 for WN! The flight attendants are fun and much nicer than others I've flown with. I hated the "open seating" till I learned the trick of becoming preferred or you can just check in mad early and it normally boosts your boarding number and helps you find a good seat. OMG ritz crackers! Boom I'm sold!

I travel for work, Southwest is my go to airline. I absolutely love how easy there is hole process is compared to other airlines.  Bags fly free, every seat is first class. I've been A-List preferred the last 2 years, I fly close to 100 flights a year, I've never had a bad experience on Southwest I can't say that for other airlines. Southwest has what I believe to be the best rewards program, they make it so easy to book flights using your points. I Highly recommend Southwest for all of your business and personal travel needs. Keep up the great work Southwest.
What's NOT to love! Had a great time at C-gate. I was lucky and ended up with a row of seats to myself.  The flight attendants were very nice and professional.  Great flying!

When I'm loyal to an airline, I'm loyal. I rode Northwest all the way to the ground (so to speak). Who would have thought a 50+ year airline would have went out of business, but such is life. 

Now, especially since I spend time in the West and Southwest, Southwest airlines are my guys (and gals). I LOVE the computer pre-booking thing that they were one of the originators of, and they have a big presence at most airports so checking your bag at the curb or "Sky Cab" is easy and you can just sashay to your gate like a rock star. On a budget.

I especially like the strolling-on-to-the-back-of-the plane-from-the-runway-thing SWA lets you do at Burbank airport. Yes, they let you walk onto your plane from the ground/runway. Very cool. You gotta try it. 

There's nothing stellar about the planes themselves inside. They're pretty cramped and it's no-frills. No video screens in the back of seats here. But, on the upside, they do have wireless you can purchase (and FREE direct TV the last flight I was on) so it's the perfect scenario to have an IPad/tablet orgy.

I'm not thrilled with every airport SWA flys into (Vegas), but it's hard to hold them responsible for that. Even though they are no-frills I think they make up for it in consistency, price and the great attitude almost every one of their employees has. They appreciate your business, let you know it and seem like they're having a great time doing their jobs.

Today is DAY 6 that they lost my CHECKED IN luggage. BF & I went to LV from San Diego, We both checked in 1 luggage each. BF got his, but I didn't get mine!!! We've been calling at least once a day, sometimes twice. And their usual script is, "I apologize, we have not found your luggage yet. No news as of yet but, we are actively searching for your luggage." That's the same line over and over again!!! From a live person of course. How can they lose a luggage that takes only 45 minutes flight to LV? They said that the tag my have been torn of. Its hard to tear off the tag that they attached! CUSTOMERS BEWARE!!! Maybe you just need to do a carry on bag!!!

Try being greeted for your flight with someone calling you over and not even smiling. Not even a good morning or a happy toned question as to where I'm traveling. 

My greeting was: "Put your check in back up here when she moves that one." While glancing at me then looking away.

I think she was having a bad day. My Air Confirmation was: I8932K if anyone at Southwest is reading this. I can't recall the agent's name but I'm sure she can be discovered by seeing who checked me and my companion in.

Upon handing our information over and placing the check in bag on the scale, she abruptly stated: Your bag is ONE POUND over the limit. Rules are rules and you have to take something out of your bag to get the weight in line. Otherwise I have to charge you an Excess Weight Fee (and her tone was miserable). As a former ramp agent, I was a bit appalled at how she approached me. I mentioned I was a ramp agent and her rebuttal was, "Then you know that the rules are the rules).

She didn't suggest, she told me to take out a jacket or a pair of jeans and carry it on the plane with me.

What's hilarious is that my bag was packed identically to how it was when I arrived in Las Vegas. Nothing more/nothing less.

It was a bit of a scene with other passengers looking on. You could tell they had the expression 'I hope I don't get her for check in." Even the agent adjacent to her appeared as if she was incredulous at my agent's attitude. I wouldn't normally have a problem taking something out of my bag to meet regulations. The way the agent approached me set me off a bit.

I checked in and went on my way. My flight experience didn't get off the ground nicely as it usually does with "LUV"

I'm a forgiving person. Maybe she was having a terrible day, week, month, etc. I paid more to fly with LUV than Spirit Airlines, just because of my loyalties. I just would like to be treated better next time I check in - like I usually do.

Changed my flight to be on an earlier one only to be delayed. Paid more too. 


Southwest just sucks!!!!!!!! Worst customer service ever and always delayed.

Flight to Vegas is quick from John Wayne.  I always hop on this flight to avoid the hectic traffic congestions on the road and getting to the airport is simple with a few terminals.  But back to the point of the airline, the service is quick and to the point.  I love the fact that we can check in with the iPhone and there's TV to watch on our own devices.  Saves me time in watching any entertainment on the plane and definitely glad not using the re-used headsets from other airline services and touching any of those wornout screens. 

Didn't get to eat or drink on the plane, but can't blame them since the flight isn't that long to get to.  

Baggage claim was fast and easy to find.

The shuttle service provided from the gateway wasn't clear, but eventually found them outside the terminal but the contracted service is a little confused with what's going on.  The service took longer than an hour to get to my hotel, so I just jump off at whatever closest hotel and walked it.

Definitely worth flying, but be cautious on the other deals aka shuttle services.  The hotel booking definitely worth utilizing with southwest getaway.  Definitely book way in advantage to take away the great savings!

This is ridiculous, east coast flight delayed, Vegas flight delayed, pilot coming on board 40 minutes we literally waited for an off duty airline employee
Totally unprofessional


Flew again much better

Let me say you suck I paid to be on a plane I'm on the plane and the bitch lady comes on the intercom and says this planes not leaving until 3 people give up there seats! Fuck you I paid I'm on the plane put this bird in the air! And you suck Southwest airholes

My favorite airline of all time. I am never disappointed, and I will never stray to another airline because I sure do love Southwest. Not only are the flights easy to book, but there is always a deal. Not only is your luggage free to bring, but they don't lose your bags! Not only are there drinks on the plane, but the flight attendants love hooking you up if you're nice!

Of course the MAIN reason I love Southwest airlines is because of their flight attendants. Have you ever YouTube'd all the hilarious videos of the flight attendants doing their announcements?? So funny!! These guys rock.

I've had the worst experience ever with this airline. Both my flights to and from Vegas were delayed at least an hour each due to maintenance. Why should the customers suffer for your airplane malfunctions? Completely ruined my trip. Thanks southwest, I will never fly with you guys ever again.

Trash airline, MISTY on flight #3398 C14 board 9:55pm take off 10: 25pm is a RACIST!!! I flew first class,One of the first people to Board plane.  she purposefully chose to point me out to everyone asking me to remove  my bags or sit in the back like i was  a slave or peasant of some sort, than started shaking her head at me when i asked her not to be rude.MISTY also turned to the caption and started chuckling and saying "this just one of those days" i asked her what her name was and could she write it down to for me, she rudely replied " its Mistyyy! Cant  you read it!!! No i cannot write it down for you!! You can remember that cant you", in front of the entire full plane. Outrageous! Right ?  She does not deserve to work in a profession where she cannot properly communicate unbiasedly with others,I will be contacting corporate and submitting a corporate complaint against her over her intentional aggressive racial behavior! I will be contacting my attorney against this unruly  airline and Misty.

FLT#14
LAS-PIT
July 25th

This flight departed on-time and actually arrived 25 min early into PIT.  Anyone that flies this route knows it's non-stop.  The crew serviced the cabin during the complete flight.  It's what I experienced just before departure that I plan on commenting about.  Everyone was seated...the luggage bin doors were still all open.  Flight attendants were just about to start the safety briefing.  At a certain point after everyone was seated, the senior flight attendant was standing facing my seat with her arms stretched straight on the edge the luggage bin with her elbows locked.  After about 20 to 30 seconds I sensed she wasn't moving and (as far as I was concerned) had no reason to stand for an extended period of time before take-off with her crotch and lower body in this fashion.  So, I looked up and she was staring (glaring) at me.  Now the way her head was between her arms this would not be apparent to anyone else.  I stared, she stared for about another 20-30 seconds...this does not sound like a very long time.  But just before take-off, it is.  I have no idea what this was about.  If any one does please let me know.  At first I thought she was looking down the front of my shirt/top.  She had a very distinct look about her.  Long red curly hair with bangs that looked too youthful for her age which was probably about mid 60's.  She had deep furrows between her eyebrows hence the age guess.  
Just after the pilot did the 2 bells she said"  Baba Boom,  Bada Bing"?  Starting the safety briefing thereafter.  
During the beverage service I ordered carbonated water, and she said " would you like lime with that, honey".  Now if you have read any of my other reviews, don't call just one person "honey" unless you call all the passengers "honey".  
I am still baffled by this un-professional behavior.
Southwest touts itself as a "low-cost" carrier....FREE this, and FREE that.  That does not mean you should allow you're employees to be classless. 
Please eliminate the "honey and sweetie" thing that the FA and Check-in agents routinely do.  This does nothing but make the airline look cheap not low-cost.
The only way to fly.  Free bags, easy rewards for free flights.  Loses luggage like any airline, but actually tries to help you and will reimburse you.  Love them 100%.

Could be 4 stars. The fact they dont charge for 2 checked bags per person is incredible. If you buy your tickets 2 weeks (usually) in advance, they really can be cheaper. The reason I'm giving 3 stars instead of 4, my last few flights were delayed. LONG delay. Well, the SA to Vegas flight was a 6 hour delay. They said it could be earlier so I waited at the airport. Had I known to ASK if the plane where the plane was, I could have left the airport, and spend that time with my husband. Also, since the flight was 2 hour 20 min, they offered no small menu with food. I dont mind paying at all. I like the cheese and fruit platter for $7. They didn't offer on the SA / Vegas flight OR the Seattle / Vegas flight. I can bring my dog, which is AWESOME, but they charge $75 EACH WAY. That's way expensive. She's 4 pounds and goes under the seat and never makes a peep. Even 50 bucks is expensive, but I never minded that. For some reason, the extra $25 each way is another reason I wouldn't give them 4 stars.

All I can say is DELAYED FLIGHTS, PERIOD. Delayed going to my destination, Delayed going back home. -__- Can it get any worse? Also I didn`t like how there were no assigned seats so we were randomly seated and most of the time me and my friends weren`t sitting together. Boooo. The only thing that Southwest is good for are checking in 2 bags for free.
William at gate 14 is an all star. He was super helpful. Made my trip that much better.

Can't beat the fares. Cattle call to your seats is fine.  Just plan ahead.  Aides are always nice funny and quick.  Only airline that doesn't charge you for bags or water.  Let's hope they never ever change their policies

I fly often and I have flown other airlines. Not one of them can hold a candle to SWA. Are they perfect? No and sometimes things happen. But, they do their best to help their customers in any situation.
I love the Rapid Rewards program. Lots of free flights every year. 
Can't live without SWA.

Broke our brand new stroller!!! Very disappointed on how they handle luggage. Then after they gave it to us Broken they said strollers aren't covered if broken. We always fly southwest but unfortunately we will be spending our money elsewhere

Took us over an hour to check-in for early international flight. I usually do bag drop off without problems but with international flights, you have to wait for full service. Why do you have two attendants for several flights is beyond me? As SW adds more international flights, they need to add more full service attendants. Finally the manager came over with about five other attendants after people started yelling about missing their flights. Where were these employees?

Landed in Vegas. The flight crew was very nice. The flight was not bumpy and it was a 50 min flight. They got the drinks and nuts to you before we landed. The flight attendant even attempted to tell a joke. It was bad but hey it was the thought that counted.

Flew SJC to Vegas today. Good flight good in-flight service. Everything went smoothly for me, but I sat with an elderly lady at the airport with a connecting flight mishap who was helped but the staff were somewhat impatient with her confusion. I would fly SW again but I wouldn't recommend them to elderly relatives! No complaints as to my own service though.
IMO, the best way to fly. Easy on, easy off, and non-stop Little Rock to Vegas and back flights daily.

People love Southwest for their straightforward honest approach to get you to your destination ASAP.

The online booking system is a breeze, and the open seating format is another cool deal,
no hidden fees, and two carry-on items allowed at no charge? Yes please! The one dreaded thing no one likes is that dreaded little kid kicking the back of your seat over, and over, and over. Luckily none of that on this flight back to the Bay Area.

The Staff are always great and very accomodating as well which makes for an even more pleasant flight...ALOHA!!!

YELP 365 CHALLENGE-(344/365) "Smooth Sailin'"

As a company, Southwest Airlines always offers cheap fares considering you book early. You may sometimes get a "wanna get away" deal a week before your flight out of nowhere(cancelled flights).

After a drunken weekend of drinking and no sleep, most visitors want to just get home. Unfortunately for me, my southwest flight was delayed two times. I had no choice but to find an empty area to create a makeshift sleeping area composed of dress shirts over my travel bag. 

Not a good place to nap due to the high traffic of travelers in gate B14. You feel like people are watching you sleep. 

Anyways, Southwest still gets my business if I want to fly again for cheap. Just wish their flights wouldn't be delayed so often. 

Also, they offer alcohol, soft drinks, and coffee on the plane. Snacks served are honey roasted peanuts and pretzels. And yes, bags really do fly free.

I suggest arriving and checking early for your flight. You will increase your chances of getting seated in the front area, so you can get in an out quickly as possible.

I was able to buy a ticket from Las Vegas to Burbank last minute on a Friday. Viva Southwest for selling affordable tickets and flying into Burbank (so I don't have to haul my butt across Los Angeles during rush hour traffic).

I have a love-annoy relationship with them.  I've organized it into a list for your reading pleasure:

LOVE: the schedule of frequent flights to places I go, ease of buying one way tickets, free bag check, easy online check in, decent mobile phone ap, no change fees, easy to deal with when you miss flights or plans change, GREAT free flight system.

ANNONY: they keep restricting the drink tickets and they're not consistent about what they can be used for, cheap flights attract some annoying seat mates, for some routes they only have flights with stops and competitors have direct flights, no tequila served on board.

Overall, I fly them on flights under 3 hours.  But no airline is perfect.

My husband  and I were flying (for his 50th birthday) from Las Vegas to Cabo San Lucas (through LAX).  The plane from Las Vegas had a mechanical issue and left Las Vegas an hour late. We landed in Los Angeles at Terminal 1 at 7:40 am, with a Southwest International flight out of Terminal 3 at 8:15 am. We were in row 14. We asked the stewardess several times about our flight. Could we leave the plane first, could they hold the plane, how would we make it. She assured us we would make it as the first officer for the Cabo flight was on our Las Vegas flight. By the time we exited the plane it was 7:50. We ran over 1.5 miles, full speed to the international terminal. Begged security to let us go first, ran the rest of the way to our gate, arriving at 8:05. 
The problem we have is that when we arrived, the gate agent said they were "looking" for us and asked us why we did not take the shuttle they had for us to transfer. We were stunned! After we asked the stewardess several times about getting to the International Terminal, waited for 13 rows to exit before us and ran in street clothes through LAX (for 1.5 miles), we found out that there was a shuttle? A convenient, easy way to start out vacation not in a panic we would miss our flight? 
Not one Southwest person said a single word to us.
We fly Southwest all the time. I am extremely disappointed with the lack of communication and service we experienced. That was certainly not a way to start a vacation. I am frankly shocked that not a single person told us that there was an easy way to get to our destination. While the delay out of Las Vegas was unavoidable, the exhausting start to out trip certainly was.

I've never had a problem with Southwest Airlines and yet I've never thought about "yelping" them either.  Until today.  We are flying out of Vegas for the holidays and the crew today is great.  They have great service and they're all super funny.  Especially the dude doing the pre flight bs ritual that nobody ever listens to.  Til today..  he had everyone listening and he was very comical.

I've never really experienced a problem
With southwest until now. I was not informed by email (which is what I signed up for to be notified if something goes wrong) that my flight was delayed by 2 hours. I have been at LAS airport since 4:30 waiting for my 6:50pm flight home(southwest flight 158 to OAK 9/19). Only to realize at 6:45 that my plane was not at all in view at gate C7. The lady next to me was the one who informed me that our plane was delayed. She said she had received a text! I am beyond annoyed, bc I do not want to spend my birthday on a plane going home. AND there was no announcement whatsoever over the loud speaker about this flight being delayed. I've been here for 3 hours and have heard a handful of other flight delays/gate changes, but nothing about flight 158 to OAK.

If you watch Mad Men, you notice that only upper crust, ubber wealthy people use to ride on airplanes.  It was a major luxury to be able to spend that much to get around.   Then coming back to the present time... it's still a luxury to be able to fly, however, it's more of a necessity now.  Especially, when driving to LV from SF takes way too long for my taste.  Plus, time is money!  

I've traveled to and from Las Vegas many times and the service is always pretty good.  It's been on time, the lines move smoothly and efficiently, and the overhead compartments for my luggage is pretty easy to take care of.  I don't have any complaints.  And this time, we arrived 15 minutes early to LV, which is good because time is money, honey.

I today's world of technology - WHY would we NOT have WiFi on this plane

How ANNOYING!!!!!!

Bags fly free!!!!

Planes are adequate, service is decent.. with online check-in and self check-in... things run pretty smooth.  The LV airport has it's own SW terminal... so it's very easy to find.  The actually end of the terminal is crowded and stuffy though... especially after a long week in Vegas you just want  to get out of there.

For the price, Southwest remains king!

You Know why I take Southwest?

They don't drag you off a plane bloodied because they over booked their plane.

They have reasonable fares.

They depart and arrive mostly on time.

The Pilots are good and the attendants are, for the most part, friendly.
One of the easiest airlines and terminals to use in Vegas! Been flying with Southwest out of Vegas for 10 years now... never had drama (oh crap, knock on wood).

I ABHOR THEIR OPEN SEATING ARRANGEMENTS! My husband is terrified of flying and because of that he refuses to enter a plane until the very last moment.  Unfortunatly for us, we didn't fully understand the open seating rule and we ended up losing our carry ons because it was a full flight and I had to sit apart from him and in between two big guys in the last row that doesn't recline.

On our way home, it wasn't any better. We arrived late and it was the same issue.  Although I do appreciate the free check in bags, I cannot tolerate the open seating arrangement.  I will never fly Southwest because of that.

It is an airline that used to be inexpensive and now is very expensive.  You still get their peanut service at full service price.  I really like to fly other airlines as I like a seat assignment as opposed to the Southwest Airline cattle call.

Southwest Airlines does have convenient flights times but the service is mediocre most of the time. Firstly, my husband and I checked in online at the same time but got different boarding groups - one in A and one in B. When we proceed to board together at the gate as coupDoesn't make any sense to make a couple traveling together

Flight from Sac to LV was 40 minutes late and when we got to LV the gate had been given away, so we've been on the Tarmac for last 20 minutes, waiting.  I will miss the meeting that, based on SWAs original schedule, I should have been early for.  Southwest's service continues to decline as the length of their delays increase.  Bad flying experience today.  One star, since we did make it here safely.

Fly for work, love them all.  Never a problem or delay and if there is they let you know immediately. Great company, appreciate the flexibility, low fares and the friendly down to earth staff. Bless, Southwest Airlines.

Wow, not only are the planes filthy but their customer is non-existent.
I was boarded on a plane at LAX heading to Vegas. The pilot pulled away without ensuring the door was secure. During the delay to determine if their was damage I had to endure the huckleberry comedic attempts by the flight crew to avoid a mutiny. 
When the pilot announced we were moving off plane A to plane B, he announced what a great job he did getting us a new plane. What a jack-ass.
Needless to say I didn't make the connection in Vegas. 
SW put me on a flight six hours later and charged me $50 for a boarding position I already paid for and told me to call Customer Service to get a refund. CS told me they don't do that. I can write a letter.
South West airlines owes me $50 and more importantly six hours of my life back.

Southwest Airlines has been my carrier of choice for business/personal travel over the last 3 years. I switched from Delta Airlines since Southwest offers a companion pass (see below for info).  I fly frequently enough to be an A-list preferred member with perks. Overall, I've always had a pleasant experience with Southwest and plan to be fly with them in the future. They've earned my loyalty and are worth a look. 

Pros: 

* Southwest's flyer-friendly policies: No change fees and you get 2 free checked bags (plus free carryons - worth mentioning since now other airlines charge for carryons)


* Ding! Fares: Southwest Airlines Offers DING! Fares as low as $49 One-Way. You must sign up for their email alerts and shop for their best Wanna-Get-Away tickets. Their Ding! specials can typically save you anywhere from $5 - $75 bucks one-way (double that savings for your round trip and add in the free check bags ...it's a steal). Ding! Fares require a 14-day advance purchase for the savings so be sure book in advance. They always have the best rates compared to other airlines with their specials. 

* Flight Crews:  Majority of their flight crews are professional, engaging, courteous, and friendly. Their safety announcements are light-hearted and funny. They have fun and it shows. Their service is well done with a selection of pop, wine, beer, and juices (beer and mixed drinks are $5 each or free with a reward coupon). You will also be offered a choice of peanuts or pretzels for snacks. On special occasions, you might get lucky with cookies that are shaped like planes or some
form of Chex mix. 

* Outstanding Service: Here are a few examples of where SWA went above and beyond. I've been on a few flights where they have passengers close their windows and turn on their service light to sing happy birthday to a fellow passenger. I even received a complimentary  bottle of champagne and a congratulatory message on our flight to San Juan, Puerto Rico to get married. They saw me carrying my wedding dress and notified the flight crew.  They surprised us and made our trip memorable. 

* Companion Pass: This is the benefit that lets you choose one person to fly free with you every time you purchase or redeem points for a flight. You can also sign up for their Chase Visa during their promotion and you can get up to 50,000 points to help you qualify for their companion pass status (after you spend $2,000 on purchases in the first three months your account is open - look at the paperwork). If you like to travel, it's worth it. You can get 2-3 round trip tickets with that 50,000 points if you book it during their sales. I have the card and have been happy with it. There is an annual fee of 99 bucks that includes 6,000 points once you hit your card-anniversary. It's a great perk and you can save a ton of money. 

* Free live and on-demand TV: You must bring your own device for viewing (smartphone/tablet). You can watch live games, HGTV, Bravo and other channels. WiFi will  cost you $8 (free for A-List Preferred Members) 

* Rapid Rewards: Sign up for their points program and earn points towards a free flight. Watch their sales to get the most bang for your buck. 

* Early Bird Seating: EBS includes automatic check-in, a better boarding position (be seated early on in their general boarding), and access to overhead bin space (since your boarding earlier/ great for carryon).  This isn't free. It will cost you $15 one way / $30 roundtrip. EBS will hook you up with these perks. 

* On-time performance:  My experience has been great with being on time. I've had a few times where my flight has been delayed. However, that goes with the territory. 

* They'll Make It Right: I've had run-ins with damaged luggage, a rude flight attendant (only twice ... I fly 30+ round trip flights a year for perspective), and oversold flights. I always brought it to their attention and they made it right. They always acknowledged the error and provided compensation/addressed my concern. It's all about how they handled the situation.  

Cons: 

* General Boarding: There are no assigned seats. You will be assigned a boarding group (A, B, or C) and position upon check in (offered 24 hrs in advance of your flight- set an alarm to check in). They will have you board according to your assigned number. This is good when you're in A or B. This is not so good when you're in the C group. This is where EBS becomes valuable. Pay the extra 30 bucks and you'll get a decent seat.


Review 4 for 2017

Annoyed! Checked in for flight exactly 24 hours in advance just to get in group A and was successful except that my flight was delayed and I ended up missing my connecting flight and Southwest had to print me and my family new boarding passes which placed us in group C! Needles to say I was super annoyed. I was traveling with small children and we all ended up in different seats. Southwest sucks!!!!!

I haven't flown to Vegas in a really long time but went last weekend for a friend's bachelorette party. Last time I flew I was 21 and got a great deal through US Airways or something. It has been a significant amount of time since then and I'm been a Vegas roadtripper since until last weekend. The stewards and stewardess we great. Wayne and Sherona were amazing. They knew we were trouble the minute they spotted 7 hot chicks in bright pink shirts headed for Sin City. We had drink coupons out the whazoo and they definitely kept them coming to get our weekend started.

After such a positive experience I don't know why I would ever drive the 4.5-5 hours again when 45 minutes in the air and great Southwest employees are available.

I LOVE: convenient flights, Early Bird check in option, free checked bags, great frequent flier program, friendly staff. When it works, it's fantastic.

I HATE:  their text and email notification system doesn't work.   If I had relied on that, I would still be waiting at the airport for my flight last week. They also didn't update the web site quickly....the Polar Vortex was wreaking havoc on air travel so I totally understand my flight being delayed twice then canceled.  What I DON'T understand is why they couldn't text me alerts as promised and keep their web site updated. 

ALSO I suspect they cancel flights when they don't have enough passengers.  I once booked a 6 am flight to Phoenix and learned it was canceled AFTER I got to the airport (thanks, text system).  Then I had a flight from Oakland to LAX which they delayed and canceled AFTER I'd left my conference early.  The new flight they put me on was delayed....which they DID manage to text me, and then just as I settled in they texted me again that it was leaving in 5 minutes.  Oh, thanks?

Quick, professional and no nonsense, best of all, they are cheap. Since it is not assigned seating you do have to check in early to make sure you get a good seat. Drinks are cheap on board at $5 and the staff is generally really friendly and accommodating. While it is not my favorite airline, they are good at what they do and are great at saving money.

Flew from McCarran in Las Vegas to San Jose today.  I was booked on a mid-afternoon flight, but was able to switch to an earlier time.  I paid extra for the Business Select upgrade and found it to be worth the price.  Just a few bucks more.  (The "cattle car" boarding is just about the only problem with flying Southwest!)
The staff was helpful and friendly throughout and the flight was a pleasant one...as usual.
The free luggage is a real plus as most carriers are finding more and more ways to gouge their customers who represent their livlihood.
At San Jose International, the bags were delivered promptly and all of us were on our collective ways.
Great way to fly.

Staff is remarkable. I get top rate service every time. And now they have added a good wine to their selection I am set. I take about 20 flights a year with them and purchase more for our biz and in the past 10 years I've had at most 4 delays and never any lost luggage. That says it all!
If you like to fly and if you like open seating hit up Southwest. I feel like their seats are wider than most planes, but what do I know? I am not an aerospace engineer but my homie is. Im out.

The employees at Southwest are self righteous jerks. Especially Iesha at the counter gate B2.
Really no seating and overbooking? Sent me to Vegas KNOWING all flights Id need were booked for the next 8 hrs! Totally NOT a problem to send me and my 2 children to a city that we'd be stuck in for 8hrs.
LAME

I love McCarran airport and the Southwest terminal is very easy to get in and out of. Staff on the plane have always been friendly and generous and they always seem to find a way to put a smile on your face with their "over the air" humor.

They have known for an hour plus that our plane was not arriving. When you continue to post a departure time that is a known error and allow your customers to let friends and relatives think it is on time it is tacky at best. When your ground transportation must travel an hour or more to meet your flight it is just wrong. If they know, the customer should know.  This, along with the many errors on the web check in over the last 8 weeks, makes me rethink who I will book my next flight with.
One of my favorite connection cities. Always threaten to "strand" myself here, at least for an extra day or two.

I love Southwest, and this one was no exception.  The staff is always friendly, and they definitely go a step above most airlines to make sure you have a great experience.  Travelling can be stressful, but at least I know that I can trust Southwest to take care of me.

On a recent trip to Orange County I had an issue with my checked baggage.  I flew during the December rain storms and when I picked up my bag at baggage claim, it was soaking wet.  I realize that bags are outside for a period of time during transport, so I didn't think much of it, until.....

I got home and discovered that the inside of my bag was soaking wet too!  All of my clothes were soaked or damp.  I was trying to figure out what happened when I realized that my flight was delayed 2 hrs in Orange County and it was pouring rain....the bags must have been sitting on the runway exposed to the rain.  I didn't mind the clothes getting soaked, but I had 2 textbooks that got damaged.

I promptly called Southwest Airlines and they asked how much they were worth.  I told them I checked on Amazon.com and that the replacement cost was $117 for both books.  They checked on their computer to verify it....once they did, they said "come on down and we'll write a check for $117".

The next day I brought my damaged textbooks to the baggage claim office at the airport and they promptly wrote me a check for $117 after verifying the damaged books.  Awesome!

One quick tip:  If you fly Southwest and have any issues with your bags, you have 4 hours from the time your flight arrives to report the issue, otherwise you can't file a claim with them.  I was lucky that I noticed right away and called them in just under 2 hours.

Kudos to Southwest!

I use this airline a lot since I fly for work  between SoCal and Vegas.  If I were paying  for the flight, think I'd go with Jet Blue instead.  but since I'm not, I get what I get.  Do not like the open seating. I have a disability with my leg that prevents me from bending it very much without excruciating pain. So... I have to do the bulkhead seat.  I pre-board, but fat lot of good that does when you are getting on a flight that already has other people on it  . Mostly the crew and attendants are nice and helpful but there is one named Beverly at the Vegas location who is a complete uber biatch. I have reported her terrible attitude to the airline. I don't mind a lot of things since it is only a one hour flight for me, but I DO mind that the last 3 trips .. my flights have been delayed because they were cancelled since the airplanes were not full.  Even if I were in perfect health, wandering around the Vegas airport for 4-8 hours is a form of torture.. But to do it with a bum knee and not have anyplace to elevate it.. makes mama grouchy...

When you're used to JetBlue nd VirginAmerica, it's hard coming here. I've had bad flights with Jet Blue (gonna be posted as well) and VA but they have the comforts I like. 

Southwest doesn't have a order of seating - first ome, first serve. Not bad. It was an empty flight so I was good. Free bags.

They don't have a TV, good snacks, good beverages but eh, an hour flight. 

Seats are alright. 

Overall, this isn't bad for a short trip.

So, I flew to Las Vegas via Southwest. I have never flown this far so to me...the flight was long. However, the flight attendants were great. They were very attentive yet firm. We had on individual who was extremely rude and did not want to sit with a larger individual but there werent any other seats left. I believe the flight attendants handled this situation perfectly...They were friendly yet firm because we had to go take off. Great job defusing the situation. The flight was smooth thanks to the weather. This flight had on board wifi which was great. You can only watch tv shows which were on prime time networks for free. Movies were $5 and to browse the internet it was $8. Of course I took the free route ...it was only a 4 1/2 hour flight. Drinks were available and offered 2x during the flight. The norm...sodas, teas, coffee, juice were complimentary and alcoholic beverages had a $5 charge. I even saw the attendants making bloody mary's ....ha...how about that!!!. Overall, good flight, great service. I recommend you become a rewards member. I pays off eventually.
A lot better than I remembered seat were spacious Headroom and Wi-Fi with some free TV shows although the flight was only an hour long it was very pleasant way to go Southwest

Having a hard time giving any review but negative to southwest today. Most of their flights out of McCarran are delayed by several hours. There isn't any appreciable weather nationally that would cause this. The gate agents don't give any information and when they're pressed by an understandably pissed passenger they threaten to have them escorted out of the terminal by security. Basically they give zero concern or care. It's not in their job description.  Way to go Southwest.  Used to think positively of your service. Now I think that's all been a mistake.

Southwest is the worst airline in terms of accommodating military personnel flying on orders! $ rules all; if you pay $40 you can upgrade your position, but if you serve the country you can get FU**ED I guess.

Thanks Southwest
Sincerely Military Personnel Everywhere

I had a traumatic experience with a mentally unbalanced Southwest gate agent at McCarran. He was abusive, threatening, and intended to keep me off the flight because of personal animosity. This happened on the morning of December 15, 2016. I will write a letter of complaint to Southwest this week and expand this review over time.

I try my very best to us Southwest. They are often on time, filghts not overbooked, no extra fees for everything and usually have the nice wifi access and lounges for the business traveler without having to go to the "fancy" rooms provided by other airlines. 

The staff are always friendly, check-in is usually a breeze with little effort. The only drawback to this is the airport itself, which I have already provided my opinion on and have been told that they are in the process of making a better place to go in and out of. Other than that, Southwest is the airline of choice. And now with the in-flight wifi, it makes it a no brainer for me!
Low Prices, Friendly Service, and you DON'T have to pay for the first bag? Don't have to ask me twice!

ABSOLUTE WORST AIRLINE. EVER. Their customer service this morning was absolutely the worst. I was attempting to ask a question to an agent and without even making eye contact, says "what, I'm listening". I had to make her physically turn her head to make actual eye contact. They have very little compassion for any of their customers and this is why... I fly only JET BLUE!!! And from here on out so will all of my family. SOUTHWEST... SUCKS!!!!!

Loved our experience recently flying from Las Vegas to Dulles! Our southwest flight was delayed which seems to be a bad way to start out but the customer service far and away made up for it. Starting with the ground crew the lady that was in charge of boarding our flight was friendly and patient. She showed a lot of empathy with out big party, and answered many questions related to our delay. Our flight attendants were great as well, they were humorous and patient as well. We were flying with my elderly grandpa and he is a lot to handle. But our flight attendant had a great rapport with him and kept him in check while being fun and respectful. Just overall turned a negative into a positive! So thanks southwest
The employees here are more brusque than I like.  I guess the increased number of passengers and problems are a challenge.  Seem to be competent and do keep things moving.

I want to praise Southwest for the way they handled my request to change my flights. My father had bought me a round trip ticket, so I could visit him over Father's Day weekend. Unfortunately, my father died Sunday. I called customer service to explain the situation and see if I could change the dates, so I could attend the funeral. The woman I talked to was kind, compassionate, and helpful. The tickets were changed, and she made sure I had direct flights with no stops. They didn't charge me more, even though, the prices for the days I needed were significantly higher. I am very grateful for how they dealt with me.

I really have no complaints about Southwest as I've started flying them more often now that I live in San Diego. They're one of two airlines that flies direct to Vegas, so I can't fly AA without wasting hours of time. I'm not crazy about the boarding process with Southwest, but I have a script that gets me an A boarding group every time. Free checked bags is nice when I need it. I just wish they flew out of the D Gates so I could use the Centurion lounge before my flight. As it stands, I go early for the lounge and then take the skytrain back from D and out to C for my flight.

I am a fan of Southwest! It is my go to airline though I love Jet Blue and Virgin.  It gets the job done and keeps it simple. They let me change flights since I was early with no extra charge. I never checkin bags but nice to have that option if I want to without any extra fees.

Checking into the flight at Las Vegas was less than convenient because over half of their kiosks had out of order signs. There was an agent barking at those trying to check.  She said that they had to form only one line, but the rope dividers were not set up properly for one way flow and some had missed the turns in the flow.  She just barked at them, that there was only one line... People were confused but she treated them as if they were trying to cut in line...which they were not.

Hate, hate, hate, hate Southwest Airlines!!! They delayed my flight from Las Vegas to Oakland due to "bad weather" in East Coast. I've been waiting for hours only to see that my flight keeps getting pushed out! This has never happened to me with Delta. Wish I were on Delta right now!!!!
Two great flights. Both filled with happy and helpful gate agents and flight attendants. I love Southwest's company culture, because you can relax, joke around and keep things light.

I would give southwest zero stars if I could. Let me just say this is a review of southwest as a whole and not individual airports .Here's the story of the travel day from hell. I started off in New Mexico my first flight had been delayed 3 different times even before I had gotten to the airport. Thank goodness for those super helpful flight update texts . Seeing that I wasn't going to be leaving NM till very late at night if ever I decided to change my flight. Apparently that was a really bad move on my part. I arrived at the airport two hours before my flight which was supposed to be boarding at 4:30. Once at my gate I see that my flight is now delayed to 5:10. No big f-ing deal , oh just the small issue of the connecting flight that is supposed to board at 5:20 in Vegas .Surprise surprise we finally land in Vegas at 5:40 and I have to run from gate c7 to gate c25. Not only did the guy give me attitude about me being late he wouldn't let me on the plane even though he let two other people down to the plane. At this point I now have to walk up to the counter to discuss what they are going to do about me missing a flight because one of their other flights made me miss my current one. I seriously lost my shit at the counter and started crying like a big baby. They end up issuing me a new ticket once they figured out it was their fault I missed my connection. I go back down the terminal looking like a wreck and head to my new gate. My new boarding time is 8:25, but guess what ! After sitting at the gate for 10 mins the computer monitor announces that flight is now delayed till 10 . Ok then , fine this is nothing new I guess I'm just going to spend all damn day at the airport. But wait it gets so much better !!! It's just been announced that the flight will be delayed till 10:30. The airplane
Is siting out on the Tarmac but now we have to wait for a crew . At this point have now told my roommate 5 different times she should pick me up from the Phoenix airport . Oh by the way I'm writing this review while still sitting in the southwest terminal at the gate. It's starting to look like I'm never going to get back to Arizona . I'm seriously wondering what the hell the delays are all about ! As far as I can tell there's no awful weather heading for Phoenix or Las Vegas. Let me just say don't fly this airline , don't waste your money. I could've driven home by now. Lastly Southwest get your shit together this is embarrassing!

Mostly, I like Southwest.  I liked it better when they assigned the boarding positions on first come, first served basis and not up-charging for A1 - 30, but what can you do.  

The seats are also ridiculously narrow and do not accommodate three grown adults, so getting a window or aisle is imperative.

Cheap, fun and good loyalty program.

Update: Daylight Saturday during the day, Omnia that night (may or may not do that). Sunday EBC and XS at night. 

I have a physical disability which negated a wheelchair. It took more than 45 minutes to get the chair to my check-in station (no checked bags, just carry-on), which made me late for my flight (which told me to go to C3 when the flight had been changed to C25). 

I just bought a whole new ticket for the next flight (after they told me it was 100% full). I am appalled at the way they treat Veterans in Las Vegas. I cried three times just trying to get checked in for a new flight that I re-paid to book. Naomi at the front desk downstairs was extremely rude and unaffectionate while Susan at the check-in desk seemed very unalarmed and uncaring. She just kept commenting about how I was late (the hospital I work for have me minimal notice but I still would've been on time had I been directed to the correct gate.) 

Thanks Southwest, for nothing!!

SW has several things other airlines don't.

The attitude toward customer service seems to be the very best in the industry. They do such a good job of getting you out on time and in on time.

I laugh every time someone complains about the boarding procedure. If a plane is full someone has to fly in a middle seat and guess what those who book late are the ones in a middle seat no matter who's airline you are flying. The boarding is so much better then the zone system some have switched to and makes no since to me at all.

Most planes now have wifi so either work can be done or it can be time for play and relaxing.

More restaurants will be open in the SW terminals and that will be good. A couple of gates in the old circle format could really be improved on. 

Overall SW give you everything you pay for a little more.

90% of the times I fly I will fly Souhwest. And this recent trip to New Orleans from Sacramento I got to put the service of Southwest against that of United Airlines. 

Here's how they matched up:

PRICE: Southwest is known for being the low fare leader, but when I shopped the other airlines for the "to" leg of my trip (Sac to NOLA), United was half what southwest wanted. United actually also came in a few bucks cheaper on the ride home as well, but considering they charge $25 a checked bag and southwest is still free for checked bags, I rode home on southwest.

COMFORT: I always thought that southwest was the sardine can of airlines but I will correct that myth right here and right now. I didnt have the middle seat on either leg (thank god) but all of the planes I went on were jam packed and southwest still had more leg room over United. I actually am wondering if United shrank their leg room to make way for those annoyingly bright little tvs on the back of the headrests that charge you to watch the news? Hmmm

SERVICE: Southwest wins hands down. Still has the cheeriest flight attendants and the quickest service. If you want a drink (as I often require when I fly) then you wont be waiting long to get one on a Southwest flight :) United flight attendants need a lesson in friendly. On both of my stops (Sac to DC and DC to NOLA) the flight attendants had attitude. Forgive me if I have waited half the flight for a drink of water and I down my 2 oz glass of water like a shot and ask you for another before you move the drink cart another 6 inches down the aisle...is it really necessary to glare at me like I just asked you to let me fly the plane? GAWD I get you are a middle aged flight attendant and your job is clearly rocket science. Please forgive me for needing another 2 oz glass of water.

No doubt I will pay whatever it takes next time to fly Southwest. No drama, just good service.

This airline is not what you expect seating wise. If you buy a ticket in "C" you're screwed. They do not assign a seat for you. You are forced to find whatever seat is leftover. This is especially horrible when you are flying with a family. They do not tell you this process until it is already too late. I'd rather try my luck on a flying pig than with this airline.

Help in trapped on a Southwest flight!  This flight from Las Vegas to Reno was loaded and ready to go 15 minutes early.  Then we were told we would be waiting for luggage to transfer.  Left the gate 30 minutes late, and then sat on the taxiway for 45 minutes. So much for southwests stellar on time reputation. The flight time from Las Vegas to Reno is 1 hour and 5 minutes, we've now been on this airplane for 1 hour and 30 minutes. It's hot packed and not pleasant.

I like the flight availability and the upfront pricing.  Flights are generally on time.  One thing I don't like is that when a flight is early, it has to sit on the tarmac.  They put it up as landed, but since they have the flights scheduled back to back, so that the flight cannot unload because there is not room.
Es war ein sehr entspannter Flug von Las Vegas nach El Paso. Das Personal freundlich  und hilfsbereit.

What's the use of being A list when 
they let all pre check it first and save sets for other people. 
I fly weekly. 
Southwest boarding process sucks. 
For the folks that spend the most money weekly for flights. I avoid Southwest a any cost. 
I usual fly Virgin or Alaska. They are much better.

This Southwest location really follows the rules! When you line up in numerical order they wont even let you skip a number. My friends and I always stand together even when we are a few numbers apart. No other Southwest airline cares if we are 1-2 numbers off but for some reason this lady would not budge. She told my friends to wait until the others to go because of the order first. Oh well whatever, no big deal. The people behind me was like this never happens. We never follow the order perfectly! Well I guess rules are rules but they do not need to be all rude when telling my friends to wait a few seconds. They never complain when I line up further back when my number comes first! I guess they pick and choose when to follow the rules.

I have been w/ Southwest since I started flying consistently and they have not disappointed.  There were a few late baggages, but they always compensated with a $50 voucher so I was always happy to get my next flight w/ a nice discount.

They offer sales all the time, and their Rapid Rewards program is pretty awesome.  You can get points not only for flying, signing up for their credit card and using it, for renting cars, booking hotels, dining at participating restuarants, and even filling out customer surveys.  There are so many ways to earn points, and they are so easy to redeem on their website when booking flights.  They also send drink coupons and cool birthday tokens (such as luggage tags) to you in the mail.

Their online system is amazing and easy to use.  Also, as an A-List member, I never have to wait in line to check in my bags, or wait long to go through security.

Their planes are rather small and bouncy, but for the most part I feel safe on their flights.  Thank you Southwest Pilots, and flight attendants for always making me feel welcome, safe, and comfortable.

Oh and don't forget their honey roasted peanuts!  They don't always have them, but when they do, it's delightful!

Yelp Challenge! Started 8/20/2011 (43/365). I have a lot of catching up to do

I've used this airline for years, I'm a preferred member with a companion pass and have had countless wonderful experiences with team members and flight experience.

However, yesterday I was REMOVED FROM MY FLIGHT, because MY MEDICAL CONDITION (in which I was fully approved to fly) MADE A FLIGHT ATTENDANT UNCOMFORTABLE.  I needed a wheelchair and an extra seat to lay in (which I arranged ahead of time).  This experience not only showed several examples of horrific customer service, it also highlighted that this airline does not equip it's planes with general emergency medical equipment.

I have a non-contagious bacterial infection and am taking heavy antibiotics, both of which cause shortness of breath. On the flight to Vegas four days ago I had done all the things wrong and was extremely out of breath when I sat down on the plane. As we were taking off I had an allergy induced asthma attack of sorts, but had no clue what was happening so I started to panic. The kind and wonderful flight attendant brought me oxygen to help calm me down, and 30 minutes later I was fine.

I was seen by multiple physicians in Las Vegas and screened and cleared for a bunch of things that could be causing the extreme fatigue and episodes of shortness of breath. I was cleared to fly, and told I would be completely fine, just use a wheelchair and don't overexert myself before the flight and take some anti-anxiety medication just in case. It would be best if I had two seats to lay down across during the flight.

I called Southwest TWICE to explain the situation, ensure everything would be ok, and to find a non-stop flight that was empty enough where I wouldn't feel bad asking for and extra empty seat on my row. Both Southwest agents were wonderful and kind and explained that would be no problem at all...JUST get a preboard pass and TELL YOUR FLIGHT ATTENDANT WHAT IS GOING ON WHEN YOU BOARD.

The flight attendant heard one word Daron Clark said ('they brought her OXYGEN on her last flight but we've resolved the issue and she's been cleared to fly.') and cut him off and took off to 'find somebody to see if [we] could fly'. She then told the pilot we needed oxygen while on the flight (not true, and not what he said), and ignored us until another woman came to ask us to step off the flight to discuss the matter. Daron Clark explained that he is one of my physicians and I was more than fine, I just needed to lay down if possible. The pilot lied and said that he didn't make the call, but we have to get off the plane (we were later told by an operations person that it's up to the crew to decide if they feel comfortable transporting a patient, which I completely understand and respect, but why lie to us and pretend it's the powers above?  He then asked if Daron was accusing the flight attendant of lying about my need for oxygen.  Again, Daron tried to explain he was one of my physicians and that I didn't need oxygen, I needed medication (which I had taken) and a wheelchair. While he was speaking the pilot turned around and walked off.

The desk agent then told us that we 'told them too much' and when we mentioned that I had used oxygen on the plane earlier they stopped listening because they were uncomfortable with us on the flight.

I get it, safety is safety. But this situation was handled HORRIBLY.  If Southwest doesn't fly with oxygen tanks (which as somebody in the medical field understands is crazy on its own) and I need oxygen, then obviously I can't fly Southwest. BUT THAT IS NOT WHAT WAS HAPPENING. The flight attendant saw a sick girl in a wheelchair and heard 'oxygen' in the beginning of the back story and freaked out. She didn't stop to ask, or think, or treat me as anything other than a hazard that needed to be removed and that she didn't want to deal with.  She did not even tell me they didn't have oxygen, she avoided eye contact and refused to speak with me.

And side note, WHY DO THEY NOT HAVE OXYGEN ON BOARD FOR EMERGENCIES???

They put me on another Southwest flight for the following day, with instructions not to mention anything next time so I don't make the flight attendants uncomfortable. 

Only after we left did we notice the paperwork (A NON DISCRIMINATION FORM) that they made Daron sign (they told him it was a DOT form and that it must be signed) had a line where they had added, 'passenger stated that they needed oxygen during the flight.'

Unbelievable.  And completely unacceptable for a company so focused on safety and heartfelt customer service.

I had the worst flight experience I've ever had on my last trip to Vegas with Southwest. First of all, my flight was delayed over an hour at the Oakland Airport. We finally started boarding, and they ran out of room on the plane (I was one of the last to board) so they the remaining passengers check our bags outside of the plane door. I meant to carry my luggage onto the plane to make things easier and avoid baggage claim once I got to Vegas, but oh well!

We had a layover in San Diego, which took a while, but wasn't too inconvenient. At least I didn't have to switch planes! Once we took off for Vegas, they started taking drink orders, but it took them so long to bring out the drinks that half of the plane (including me) never got our drinks because we had already arrived in Vegas! I was pretty disappointed, but at least I had arrived!

I called up my sister and friend, who drove over to the airport to get me. But, to my dismay, my luggage was NOWHERE to be found. I waited at baggage claim for 2 flights worth of luggage to pass, asked around, and then found myself in an extremely long line of other people who could also not locate their bags. In total, the line took over an hour to get through. I asked my sister to go back to the hotel without me. At the end, they made me file a lost luggage report, and said the would cover $50 of necessities (I literally was left with nothing for my trip). They said they were pretty sure they'd find it that night or the next morning and would deliver it to my hotel.

Everyday they called me to say my luggage still had not been found.

My trip came and went. I was pretty sad about losing my luggage, clothes, makeup, and jewelry. A few days later, around 8pm, I got a random call from Oakland airport. The girl sounded really confused, said she found a bag with my name on it, and asked if I had flown anywhere recently. I told her, "Yeah I was in Vegas a few days ago and my luggage never arrived. I filed a report, and Southwest was supposed to be looking for it." After I told her that she was still confused, but was eventually able to look up my lost luggage report on their system. So basically, they just randomly found my bag - they were NOT looking for it. 

The only good part is that they delivered my bag to my house that night!!!! I was so happy to get all my stuff back, but pretty disappointed with my experience.

Love flying Southwest!  Hello Kiosk!  I have my carry on and I'm ready to go!

k, bye.

To make my trip more enjoyable I gain favors!  That and enjoy a couple perks not yet known to everyone but my friends with Yelp benefits.

For example, I would always buy a box of Chocolate Covered Macadamia Nuts and give it to the first or lead flight attendant and tell them I bought the crew a box of chocolate.  Watch the favoritism spoil during your trip.

When they're pouring the drinks into cups, ask for the can.  They'll give it to you, it might be empty but hey it could have been full!

Any physics nerd out here?  *Raises hand*  If someone attempts to open the door in mid-flight do this:  *Raise both middle fingers*  And leave them alone because e=mc2.  It's impossible for that door to be opened, so watch that loser get tired then give him an elbow drop from the top seat turnbuckle.  

If you have kids and they really want to see the cockpit, wait until the end after everyone gets out and then ask the pilot, they'll have all the time in the world to let them or you check it out.  Ladies, you might even be able to sit on their lap.  

Don't use anything from the crew unless it's wrapped in plastic, you don't want to use old blankets and towels.  And anything in the pocket in front of you too like magazines and shit, those are old and collect dirt, filth, cooties.  Buy a magazine and use that.

Girls know that moisturizing trick about dead air and lotion to keep your skin hydrated or something, go ask them about it.  

Oh and one more, there's a way to open a locked door from the outside, so when your friends go to use the toilet you can troll them.  The way to open it, wait.. perverts might be reading this.  Message me and I'll tell you how.

Anyone wanna have a UYE plane trip ride when they have their $1 flights let me know, I'm down!

As I begin my traveling gypsy routine with work I have chosen Southwest as my airline of choice out of convenience.

I enjoy the crews with their fun personalities and the fact that I can check in 24 hours in advance and get my order number for seating is a total bonus.

It's a pleasure to be able to seat myself, front, middle or back and aisle, window or middle.  Typical airline stuff otherwise, drink service, and snacks are nice.  One of the only airlines to offer free checking of two, yep I said it two bags.  Now that's service!

Sign up for the Rapid Rewards and work your way towards a free flight or some nice little upgrades.

Always satisfied with Southwest!

EMAIL TO SOUTHWEST DETAILING WORST EXPERIENCE EVER: STAY AWAY

To whom it may concern, I have never had such a horid experience with your airline and have already wrote multiple reviews elsewhere detailing the flaws in your airlines service. My group and I arrived to the gate an hour early and proceeded to line up when it was time to board. We were line numbers 36-39 and waited until everyone in front of us walked onto the plan. Then we walked up to NATHAN who was the rudest minimum wage  ticket beeper I have ever met. As we walked up to him he immediately said "back up and wait your turn, you are not allowed on the plane yet" in the most snappy attitude I've ever seen from someone that worked at an airport. He said this even though there was nobody in front of us. So we stepped back and my pregnant girlfriend made a comment to one of our other friends saying "that was really rude, I've never been treated like that before". NATHAN overheard the comment and chimed in saying "Well that is SOUTHWEST policy and if you've never been treated like that before then I'm going to call all the SOUTHWESTS and make sure you're treated the same way". That kind of irritated me so I said "Sir I don't know what your issue is, all we are saying is we have never had service like this before" NATHAN then said "Sir according to FAA regulations you cant bring vodka on the plane". I was drinking a cup of WATER from WENDYS. Next NATHAN said "Will the 4 of you please step to the side I'm going to have security meet with you for INTOXICATION". RIDICULOUS we hadn't had any alcohol that day and to TOP IT OFF he lied to security and said we were drinking in the gate! What BULLSHIT. FINALLY 2  SECURITY members came and agreed we were NOT intoxicated whatsoever and tried to argue with NATHAN to let us on the plane. He walked away into the plane and the plane LEFT! HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE SECURITY FELT BAD FOR US AND GAVE US $20 FOR THE AWFUL EXPERIENCE. WE WERE STUCK IN LAS VEGAS FOR 9 HOURS WITH NO COMPENSATION FOR THE RUDE, UNPROFESSIONAL AND VULGAR BEHAVIOR FROM YOUR EMPLOYEE. I WILL NEVER FLY WITH YOUR AIRLINE AGAIN AND I WILL BE WRITING REVIEWS ON EVERY POSSIBLE SITE KNOWN TO MAKE SURE THIS DOESN'T HAPPEN TO ANYONE ELSE. COMPLETELY UNACCEPTABLE.

Bags fly free, I'd give them 5 stars if I got to fly free.  So it will stay to just 4 stars for now. I prefer to drive between California and Las Vegas, but when I fly I got no choice, my travel department usually books Southwest. 

I remember the days of flying Southwest on a weekly basis.  These were the days when I was Premier (Southwest's version of Elite).  You have to go through the whole "cattle call", but I didn't because I was usually the early A's.  Now that I don't fly as much, I'm one of the C's and if I'm lucky maybe a B. So now, you'll find me in the back or squeezed in-between two of the biggest people in the world.  It's cool though, they make perfect arm rest or a shoulder to lean on. I also usually try to use the bathroom before I board because SW's bathrooms are usually small and dirty.  

Besides the whole unassigned seats and bathrooms, I like Southwest.  If you're flying Southwest, you're usually flying a short distance anyway.  Flights are cheaper, wifi is only $5, and there's flights scheduled to SoCal throughout the day (notice I didn't say Cali). You can say that Southwest is my comfort food of flying. I'm a fan, mainly because I gots no choice. 

By the way...the highlight on any Southwest flight...SkyMall Magazine Baby!!
My last FIVE flights leaving Las Vegas with Southwest have been delayed. Many of my returning flights have also been delayed. If that isn't a good reason to take away a star, I don't know what is.

This is for SW in Vegas only. Overall I love SW and have been an A member for years but SW staff in Vegas are assholes. Countless times I have been delayed in Vegas over the years only to be greeted by complete jerks when trying to rebook or change connections due to equipment failure or weather issues. I have seen numerous people video tape SW employees behaving less than professional in Vegas. SW has offered many of us vouchers for Vegas delays and staff behavior which is always greatly appreciated but it is time to change the customer service reps and managers here .

The last two times we used SWA was to severely undercut the costs of of being over charged for a connecting flight from LAS to LAX when we fly international. This last trip doing so easily saved us $300, but it was actually more like $600 since I'm a Rapid Rewards member w/SWA card. I actually can't remember the last time I paid for a flight with SWA!

So why 3 stars and not 4 or 5? This last time we flew as a family of three. Our son is special needs and most of the time we fly we are able to board early, we even noted this while booking online. So as we waited for the boarding announcement for people with young children or special assistance we heard the call for elderly flyers and top tier rewards members, then the A group, and then for families. So, no surprised we boarded we had to make our way to the back and struggled with our son, who is well behaved, but very easily distracted, especially with all the people making noise while getting settled. This made for some awkward situations of him trying to sit down next to random people while we made our way to the back.

On our way back I had to upgrade our tickets to guarantee A class boarding to make things ab bit easier for us, and it did, but this is the only airline I've flown on that requires us to do. Also, their system was glitching hard when I upgraded the tickets, so it wasn't telling me I was already checked in and had to reach to SWA to reconfirm everything.

it was pretty cheap to fly to las vegas. depending on how many days you book ahead, you can save considerable monies. southwest has easy checkins. a long list of departure times and they leave from oaktown!

I love Southwest.

I definitely prefer Southwest to United and American Airlines if you're flying to San Jose, Las Vegas, Los Angeles, Albuquerque, etc.

- Bags fly free
- Boarding pass printing/check-in kiosks for fast, easy, on-the-go service
- Friendly/funny flight attendants
- Comfortable seating
- First come, first serve seating

Just be sure to check-in as soon as it's 24 hours prior to your flight so you get first dibs on seating/overhead compartment carry-on space.
i couldn't complain about flying southwest. 2 free check in bags. If you buy your ticket in advance, you can get a great deal. Got me to point A to point B
I really appreciate how friendly the SW staff are on the planes but especially in the luggage claim office. Colleen was so nice, helpful and just an absolute pleasure to chat with.

I used to love Southwest. They still have friendly employees but delays and cancellations have become the normal for them. An easy 1 hour flight from Burbank to Las Vegas ended up being an all day ordeal. Delayed 5 hours... could have driven. My return flight has been cancelled and I now sit in Vegas waiting for a later flight and crossing my fingers that it isn't delayed or cancelled. Again, I should have driven. By the way, if you pay for Early Bird check in and your flight gets cancelled, they do not reimburse you unless you call and complain.

Love Southwest, but for some reason at this airport, my flight is always delayed, and the gate is super far for arrivals and departures. This particular airline had the rudest flight attendants, which is not normal for Southwest. Specifically one flight attendant that was rude when my friend and I tried to sit in a 2 seater, and he told us it was taken when there was nothing on the seats to imply that. Then he completley ignored me during the drink requests and was just mean all throughout the flight. Wish I caught his name to write a formal complaint to SW.

Have been flying Southwest for years. 

At first I thought that the chaotic boarding process was terrible. Once you are used to how the system works it is fine. With this system you have to make sure that you are on time to check in for your flight 24hours before departure. I always do this and really never seem to have a problem getting a seat where I want. 

Now for my flight today I violated my own rule and forgot to check in! Shame on me. I was assigned C-22. Upon arrival at the airport I proceeded tot he gate and was able (for $40) to buy A2 much better! Cost a few bucks but now I know that I am good to go!

The planes always seem more comfortable to me than other carriers and I am not sure if it is the pilots or the equipment, but the flights and landings always seem to be more comfortable about SWA.

So overall cant go wrong here!

The Good: No change fees; refund in either travel credit or cash, depending on flight level booked, for cancelled flights; two free checked bags; choice of seats via general boarding; free drink coupons after ten one way flights; favorable and lucrative reward program; comfortable jets; so much to like!

The Bad: Flight delays, but no more than other airlines; no first class option; when the flight is going on to another destination and people remain on the plane from the last destination before you board, they allow them to move up to better seats, doing so causes you to have to take a worse seat, even if you purchased business class select fares.

The Rest: overall an airline deserving of a five star rating. If I am not planning on flying first class then Southwest is my first choice!

I love southwest for their flexability and prices. 

AS FOR THE LAS VEGAS CHECK IN PERSONNEL... They have repeatedly been the absolute WORST I have ever dealt with in the entire airline industry and I take an average of 20 Round Trip flights per year. I am finally taking the time to write this review after my 4th horrible experience her at the Las Vegas airport. They are rude, unprofessional, lazy, and go out of their way to make traveling more difficult for you. ..  It's just so sad because they are a great airline in many other ways.

As far as affordable airlines go, really SW is the best. Service is usually friendly and moves relatively quickly. Flying to/from Vegas/Reno to see my mom is by far the best choice for the price and availability. I have Rapid Rewards from my credit card and so many of our trips around the country have been almost free by using points. 
I dislike the whole seating by checking in, I'll usually spend the extra $15 each way to get Early Bird Check-in because I hate the feeling of stressing about checking in the SECOND it's 24 hours from your flight, but, other than that SW Air is very good. 
They even provide 2 free bags per person and a free drink and bag of pretzels... Delta and United don't do that. Free pretzels, I tell you. Free.

Cattle cars since they offer no business or 1st class seats, but if you opt for early check-in capability, and check in early enough to get a low boarding number, you can grab a front row seat so at least you're one of the first to board and exit.  No baggage fee for the 1st checked bag either.

And on this last flight back from Vegas to SEATAC, my checked suitcase was on a later flight - but they delivered it right to my home when it arrived in Seattle.  So that's a big bonus.

Southwest did great going on my trip but coming back was a nightmare.

Southwest in Oakland was fast, friendly and efficient and I was very satisfied but southwest did a very poor job in Vegas.

Boarding was a mess and the attendant was not helpful. He did not allow me and my husband to board at the same time giving some lame excuse that literally did not make sense.  He refused to help and I got sent back to the end of the line. 

The attendants on the plane were the most unprofessional I've ever seen. When it was time to give the usual safety directions both of the attendants giving instructions were goofing around.

Then they were laughing and talking very loud the entire plane ride, which was very inconsiderate to the people trying to get some shut eye on a 10PM flight.
